2016-12-01.abstract: Mr. Trump’s surprise announcements and impulsive gestures have brought into sharp focus the compulsively theatrical style he will bring to the Oval Office.
2016-12-01.snippet: Mr. Trump’s surprise announcements and impulsive gestures have brought into sharp focus the compulsively theatrical style he will bring to the Oval Office.
2016-12-01.lead_paragraph: It began at dawn, with a Twitter post about flag-burning.
2016-12-01.headline_main: Trump, a Free-Form Leader, Experiments and Invites Drama

2016-12-01.abstract: Lawmakers in the Finnish city voted down a proposal to pay for a $138 million museum with a mix of private and public money.
2016-12-01.snippet: Lawmakers in the Finnish city voted down a proposal to pay for a $138 million museum with a mix of private and public money.
2016-12-01.lead_paragraph: Plans to build a Guggenheim museum in Helsinki were defeated on Wednesday night, when lawmakers in the Finnish city voted down a proposal to pay for the $138 million museum with a mixture of private and public money.
2016-12-01.headline_main: Guggenheim Helsinki Museum Plans Are Rejected

2016-12-01.abstract: An effort championed by Jill Stein begins on Thursday, answers to some often-asked questions about the planned reviews of Election Day vote totals.
2016-12-01.snippet: An effort championed by Jill Stein begins on Thursday, answers to some often-asked questions about the planned reviews of Election Day vote totals.
2016-12-01.lead_paragraph: It has been nearly a month since Donald J. Trump beat Hillary Clinton to win the presidency. But efforts continue in three battleground states to take another look at the election results.
2016-12-01.headline_main: Recount Bids in 3 States Seem the Longest of Long Shots

2016-12-01.abstract: Police Department logs obtained by The New York Times offer a complete record of Mayor Bill de Blasio's use of police helicopters, including 10 trips taken in the last three months.
2016-12-01.snippet: Police Department logs obtained by The New York Times offer a complete record of Mayor Bill de Blasio's use of police helicopters, including 10 trips taken in the last three months.
2016-12-01.lead_paragraph: Police Department logs obtained by The New York Times offer a complete record of Mayor Bill de Blasio's use of police helicopters, including 10 trips taken in the last three months.
2016-12-01.headline_main: Records of Bill de Blasio's Helicopter Flights

2016-12-01.abstract: Mayor Bill de Blasio has taken 10 rides by police chopper in the last three months. Before that, he had traveled that way a total of eight times since taking office.
2016-12-01.snippet: Mayor Bill de Blasio has taken 10 rides by police chopper in the last three months. Before that, he had traveled that way a total of eight times since taking office.
2016-12-01.lead_paragraph: For much of his tenure, Mayor Bill de Blasio has rarely availed himself of Police Department helicopters to get around New York City. Getting around that way, he has said, was simply not his thing.
2016-12-01.headline_main: Mayor de Blasio’s Trips by Police Helicopter Rise Sharply, Records Show

2016-12-01.abstract: Gov. Pat McCrory, rejected by the voters, is engaging in a shameless attack on the electoral system.
2016-12-01.snippet: Gov. Pat McCrory, rejected by the voters, is engaging in a shameless attack on the electoral system.
2016-12-01.lead_paragraph: As early voting exit polls in North Carolina trickled in just before Election Day, state Republican Party officials could hardly contain their glee. They issued a statement hailing early results that suggested “the once dynamic Obama Coalition” was “crumbling and tired.” The statement boasted that the percentage of African-Americans voting early had dropped by 8.5 percent below 2012 levels, while white early voting was up by 22.5 percent.
2016-12-01.headline_main: North Carolina’s Sore Loser

2016-12-01.abstract: Addressing a conference of his Fatah party, Mr. Abbas sought to push forward long-stalled efforts to reconcile the two major competing Palestinian factions.
2016-12-01.snippet: Addressing a conference of his Fatah party, Mr. Abbas sought to push forward long-stalled efforts to reconcile the two major competing Palestinian factions.
2016-12-01.lead_paragraph: RAMALLAH, West Bank — Mahmoud Abbas, the president of the Palestinian Authority that operates in the West Bank, proposed on Wednesday the creation of a temporary unity government along with Hamas, the militant rival faction that controls the Gaza Strip.
2016-12-01.headline_main: Mahmoud Abbas Proposes Palestinian Unity Government With Hamas

2016-12-01.abstract: The new product is sugar, but is made differently so less goes into the stomach but consumers still get the sweet taste.
2016-12-01.snippet: The new product is sugar, but is made differently so less goes into the stomach but consumers still get the sweet taste.
2016-12-01.lead_paragraph: Call it sugar lite.
2016-12-01.headline_main: Nestlé Reformulates Sugar and Says It Will Use Less in Its Candy

2016-12-01.abstract: Ted Minnis, a 47-year-old Californian, had never coached college water polo when arrived at Harvard in 2010, but he has helped the program achieve a once-unlikely goal.
2016-12-01.snippet: Ted Minnis, a 47-year-old Californian, had never coached college water polo when arrived at Harvard in 2010, but he has helped the program achieve a once-unlikely goal.
2016-12-01.lead_paragraph: With a 13-12 overtime victory over Bucknell in an N.C.A.A. tournament play-in game Saturday, Harvard’s men’s water polo team achieved a once-unlikely goal: getting to the top of the East Coast’s water polo establishment for the first time in program history.
2016-12-01.headline_main: Harvard Becomes an East Coast Water Polo Power, Thanks to Its West Coast Coach

2016-12-01.abstract: Mr. Bharara, who has prosecuted powerful figures in high-profile corruption cases, made the announcement after a meeting with the president-elect.
2016-12-01.snippet: Mr. Bharara, who has prosecuted powerful figures in high-profile corruption cases, made the announcement after a meeting with the president-elect.
2016-12-01.lead_paragraph: Preet Bharara, the United States attorney in Manhattan who has built a reputation as a fierce prosecutor of public corruption cases, said on Wednesday that he intended to remain in office under President-elect Donald J. Trump’s administration.
2016-12-01.headline_main: Preet Bharara Says He Will Stay On as U.S. Attorney Under Trump

2016-12-01.abstract: Part Ralph Nader, part bounty hunter, China’s fakes detectives reap rewards for finding counterfeits — but could go out of business under new rules.
2016-12-01.snippet: Part Ralph Nader, part bounty hunter, China’s fakes detectives reap rewards for finding counterfeits — but could go out of business under new rules.
2016-12-01.lead_paragraph: BEIJING — Ji Wanchang strolled through a Beijing luxury mall one recent morning with an eye out for luxury coats. But at one store, a clerk told him a fur-collared Moncler and other coats were “sample sizes” and not for sale.
2016-12-01.headline_main: Though Awash in Fakes, China Rethinks Counterfeit Hunters

2016-12-01.abstract: Sharing a snack on a Manhattan sidewalk.
2016-12-01.snippet: Sharing a snack on a Manhattan sidewalk.
2016-12-01.lead_paragraph: Dear Diary:
2016-12-01.headline_main: Blueberries for a Stranger

2016-12-01.abstract: Tiger Woods’s return is the main event at the Hero World Challenge, but the pro-am golf debut of Derek Jeter, the retired Yankees shortstop, is also making waves.
2016-12-01.snippet: Tiger Woods’s return is the main event at the Hero World Challenge, but the pro-am golf debut of Derek Jeter, the retired Yankees shortstop, is also making waves.
2016-12-01.lead_paragraph: NASSAU, Bahamas — The isolated, low-key setting at Albany Golf and Beach Resort Club was the perfect place for the superstar to make his debut. Not Tiger Woods, who will make his first competitive start of 2016 on Thursday, but Derek Jeter, the retired Yankees shortstop who played in a group with Rickie Fowler on Wednesday in the Hero World Challenge pro-am.
2016-12-01.headline_main: Derek Jeter Takes a Swing, and Steps Into Tiger Woods’s Spotlight

2016-12-01.abstract: On his 26th birthday, Mr. Carlsen beat Sergey Karjakin in a series of high-speed tiebreakers, securing his reputation as a player with no weaknesses.
2016-12-01.snippet: On his 26th birthday, Mr. Carlsen beat Sergey Karjakin in a series of high-speed tiebreakers, securing his reputation as a player with no weaknesses.
2016-12-01.lead_paragraph: It took nearly three weeks, 12 closely fought games and a day of high-speed tiebreakers to decide the World Chess Championship, but at the end of play on Wednesday, victory went to Magnus Carlsen, the Norwegian grandmaster, leaving Sergey Karjakin to return home to Russia in noble defeat.
2016-12-01.headline_main: Magnus Carlsen Overwhelms Challenger in Tiebreakers to Win World Chess Championship

2016-12-01.abstract: Detective Hassan Hamdy, who was investigated by a grand jury after the killing, is now part of the unit that flies Mayor Bill de Blasio around New York by helicopter.
2016-12-01.snippet: Detective Hassan Hamdy, who was investigated by a grand jury after the killing, is now part of the unit that flies Mayor Bill de Blasio around New York by helicopter.
2016-12-01.lead_paragraph: A New York police detective who was investigated by a grand jury after he shot and killed an unarmed National Guardsman during a 2012 traffic stop in Queens is now part of the unit that flies Mayor Bill de Blasio around the city by helicopter, according to Police Department records.
2016-12-01.headline_main: Police Co-Pilot for Mayor de Blasio Fatally Shot Unarmed Driver in 2012

2016-12-01.abstract: Lawyers make closing arguments in the case of Michael T. Slager, who was seen on a video fatally shooting Mr. Scott, who ran after a traffic stop.
2016-12-01.snippet: Lawyers make closing arguments in the case of Michael T. Slager, who was seen on a video fatally shooting Mr. Scott, who ran after a traffic stop.
2016-12-01.lead_paragraph: CHARLESTON, S.C. — They sat on the same courtroom bench, but worlds apart — the parents of Walter L. Scott, a black man shot to death in 2015, and Michael T. Slager, the white police officer who killed him as he fled after a traffic stop.
2016-12-01.headline_main: Charleston Jury Gets Case of Officer Who Killed Walter Scott

2016-12-01.abstract: The pilot pleaded to make an immediate landing because of the situation, according to a recording leaked to Colombian news organizations.
2016-12-01.snippet: The pilot pleaded to make an immediate landing because of the situation, according to a recording leaked to Colombian news organizations.
2016-12-01.lead_paragraph: The pilot of a plane that crashed late Monday while flying members of a Brazilian soccer team to a competition in Colombia pleaded to make an immediate landing because the aircraft was out of fuel, according to a recording leaked to Colombian news outlets on Wednesday.
2016-12-01.headline_main: Doomed Jet Carrying Brazilian Team Reportedly Ran Out of Fuel

2016-12-01.abstract: The bill would increase funding to fight cancer and other diseases, address weaknesses in the nation’s mental health systems and help combat prescription drug addictions.
2016-12-01.snippet: The bill would increase funding to fight cancer and other diseases, address weaknesses in the nation’s mental health systems and help combat prescription drug addictions.
2016-12-01.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The House overwhelmingly passed a far-reaching measure on Wednesday to increase funding for research into cancer and other diseases, address weaknesses in the nation’s mental health systems and help combat the prescription drug addictions that have bedeviled nearly every state.
2016-12-01.headline_main: House Overwhelmingly Approves Sweeping Health Measure

2016-12-01.abstract: Quotation of the day for Thursday, December 1, 2016.
2016-12-01.snippet: Quotation of the day for Thursday, December 1, 2016.
2016-12-01.lead_paragraph: “You can’t just lock people up without any finding of dangerousness, without any finding of flight risk, for an indefinite period of time, and not run into due process.”
2016-12-01.headline_main: Quotation of the Day

2016-12-01.abstract: He modeled the first McDonald’s double-decker on burgers at a Big Boy and introduced it in 1967 in Uniontown, Pa. A year later, it was on the menu nationwide.
2016-12-01.snippet: He modeled the first McDonald’s double-decker on burgers at a Big Boy and introduced it in 1967 in Uniontown, Pa. A year later, it was on the menu nationwide.
2016-12-01.lead_paragraph: In April 1967, hamburger lovers in Uniontown, Pa., south of Pittsburgh, met a newer, bigger burger. Introduced by a local McDonald’s, it was called the Big Mac, and for 45 cents it delivered, as a 1970s jingle would have it, “two all-beef patties, special sauce, lettuce, cheese, pickles, onions on a sesame-seed bun.”
2016-12-01.headline_main: Michael James Delligatti, Creator of the Big Mac, Dies at 98

2016-12-01.abstract: Steven Mnuchin, the financier who has been tapped to run Treasury, joins other wealthy investors chosen by Mr. Trump, a sign of possible tax cuts and deregulation ahead.
2016-12-01.snippet: Steven Mnuchin, the financier who has been tapped to run Treasury, joins other wealthy investors chosen by Mr. Trump, a sign of possible tax cuts and deregulation ahead.
2016-12-01.lead_paragraph: In a campaign commercial that ran just before the election, Donald J. Trump’s voice boomed over a series of Wall Street images. He described “a global power structure that is responsible for the economic decisions that have robbed our working class, stripped our country of its wealth, and put that money into the pockets of a handful of large corporations.”
2016-12-01.headline_main: Trump’s Economic Cabinet Picks Signal Embrace of Wall St. Elite

2016-12-01.abstract: Michael Venditto, the Republican incumbent, and John E. Brooks, his Democratic challenger, remained in a close contest amid objections from both parties.
2016-12-01.snippet: Michael Venditto, the Republican incumbent, and John E. Brooks, his Democratic challenger, remained in a close contest amid objections from both parties.
2016-12-01.lead_paragraph: Painstaking vote counts. Talk of possible fraud. Suggestions of racism and ageism, and disparaging comments about people with disabilities. And none of it had anything to do with Donald J. Trump.
2016-12-01.headline_main: Democrats Claim to Win Senate Seat on Long Island, but G.O.P. Disagrees

2016-12-01.abstract: Mr. Leone was borough president from 1970 to 1976, when Brooklyn did not enjoy the renown as a cultural center and thriving place to live that it has today.
2016-12-01.snippet: Mr. Leone was borough president from 1970 to 1976, when Brooklyn did not enjoy the renown as a cultural center and thriving place to live that it has today.
2016-12-01.lead_paragraph: Sebastian Leone, who as borough president in the 1970s worked to raise Brooklyn’s profile long before its current renaissance, died on Nov. 14 in Brooklyn. He was 91.
2016-12-01.headline_main: Sebastian Leone, Borough President Who Championed Brooklyn, Dies at 91

2016-12-01.abstract: The 1,000 jobs the president-elect saved represent just 0.2 percent of total manufacturing employment in Indiana.
2016-12-01.snippet: The 1,000 jobs the president-elect saved represent just 0.2 percent of total manufacturing employment in Indiana.
2016-12-01.lead_paragraph: In tiny Sellersburg, Ind., just across the border from Kentucky, Manitowoc Foodservice is in the final stages of closing a factory that makes beverage dispensers and ice machines and is laying off 84 workers.
2016-12-01.headline_main: Trump Saved Jobs at Carrier, but More Midwest Jobs Are in Jeopardy

2016-12-01.abstract: Tall and striking, combining sensuous grace with nuanced force, Ms. Meehan came to notice as a leading soloist in the Erick Hawkins troupe in the 1960s.
2016-12-01.snippet: Tall and striking, combining sensuous grace with nuanced force, Ms. Meehan came to notice as a leading soloist in the Erick Hawkins troupe in the 1960s.
2016-12-01.lead_paragraph: Nancy Meehan, a highly original choreographer and dancer whose evocative, plotless works on nature themes found a special place amid opposing trends in experimental dance after the 1960s, died on Nov. 23 in Manhattan. She was 85.
2016-12-01.headline_main: Nancy Meehan, 85, Evocative Dancer and Choreographer, Dies

2016-12-01.abstract: Chris McCullough’s dual career with two Brooklyn teams is unusual, but a split existence is not. 45 N.B.A. players have been assigned on 103 occasions this season to D-League stints.
2016-12-01.snippet: Chris McCullough’s dual career with two Brooklyn teams is unusual, but a split existence is not. 45 N.B.A. players have been assigned on 103 occasions this season to D-League stints.
2016-12-01.lead_paragraph: It’s good to be 21 years old: no aches, no existential crises. After scoring 22 points in nearly 35 minutes of playing time on Tuesday afternoon for the Long Island Nets of the N.B.A. Development League, Chris McCullough stretched his muscles on a foam roll, iced his knees, soaked in a hot tub, ate a snack and took a nap. McCullough then changed locker rooms and uniforms inside Barclays Center in order to be ready for a game with the Brooklyn Nets at 7:30 that evening.
2016-12-01.headline_main: He Works Day and Night for the Nets. And the Other Nets.

2016-12-01.abstract: William Christenberry’s color photographs of the rural South describe the slow passage of time with plain-spoken eloquence.
2016-12-01.snippet: William Christenberry’s color photographs of the rural South describe the slow passage of time with plain-spoken eloquence.
2016-12-01.lead_paragraph: William Christenberry’s color photographs of the rural South describe the slow passage of time with plain-spoken eloquence.
2016-12-01.headline_main: His Affection for the South

2016-12-01.abstract: Few artists have been so identified with one small patch of terrain as Mr. Christenberry, who used Hale County, Ala., as the inspiration for many of his works.
2016-12-01.snippet: Few artists have been so identified with one small patch of terrain as Mr. Christenberry, who used Hale County, Ala., as the inspiration for many of his works.
2016-12-01.lead_paragraph: William A. Christenberry, whose widely admired color photographs of the red-clay landscapes and kudzu-wreathed dwellings in his native corner of the rural South describe the slow passage of time there with plain-spoken eloquence, died on Monday in Washington. He was 80.
2016-12-01.headline_main: William A. Christenberry, Photographer of Rural South, Dies at 80

2016-12-01.abstract: The rookie quarterback Dak Prescott of the Cowboys faces a sack-happy, ball-hawking Vikings defense in a clash of N.F.C. teams.
2016-12-01.snippet: The rookie quarterback Dak Prescott of the Cowboys faces a sack-happy, ball-hawking Vikings defense in a clash of N.F.C. teams.
2016-12-01.lead_paragraph: 8:25 p.m. Eastern, NBC and N.F.L. Network Line: Dallas by 3½
2016-12-01.headline_main: Thursday’s N.F.L. Matchup: Dallas Cowboys (10-1) at Minnesota Vikings (6-5)

2016-12-01.abstract: The chief operating officer of Facebook has signed the Giving Pledge, a campaign in which the world’s richest people vow to give away at least half their wealth.
2016-12-01.snippet: The chief operating officer of Facebook has signed the Giving Pledge, a campaign in which the world’s richest people vow to give away at least half their wealth.
2016-12-01.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Late last year, the Facebook co-founder Mark Zuckerberg and his wife, Priscilla Chan, said they would donate 99 percent of their Facebook shares toward a new financial vehicle for charitable purposes.
2016-12-01.headline_main: Sheryl Sandberg Said to Plan $100 Million in Charitable Giving

2016-12-01.abstract: Timothy Polin nourishes our brains with a clever turn.
2016-12-01.snippet: Timothy Polin nourishes our brains with a clever turn.
2016-12-01.lead_paragraph: THURSDAY PUZZLE — Even though we’re still struggling to finish all of the Thanksgiving leftovers at my house, a puzzle about food is always welcome, especially when it’s as much fun as today’s offering by Timothy Polin.
2016-12-01.headline_main: Nacho Accompaniment

2016-12-01.abstract: In this delightful musical, members of a school choir compete for one spot in the land of the living after they are killed when the title contraption malfunctions.
2016-12-01.snippet: In this delightful musical, members of a school choir compete for one spot in the land of the living after they are killed when the title contraption malfunctions.
2016-12-01.lead_paragraph: If your knees go weak at the mere sight of a roller coaster, and you shrink in your seat whenever a Six Flags commercial comes on television, you may want to think twice before snapping up a ticket to “Ride the Cyclone,” a musical comedy about, odd as it seems, a gruesome accident at an amusement park that takes the lives of six teenagers.
2016-12-01.headline_main: Review: Teenagers Sing to Survive in ‘Ride the Cyclone’

2016-12-01.abstract: It’s hard to have a bad episode with Cookie Lyon at the center.
2016-12-01.snippet: It’s hard to have a bad episode with Cookie Lyon at the center.
2016-12-01.lead_paragraph: You might want to sit down before you read this oh-so-shocking revelation: When “Empire” put Cookie Lyon at the center of an episode, it got the best episode of its third season so far. Largely pushing Lucious and the constant conflicts he engenders between his sons to the side, this week’s focus was squarely on the queen as she attempted to bring her scatterbrained family together to impress the family of her once-again boyfriend, the New York City mayoral candidate Angelo DuBois. Taraji P. Henson’s unerring ability to find the core of Cookie’s every interaction and mine it for all it’s worth is the show’s greatest renewable resource.
2016-12-01.headline_main: ‘Empire’ Season 3, Episode 7: Queen Cookie

2016-12-01.abstract: The State Board of Elections ordered a recount of roughly 94,000 votes in Durham County, a move that could help resolve Gov. Pat McCrory’s race for re-election.
2016-12-01.snippet: The State Board of Elections ordered a recount of roughly 94,000 votes in Durham County, a move that could help resolve Gov. Pat McCrory’s race for re-election.
2016-12-01.lead_paragraph: RALEIGH, N.C. — Acceding to the wishes of the embattled Gov. Pat McCrory, the North Carolina State Board of Elections on Wednesday ordered a recount of roughly 94,000 votes in Durham County, a move that could help resolve a contested governor’s race here that remains undecided three weeks after Election Day.
2016-12-01.headline_main: Partial Recount Ordered in North Carolina Governor’s Race

2016-12-01.abstract: The vote was most likely the final hurdle in ratifying the troubled agreement whose earlier version had been rejected in a referendum this fall.
2016-12-01.snippet: The vote was most likely the final hurdle in ratifying the troubled agreement whose earlier version had been rejected in a referendum this fall.
2016-12-01.lead_paragraph: Colombia’s Congress approved a revised peace accord with the country’s largest rebel group on Wednesday night, a vote that was most likely the final hurdle in ratifying the troubled agreement whose earlier version had been rejected in a referendum this fall.
2016-12-01.headline_main: Colombia’s Congress Approves Peace Accord With FARC

2016-12-01.abstract: This time, the Mets’ courtship of Yoenis Cespedes was different. It was mutual and featured a lot of communication.
2016-12-01.snippet: This time, the Mets’ courtship of Yoenis Cespedes was different. It was mutual and featured a lot of communication.
2016-12-01.lead_paragraph: This time, the Mets’ courtship of Yoenis Cespedes was different. It was mutual. Cespedes, the star outfielder, was not out of work in late January and still negotiating with teams, as he was last winter. From the start of this off-season — in fact, even before it — the Mets and Cespedes knew they wanted to stay together.
2016-12-01.headline_main: Cespedes Wanted to Stay. Mets Wanted Him to Stay. Done Deal.

2016-12-01.abstract: This week’s episode had flashes of brilliance, but trouble juggling its multiple plots.
2016-12-01.snippet: This week’s episode had flashes of brilliance, but trouble juggling its multiple plots.
2016-12-01.lead_paragraph: Almost all television dramas juggle several plots at once, which serve to sharpen one another, create contrasts, switch up the scenery, or leave cliffhangers. Sadly, this week’s “Designated Survivor” proved unable to maintain this delicate act: It has a riveting A Story, but a labored B Story and an unimportant and mawkish C Story. The resulting episode contains flashes of brilliance, but overall is clumsy and unbalanced.
2016-12-01.headline_main: ‘Designated Survivor’ Season 1, Episode 8: Priorities and Principles

2016-12-01.abstract: Corrections appearing in print on Thursday, December 1, 2016.
2016-12-01.snippet: Corrections appearing in print on Thursday, December 1, 2016.
2016-12-01.lead_paragraph: INTERNATIONAL
2016-12-01.headline_main: Corrections: December 1, 2016

2016-12-01.abstract: Art Basel features work from 269 galleries, including some there for the first time and some who have been given more prominent space.
2016-12-01.snippet: Art Basel features work from 269 galleries, including some there for the first time and some who have been given more prominent space.
2016-12-01.lead_paragraph: Some elements of Art Basel Miami Beach are as constant as the Florida sunshine. But Marc Spiegler, the global head of the event, said this was “a year of change” for the most important American art fair.
2016-12-01.headline_main: Important Arts Fair Looks for Balance in Miami Beach

2016-12-01.abstract: A British exhibition shows how the avant-garde adapted classical forms to express postwar issues. Included are gifted artists who are little known.
2016-12-01.snippet: A British exhibition shows how the avant-garde adapted classical forms to express postwar issues. Included are gifted artists who are little known.
2016-12-01.lead_paragraph: CHICHESTER, ENGLAND — After the end of World War I, there was a radical rethinking in the visual arts, called a “Rappel à l’ordre” (Return to Order) by the Cubist painter André Lhote, as avant-garde exponents of such movements as Cubism, Futurism and Abstraction began to re-examine classical forms as fruitful modes of expression for modern times.
2016-12-01.headline_main: Big Rethinking: Classicism in the U.K. After World War I

2016-12-01.abstract: Along with the annual Art Basel Miami Beach fair, the city has nonprofits, museums and collections that nourish the art world all year long.
2016-12-01.snippet: Along with the annual Art Basel Miami Beach fair, the city has nonprofits, museums and collections that nourish the art world all year long.
2016-12-01.lead_paragraph: No one would dispute that Miami has put itself on the map of places that matter in the visual arts world, largely because of the 15-year-old fair Art Basel Miami Beach. But what happens when the circus leaves town?
2016-12-01.headline_main: Miami, With Sun, Surf and Clubs, Now Has a Solid Art Scene

2016-12-01.abstract: The director Salman Matinfar felt contemporary Iranian art was not well understood or presented and that locals should get to view international artists.
2016-12-01.snippet: The director Salman Matinfar felt contemporary Iranian art was not well understood or presented and that locals should get to view international artists.
2016-12-01.lead_paragraph: LONDON — Reza Aramesh had received offers before. Over the years the London-based artist, who was born in Iran, was approached by various Tehran galleries asking if he would like to have his works exhibited. But for a variety of reasons it never felt suitable.
2016-12-01.headline_main: Tehran’s Ab-Anbar Gallery Links the Diaspora and Global Art

2016-12-01.abstract: From a studio in a neighborhood on the cusp of gentrification, Sun Xun builds from his family’s and his nation’s shared histories.
2016-12-01.snippet: From a studio in a neighborhood on the cusp of gentrification, Sun Xun builds from his family’s and his nation’s shared histories.
2016-12-01.lead_paragraph: BEIJING — A trip to Sun Xun’s studio involved clambering — suitcase and all — onto the back of his friend’s moped in the dusty outskirts of this city. The scooter puttered through Heiqiaocun, or Black Bridge Village, before stopping at the vast industrial space used by Mr. Sun.
2016-12-01.headline_main: A Chinese Artist Consumed by the Idea of Inevitable Change

2016-12-01.abstract: What to expect from art galleries exhibiting at the international showcase for the first time.
2016-12-01.snippet: What to expect from art galleries exhibiting at the international showcase for the first time.
2016-12-01.lead_paragraph: Twenty-one galleries are making their debut at Art Basel Miami Beach  on Thursday, out of some 600 dealers who applied for the fair and 269 who were accepted. The lineup is determined after much debate on the merit of each and how individual galleries contribute to the overall balance of the show. The New York Times asked Noah Horowitz, the fair’s director, to highlight several newcomers.
2016-12-01.headline_main: 7 Notable Debuts at Art Basel Miami Beach

2016-12-01.abstract: Festive finery in the window displays of New York City’s favorite retailers.
2016-12-01.snippet: Festive finery in the window displays of New York City’s favorite retailers.

2016-12-01.lead_paragraph: Witness the creation of the Bergdorf Goodman holiday displays as David Hoey, who has been the window director for 18 years, walks you through the detailed process.

2016-12-01.abstract: With its high concentration of vintage shops, unique specialty stores and small boutiques, Shimokitazawa is seen as a shopping mecca by hip Tokyoites.
2016-12-01.snippet: With its high concentration of vintage shops, unique specialty stores and small boutiques, Shimokitazawa is seen as a shopping mecca by hip Tokyoites.
2016-12-01.lead_paragraph: The low-key neighborhood of Shimokitazawa in western Tokyo is only one express-train stop from the sensory excesses of chaotic Shibuya — imagine Times Square, amplified — but it’s a world away in spirit. The area, locally called Shimokita, is populated by hip young Tokyoites drawn by the relaxed, small-town atmosphere that makes the neighborhood an anomaly in this bustling megalopolis. The narrow streets are easy to navigate and dense with local businesses, including a high concentration of vintage shops, unusual specialty stores and small boutiques stocked with wares from young artists and artisans. Many consider this the coolest neighborhood in Tokyo, and when you browse some of the most interesting shops, it’s hard to disagree.
2016-12-01.headline_main: Five Places to Shop in Tokyo

2016-12-01.abstract: Threats and self-dealing don’t get a negotiator very far in Havana.
2016-12-01.snippet: Threats and self-dealing don’t get a negotiator very far in Havana.
2016-12-01.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — DONALD J. TRUMP has never felt compelled to play by conventional rules — neither in business nor in politics — and that iconoclasm has made him a billionaire and president-elect of the United States. But if he thinks he can use his business practices abroad as a model for negotiations with foreign governments, he will be in for a rude awakening, especially with Cuba. Mr. Trump’s foreign business deals have been lucrative, but they exemplify just the sort of cronyism and shady dealing that characterized American business practices in Cuba before Fidel Castro’s revolution — practices that stoked Cuban nationalism, increased Mr. Castro’s popularity and led to the seizure of over a billion dollars of American property.
2016-12-01.headline_main: What Trump Misses About Cuba

2016-12-01.lead_paragraph: In the 1936 film “Show Boat,” Paul Robeson, in a brilliant and moving performance as the stevedore Joe, sings “Ol’ Man River.” The scene is melancholic, even tragic, as Robeson contrasts the hardships of his menial labor with the effortless flow of the Mississippi River. The actor’s expression hints at weariness and sadness, that “uneasily tied knot of pain and hope,” as the writer Richard Wright described it, which often registered on the faces of marginalized African-American entertainers of the time.
2016-12-01.headline_main: Black Male Glamour, as Style and Substance

2016-12-01.abstract: Cooked with a startling flame — and just a dash of Brooklyn.
2016-12-01.snippet: Cooked with a startling flame — and just a dash of Brooklyn.
2016-12-01.lead_paragraph: “Ah, they are not rising!” Marianne Tober cried, in a near panic over her gougères. They weren’t just cheese puffs; they were her Burgundian birthright, well-salted dairy fat given airy form, and her mother’s recipe had never failed her before. But it was true: The gougères in her oven were lying stubbornly flat, browning pungently into something you might call savory Gruyère cookies. Which, as you can imagine, were still pretty delicious. “But they’re not the way they’re supposed to be,” she lamented. I assured her that the tray of gougères would not survive the night. She managed a smile, then said: “You know, Americans give you credit for trying things. Everything doesn’t have to be ‘correct.’ That’s one reason French people like being here so much.”
2016-12-01.headline_main: A Shamelessly French Chicken in Cider

2016-12-01.abstract: For all the virtuosic craftsmanship on display in these YouTube videos, the real draw may be the absorbing peace of watching a man go about his work.
2016-12-01.snippet: For all the virtuosic craftsmanship on display in these YouTube videos, the real draw may be the absorbing peace of watching a man go about his work.
2016-12-01.lead_paragraph: Somewhere in an unidentifiable patch of scrubby forest, a nameless man labors to make something — an ax, a forge, an entire hut — using only materials that he has collected from the surrounding wilderness. It’s a patient process. Working without tools means that every fire has to be started by hand, without matches, using a straight stick spun against another piece of wood, the ember gently edged into a handful of dry duff until it kindles. Chopping down a sapling means first flaking a stone into an adz, then hammering the adz into the trunk until the tree can be wrenched down.
2016-12-01.headline_main: Letter of Recommendation: ‘Primitive Technology’

2016-12-01.lead_paragraph: While practically no official news was received yesterday from Roumanian sources regarding operations on the front round Bucarest, Berlin advices report that Generals Falkenhayn and Mackensen have made further impor­tant progress, though their advance has been much less rapid since Tuesday. North-west of the capital Falkenhayn has occupied the important towns of Kampulung and Pitesti, while in the south Mackensen has pushed ahead a little beyond Comana, rather less than seventeen miles from Bucarest.

2016-12-01.abstract: Benjamin Millepied stages “Homecoming” at the Ace Hotel.
2016-12-01.snippet: Benjamin Millepied stages “Homecoming” at the Ace Hotel.
2016-12-01.lead_paragraph: It seems fitting that the world premiere of “Homecoming,” a new ballet from Benjamin Millepied, will take place in Los Angeles, where he recently returned after a stint leading the Paris Opera Ballet. But don’t expect an on-the-nose celebration. The piece is an abstract duet set to songs by Rufus Wainwright, who will live-accompany Millepied and Janie Taylor, a new addition to Millepied’s company, L.A. Dance Project. If anything, says the choreographer, it’s about a couple “losing and finding each other within a relationship.” It’s also inherently about the idea of what ballet can be. “Dance is really the art that assembles other art,” he says. For “On the Other Side” — making its U.S. premiere alongside “Homecoming” at the gorgeously restored Art Deco theater at the Ace Hotel in downtown Los Angeles — Millepied enlisted the painter Mark Bradford to design the sets.
2016-12-01.headline_main: An Art-Filled Ballet Comes to Los Angeles

I work hard at my job and on my personal relationships. But lately I can’t help noticing how one-sided they all are. My friends and boyfriend sit back and talk about themselves nonstop without ever asking me a question about my life. It’s even fallen on me to initiate plans and make all the arrangements. How should I complain to these people (or back away from them)?

2016-12-01.abstract: From the omnipresent aroma of palo santo to a growing faith in Tarot, a new age vibe pulsed through the year.
2016-12-01.snippet: From the omnipresent aroma of palo santo to a growing faith in Tarot, a new age vibe pulsed through the year.
2016-12-01.lead_paragraph: Palo santo, which means “holy stick” in Spanish, is a tree indigenous to the Caribbean and South America. When burned, it emits a fragrance of pine and citrus. Lighting a stick of palo santo, like burning a bundle of sage or sweetgrass, is believed to chase away misfortune. Amazonian shamans use it in ayahuasca ceremonies to cleanse a ceremonial space of bad spirits. Given its mystical connotations, it’s not a scent associated with the secular world, but lately I have noticed its distinctive smoke wafting over more earthly settings, from Brooklyn dive bars to blue-chip art openings.
2016-12-01.headline_main: The Modern Charm of Practical Magic

2016-12-01.abstract: Whatever Pope Francis wants, the church’s liberal wing is implementing a revolution.
2016-12-01.snippet: Whatever Pope Francis wants, the church’s liberal wing is implementing a revolution.
2016-12-01.lead_paragraph: I haven’t written in this space for some time, but now that the election is over some additional interventions seem necessary to capture what’s happening in Roman Catholicism’s remarkable period of controversy. My Sunday column talked a bit about the way in which varying interpretations of “Amoris Laetitia,” Pope Francis’s apostolic exhortation on the family, have produced variations in official Catholic teaching on marriage from diocese to diocese, region to region – a “submerged schism,” to borrow a phrase from the Vatican-watcher Andrea Gagliarducci, which thanks to the astringent words of certain bishops is no longer even that submerged.
2016-12-01.headline_main: The End of Catholic Marriage

2016-12-01.snippet: In the Upper Engadin, a 35-mile swath of the southeastern Swiss Alps, a crop of galleries have emerged as an après-ski alternative.
2016-12-01.lead_paragraph: When the curator and art dealer Vito Schnabel decided to open his first permanent gallery space last December, he chose St. Moritz over the art districts of Chai Wan, Chelsea or Wynwood. He’s not alone: Exhibitions in ski resorts have become something of a phenomenon lately. This past summer, the curator Neville Wakefield organized a group show featuring work by Dan Colen, Damien Hirst and Richard Prince in an Aspen ski shop, while in Gstaad, Hauser & Wirth erected an exhibition of monumental Calder sculptures (“Calder in the Alps,” on view through March 31, 2017), many of which had never been exhibited in Switzerland before.
2016-12-01.headline_main: Art, at High Altitudes

2016-12-01.abstract: Glossy new books devoted to the lavish retreats of American “country house” living.
2016-12-01.snippet: Glossy new books devoted to the lavish retreats of American “country house” living.
2016-12-01.lead_paragraph: Julian Fellowes may be adapting the “Downton Abbey” formula to a stateside setting, but why wait for his late-19th-century period piece, “The Gilded Age,” when you can escape right now into the well-apportioned drawing rooms of the past? Just crack open one of the glossy new books devoted to American “country house” living and concoct your own melodrama about the privileged few. The impulse behind their lavish retreats was to “get away from it all” — but, of course, the “all” often came right along with them.
2016-12-01.headline_main: Three Handsome Books on Country Living

2016-12-01.abstract: Here’s what you need to know to start your day.

2016-12-01.headline_main: François Hollande, Donald Trump, Vladimir Putin: Your Friday Briefing

2016-12-01.abstract: Sidney Weinberg, “Mr. Wall Street,” began a tradition of Goldman executives taking on public service that is continuing under President-elect Trump.
2016-12-01.snippet: Sidney Weinberg, “Mr. Wall Street,” began a tradition of Goldman executives taking on public service that is continuing under President-elect Trump.
2016-12-01.lead_paragraph: During World War II, President Franklin D. Roosevelt selected Sidney J. Weinberg, the chief executive of Goldman Sachs, to serve as the assistant director of the War Production Board. Mr. Weinberg was one of the few men on Wall Street to support Roosevelt in the 1932 election, and he went on to advise Presidents Harry S. Truman, Dwight D. Eisenhower and Lyndon B. Johnson.
2016-12-01.headline_main: The Guys From ‘Government Sachs’

2016-12-01.abstract: Senators said that the vote would help ensure that the United States could quickly reimpose sanctions if Iran violated its obligations under an agreement.
2016-12-01.snippet: Senators said that the vote would help ensure that the United States could quickly reimpose sanctions if Iran violated its obligations under an agreement.
2016-12-01.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Senate voted unanimously on Thursday to extend the president’s authority to impose sanctions on Iran for another decade, a largely symbolic move intended to keep pressure on Tehran to abide by the landmark nuclear accord struck last year.
2016-12-01.headline_main: Senate Votes to Extend Iran Sanctions Authority

2016-12-01.abstract: Mr. Hollande stunned the nation with his decision, even though few observers thought he could recover from his poor approval ratings to win next year’s vote.
2016-12-01.snippet: Mr. Hollande stunned the nation with his decision, even though few observers thought he could recover from his poor approval ratings to win next year’s vote.
2016-12-01.lead_paragraph: STRASBOURG, France — Battered by months of dismal approval ratings and a stubbornly high unemployment rate, President François Hollande of France announced Thursday night that he would not compete in next year’s election.
2016-12-01.headline_main: President François Hollande of France Won’t Seek Re-election

2016-12-01.abstract: The British police said on Thursday that at least 350 people have come forward to report abuse at the hands of soccer coaches.
2016-12-01.snippet: The British police said on Thursday that at least 350 people have come forward to report abuse at the hands of soccer coaches.
2016-12-01.lead_paragraph: LONDON — At least 350 people have come forward to report abuse at the hands of youth soccer coaches in Britain over the past two weeks, the police said Thursday, deepening a child sexual abuse scandal that has engulfed English soccer.
2016-12-01.headline_main: Claims of Child Sexual Abuse in English Soccer Grow

2016-12-01.abstract: A gilded spot on West 57th Street will bow out with a flourish on New Year’s Eve.
2016-12-01.snippet: A gilded spot on West 57th Street will bow out with a flourish on New Year’s Eve.

2016-12-01.abstract: Revisit Tomi Ungerer’s surprising stories, pretend to cook and more in these large-format illustrated books.
2016-12-01.snippet: Revisit Tomi Ungerer’s surprising stories, pretend to cook and more in these large-format illustrated books.
2016-12-01.lead_paragraph: Arriving at a moment when they seem perhaps especially welcome, these six large-format books might provide a bit of escape for young readers and grown-ups alike. They remind us that literature can be at least as strange and interesting as reality, and that, though there is more than enough despair and ugliness to go around, there is also — still — hope and beauty and imagination to spare.
2016-12-01.headline_main: Big Beautiful Books for Small People

2016-12-01.abstract: Wisconsin is recounting the presidential vote at the behest and expense of Jill Stein, of the Green Party, with Michigan and Pennsylvania recounts up in the air.
2016-12-01.snippet: Wisconsin is recounting the presidential vote at the behest and expense of Jill Stein, of the Green Party, with Michigan and Pennsylvania recounts up in the air.
2016-12-01.lead_paragraph: ELKHORN, Wis. — The basement room was cleared of pens with blue or black ink, items that could mar paper ballots. Anyone wearing a coat was told to leave it in the hallway, in case something nefarious was hidden underneath. Water bottles, purses and keys were placed on the floor, leaving the large plastic tables smooth and uncluttered.
2016-12-01.headline_main: ‘We’re Going to Get This Done’: Wisconsin Vote Recount Is Underway

2016-12-01.abstract: It’s also a security risk.
2016-12-01.snippet: It’s also a security risk.
2016-12-01.lead_paragraph: President-elect Donald J. Trump said on Wednesday that he would separate himself from his businesses before he enters the White House. More details about the arrangement will be announced in mid-December, but it sounds as if he plans to step away from only the management of his business, which presumably will be turned over to his children, while retaining ownership.
2016-12-01.headline_main: Trump’s Business Empire Isn’t Just an Ethical Disaster

2016-12-01.lead_paragraph: Perhaps you had a wonderful gift in mind for your cocktail-loving, whiskey-sipping friend: an excellent bottle of nicely aged rye.

2016-12-01.abstract: Canal Street Market opens Thursday.
2016-12-01.snippet: Canal Street Market opens Thursday.
2016-12-01.lead_paragraph: In Chinatown, just in time for the holidays (and surrounded by kitschy souvenir shops and knockoff designer fashion vendors), a gleaming new storefront now offers artisan and handcrafted goods. The Canal Street Market’s airy, industrial space dates back to the 19th century, and was once occupied by the Studebaker Brothers wagon and auto manufacturers. The market’s founder, the developer Philip Chong, says he wanted to introduce a missing retail component to Chinatown, “in a space that feels uniquely downtown New York.”
2016-12-01.headline_main: A One-Stop Artisanal Goods Shop, in Chinatown

2016-12-01.abstract: The annual lingerie event was held in Paris for the first time.
2016-12-01.snippet: The annual lingerie event was held in Paris for the first time.

2016-12-01.abstract: Secretary General Ban Ki-moon avoided any mention of who brought the disease to Haiti, and critics said his mea culpa came too late.
2016-12-01.snippet: Secretary General Ban Ki-moon avoided any mention of who brought the disease to Haiti, and critics said his mea culpa came too late.
2016-12-01.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS — After six years and 10,000 deaths, the United Nations issued a carefully worded public apology on Thursday for its role in the 2010 cholera outbreak in Haiti and the widespread suffering it has caused since then.
2016-12-01.headline_main: U.N. Apologizes for Role in Haiti’s 2010 Cholera Outbreak

2016-12-01.abstract: The capture of Ben Ziane Berhili was the highest-profile arrest yet in an operation that has seized $3.2 billion worth of hashish since 2013.
2016-12-01.snippet: The capture of Ben Ziane Berhili was the highest-profile arrest yet in an operation that has seized $3.2 billion worth of hashish since 2013.
2016-12-01.lead_paragraph: PALERMO, Italy — One of the world’s most wanted hashish smugglers has been captured in Casablanca, Morocco, the Italian police said on Thursday, the highest-profile arrest yet in a three-year anti-trafficking operation that has spanned three continents.
2016-12-01.headline_main: One of World’s Most Wanted Hashish Smugglers Arrested in Morocco

2016-12-01.abstract: Chef Rocky Barnette debuts a preconquest menu at the Capri this month.
2016-12-01.snippet: Chef Rocky Barnette debuts a preconquest menu at the Capri this month.
2016-12-01.lead_paragraph: “Every mesquite tree tastes different, so you have to walk around tasting them all,” says chef Rocky Barnette about the southwestern plant that grows plentifully in Marfa, Tex., where he lives and cooks. The indigenous flora and fauna of the sleepy town have become an obsession for Barnette. So much so that in December, he will launch a preconquest tasting menu — a collection of dishes inspired by the ancient cuisines of the region — at the Capri, the restaurant and events space owned by his wife, the arts and culture philanthropist Virginia Lebermann.
2016-12-01.headline_main: In Marfa, Eating the Ancient Way

2016-12-01.abstract: The French fashion crowd turned out for a runway show that was a spectacle.
2016-12-01.snippet: The French fashion crowd turned out for a runway show that was a spectacle.
2016-12-01.lead_paragraph: PARIS — On Wednesday evening, Paris, the birthplace in 1889 of the modern bra (not to mention the home of many of the world’s greatest fashion houses and runway shows), finally played host to the Fantasy Bra as the Victoria’s Secret Fashion Show rolled out the pink carpet at the Grand Palais.
2016-12-01.headline_main: Victoria’s Secret Takes Paris

2016-12-01.abstract: Mr. Schultz is planning to leave the job in April, turning the reins over to his handpicked successor, Kevin Johnson.
2016-12-01.snippet: Mr. Schultz is planning to leave the job in April, turning the reins over to his handpicked successor, Kevin Johnson.
2016-12-01.lead_paragraph: SEATTLE — Howard Schultz, the visionary leader of Starbucks, said on Thursday he would step down as chief executive next year, handing over to his personally selected successor the management of the company he built into the world’s largest coffee business, with over 25,000 stores in 75 countries.
2016-12-01.headline_main: Howard Schultz to Step Down as Starbucks Chief Next Year

2016-12-01.abstract: My clinic rooms, clean and nondescript as they are, sometimes provide a safe house for laying bare the wrenching decisions that tug on my patients.
2016-12-01.snippet: My clinic rooms, clean and nondescript as they are, sometimes provide a safe house for laying bare the wrenching decisions that tug on my patients.
2016-12-01.lead_paragraph: “I’m pregnant,” my patient’s wife told me, her face a tapestry of conflicting emotions. My patient was watching her, too, trying to figure out if he should echo her happiness, or her grief.
2016-12-01.headline_main: A Place to Be Heard

2016-12-01.snippet: Americans like it.

2016-12-01.abstract: In his first competitive round in over a year, Woods birdied four of his first eight holes, then had two double-bogeys and a bogey after the turn to finish one over par.
2016-12-01.snippet: In his first competitive round in over a year, Woods birdied four of his first eight holes, then had two double-bogeys and a bogey after the turn to finish one over par.
2016-12-01.lead_paragraph: NASSAU, the Bahamas — From the third fairway, Tiger Woods struck a shot with his 5-iron and froze on his follow-through, tracking the ball as he did routinely in his prime. The shot, his second on the 572-yard par 5 at Albany Golf Club on Thursday, was hit almost too flush. Woods had not been sure he had enough club to reach the green, so he was surprised when the ball rolled off the back of it.
2016-12-01.headline_main: Tiger Woods Shows Some Magic, Then Shows Some Rust

2016-12-01.abstract: Readers urge the media not to allow Mr. Trump’s tweets to dictate what they write about.
2016-12-01.snippet: Readers urge the media not to allow Mr. Trump’s tweets to dictate what they write about.
2016-12-01.lead_paragraph: To the Editor:
2016-12-01.headline_main: How the Media Covers Donald Trump’s Tweets

2016-12-01.abstract: A teenage girl curious about sex engages in an online flirtation that leads to stranger danger.
2016-12-01.snippet: A teenage girl curious about sex engages in an online flirtation that leads to stranger danger.
2016-12-01.lead_paragraph: “There isn’t a reality or a virtual reality anymore, bro,” the owner of a pornography shop says in “Videofilia (and Other Viral Syndromes),” a fractured and calculatedly off-putting feature from Juan Daniel F. Molero. “Everything’s been mixed up.”
2016-12-01.headline_main: Review: ‘Videofilia (and Other Viral Syndromes)’ Is a Digital Hall of Mirrors

2016-12-01.abstract: A corporate conspiracy with a medical company is at the center of this classical Hong Kong action film directed by Ringo Lam.
2016-12-01.snippet: A corporate conspiracy with a medical company is at the center of this classical Hong Kong action film directed by Ringo Lam.
2016-12-01.lead_paragraph: The energetic and influential Hong Kong director Ringo Lam was, in his 1980s heyday, noted for action pictures with intensely emotional and convoluted stories. (His 1987 film “City on Fire” was something of a model for Quentin Tarantino’s “Reservoir Dogs.”) After taking a hiatus from directing in 2007, Mr. Lam returned last year with “Wild City.” Now he’s back with “Sky on Fire,” about, among other things, a truck driver named Chia (Joseph Chang), who blunders into a complicated corporate conspiracy while pursuing a new cancer cure for his adoptive sister Jen (Amber Kuo).
2016-12-01.headline_main: Review: ‘Sky on Fire,’ or Is That Just a Gleaming C.G.I. Skyscraper?

2016-12-01.abstract: A bachelor party goes horribly awry in this feature-length treatment by Gregg Bishop of a segment in the horror anthology “V/H/S.”
2016-12-01.snippet: A bachelor party goes horribly awry in this feature-length treatment by Gregg Bishop of a segment in the horror anthology “V/H/S.”
2016-12-01.lead_paragraph: Nothing good has ever come of a bachelor party, but the one in “Siren” goes particularly awry. The movie is a not-great horror flick, but if it discourages one future groom from having a final ill-advised night of debauchery, it will have served a purpose.
2016-12-01.headline_main: Review: ‘Siren’ Suggests Grooms-to-Be Ought to Stay Home

2016-12-01.abstract: Therese Oneill’s “Unmentionable” transports us back to the world of middle-class 19th-century women, emphasizing the messy details that costume dramas airbrush out.
2016-12-01.snippet: Therese Oneill’s “Unmentionable” transports us back to the world of middle-class 19th-century women, emphasizing the messy details that costume dramas airbrush out.
2016-12-01.lead_paragraph: UNMENTIONABLEThe Victorian Lady’s Guide to Sex, Marriage, and MannersBy Therese OneillIllustrated. 307 pp. Little, Brown & Company. $25.
2016-12-01.headline_main: The Private Life of Victorians

2016-12-01.abstract: The civilians of opposition-held eastern Aleppo are fleeing by the thousands after days of near constant bombardment by Syrian and Russian forces. Their flight to areas of humanitarian aid is a risky one.
2016-12-01.snippet: The civilians of opposition-held eastern Aleppo are fleeing by the thousands after days of near constant bombardment by Syrian and Russian forces. Their flight to areas of humanitarian aid is a risky one.
2016-12-01.lead_paragraph: The civilians of opposition-held eastern Aleppo are fleeing by the thousands after days of near constant bombardment by Syrian and Russian forces. Their flight to areas of humanitarian aid is a risky one.

2016-12-01.abstract: This Carles Torrens film centers on a psychological duel between an animal shelter worker and a former crush.
2016-12-01.snippet: This Carles Torrens film centers on a psychological duel between an animal shelter worker and a former crush.
2016-12-01.lead_paragraph: A man locks a woman in a steel cage in a rat-infested basement, explaining that he wants to “save” her. He’s a really sweet man who’s superkind to animals, and we can see that detaining this young beauty is causing him no end of distress. So let’s root for him, then?
2016-12-01.headline_main: Review: That ‘Pet’ at the Shelter Looks Like a Caged Woman

2016-12-01.abstract: The highlights of eight years of writing about collectors and their obsessions as well as the makers at the source.
2016-12-01.snippet: The highlights of eight years of writing about collectors and their obsessions as well as the makers at the source.
2016-12-01.lead_paragraph: Slices of cake from royal weddings, locks of hair from famous heads, firecracker wrappers, and artifacts related to the assassination of John F. Kennedy. These are among the rarefied obsessions of the collectors I have interviewed in eight years as the Antiques columnist for The New York Times. I tried to shed light on the origins of luxuries created by members of oppressed communities, and the wanderings of belongings of persecuted families driven into exile. I set out to explain why we make what we make and why we buy what we buy, and asked what our possessions express about us, and about the extremes of human folly, greed, experimentation and ambition.
2016-12-01.headline_main: Magnificent Obsessions: Pursuits of a Lifetime

2016-12-01.abstract: Dito Montiel’s film, which stars Shia LaBeouf as a scarred veteran, imparts the urgency of its issue more effectively with statistics than with its script.
2016-12-01.snippet: Dito Montiel’s film, which stars Shia LaBeouf as a scarred veteran, imparts the urgency of its issue more effectively with statistics than with its script.
2016-12-01.lead_paragraph: Early in “Man Down,” Gabriel, a battle-scarred Marine played by Shia LaBeouf, walks past a burned-out former factory building that’s spray-painted with the message “America We Have a Problem.”
2016-12-01.headline_main: Review: ‘Man Down’ Looks at Combat Trauma Through a Marine’s Eyes

2016-12-01.abstract: Natalie Portman is perfect in Pablo Larraín’s multifaceted portrait of the former first lady Jacqueline Kennedy as an embodiment of grief and as an architect of brilliant political theater.
2016-12-01.snippet: Natalie Portman is perfect in Pablo Larraín’s multifaceted portrait of the former first lady Jacqueline Kennedy as an embodiment of grief and as an architect of brilliant political theater.
2016-12-01.lead_paragraph: On Nov. 25, 1963, three days after becoming the world’s most famous widow, Jacqueline Kennedy slipped on a mourning veil. A diaphanous shroud reaching to her waist, it moved lightly as she walked behind her husband’s coffin in the cortege that traveled from the White House to St. Matthew’s Cathedral. The veil was transparent enough to reveal her pale face, though not entirely, ensuring that she was at once visible and obscured. “I don’t like to hear people say that I am poised and maintaining a good appearance,” she later said. “I am not a movie actress.”
2016-12-01.headline_main: ‘Jackie’: Under the Widow’s Weeds, a Myth Marketer

2016-12-01.abstract: Seven artists and collectives from mainland China, Hong Kong and Taiwan unravel traditional notions of place and history in this show at the Guggenheim Museum.
2016-12-01.snippet: Seven artists and collectives from mainland China, Hong Kong and Taiwan unravel traditional notions of place and history in this show at the Guggenheim Museum.
2016-12-01.lead_paragraph: Museums of modern and contemporary art like to talk a big game about globalism, and their big-tent discourse challenges the old assumption that artists can be naturally grouped together by geography. Yet the fact remains: Western artists get the solo shows, while audiences usually discover art from beyond the United States and Europe through exhibitions with a geographic focus — which lump together diverse and sometimes unrelated artists under a national or regional banner.
2016-12-01.headline_main: Chinese Artists Redraw Boundaries in ‘Tales of Our Time’

2016-12-01.abstract: Albers, a painter best known for his devotion to color, also developed an interest in black and white, as two exhibitions illustrate.
2016-12-01.snippet: Albers, a painter best known for his devotion to color, also developed an interest in black and white, as two exhibitions illustrate.
2016-12-01.lead_paragraph: “Purity of heart is to will one thing,” the philosopher Soren Kierkegaard wrote. It’s tempting to think of the painter Josef Albers, renowned for his late-career devotion to — not to say obsession with — the mechanics of color in art, as someone who was pure in that narrowing-down way.
2016-12-01.headline_main: Josef Albers’s Science and Soul of Seeing

2016-12-01.abstract: Chris Smith’s oral history traces the 16-year sprint that turned “The Daily Show” from a second-rate cable presentation into a vital institution in American politics and the media.
2016-12-01.snippet: Chris Smith’s oral history traces the 16-year sprint that turned “The Daily Show” from a second-rate cable presentation into a vital institution in American politics and the media.
2016-12-01.lead_paragraph: THE DAILY SHOW (THE BOOK)An Oral HistoryBy Chris SmithIllustrated. 459 pp. Grand Central Publishing. $30.

2016-12-01.abstract: Starboard Value has asked Rockwell Collins to consider selling itself instead of buying B/E Aerospace. The hedge fund faces an uphill climb.
2016-12-01.snippet: Starboard Value has asked Rockwell Collins to consider selling itself instead of buying B/E Aerospace. The hedge fund faces an uphill climb.
2016-12-01.lead_paragraph: Starboard Value is flying close to the sun. Starboard, the activist hedge fund run by Jeff Smith, wants aircraft-parts maker Rockwell Collins to consider ditching a $6.4 billion tie-up with B/E Aerospace. Grounding the merger has merit, but Carl Icahn and others have had mixed results agitating against mergers and acquisitions. A Trump-inspired rally in Rockwell’s stock complicates Starboard’s case.
2016-12-01.headline_main: Activist Fund Has Tough Sell to Get Rockwell to Rethink Deal

2016-12-01.abstract: Richard McGuire’s charming “Sequential Drawings” collects over a decade’s worth of spot illustrations for The New Yorker.

2016-12-01.abstract: “Dreamlands: Immersive Cinema and Art, 1905-2016,” at the Whitney Museum of American Art, means to dismantle the cinematic givens we take for granted.
2016-12-01.snippet: “Dreamlands: Immersive Cinema and Art, 1905-2016,” at the Whitney Museum of American Art, means to dismantle the cinematic givens we take for granted.
2016-12-01.lead_paragraph: When the movie camera emerged around the turn of the 20th century, it quickly became the miracle that never stopped giving. It attracted scientists, the news industry and entertainers. It generated its own forms of commerce, wealth and celebrity and, for a while, inspired its own architecture, the luxurious movie palace. It was itself the focus of constant innovation, from the advent of sound, color and 3-D, to digitalization, which let smartphones and other devices incorporate both filmless cameras and small screens — hand-held movie palaces. And from the very beginning, creative people of all types grasped the cinema as an artistic outlet that would transform traditional storytelling and popular culture while giving a new focus to the international avant-garde. That group soon set about taking liberties with all aspects of the miracle: the camera, film and projector and the ways they could be manipulated to alter experiences of time, light, space and self.
2016-12-01.headline_main: Diving Into Movie Palaces of the Mind at the Whitney

2016-12-01.abstract: In this Aleksey Mizgirev film set in 1860 St. Petersburg, an ex-nobleman makes his living as a proxy in honor matches of shooting skill.
2016-12-01.snippet: In this Aleksey Mizgirev film set in 1860 St. Petersburg, an ex-nobleman makes his living as a proxy in honor matches of shooting skill.
2016-12-01.lead_paragraph: The Russian-born author Vladimir Nabokov more than once complained about the conventions of depicting Russian duels in non-Russian works of art — noblemen with their backs turned to each other, walking 10 paces ahead, and so on. Not how it was done, the great writer insisted. “The Duelist,” a Russian-made picture about a former nobleman making his living as a proxy in honor-restoring matches of shooting skill, never shows such a duel. In this movie, directed by Aleksey Mizgirev and set in 1860 St. Petersburg, the fighters meet at close range, sometimes stand separated by a screen, and face off in other visually interesting ways. I still don’t think Nabokov would have approved — he had better taste in movies.
2016-12-01.headline_main: Review: ‘The Duelist’ Is a Good Shot. A Very Good Shot.

As they developed the idea, they mined their own childhood memories, took lessons at a shooting range, ordered rifle parts on the web and joined in a hunt.

2016-12-01.abstract: This captivating movie, like the blues itself, is at once a recognition of somber truths and a gesture of protest against them.
2016-12-01.snippet: This captivating movie, like the blues itself, is at once a recognition of somber truths and a gesture of protest against them.
2016-12-01.lead_paragraph: “Two Trains Runnin’,” Sam Pollard’s compact, resonant documentary — part essay film, part road picture, part musical anthology — is built around an astonishing historical coincidence. On June 21, 1964, two lost giants of the Delta blues, Skip James and Son House, were found by separate crews of obsessed music fans after weeks of amateur sleuthing along the back roads of Mississippi. James and House had each made a handful of recordings in the ’30s and ’40s, and then faded into obscurity until the folk revival of the early ’60s piqued the interest of students and coffeehouse guitar pickers in the college towns of the North.
2016-12-01.headline_main: Review: In ‘Two Trains Runnin’,’ the Convergence of Idealism, Brutality and Artistic Genius

2016-12-01.abstract: “The Undoing Project: A Friendship That Changed Our Minds” looks at the groundbreaking collaboration between the psychologists Daniel Kahneman and Amos Tversky.
2016-12-01.snippet: “The Undoing Project: A Friendship That Changed Our Minds” looks at the groundbreaking collaboration between the psychologists Daniel Kahneman and Amos Tversky.
2016-12-01.lead_paragraph: Among Daniel Kahneman’s many imaginative contributions to the field of psychology is something called the “peak-end rule,” which holds that our memories of any given experience are defined not by how we felt about it moment to moment, but how we felt as it ended and how it felt at its most intense. Say you go to Italy, and the first five days are blighted by rain, but the last two are ablaze with sunshine. You are likely to remember that trip far more fondly than had it been the other way around.
2016-12-01.headline_main: Review: Michael Lewis on Two Well Matched (but Finally Mismatched) Men

2016-12-02.abstract: Suggested reading by book critics and editors at The New York Times.
2016-12-02.snippet: Suggested reading by book critics and editors at The New York Times.
2016-12-02.lead_paragraph: This week’s books offer seriousness and substance, two qualities much in demand during this pause between holidays. After talking to Michael Chabon on the Book Review’s podcast about how he chose to meld fiction and memoir to get at the way in which families construct their stories, I’m especially interested in reading his latest novel, “Moonglow.” Similarly, David France, the author of “How to Survive a Plague,” makes a great case for why we need — are long overdue for, in fact — an updated account of the AIDS epidemic, which many readers left off in 1987 with Randy Shilts’s “And the Band Played On.” Much has happened since then, and it’s a history we need to remember.
2016-12-02.headline_main: 10 New Books We Recommend This Week

2016-12-02.lead_paragraph: The holidays came early this year for workers at a Carrier furnace plant in Indiana, who learned on Tuesday that 800 of their jobs would not be moving to Mexico after all. Their good fortune is also an early triumph for the incoming Trump administration. President-elect Donald Trump had promised during the campaign to stop the offshoring of American manufacturing jobs, and true to that pledge, he and Vice President-elect Mike Pence, who is governor of Indiana, cut a deal with Carrier, a division of United Technologies, to keep the jobs in the state.

2016-12-02.abstract: The power structure of the Reagan years, and the age of AIDS, gave artists and activists something to rebel against.
2016-12-02.snippet: The power structure of the Reagan years, and the age of AIDS, gave artists and activists something to rebel against.
2016-12-02.lead_paragraph: Even before the political ascendancy of Donald J. Trump, who, among other distinctions remains an avatar of 1980s materialism, the ’80s, it seemed, were under review. In May, an auction at Christie’s set a record for the work of Jean-Michel Basquiat, when a large, untitled canvas he created in Italy in 1982 sold for $57.3 million. More recently, the clothing line Alice & Olivia, in conjunction with the Basquiat estate, produced graphic printed skirts paying tribute to the artist, while the Japanese retailer Uniqlo delivered Basquiat T-shirts. Beyond that, the Museum of Modern Art is currently reprising “The Ballad of Sexual Dependency,” Nan Goldin’s visual confessional of indulgence and torment, a defining artistic achievement of the ’80s whose themes — violence among intimates, AIDS, the reimagining of family — were totemic to the period.
2016-12-02.headline_main: Lessons on Rebelling, From the 1980s

2016-12-02.lead_paragraph: Jessica Lappin, president of the Alliance for Downtown New York, among the city’s largest business improvement districts, has a long history with Lower Manhattan. While she now calls a two-bedroom co-op in Midtown East home, in 1993 she was in the first graduating class of Stuyvesant High School’s Lower Manhattan campus. “Lower Manhattan was a ghost town on nights and weekends,” she said of the early 1990s. Since then, it has become one of the fastest-growing neighborhoods in the city. Ms. Lappin, 41, lives with her husband, Andrew Wuertele, 42, the chief administrative officer at East River Medical Imaging, and their sons, Lucas, 9, and Miles, 5.

2016-12-02.lead_paragraph: TURIN, Italy — Italy’s prime minister, Matteo Renzi, only 41, once seemed to have solved the riddle of how to survive Europe’s populist, anti-establishment tempest. But with a critical national referendum on Sunday, the populist wave is now threatening to crush him and plunge Italy into a political crisis when the European Union is already reeling.

2016-12-02.abstract: The nation’s lawmakers signed off on the peace deal with the Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia. Now comes the hard part.
2016-12-02.snippet: The nation’s lawmakers signed off on the peace deal with the Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia. Now comes the hard part.
2016-12-02.lead_paragraph: Among the dozens of people who addressed Colombia’s Congress this week before lawmakers ratified a peace deal with the country’s largest guerrilla group, Richard Moreno stood out. Men like him don’t often get to confront the ruling elite. So when he got his turn at the podium, Mr. Moreno, an Afro-Colombian activist from Chocó, one of the poorest and most violence-scarred departments in the country, didn’t speak. He bellowed.
2016-12-02.headline_main: In Colombia, Turning a Peace Deal Into Reality

2016-12-02.abstract: The white working class is due for a rude awakening when the safety net is shredded.
2016-12-02.snippet: The white working class is due for a rude awakening when the safety net is shredded.
2016-12-02.lead_paragraph: Donald Trump won the Electoral College (though not the popular vote) on the strength of overwhelming support from working-class whites, who feel left behind by a changing economy and society. And they’re about to get their reward — the same reward that, throughout Mr. Trump’s career, has come to everyone who trusted his good intentions. Think Trump University.
2016-12-02.headline_main: Seduced and Betrayed by Donald Trump

2016-12-02.abstract: A huge steel arch has been moved over the radioactive wreckage of a Chernobyl reactor, a project in which many nations helped to raise funds.
2016-12-02.snippet: A huge steel arch has been moved over the radioactive wreckage of a Chernobyl reactor, a project in which many nations helped to raise funds.
2016-12-02.lead_paragraph: The great steel arch that has been inched into place over the blackened and crumbling “sarcophagus” containing the radioactive carcass of Chernobyl’s Reactor No. 4 is an extraordinary feat of human ingenuity. Resembling a vast, gleaming hangar, it was designed to withstand extreme temperatures, tornadoes and corrosion for at least a century, and it had to be built far from the toxic reactor and then slid, all 32,000 tons of it, into place.
2016-12-02.headline_main: The Great Arch of Chernobyl

2016-12-02.abstract: As Western standoffs go, the Bundy brothers episode featured comic book cowboys. But for the Standing Rock Sioux, a pipeline is an existential threat.
2016-12-02.snippet: As Western standoffs go, the Bundy brothers episode featured comic book cowboys. But for the Standing Rock Sioux, a pipeline is an existential threat.
2016-12-02.lead_paragraph: For most of this past week, a winter storm has lashed at the North Dakota prairie camp where the Standing Rock Sioux are making a stand to keep an oil pipeline away from water that is a source of life for them.
2016-12-02.headline_main: Fake Cowboys and Real Indians

2016-12-02.lead_paragraph: It was the morning after the election. The bottle of Champagne I’d opened as part of an anticipated victory celebration still sat on the coffee table, only one-third finished, the unconsumed flat remainder marking the exact moment that my future, as a transgender American, became uncertain.
2016-12-02.headline_main: Really, You’re Blaming Transgender People for Trump?

2016-12-02.snippet: Aren’t there scarier creatures in the actual fossil record?
2016-12-02.lead_paragraph: Kat writes: Some of my co-workers insist that dragons are real. I’m no paleontologist, but I think the myth of dragons came about when people found dinosaur bones. My co-workers, particularly one person named Stephanie, insist that I can’t prove dragons never existed. If I’m right, please order her to stop bringing up dragons at work.
2016-12-02.headline_main: Judge John Hodgman on the Existence of Dragons

2016-12-02.abstract: Provide ample water. Let them pay for themselves.
2016-12-02.snippet: Provide ample water. Let them pay for themselves.
2016-12-02.lead_paragraph: It all starts with a package. “The post office only ships a few kinds of animals — things like honeybees and baby chicks,” says Kim Flottum, the editor of Bee Culture magazine. Buy your insects from an association that raises bees, typically in Southeastern states or California. Flottum suggests beginning beekeepers order a small colony, or “nuc,” before the end of the year if they want it in time for spring. It will come in a parcel about the size of a shoe box that holds 1.5 pounds or so of bees, or roughly 5,000 bees and a queen.
2016-12-02.headline_main: How to Keep Bees

2016-12-02.abstract: Selected by Matthew Zapruder.
2016-12-02.snippet: Selected by Matthew Zapruder.
2016-12-02.lead_paragraph: In 2009, President Obama signed a congressional resolution of apology to Native Americans. In her first book, “Whereas,” Layli Long Soldier responds to that apology in a masterful long prose poem, “Whereas Statements.” The poem is at various times personal, historical, legalistic, intuitive, argumentative, angry, despairing, hopeful and loving. As a dual citizen of the United States and the Oglala Lakota Nation, she writes, “I must work, I must eat, I must art, I must mother, I must friend, I must listen, I must observe, constantly I must live.” Selected by Matthew Zapruder.
2016-12-02.headline_main: From ‘Whereas Statements’

2016-12-02.lead_paragraph: Most New Yorkers would rather not relive the mind-numbing disappointment that can come from navigating the city’s real estate market. They would rather forget that awful landlord, or that apartment they can’t afford, or that condo that replaced all the shops on their block. But where most people see only stress and angst in the face of rapid gentrification, some artists find inspiration.

2016-12-02.snippet: An undocumented family’s moment of fear.
2016-12-02.lead_paragraph: On that particular evening back in 2003, my parents were in the car together returning home from work — my mother was a babysitter, my father an electrician — when they noticed three men in suits reading the labels on the mailboxes in front of our building. This was on the urban streets of New Jersey, against a backdrop of dilapidated buildings, and they immediately assumed who it was.
2016-12-02.headline_main: When Immigration Agents Came Knocking

While touring the factory floor at the heating and cooling company on Thursday, Mr. Trump indicated that he intended to follow through on pledges to impose stiff tariffs on imports from companies that move production overseas and ship their products back to the United States.

2016-12-02.snippet: Chardon perfectly expresses the new bohemian effervescence of its Provençal hometown.
2016-12-02.lead_paragraph: The most visible sign of an artistic quickening in Arles is probably the Frank Gehry-designed tower rising at LUMA Arles, a contemporary art center being created in a former rail yard. But it’s Chardon, a cozy restaurant that opened this summer, which perfectly expresses its new bohemian effervescence.
2016-12-02.headline_main: A Restaurant Marks a Newly Creative City in Southern France

2016-12-02.abstract: Here are lessons a vacation-package skeptic and budget traveler learned from her first experience with “bulk” travel in Hawaii.
2016-12-02.snippet: Here are lessons a vacation-package skeptic and budget traveler learned from her first experience with “bulk” travel in Hawaii.
2016-12-02.lead_paragraph: Sometimes budget travel means spending as little as possible to take the longest, farthest, most ambitious adventure possible. Other times, you just need a break. If the goal of a trip is to relax and spend focused time with family, you have to be realistic about scheduling and budgetary constraints and honest about your tastes and you need to seize any window of opportunity. Here are some lessons this vacation-package skeptic learned from her first experience with what the industry calls “bulk” travel.
2016-12-02.headline_main: Five Ways to Shop for the Best Vacation Package

2016-12-02.abstract: I will carry this child for the rest of my life. He lives within me, forever a young man of 22.
2016-12-02.snippet: I will carry this child for the rest of my life. He lives within me, forever a young man of 22.
2016-12-02.lead_paragraph: I can feel their unasked questions. People wonder how I can still stand, still walk, still laugh. But they don’t ask. You can’t ask that of a mother who has lost her child. My son, Daniel, died three years ago at the age of 22. When people ask me, “How… are you?,” that pause, that inflection, tells me that’s really what they want to know.
2016-12-02.headline_main: Loving My Son, After His Death
