2016-12-09.abstract: Radulov, 30, a Russian star who left the N.H.L. twice with his reputation in tatters, had helped Montreal to the league’s best record.
2016-12-09.snippet: Radulov, 30, a Russian star who left the N.H.L. twice with his reputation in tatters, had helped Montreal to the league’s best record.
2016-12-09.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — Slogging through a challenging California trip, the Montreal Canadiens survived a major injury scare last week after forward Alexander Radulov was bloodied by a high stick late in a 2-1 loss to the San Jose Sharks.
2016-12-09.headline_main: Alexander Radulov, Once a Disrupter, Grows Into a Leader for the Canadiens

2016-12-09.abstract: The tiny, striking bird is an amiable partner on a walk, its familiar call welcome in the winter woods.
2016-12-09.snippet: The tiny, striking bird is an amiable partner on a walk, its familiar call welcome in the winter woods.
2016-12-09.lead_paragraph: On a recent walk along the edge of a young Bronx woodland, I looked up to find that I was not alone. About six black-capped chickadees had turned a bare gray birch into a sort of Christmas tree. As additional birds flitted in, they chattered and jockeyed for position. Clearly investigating my activities, within a few seconds a dozen birds were no more than a yard or two away. It struck me that I’ve received holiday cards that looked a lot like this.
2016-12-09.headline_main: The Black-Capped Chickadee, Curious and Congenial

2016-12-09.abstract: Reggie Gray, who helped develop the choreography, is vigilant about maintaining its political and artistic integrity as it moves into the mainstream.
2016-12-09.snippet: Reggie Gray, who helped develop the choreography, is vigilant about maintaining its political and artistic integrity as it moves into the mainstream.
2016-12-09.lead_paragraph: Reggie Gray stood in the wings at BRIC House ballroom in Fort Greene, Brooklyn, one recent Sunday evening and watched, along with a full audience, as waves of dancers took the stage to do battle. Their moves were at turns staggering contortions and graceful glides, sweeping artistry and fleeting chronicles of everyday life.
2016-12-09.headline_main: Flexing, a Street Dance Born in Brooklyn, Pushes Boundaries

2016-12-09.abstract: This Douglas Turner Ward “satirical fantasy” from 1965 has been revived by the Negro Ensemble Company, performed largely by black actors in whiteface.
2016-12-09.snippet: This Douglas Turner Ward “satirical fantasy” from 1965 has been revived by the Negro Ensemble Company, performed largely by black actors in whiteface.
2016-12-09.lead_paragraph: What would the world look like if everyone that Donald J. Trump had ever disdained — the Mexicans and the Muslims, the nasty women and the failing journalists — vanished? How would a morning unfold if Hillary Clinton’s “basket of deplorables” suddenly turned up empty? If those we look down on disappeared overnight, how would we go on?
2016-12-09.headline_main: Review: In ‘Day of Absence,’ Blacks Vanish From a Town, and Chaos Ensues

2016-12-09.abstract: Is it boredom, anxiety or an attempt to fill a schnauzerpoo-size void that drives us to buy things we will never use — especially things at holiday markets?
2016-12-09.snippet: Is it boredom, anxiety or an attempt to fill a schnauzerpoo-size void that drives us to buy things we will never use — especially things at holiday markets?
2016-12-09.lead_paragraph: I just bought an item called “My Little Steamer.” Obviously I was fiscally impaired. Would I buy a product called “My Little Sneakers” or “My Little Automobile”? This steamer is about as effective as taking a sip of hot tea and then exhaling over a garment. Actually, exhaling would be more effective because then you might spot the garment and be forced to take it to a dry cleaner.
2016-12-09.headline_main: Grasping for Sanity in the Season of Fiscal Impairment

2016-12-09.abstract: The 31-year-old baritone, who is also a professor at Brooklyn College Conservatory of Music, immerses himself in scores and then unwinds with comfort food.
2016-12-09.snippet: The 31-year-old baritone, who is also a professor at Brooklyn College Conservatory of Music, immerses himself in scores and then unwinds with comfort food.
2016-12-09.lead_paragraph: For members of the Handel-industrial complex, it’s showtime. From now until you-know-when, choirs singing the “Messiah” will give canned holiday music a run for its money. Malcolm J. Merriweather, 31, who made his professional solo debut at 10 singing the “Messiah” in Buffalo (he took home $10), will be paying it forward on Dec. 17, when he conducts the nearly century-old Dessoff Choirs in a sing-in with audience participation at the Union Theological Seminary in Manhattan. Mr. Merriweather, who begins most Sundays in his 15th-floor apartment in Harlem, is an accomplished baritone as well as the choirs’ musical director. He is also an assistant professor and director of choirs at Brooklyn College Conservatory of Music of the City University of New York.
2016-12-09.headline_main: How Malcolm Merriweather, Musical Director of the Dessoff Choirs, Spends His Sundays

2016-12-09.abstract: Delays are costing the pipeline’s builder hundreds of millions of dollars, but the nation’s energy supply is unlikely to suffer.
2016-12-09.snippet: Delays are costing the pipeline’s builder hundreds of millions of dollars, but the nation’s energy supply is unlikely to suffer.
2016-12-09.lead_paragraph: HOUSTON — Energy Transfer Partners, a major pipeline operator, has lost hundreds of millions of dollars from delays in the completion of the Dakota Access Pipeline. And its standoff with the Standing Rock Sioux Tribe over a section running through tribal lands could mean an additional $80 million a month in losses.
2016-12-09.headline_main: North Dakota Could Be Biggest Loser in Ruling Against Oil Pipeline

2016-12-09.abstract: Mr. Lake was instrumental in founding the band King Crimson, which is widely regarded as having produced the first progressive-rock album.
2016-12-09.snippet: Mr. Lake was instrumental in founding the band King Crimson, which is widely regarded as having produced the first progressive-rock album.
2016-12-09.lead_paragraph: Greg Lake, a singer, guitarist and songwriter who was a founding member of the 1970s progressive-rock bands King Crimson and Emerson, Lake and Palmer, died on Wednesday in London. He was 69.
2016-12-09.headline_main: Greg Lake, of King Crimson and Emerson, Lake and Palmer, Dies at 69

2016-12-09.abstract: The Better Online Ticket Sales, or BOTS, Act, which takes aim at computer programs that circumvent ticketing websites’ security measures, will now go to President Obama.
2016-12-09.snippet: The Better Online Ticket Sales, or BOTS, Act, which takes aim at computer programs that circumvent ticketing websites’ security measures, will now go to President Obama.

2016-12-09.abstract: Event spaces have been scrutinized or shut down in Nashville, Philadelphia, Austin and elsewhere since a warehouse fire in Oakland killed 36 people.
2016-12-09.snippet: Event spaces have been scrutinized or shut down in Nashville, Philadelphia, Austin and elsewhere since a warehouse fire in Oakland killed 36 people.
2016-12-09.lead_paragraph: OAKLAND, Calif. — In the aftermath of a fire that killed 36 people here last Friday night, fire departments around the country have begun to investigate and in some cases evict residents from illegally occupied warehouses.
2016-12-09.headline_main: Oakland Fire Leads to Crackdown on Illegal Warehouses Nationwide

2016-12-09.abstract: But residents of the rebel-held enclave reported that after a day of intense bombardment, fighting was continuing, and many were in a state of panic.
2016-12-09.snippet: But residents of the rebel-held enclave reported that after a day of intense bombardment, fighting was continuing, and many were in a state of panic.
2016-12-09.lead_paragraph: BEIRUT, Lebanon — Russian officials said Thursday that the Syrian Army had stopped combat operations in the divided city of Aleppo in order to evacuate civilians, but residents of the rebel-held enclave reported that after a day of intense bombardment, fighting was continuing.
2016-12-09.headline_main: Russia Says Aleppo Combat Has Ceased; Residents Disagree

2016-12-09.abstract: The 21st Century Cures Act, a bill that sailed through Congress with overwhelming support from both parties, stands in contrast to the looming fight over the Affordable Care Act.
2016-12-09.snippet: The 21st Century Cures Act, a bill that sailed through Congress with overwhelming support from both parties, stands in contrast to the looming fight over the Affordable Care Act.
2016-12-09.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — With self-congratulatory zeal and smiles all around, huge bipartisan majorities in Congress have just passed legislation to speed the discovery of cures for killer diseases. At the same time, Republican leaders have been devising a strategy to undo the Affordable Care Act, which has done more than any law in a generation to treat people with those diseases.
2016-12-09.headline_main: Cures Act Gains Bipartisan Support That Eluded Obama Health Law

2016-12-09.abstract: The New York governor has not been implicated but said he could be called as a witness in a trial of former associates, including Joseph Percoco.
2016-12-09.snippet: The New York governor has not been implicated but said he could be called as a witness in a trial of former associates, including Joseph Percoco.

2016-12-09.abstract: A doctor said he had never heard of a steam radiator causing death, like those of a two sisters in the Bronx. Burns are more common, but rarely fatal.

2016-12-09.lead_paragraph: Mayor Bill de Blasio of New York on Thursday described the deaths of two young sisters in temporary homeless housing in the Bronx as an “extraordinary and unprecedented accident.” The authorities have said that the girls, Ibanez Ambrose, 2, and Scylee Vayoh Ambrose, 1, were found by emergency responders just after noon on Wednesday after a radiator malfunctioned in their apartment. The New York City Medical Examiner’s Office said the sisters had died from overheating and thermal injuries from exposure to hot steam. The investigation by several city agencies is continuing and many questions remain.
2016-12-09.headline_main: Steam Radiators Can Burn but Are Rarely Deadly

Anthony Scaramucci, a Trump transition official appearing on the same program, had barely finished saying, “What I admire about Mr. Jones, he’s fighting for the American worker,” when Mr. Trump tweeted, “Chuck Jones, who is President of United Steelworkers 1999, has done a terrible job representing workers.”

2016-12-09.abstract: Create an S-curve out of the blade. Don’t bow on the teeth side.
2016-12-09.snippet: Create an S-curve out of the blade. Don’t bow on the teeth side.
2016-12-09.lead_paragraph: Just about any version of the familiar cutting tool will do — “any nonelectric, full-bladed saw,” says Natalia (the Saw Lady) Paruz, who has performed with dozens of orchestras internationally. “The longer the blade, the more notes it will have.” Paruz has three different saws specially made for musical performances, but she recommends starting with a standard carpenter’s saw of 26 inches. “It’s the easiest length, and you have about an octave and a half to work with,” Paruz says. “If you want more complex music, you need 32 inches. But if the saw is too long, it’s unwieldy, and you can’t really handle it.” Thinner blades are easier to manipulate. You need to be able to bend the thing easily.
2016-12-09.headline_main: How to Play the Saw

2016-12-09.lead_paragraph: He’s no seasonal superstar like Scrooge, but let’s spare a thought for Krook, the unfortunate rag-and-bottle man in “Bleak House,” Charles Dickens’s great novel of the law and its tortuous machinations. A drinker of gin in colossal quantity, Krook perishes after going up in flames, the victim of the most infamous instance of spontaneous human combustion in English literature. Some draw a connection between his immoderate intake of alcohol and his predisposition for auto-immolation; I keep in mind that the cheap, corrosive rotgut of Krook’s place and time was different from the nice stuff we take with tonic today.
2016-12-09.headline_main: A Victorian Toast

2016-12-09.abstract: A recent study suggests that frequent activity, not just occasional bouts of exercise, is needed to counter the deleterious effects of too much sitting.
2016-12-09.snippet: A recent study suggests that frequent activity, not just occasional bouts of exercise, is needed to counter the deleterious effects of too much sitting.
2016-12-09.lead_paragraph: By now it is pretty well accepted both that physical inactivity is bad — recently linked to 6 percent of all cases of heart disease worldwide and 11 percent of all premature deaths in the United States — and that exercise is good, because it tends to increase life span and protect against heart disease. Yet few studies actually show that exercise reduces the unhealthful impacts of too much sitting. People who work out but also sit for long hours — active couch potatoes, you might say — may often share the same elevated risks for disease and early death as their less active peers.
2016-12-09.headline_main: Keep It Moving

2016-12-09.abstract: Lauren Graham, the “Gilmore Girls” actress whose new memoir is No. 3 on the hardcover nonfiction list, says she has carefully calibrated just how revealing she wants to be.
2016-12-09.snippet: Lauren Graham, the “Gilmore Girls” actress whose new memoir is No. 3 on the hardcover nonfiction list, says she has carefully calibrated just how revealing she wants to be.
2016-12-09.lead_paragraph: I Will Follow: Let’s get the beta male confession out of the way — I used to watch “Gilmore Girls” with my wife, and I liked it. The characters’ rapport and repartee (rapportee?) were like throwbacks to the great “Thin Man” movies, and the series cultivated such a literary vibe during its original seven-year run that websites compiled vast reading lists from its allusions. All of which is to say: When I told my wife that Lauren Graham, who played Lorelai Gilmore, would be appearing at the 92nd Street Y in New York to promote her memoir, “Talking as Fast as I Can” (new at No. 3 on the hardcover nonfiction list), we were there in a trice. Picture William Shatner speaking to a crowd of “Star Trek” fans, only 98 percent female, and you’ll get the idea: lots of fellowship and laughter and screaming, with the center of attention gamely baffled and entertained by it all. “I love you, Lauren!” one woman shouted, and Graham, grinning widely at the sea of cellphone flash bulbs, deadpanned, “I love your adherence to ‘The use of photography is strictly prohibited.’ ”
2016-12-09.headline_main: The Story Behind This Week’s Best Sellers

2016-12-09.abstract: Distinct populations of Atlantic killifish developed adaptations that helped them survive in waters tainted by toxic leftovers of industrial manufacturing.
2016-12-09.snippet: Distinct populations of Atlantic killifish developed adaptations that helped them survive in waters tainted by toxic leftovers of industrial manufacturing.
2016-12-09.lead_paragraph: The State of New Jersey says you can’t eat the fish or shellfish from the Lower Passaic River and Newark Bay. That’s because they’re living in the Diamond Alkali Superfund Site, where toxic leftovers from the manufacture of chemicals like DDT and the infamous Agent Orange oozed into surrounding waterways to be taken up by the animals that inhabited them. It’s an evolutionary miracle some of these animals are even alive. No, seriously. A fish that adapted to survive in this water shows evolution at its finest, according to a study published Thursday in Science.
2016-12-09.headline_main: Rapid Evolution Saved This Fish From Pollution, Study Says

2016-12-09.lead_paragraph: Even with his astonishing technique, the Russian pianist Daniil Trifonov looked as if he needed all his youthful energy to get through his formidable recital program at Carnegie Hall on Wednesday. During the fiendishly difficult final work, Stravinsky’s Three Movements From “Petrouchka,” there were fleeting moments when the slender, boyish Mr. Trifonov, 25, threw his arms so forcefully into pummeling fortissimo chords that his body lifted maybe six inches off the piano bench.
2016-12-09.headline_main: Fleet Fingers and Red-Eye Flights: A Pianist Is a Study in Stamina

2016-12-09.lead_paragraph: The winner of the Heisman Trophy, to be announced Saturday night, will be decided above all by journalists. Of the 929 total votes, 870 were allotted to members of the news media, who are equally spread among six geographic regions like a gridiron electoral college. Anyone else could have voted online to help determine the ranking on a single public ballot, which consists of three spots, for first, second and third place.

2016-12-09.lead_paragraph: IMPHAL, India — In her makeshift campaign office, surrounded by plywood desks and a giant whiteboard, Irom Chanu Sharmila rambled a bit, talking about the nearly 16 years she fasted to protest abuses by the armed forces, about spending most of that time in a hospital ward being force-fed through a nose tube under a law in India criminalizing suicide and about her reasons for ending the hunger strike and emerging to contest coming elections in Manipur State.

2016-12-09.snippet: A German writer tells how he unearthed a startling fact about the Third Reich for his best-selling book, “Blitzed: Drugs in Nazi Germany.”
2016-12-09.lead_paragraph: Given the sheer tonnage of books already devoted to the Nazis and Hitler, you might assume that everything interesting, terrible and bizarre is already known about one of history’s most notorious regimes and its genocidal leader. Then along comes Norman Ohler, a soft-spoken 46-year-old novelist from Berlin, who rummages through military archives and emerges with this startling fact: The Third Reich was on drugs.

Studies have shown that these subtle biases are widespread and associated with discrimination in legal, economic and organizational settings.

2016-12-09.abstract: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau met with leaders to discuss carbon emissions, Canadian women’s golf got a shot in the arm and history was made on a telecast.
2016-12-09.snippet: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau met with leaders to discuss carbon emissions, Canadian women’s golf got a shot in the arm and history was made on a telecast.
2016-12-09.lead_paragraph: Donald J. Trump has not yet moved into the White House but his anticipated policies are already spurring debate over what actions, if any, Canada will need to take in response. That was the case on Friday when Prime Minister Justin Trudeau met with the provincial and territorial leaders to work out a national approach to pricing on carbon emissions. Before the meeting, Mr. Trudeau set out a plan where the price — either through a fossil fuel tax or a cap-and-trade system of emission allowances — would reach 50 Canadian dollars, or about $38, a metric ton, or 2,205 pounds, over five years. He also warned that provinces that did not buy in would have the price imposed on them. During the presidential election campaign, Mr. Trump said that he would pull the United States out of the climate change commitments made by the Obama administration. Some Canadians, mostly Conservative politicians, say the economy will be in jeopardy if Canada goes ahead with carbon pricing in the absence of American action. But when I looked into the debate, I also found people who argued that moving now on carbon emissions could give Canada a competitive advantage.
2016-12-09.headline_main: Canada Today: Emissions Policy, Bird-Hunting and Meat Pie

2016-12-09.abstract: Readers solve the real-life case of a builder with blisters all over his hands.
2016-12-09.snippet: Readers solve the real-life case of a builder with blisters all over his hands.
2016-12-09.lead_paragraph: On Thursday we asked Well readers to take on the difficult case of a 64-year-old contractor who had had a blistering rash on his hands off and on for over 20 years. The man saw the rash as simply annoying, but the diagnosis suggested an important underlying medical problem. Your challenge was to identify both the cause of the rash as well as the underlying diagnosis.
2016-12-09.headline_main: Think Like a Doctor: The Builder’s Blisters Solved!

2016-12-09.abstract: The classified version of the Senate report on torture is in danger of being lost forever unless the Obama administration acts soon.
2016-12-09.snippet: The classified version of the Senate report on torture is in danger of being lost forever unless the Obama administration acts soon.
2016-12-09.lead_paragraph: In President Obama’s final national security speech on Tuesday, he spoke about the importance of staying true to our values, of not returning to torture, and of transparency. Now, in his remaining time in office, he has an opportunity to take action to advance these goals and to do something of great importance for the public’s understanding of our history. He has the ability to protect the Senate Intelligence Committee’s full 6,700-page report on torture from being lost, perhaps forever.
2016-12-09.headline_main: The Torture Report Must Be Saved

2016-12-09.abstract: Our chief dance critic takes readers through the party scene of Mr. Morris’s “The Hard Nut,” a triumph of postmodernism at the Brooklyn Academy of Music.

2016-12-09.lead_paragraph: It is an unwritten law that every new production of “The Nutcracker” must tell a story that is somehow different from any other. Although the original 1892 ballet — unusual for 19th-century repertory — told no love story, many current productions have injected romance, and a few have sex, too. Modern-dress “Nutcrackers” are not unusual.
2016-12-09.headline_main: Mark Morris’s Party With Robots, Barbie and a Nutcracker

2016-12-09.abstract: Bob Dylan’s Nobel no-show leaves the Swedish Academy to deny that it’s insulted.
2016-12-09.snippet: Bob Dylan’s Nobel no-show leaves the Swedish Academy to deny that it’s insulted.
2016-12-09.lead_paragraph: STOCKHOLM — “I’m Not There” was the title of a 2007 movie about the exquisite elusiveness of the singer Bob Dylan. It is also the unofficial theme of the week in Stockholm, where Mr. Dylan, who won the 2016 Nobel Prize in Literature, is not here to accept it.
2016-12-09.headline_main: Dylan, Polite? It Ain’t Him, Babe

2016-12-09.abstract: A revival of “Salome” at the Met, a “Macbeth” in Brooklyn, the St. Thomas choir’s “Messiah” and Kun Woo Paik at the Philharmonic.
2016-12-09.snippet: A revival of “Salome” at the Met, a “Macbeth” in Brooklyn, the St. Thomas choir’s “Messiah” and Kun Woo Paik at the Philharmonic.
2016-12-09.lead_paragraph: We’re happy to introduce a new weekly roundup of classical music coverage, appearing in print every Saturday.
2016-12-09.headline_main: Classical Music This Week

2016-12-09.abstract: Shares of several big banks have surged since election night, but some investors see bigger opportunity in the international markets.
2016-12-09.snippet: Shares of several big banks have surged since election night, but some investors see bigger opportunity in the international markets.
2016-12-09.lead_paragraph: In the four weeks since Donald J. Trump was elected president, many stocks have soared and the market’s winners have been clustered around a specific theme: an inflating economy.
2016-12-09.headline_main: How to Play the Trump Stock Market Rally

2016-12-09.abstract: The authorities say a thick layer of haze over the city is the result of car exhaust, wood-burning furnaces and a layer of warm, stagnant air.
2016-12-09.snippet: The authorities say a thick layer of haze over the city is the result of car exhaust, wood-burning furnaces and a layer of warm, stagnant air.
2016-12-09.lead_paragraph: PARIS — Even those who love Paris have been frustrated this week by a choking haze that descended on the city, irritating residents’ eyes and throats and leading officials to limit the number of cars on the road.
2016-12-09.headline_main: Paris Imposes Measures to Fight Pollution, With Mixed Results

2016-12-09.abstract: Though a U.S. rival has its struggles, the Canadian Women’s Hockey League is seeing steady progress, including a league-first game at an N.H.L. arena on Saturday.
2016-12-09.snippet: Though a U.S. rival has its struggles, the Canadian Women’s Hockey League is seeing steady progress, including a league-first game at an N.H.L. arena on Saturday.
2016-12-09.lead_paragraph: BOSTON — Kristina Brown, a forward for the Boston Blades in the Canadian Women’s Hockey League, also works full time as a project engineer on a 32-story condo and apartment complex being built near Fenway Park.
2016-12-09.headline_main: As Women’s Hockey Advances in Canada, Pay Checks May Not Be Far Behind

2016-12-09.abstract: Transparency International, an anti-corruption watchdog, has compiled a list of the world’s most corrupt countries.
2016-12-09.snippet: Transparency International, an anti-corruption watchdog, has compiled a list of the world’s most corrupt countries.
2016-12-09.lead_paragraph: Transparency International, an anti-corruption watchdog, has compiled a list of the world’s most corrupt countries.
2016-12-09.headline_main: The World's Most Corrupt Countries

2016-12-09.abstract: Hillary Clinton’s total expenses were $565 million, and Donald J. Trump’s were $322 million — significantly less than their counterparts spent in 2012.
2016-12-09.snippet: Hillary Clinton’s total expenses were $565 million, and Donald J. Trump’s were $322 million — significantly less than their counterparts spent in 2012.
2016-12-09.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Donald J. Trump won the White House after spending a little more than half of what Hillary Clinton did, using a combination of his own money and contributions from donors big and small to fuel a campaign that shattered the modern conventions of money and politics.
2016-12-09.headline_main: Trump Spent Far Less Than Clinton, but Paid His Companies Well

2016-12-09.abstract: Prosecutors and defense lawyers are introducing scores of exhibits in the federal trial of Dylann S. Roof, the self-avowed white supremacist who is accused of killing nine black people at the Emanuel African Methodist Episcopal Church. Although the judge has forbidden the release of some exhibits, such as certain crime scene photographs, he has allowed many to be made public beyond the courtroom.
2016-12-09.snippet: Prosecutors and defense lawyers are introducing scores of exhibits in the federal trial of Dylann S. Roof, the self-avowed white supremacist who is accused of killing nine black people at the Emanuel African Methodist Episcopal Church. Although th...
2016-12-09.lead_paragraph: Prosecutors and defense lawyers are introducing scores of exhibits in the federal trial of Dylann S. Roof, the self-avowed white supremacist who is accused of killing nine black people at the Emanuel African Methodist Episcopal Church. Although the judge has forbidden the release of some exhibits, such as certain crime scene photographs, he has allowed many to be made public beyond the courtroom.
2016-12-09.headline_main: The Dylann Roof Trial: The Evidence

2016-12-09.abstract: After an inquiry, officials suspended the license of Kevin Reilly, who was operating the crane that collapsed and killed a man in Manhattan in February.
2016-12-09.snippet: After an inquiry, officials suspended the license of Kevin Reilly, who was operating the crane that collapsed and killed a man in Manhattan in February.
2016-12-09.lead_paragraph: The operator of a crane that collapsed and killed one person in Lower Manhattan in February failed to properly lower the boom and was responsible for the accident, New York City officials said on Friday.
2016-12-09.headline_main: Operator Is at Fault for Fatal Crane Accident, City Finds

2016-12-09.abstract: New York City goes ahead with a $194 million plan to fix up infrastructure on the Bronx side of the Harlem River in anticipation of people and businesses coming with future development.
2016-12-09.snippet: New York City goes ahead with a $194 million plan to fix up infrastructure on the Bronx side of the Harlem River in anticipation of people and businesses coming with future development.
2016-12-09.lead_paragraph: The bustling riverfront envisioned for a tattered stretch of warehouses and parking lots in the South Bronx is still many years away.
2016-12-09.headline_main: No People in Sight Yet, but South Bronx Gets Ready for Development

2016-12-09.abstract: In his latest podcast, “Good, Bad and Mad,” the columnist Andrew Rosenthal said he couldn’t think of any good news. Listeners helped by sending along tidings of good news.
2016-12-09.snippet: In his latest podcast, “Good, Bad and Mad,” the columnist Andrew Rosenthal said he couldn’t think of any good news. Listeners helped by sending along tidings of good news.
2016-12-09.lead_paragraph: In Good, Bad and Mad: Andrew Rosenthal on the News, a regular Inside the Times podcast, the Times Op-ed columnist Andrew Rosenthal talks about the news — the good, the bad and that which makes him mad.
2016-12-09.headline_main: Cheer Up, Andrew Rosenthal! Podcast Listeners Send Along Good News

2016-12-10.abstract: Sales and employment are on the rise in the restaurant industry, undercutting claims by the Trump pick for Labor that the law has undermined the industry.
2016-12-10.snippet: Sales and employment are on the rise in the restaurant industry, undercutting claims by the Trump pick for Labor that the law has undermined the industry.
2016-12-10.lead_paragraph: Of all the policy positions taken by Andrew F. Puzder, the fast-food chief executive whom Donald J. Trump has chosen to be his secretary of labor, one he returns to with regularity is his passionate disdain for the Affordable Care Act and its effect on businesses and workers.
2016-12-10.headline_main: ‘Restaurant Recession’ From Health Care Act? Little Evidence

2016-12-10.abstract: In boxing, when the faithful gather for a title bout, it’s like being transported to another era.
2016-12-10.snippet: In boxing, when the faithful gather for a title bout, it’s like being transported to another era.
2016-12-10.lead_paragraph: It’s always 1926 at the fights. A horse-and-wagon tang of atavism drifts in the air as boxers throw traditional punches — jabs, crosses and hooks — and voices from the crowd call out timeless advice: “To the body! The body!”
2016-12-10.headline_main: Want to Visit the Jazz Age? Try Fight Night in Vegas

2016-12-10.abstract: Pia Scala-Zankel’s play, a Vertigo Theater production at the New Ohio Theater, follows youths living on the streets of New York in the 1980s.
2016-12-10.snippet: Pia Scala-Zankel’s play, a Vertigo Theater production at the New Ohio Theater, follows youths living on the streets of New York in the 1980s.
2016-12-10.lead_paragraph: The characters in some plays — generally the not-so-good ones — leave your consciousness almost as soon as you leave the theater. Others stay a while, or never leave at all. I’m confident that the three central characters in “Street Children,” an affecting and saucily funny new play by Pia Scala-Zankel, about transgender youth living on the harsh streets of New York in the 1980s, will remain with me for good. But also, given the dark turns their lives take, for not-so-good.
2016-12-10.headline_main: Review: Transgender ‘Street Children,’ Out on a Pier

2016-12-10.abstract: The corruption scandal that engulfed the president, Park Geun-hye, has yet another twist — an argument involving her adviser’s dog.
2016-12-10.snippet: The corruption scandal that engulfed the president, Park Geun-hye, has yet another twist — an argument involving her adviser’s dog.
2016-12-10.lead_paragraph: SEOUL, South Korea — Did a fight over a puppy lead to the vote to impeach South Korea’s leader? A whistle-blower whose account has riveted South Koreans says it did.
2016-12-10.headline_main: Key Figure in South Korean Leader’s Troubles: A Puppy

2016-12-10.abstract: Times had changed between the astronaut’s 1962 and 1998 parades in Manhattan. The man, essentially, had not.
2016-12-10.snippet: Times had changed between the astronaut’s 1962 and 1998 parades in Manhattan. The man, essentially, had not.
2016-12-10.lead_paragraph: It is March 1, 1962. There is bright sunshine across Lower Manhattan, and a crowd is building. New Yorkers still love a parade. The ritual of throwing blizzards of ticker tape from the windows of stock brokerages has become a cherished tradition. People are lining the sidewalks of Broadway, two deep, then four deep, then six deep. And they keep arriving.
2016-12-10.headline_main: For John Glenn, a Rare Repeat Tour of the Canyon of Heroes

2016-12-10.abstract: The Knicks star dismissed the team president’s remark that Anthony sometimes holds the ball too long.
2016-12-10.snippet: The Knicks star dismissed the team president’s remark that Anthony sometimes holds the ball too long.
2016-12-10.lead_paragraph: Carmelo Anthony addressed on Friday the latest controversy involving Phil Jackson — one that happens to involve Anthony himself. Anthony, the Knicks star, said he had not spoken to Jackson, the Knicks’ president, since Jackson chided him in an interview this week for having a tendency to hold onto the ball too long.
2016-12-10.headline_main: To Carmelo Anthony, Phil Jackson’s Comments Are a ‘Temporary Black Cloud’

2016-12-10.abstract: Japan said Shinzo Abe would be the country’s first prime minister to visit the site of the attack, but it now appears that historic occasion actually took place in 1951.
2016-12-10.snippet: Japan said Shinzo Abe would be the country’s first prime minister to visit the site of the attack, but it now appears that historic occasion actually took place in 1951.
2016-12-10.lead_paragraph: TOKYO — When Prime Minister Shinzo Abe said this week that he would visit Pearl Harbor with President Obama, news organizations around the world reported that the visit would be the first ever by a Japanese premier to the naval base that his country attacked in 1941.
2016-12-10.headline_main: Japanese Leader’s Pearl Harbor Visit May Not Be a First, After All

2016-12-10.abstract: The social network, which has dealt with similar issues in recent months, is fixing three of its ad-measurement devices after inaccuracies were found.
2016-12-10.snippet: The social network, which has dealt with similar issues in recent months, is fixing three of its ad-measurement devices after inaccuracies were found.
2016-12-10.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — One of Facebook’s biggest appeals to advertisers is its wealth of data on the millions of people who use the site daily. Yet the social network recently has come under scrutiny from some of its biggest advertisers for errors in that data.
2016-12-10.headline_main: Facebook Reports New Issues With Ad-Counting Tools

2016-12-10.abstract: About 3,500 graduate students who are teaching or research assistants will join the United Automobile Workers.
2016-12-10.snippet: About 3,500 graduate students who are teaching or research assistants will join the United Automobile Workers.
2016-12-10.lead_paragraph: Graduate students at Columbia University voted to unionize this week, the group announced on Friday. The union will be the first to represent graduate students since the National Labor Relations Board ruled in August that students who work as teaching and research assistants have a federal right to unionize.
2016-12-10.headline_main: Columbia Graduate Students Vote Overwhelmingly to Unionize

2016-12-10.abstract: Much of the swelling confidence may come from one political party, but consumers, business leaders and Wall Street show a lot of excitement.
2016-12-10.snippet: Much of the swelling confidence may come from one political party, but consumers, business leaders and Wall Street show a lot of excitement.
2016-12-10.lead_paragraph: Consumers say they are more confident. Business leaders, once wary, are now expressing excitement that one of their own is headed toward the White House. And Wall Street is bordering on the ecstatic.
2016-12-10.headline_main: Trump’s Honeymoon Begins: Confidence in the Economy Is Booming

2016-12-10.abstract: The Bronx district attorney’s office was investigating conditions in the building and its landlord, Moshe Piller. The radiator was sent to the F.B.I.
2016-12-10.snippet: The Bronx district attorney’s office was investigating conditions in the building and its landlord, Moshe Piller. The radiator was sent to the F.B.I.
2016-12-10.lead_paragraph: Two days after a steam radiator burst in homeless housing in the Bronx, killing two young sisters, investigators from several city agencies — the Police Department, child welfare services and the Buildings Department — pored over physical evidence and records to distill what Mayor Bill de Blasio has called “a freak accident.”
2016-12-10.headline_main: After Burst Radiator Kills 2 Girls, Investigators Scrutinize Bronx Building

2016-12-10.abstract: Advisers say the personal baggage and problematic scandals embroiling some of his biggest supporters are unappealing to President-elect Donald J. Trump.
2016-12-10.snippet: Advisers say the personal baggage and problematic scandals embroiling some of his biggest supporters are unappealing to President-elect Donald J. Trump.
2016-12-10.lead_paragraph: President-elect Donald J. Trump boasted throughout the presidential campaign of his loyalty as a singular quality. “Folks, look, I’m a loyal person,” Mr. Trump said at a CNN town hall in April, explaining why he would not rid his campaign of a staff member who was under fire.
2016-12-10.headline_main: Trump Isn’t Rewarding a Lot of Loyalists with Cabinet Jobs. Here’s Why.

2016-12-10.abstract: It’s settled that there is state-sponsored doping in Russia, but what to do about it presents a different headache.
2016-12-10.snippet: It’s settled that there is state-sponsored doping in Russia, but what to do about it presents a different headache.
2016-12-10.lead_paragraph: Russia is an unrepentant sporting reprobate.
2016-12-10.headline_main: After Russia’s Spree of Doping, a Time to Reform

2016-12-10.abstract: The 74-point document also hints at Donald J. Trump’s interest in nuclear power.
2016-12-10.snippet: The 74-point document also hints at Donald J. Trump’s interest in nuclear power.
2016-12-10.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President-elect Donald J. Trump’s transition team has circulated an unusual 74-point questionnaire at the Department of Energy that requests the names of all employees and contractors who have attended climate change policy conferences, as well as emails and documents associated with the conferences.
2016-12-10.headline_main: Climate Change Conversations Are Targeted in Questionnaire to Energy Department

2016-12-10.abstract: Three managers in Prudential’s corporate investigation division found signs that Wells Fargo had signed up customers for insurance without the customers’ knowledge.
2016-12-10.snippet: Three managers in Prudential’s corporate investigation division found signs that Wells Fargo had signed up customers for insurance without the customers’ knowledge.
2016-12-10.lead_paragraph: Three managers in Prudential’s corporate investigation division found signs that Wells Fargo had signed up customers for insurance without the customers’ knowledge.
2016-12-10.headline_main: Prudential Wrongful Termination Lawsuit

2016-12-10.abstract: Mr. Jammeh’s rejection of the results of last week’s vote came as a blow to many Gambians, who feared that it would catapult the nation into chaos.
2016-12-10.snippet: Mr. Jammeh’s rejection of the results of last week’s vote came as a blow to many Gambians, who feared that it would catapult the nation into chaos.
2016-12-10.lead_paragraph: DAKAR, Senegal — The fate of the presidency in Gambia took a peculiar turn Friday night when the longtime incumbent appeared on state television to announce that he was rejecting the results of last week’s vote that ousted him. He also called for new elections.
2016-12-10.headline_main: Yahya Jammeh, Gambian President, Now Refuses to Accept Election Defeat

2016-12-10.abstract: Three whistle-blowers have filed a wrongful termination suit against the insurer Prudential, saying they were fired for trying to draw attention to dishonest conduct at Wells Fargo.
2016-12-10.snippet: Three whistle-blowers have filed a wrongful termination suit against the insurer Prudential, saying they were fired for trying to draw attention to dishonest conduct at Wells Fargo.
2016-12-10.lead_paragraph: When Wells Fargo admitted a few months ago that thousands of its employees had created as many as two million unauthorized accounts for its customers, alarm bells went off at Prudential, one of the nation’s biggest insurance firms.
2016-12-10.headline_main: Accusations of Fraud at Wells Fargo Spread to Sham Insurance Policies

2016-12-10.abstract: The impoverished Asian country of 1.2 million naturalized over a dozen Brazilians in 2015 in an effort to qualify for the 2018 World Cup.
2016-12-10.snippet: The impoverished Asian country of 1.2 million naturalized over a dozen Brazilians in 2015 in an effort to qualify for the 2018 World Cup.
2016-12-10.lead_paragraph: The soccer federation of East Timor, a small nation in the Indonesian archipelago, has been charged by Asia’s regional soccer governing body with using forged and falsified documents to field ineligible players on its national team, according to a spokeswoman for the governing body, the Asian Football Confederation.
2016-12-10.headline_main: East Timor Is Accused of Using Ineligible Players for Its Soccer Team

2016-12-10.abstract: The American way is that civilians control the generals, not the other way around.
2016-12-10.snippet: The American way is that civilians control the generals, not the other way around.
2016-12-10.lead_paragraph: Washington — A new president, swept into office on a tide of fake news and media manipulation, surrounds himself with generals: his adviser on foreign policy, the defense minister, his minister of the interior and the further possible appointments of foreign minister and intelligence director.
2016-12-10.headline_main: Donald Trump’s Military Government

2016-12-10.abstract: Mr. Hardesty played on the sessions that created hits like “I’m Walkin’,” “My Blue Heaven,” “Ain’t It a Shame” and “Let the Four Winds Blow.”
2016-12-10.snippet: Mr. Hardesty played on the sessions that created hits like “I’m Walkin’,” “My Blue Heaven,” “Ain’t It a Shame” and “Let the Four Winds Blow.”
2016-12-10.lead_paragraph: Herb Hardesty, a tenor saxophonist whose name was synonymous with New Orleans rhythm and blues and early rock ’n’ roll and whose lyrical solos were heard on nearly all of Fats Domino’s hit songs, died on Dec. 3 in Las Vegas. He was 91.
2016-12-10.headline_main: Herb Hardesty, Fats Domino’s Saxophonist at Dawn of Rock ‘n’ Roll, Dies at 91

2016-12-10.abstract: Rex W. Tillerson’s strong ties with Russia could come under scrutiny during a Senate confirmation hearing.
2016-12-10.snippet: Rex W. Tillerson’s strong ties with Russia could come under scrutiny during a Senate confirmation hearing.
2016-12-10.lead_paragraph: Rex W. Tillerson, the president and chief executive of Exxon Mobil, has emerged as President-elect Donald J. Trump’s top choice to become secretary of state, according to a person with direct knowledge of the search process.
2016-12-10.headline_main: Exxon Mobil Chief Rises as Trump’s Choice for Secretary of State

2016-12-10.abstract: The impeachment of President Park Geun-hye was long overdue, but it won’t solve the problem of endemic corruption.
2016-12-10.snippet: The impeachment of President Park Geun-hye was long overdue, but it won’t solve the problem of endemic corruption.
2016-12-10.lead_paragraph: SEOUL, South Korea — There were euphoric cheers from the crowd outside the National Assembly on Friday when its speaker announced the outcome: By 234 to 56, South Korean lawmakers had voted to impeach President Park Geun-hye for her role in a corruption scandal that has paralyzed the country for two months. Her powers have been suspended, and Prime Minister Hwang Kyo-ahn has taken over as acting president.
2016-12-10.headline_main: South Korean Corruption Will Endure

2016-12-10.abstract: It’s the only way for President-elect Donald Trump to avoid ethical conflicts.
2016-12-10.snippet: It’s the only way for President-elect Donald Trump to avoid ethical conflicts.
2016-12-10.lead_paragraph: President-elect Donald Trump won’t be stepping down from his role as an executive producer on “The New Celebrity Apprentice” — an unprecedented situation in which the commander in chief would have a job on the side.
2016-12-10.headline_main: One Job Is Enough. Sell the Hotel.

2016-12-10.abstract: Ms. Kurosawa, who was born into a dance family, was rebelliously devoted to her art, but not to the trappings of fame or popularity.
2016-12-10.snippet: Ms. Kurosawa, who was born into a dance family, was rebelliously devoted to her art, but not to the trappings of fame or popularity.
2016-12-10.lead_paragraph: Mika Kurosawa, a choreographer and dancer who was considered by many to be the godmother of Japanese contemporary dance, died on Dec. 1 in Yokohama, Japan. She was 59.
2016-12-10.headline_main: Mika Kurosawa, ‘Godmother’ of Japanese Contemporary Dance, Dies at 59

2016-12-10.abstract: The 59-year-old man was installing a facade as part of a residential development on the Williamsburg waterfront.
2016-12-10.snippet: The 59-year-old man was installing a facade as part of a residential development on the Williamsburg waterfront.
2016-12-10.lead_paragraph: A construction worker died on Friday after falling from scaffolding at the site of a residential development in Brooklyn, in what was at least the city’s 11th construction death this year.
2016-12-10.headline_main: Worker Dies in Fall at Old Domino Sugar Site in Brooklyn

2016-12-10.abstract: Five players are up for this year’s award, which goes to college football’s most outstanding player. The voting panel includes 58 former winners.
2016-12-10.snippet: Five players are up for this year’s award, which goes to college football’s most outstanding player. The voting panel includes 58 former winners.
2016-12-10.lead_paragraph: Sophomore quarterback, Louisville
2016-12-10.headline_main: The Heisman Trophy Finalists

2016-12-10.abstract: Aides to the president-elect defended his right to profit from the NBC reality show, even as ally Newt Gingrich called the president-elect’s involvement “weird.”
2016-12-10.snippet: Aides to the president-elect defended his right to profit from the NBC reality show, even as ally Newt Gingrich called the president-elect’s involvement “weird.”
2016-12-10.lead_paragraph: President-elect Donald J. Trump is entering office with financial entanglements that are exotic and far-flung: a condominium project in Manila, a luxury furniture maker in Istanbul, golf courses in Scotland and Ireland, and a hotel in Azerbaijan.
2016-12-10.headline_main: An ‘Apprentice’ Role for Trump Opens Door Wide for Questions

2016-12-10.abstract: With their president impeached, Koreans now must purge their politics of the idea that corruption is an unavoidable price to pay for economic growth.
2016-12-10.snippet: With their president impeached, Koreans now must purge their politics of the idea that corruption is an unavoidable price to pay for economic growth.
2016-12-10.lead_paragraph: It is understandable that South Koreans would celebrate after their Parliament voted overwhelmingly on Friday to impeach President Park Geun-hye, whose involvement with a shady and corrupt confidante has generated six weeks of huge street protests and demands for her resignation. The crisis, and Ms. Park’s precipitous fall in public support, had made it all but impossible for her to function effectively.
2016-12-10.headline_main: Restoring Trust in South Korea

2016-12-10.abstract: Gird your loins. Byron Walden is back.
2016-12-10.snippet: Gird your loins. Byron Walden is back.
2016-12-10.lead_paragraph: SATURDAY PUZZLE — I’ll tell you what got me: PET HATES, at 7A. It was my mistake, because I tried to put a singular answer into a plural entry, but I just couldn’t get “pet peeve” out of my head. I hate when that happens, don’t you?
2016-12-10.headline_main: Leader in a Suit

2016-12-10.abstract: A clever new video created by a parents’ nonprofit “to prevent other families from suffering this pain” has already attracted millions of viewers.
2016-12-10.snippet: A clever new video created by a parents’ nonprofit “to prevent other families from suffering this pain” has already attracted millions of viewers.
2016-12-10.lead_paragraph: NEWTOWN, Conn. — It’s been four years since the gun carnage at Sandy Hook Elementary School took the lives of 20 first graders in a matter of minutes. The grief of the parents remains unfathomable. But their determined efforts to prevail beyond the mayhem have turned out to be creative and far-reaching.
2016-12-10.headline_main: A Viral Twist to the Newtown Tragedy

2016-12-10.abstract: President John Mahama was beaten by Nana Akufo-Addo, a lawyer and former foreign minister who rode a wave of discontent over the country’s plummeting growth rate.
2016-12-10.snippet: President John Mahama was beaten by Nana Akufo-Addo, a lawyer and former foreign minister who rode a wave of discontent over the country’s plummeting growth rate.
2016-12-10.lead_paragraph: ACCRA, Ghana — In an election that became a referendum on Ghana’s faltering economy, Nana Akufo-Addo, a leader of the opposition, surfaced Friday as the winner over the incumbent president, John Mahama.
2016-12-10.headline_main: With Election Defeat, Ghana’s President Becomes Casualty of Faltering Economy

2016-12-10.abstract: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau announced a plan to reduce carbon emissions that relies on fossil fuel taxes and cap-and-trade systems of emission allowances.
2016-12-10.snippet: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau announced a plan to reduce carbon emissions that relies on fossil fuel taxes and cap-and-trade systems of emission allowances.
2016-12-10.lead_paragraph: OTTAWA — Prime Minister Justin Trudeau announced on Friday that Canada would introduce nationwide carbon pricing in 2018.
2016-12-10.headline_main: Canada Strikes a Deal to Cut Carbon Emissions by Putting a Price on Them

2016-12-10.lead_paragraph: “I could have walked out, and you know, that’s just what I was thinking, but then I just like, I don’t know, I don’t want to say spur of the moment, but, you know, I just finally decided I had to do it.”
2016-12-10.headline_main: Quotation of the Day

2016-12-10.abstract: The first town chartered by African Americans has battled two 100-year storms in under 20 years. Some see the ruins of homes, many covered in mold, as a lost cause. Others vow to rebuild.

2016-12-10.snippet: Residents of Princeville, N.C., are considering the prospect of leaving their town after enduring a 100-year flood for the second time in 17 years.

2016-12-10.lead_paragraph: Back in 1987, when Jessica Burdman and her then-husband were shopping for a house in San Francisco, they found themselves priced out of their popular Noe Valley neighborhood. They looked southeast — and up — to nearby Bernal Heights. A working-class community, it offered small vintage houses on a severely raked hillside with majestic views, when you scrambled to the top. The couple paid $189,000 for a 900-square-foot house on a street not inappropriately called Bonview. They added a second floor.

2016-12-10.abstract: A co-op has problems with a grocery store that attracts pigeons and rats.
2016-12-10.snippet: A co-op has problems with a grocery store that attracts pigeons and rats.
2016-12-10.lead_paragraph: Q. Our co-op on the Upper West Side  is next door to a grocery store. Our back courtyard shares open space with  the grocery store’s air vents and cooling system. Pigeons are  nesting around the store’s cooling system, providing food for rats. Our co-op hired an exterminator, but so long as the nests remain, the problem continues. The store’s management company has not returned our calls. When we called 311, we received a warning from the city that our building was in violation of health codes and would face fines if the pigeon problem was not resolved. We called 311 again to explain. The operator opened a new service complaint, but we have heard nothing back. That was six months ago. What recourse do we have?
2016-12-10.headline_main: How Can a Co-op Shoo Away a Pigeon Complaint?

2016-12-10.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — On any given day, locals flock to Comet Ping Pong, a pizza joint here not far from where I live, to eat, talk and, of course, play Ping-Pong. But last Sunday, a man armed with a military-style assault rifle and a pistol turned up for an entirely different reason: to see for himself whether the restaurant was indeed, as right-wing fake news reports and conspiracy websites have declared, the hub of a vile child sex-slavery ring masterminded by Hillary Clinton.

2016-12-10.lead_paragraph: CHICAGO — On the Saturday before the presidential election, in the city Donald J. Trump had cast during his campaign as the nightmare of urban America, a Chicago police officer killed a 25-year-old black man. According to police accounts, Joshua Beal and his family were leaving the funeral of a relative when they got into a traffic altercation with an off-duty fireman. An off-duty police officer and a uniformed sergeant joined the fray. When Mr. Beal “failed to drop his weapon,” he was shot multiple times by one or both of the officers.

2016-12-10.lead_paragraph: Winston Churchill was ebullient; he thought it was all over at last. On the evening of Sunday, Dec. 7, 1941, hosting a small birthday dinner at Chequers, the prime minister’s country retreat, for Kathleen Harriman, the daughter of the American diplomat W. Averell Harriman, Churchill heard the news of the Japanese attack on Pearl Harbor from the BBC. “At this very moment I knew the United States was in the war, up to the neck and in to the death,” he wrote in his war memoirs. “So we had won after all!” After standing alone against Berlin since the German invasion of Poland on the first day of September 1939, struggling to engage an isolationist America, Churchill “slept the sleep of the saved and thankful.”
2016-12-10.headline_main: Which Date Should Live in Infamy?

2016-12-10.lead_paragraph: BEIRUT, Lebanon — He had long been one of the more optimistic anti-government residents of the besieged, rebel-held section of Aleppo, trying to buoy others’ spirits even as loyalist forces closed in. 2016-12-10.abstract: Richard Sandomir, who covered sports media for The New York Times for a quarter of a century, recounts his memories as he moves to a new assignment.
2016-12-10.snippet: Richard Sandomir, who covered sports media for The New York Times for a quarter of a century, recounts his memories as he moves to a new assignment.
2016-12-10.lead_paragraph: And now, after 25 years covering sports media for The New York Times, I’m off to the obituaries department. Live sports to dead folks? I needed a new challenge, time away from pregame shows that have become indistinguishable towers of babble, three-man broadcast booths (deliver me from low-talking Cal Ripken Jr. on TBS baseball) and treacly, genteel Masters coverage that is done to please the overlords at Augusta.
2016-12-10.headline_main: Pressing the Off Button on an Indelible Marathon of Images

2016-12-10.abstract: Federal parks, forests, wildlife refuges and rangelands are owned by the public. We should resist the Republicans who want to sell or give them away.
2016-12-10.snippet: Federal parks, forests, wildlife refuges and rangelands are owned by the public. We should resist the Republicans who want to sell or give them away.
2016-12-10.lead_paragraph: Bozeman, Mont. — The Statue of Liberty stands on a piece of federal land, but “federal” doesn’t mean it belongs to Washington. This piece of real estate, 15 precious acres known as Liberty Island, lies in Upper New York Bay just west of the state line between New York and New Jersey, but it doesn’t belong to New Jersey. Liberty Island is part of Statue of Liberty National Monument, created in increments by three American presidents (beginning with Calvin Coolidge in 1924) using their authority under the Antiquities Act. The National Park Service administers it, but it doesn’t belong to that agency. It belongs to a schoolteacher in Vermont, a coal miner in West Virginia, a waitress in Las Vegas, a tattooist in San Francisco, and to you, and to me, and to every other American citizen.
2016-12-10.headline_main: It’s Our Land. Let’s Keep It That Way.

Bloomberg, whose administration began prohibiting traffic on several blocks of Broadway in 2009 to create a vast plaza. But in short order, the vehicles seem to have been replaced with Minnies and Mickeys, Elmos and SpongeBobs and half-naked or flag-painted buskers.
2016-12-10.headline_main: It’s Time to Set Broadway Free

2016-12-11.abstract: Romo rose from an undrafted rookie to the Pro Bowl, but he has been replaced by Dak Prescott, a player who is exactly what Romo once was.
2016-12-11.snippet: Romo rose from an undrafted rookie to the Pro Bowl, but he has been replaced by Dak Prescott, a player who is exactly what Romo once was.
2016-12-11.lead_paragraph: FRISCO, Tex. — The Dallas Cowboys’ new headquarters is sparkly and showy and so Texas-over-the-top that it makes the team’s longtime base of operations — in Irving, about 20 miles southwest of here — look like your grandparents’ wood-paneled rec room. The complex is like an airy, marbled museum, with reminders, maybe every 10 steps, that the Cowboys once were a dynasty: Super Bowl rings, Super Bowl trophies and hagiographic displays of all five of the franchise’s Super Bowl victories.
2016-12-11.headline_main: Tony Romo’s Star Is Eclipsed by Another Feel-Good Story

2016-12-11.snippet: This Warren Ellis novel about a sanitarium of futurologists is efficient and alive, but at times clichéd.
2016-12-11.lead_paragraph: Some writers have been thinking about the future for so long that now it is the future. Warren Ellis, the author of a smart, tight, occasionally tiresome new novel called “Normal,” has been at work on the subject since the early 1990s and may have decided it was time to offer a sly acknowledgment of his own longevity: The book is about a sanitarium full of futurologists in various states of nervous breakdown.
2016-12-11.headline_main: Review: ‘Normal’ Looks Into the Abyss and Finds the Future

2016-12-11.lead_paragraph: CHICAGO — “The Nutcracker” is traditionally set in Nuremberg, Germany, in the early 19th century. But across America, which presents far more productions of this ballet than any other country, the story is often transposed to the city in which it’s being performed. From New London, Conn., to Nashville, audiences can watch their local “Nutcracker” with civic pride; and certainly these American adaptations appeal to the tourist in me.

2016-12-11.lead_paragraph: MANILA — Dusk set silver-gray over the crowd gathered in a park here on Nov. 25, but the banners and placards could still be clearly seen. Homemade, cardboard, some laminated with packing tape to protect them from the rain, the signs expressed the rage of thousands of young Filipinos rallying against the recent, clandestine burial of the dictator Ferdinand Marcos in the Cemetery of Heroes.

2016-12-11.lead_paragraph: ISTANBUL — On Nov. 17, members of Parliament from Turkey’s ruling Justice and Development Party, or A.K.P., proposed a bill that seemed bizarre, even in the context of Turkey, where every week seems to bring a new, shocking outrage. The bill called for people who had sexually abused underage girls before Nov. 16 to avoid punishment if the abuser agreed to marry his victim.

The purpose is to see if reluctant businessmen can be persuaded to sell the Africans desperately needed drugs at a modest price.

2016-12-12.lead_paragraph: “Now more than ever”: The phrase is all over the publicity for Alvin Ailey American Dance Theater’s season at City Center this year. It’s easy to imagine why the inspiration and solace for which this company is known might be newly relevant, newly needed. Near the start of “Revelations,” the work this troupe has danced in most of its performances for decades, torqued bodies express the pain of the oppressed to the sung words “there is trouble all over this world.” At the end, those bodies rock in joyful redemption.

2016-12-12.snippet: By vetoing a reform bill, the New Jersey governor supports abuses of prisoners that hide behind euphemisms like “restrictive housing units.”
2016-12-12.lead_paragraph: Flashing anger, Gov. Chris Christie has vetoed a legislative measure that would limit the use of solitary confinement in New Jersey’s prisons. He defended the state’s policy of “restrictive housing,” insisting it is significantly different from the harsh isolation reformers are fighting to curtail in federal and state prisons across the country. Civil rights watchdogs properly criticized New Jersey for resorting to euphemisms like “disciplinary detention” to mask a practice that remains a reality for far too many state prisoners.
2016-12-12.headline_main: Chris Christie’s Defense of Solitary Confinement

This has actually been obvious for months, but the agency was reluctant to state that conclusion before the election out of fear that it would be seen as taking a political role.

2016-12-12.abstract: After 20 years of photographing asylum seekers around the world, I have never seen anything as bad as this.
2016-12-12.snippet: After 20 years of photographing asylum seekers around the world, I have never seen anything as bad as this.
2016-12-12.lead_paragraph: MANUS, Papua New Guinea — I was 17 when I first came face to face with refugees. It was 1995 in Melbourne, Australia, and it was a Saturday. As usual I was out taking pictures of my friends skateboarding. We rolled up to a spot near the state Parliament. Across the street a protest was taking place — Cypriot women calling for the government to help them find their sons who had disappeared during the Turkish invasion of Cyprus in 1974. I left my friends and took a photograph of the protesters.
2016-12-12.headline_main: I Am Ashamed to Be Australian

2016-12-12.lead_paragraph: In 1997, Oksana Yushko moved from her home in eastern Ukraine to Moscow for an accountant’s job at a large herbal medicine company. It was a lucrative position, but soul-crushing. Every day was exactly like the next, she said, like a Russian version of the Bill Murray movie “Groundhog Day.” Seven years later, she left the security of her job to become a photographer, transforming her humdrum life into one of travel, adventure and no regrets.

2016-12-12.lead_paragraph: It is officially stated that the Queen has been pleased to approve the appointment of His Excellency the Marquis of Dufferin and Ava as Her Majesty’s Ambassador in Paris. The new Ambassador is a man of the widest diplomatic experience, and in every respect qualified to fill the important post to which he has been appointed. As far back as 1860 he was sent to Smyrna as British Commissioner to inquire into the massacre of Christians there. In 1864 he was Under-Secretary of State for India. In 1872 Mr. Glad­stone appointed him Governor-General of Canada, and he filled the office till 1878.
2016-12-12.headline_main: Queen of England Appoints New Ambassador to Paris

2016-12-12.abstract: Social scientists have come up with useful advice for gift-giving during the holiday season. Rule 1: Nobody really cares how much thought you put into it.

2016-12-12.abstract: This new glass serving dish keeps caviar cold without making a puddle of melted ice.
2016-12-12.snippet: This new glass serving dish keeps caviar cold without making a puddle of melted ice.
2016-12-12.lead_paragraph: To serve caviar properly, you need to deal with a bed of crushed ice, which can get sloppy as it melts. This new two-piece handblown glass caviar dish from Simon Pearce makes it easy, keeping the ice neatly on the bottom to maintain the chill. A one- to four-ounce tin of precious roe fits in the gently sloped top section. Mother-of-pearl spoons and other accouterments, like a dish for crème fraîche, are up to you. The set is large enough to be deployed for serving a seafood dip, salmon rillettes or smoked fish spread: Bristol Caviar Chiller Set, $100, simonpearce.com.
2016-12-12.headline_main: An Elegant Solution to Caviar Service

2016-12-12.abstract: The SoHo pastry chef’s Christmas Morning Cereal returns for a limited engagement.
2016-12-12.snippet: The SoHo pastry chef’s Christmas Morning Cereal returns for a limited engagement.
2016-12-12.lead_paragraph: For the past few years, the pastry chef Dominique Ansel has been concocting what he calls Christmas Morning Cereal, which can also be sprinkled over ice cream or nibbled on the sly. It resembles the offspring of granola and Cocoa Krispies: a devilish mix of clumps of puffed rice covered in caramelized milk chocolate, candied hazelnuts and meringue drops. It’s available again in Mr. Ansel’s SoHo store, and can be ordered online for pickup and, for that far-flung sweet tooth, for delivery in the continental United States: Christmas Morning Cereal, $15.50 at Dominique Ansel Bakery, 189 Spring Street (Thompson Street), 212-219-2773, or from dominiqueansel.com/christmas-cereal-shipping; orders must be received by Friday for shipping the next Monday, minimum three boxes with a shipping charge of $3 per box.
2016-12-12.headline_main: Dominique Ansel Leaves Something Tasty Under the Tree

2016-12-12.abstract: The Parisian charcutier Nicolas Rafa is crafting uncommonly beautiful terrines, pâtés and sausages for Le District.
2016-12-12.snippet: The Parisian charcutier Nicolas Rafa is crafting uncommonly beautiful terrines, pâtés and sausages for Le District.
2016-12-12.lead_paragraph: Ornate truffle-studded and pastry-wrapped pâtés, terrines, galantines and sausages, like boudin blanc, are French holiday traditions. Le District, the French market in Battery Park City, is now selling a dazzling array of seasonal charcuterie made from pork, game, poultry and veal, along with its staples. Nicolas Rafa, a Parisian chef who trained with the master charcutier Gilles Verot, is the man fashioning these uncommonly beautiful specialties, some glittering in jellied wraps, others revealing kaleidoscope patterns when sliced: Holiday charcuterie, $22 to $99 per pound; regular pâtés, terrines and sausages, $8 to $70 per pound, Le District, Brookfield Place, 225 Liberty Street (West Street), 212-981-8588, ledistrict.com.
2016-12-12.headline_main: Festive French Charcuterie for the Holidays

2016-12-12.abstract: Katja Haecker sells German baked goods, including zimtsterne, online and at Smorgasburg.
2016-12-12.snippet: Katja Haecker sells German baked goods, including zimtsterne, online and at Smorgasburg.
2016-12-12.lead_paragraph: Inspired by nostalgia for home, Katja Haecker started Sweet & Salzig, featuring sweet and savory cakes, tarts and cookies made from family recipes from the Schwabenland region of Germany, near France and Switzerland. She began selling her baked goods last year at the weekend markets Smorgasburg and Brooklyn Flea, and now has a website. For Christmas, she offers gently spiced zimtsterne cinnamon cookies, above, along with honey lebkuchen and sugar-dusted stollen, plain or with a marzipan filling, the better to keep it moist. Visit her stand at Smorgasburg’s winter market, and you’ll find other items like her sauerkraut tart, onion cakes, poppy-seed cakes and strudels. Some of her items are also sold at Schaller & Weber on the Upper East Side: Zimtsterne, $18 for nine cookies, sweetandsalzig.com.
2016-12-12.headline_main: Cookies Are the Stars of Sweet & Salzig

2016-12-12.abstract: Eli Zabar’s brioche holiday wreath does double duty.
2016-12-12.snippet: Eli Zabar’s brioche holiday wreath does double duty.
2016-12-12.lead_paragraph: This year, Hanukkah begins on Christmas Eve. Accordingly, Eli Zabar has come up with edible décor appropriate for both occasions — a wreath of buttery braided brioche. Bring one to a party: Brioche holiday wreath, $45, 866-354-3547, elizabar.com.
2016-12-12.headline_main: A Wreath Made for Chrismukkah

Breyer on Monday issued an unusual dissent from the Supreme Court’s decision not to hear the case of a Florida death row inmate who said his conviction had been based on flawed evidence and false testimony.
2016-12-12.headline_main: Once Again, Justice Breyer Presses Case Against Death Penalty

2016-12-12.abstract: Vinous teams up with Delectable and Banquet to expand its wine coverage.
2016-12-12.snippet: Vinous teams up with Delectable and Banquet to expand its wine coverage.
2016-12-12.lead_paragraph: Your smartphone knows much more about wine than you do, maybe even more than an expert like Hugh Johnson. That’s because the Vinous app and website, created by Antonio Galloni in 2013 after he left Robert Parker’s Wine Advocate, has just scooped up two other free apps, Delectable and Banquet, to enhance its wine coverage. Scan a wine label, and Delectable will give you reviews by a cross section of wine drinkers, both amateur and professional, like sommeliers, not just the opinions by wine critics that you’d find for 170,000 wines on Vinous. Delectable’s database covers more than a million choices, for spirits and beer too, with comments from some 4.6 million users. Banquet will tell you where to buy the bottles. Shops pay a fee to be listed. Vinous operates on a subscription basis, and the depth of information you get on a wine depends on your subscription level: Vinous, vinous.com.
2016-12-12.headline_main: An App That Puts Wine Reviews in Your Pocket

2016-12-12.abstract: The posters this artist plastered all over New York represent a pre-Facebook era of political statement; some 100 of them will be shown at Alden Projects.
2016-12-12.snippet: The posters this artist plastered all over New York represent a pre-Facebook era of political statement; some 100 of them will be shown at Alden Projects.
2016-12-12.lead_paragraph: Set aside your image of Jenny Holzer, the reigning art-world star whose popularized aphorisms — such as “Abuse of Power Comes as No Surprise” and “Protect Me From What I Want” — have been emblazoned on marble benches and massive LED screens from the Guggenheim Museum to the Venice Biennale. Instead, meet Jenny Holzer, urban guerilla-style anonymous artist. That’s the thrust of a new show at Alden Projects in Manhattan, opening on Jan. 13 and featuring more than 100 of the “Truisms” and “Inflammatory Essays” posters that Ms. Holzer began creating in 1977 and then proceeded to plaster all over New York City in the dead of the night.
2016-12-12.headline_main: Taking It to the Street With Jenny Holzer

2016-12-12.abstract: A comprehensive chronicle of abuses committed by the American government after the Sept. 11 attacks should be declassified.

2016-12-12.abstract: The Justice Department’s use of an anti-racketeering law in a health care fraud case might portend more aggressive crackdowns on executives.
2016-12-12.snippet: The Justice Department’s use of an anti-racketeering law in a health care fraud case might portend more aggressive crackdowns on executives.
2016-12-12.lead_paragraph: One of the most powerful tools in the Justice Department’s arsenal is the Racketeer Influenced and Corrupt Organizations Act, better known as RICO, that can result in long prison sentences for members of criminal organizations. Although the law has rarely been used against corporate executives, an indictment that includes a RICO conspiracy charge last week in a health care fraud case in Boston could signal a more aggressive approach to violations involving senior management.
2016-12-12.headline_main: RICO Charge in Pharmaceutical Case May Signal Tougher Tactics

2016-12-12.abstract: Betsy DeVos pushed back on any regulation of Detroit’s troubled school system. Will she bring that free-market approach to America’s public schools?
2016-12-12.snippet: Betsy DeVos pushed back on any regulation of Detroit’s troubled school system. Will she bring that free-market approach to America’s public schools?
2016-12-12.lead_paragraph: Few disagreed that schools in Detroit were a mess: a chaotic mix of charters and traditional public schools, the worst-performing in the nation.
2016-12-12.headline_main: How Trump’s Education Nominee Bent Detroit to Her Will on Charter Schools

2016-12-12.abstract: Our guide to affordable shows for almost anyone, from I-can’t-get-enough-tinsel traditionalists to Santa-is-for-suckers holiday haters.
2016-12-12.snippet: Our guide to affordable shows for almost anyone, from I-can’t-get-enough-tinsel traditionalists to Santa-is-for-suckers holiday haters.
2016-12-12.lead_paragraph: Need a break from the hunt for Hatchimals or from eyeball-detonating Christmas displays? Here’s our guide to eight affordable shows for eight holiday theater tastes, from I-can’t-get-enough-tinsel traditionalists to Santa-is-for-suckers holiday haters.
2016-12-12.headline_main: 8 Holiday Shows for Various Tastes

2016-12-12.headline_main: Donald Trump, Aleppo, Golden Globes: Your Monday Evening Briefing

2016-12-12.abstract: Speculation centered on whether Mr. West’s new hair color was linked to recent emotional and professional turmoil.
2016-12-12.snippet: Speculation centered on whether Mr. West’s new hair color was linked to recent emotional and professional turmoil.
2016-12-12.lead_paragraph: Kanye West, the rapper, fashion designer, showman and Twitter ranter, has maintained a low profile since canceling his “Saint Pablo” tour and being hospitalized in mid-November amid rumors of severe exhaustion.
2016-12-12.headline_main: Interpreting Kanye West’s Blond ’Do

2016-12-12.abstract: For the NASA alumni and other Floridians in Patrick Ryan’s short-story collection, the American dream proves elusive.
2016-12-12.snippet: For the NASA alumni and other Floridians in Patrick Ryan’s short-story collection, the American dream proves elusive.
2016-12-12.lead_paragraph: The stories by Patrick Ryan in “The Dream Life of Astronauts” take place in and around Cape Canaveral, Fla. Some of his characters work for NASA — or did, before they fell back into the slipstream of ordinary life. Some simply live nearby on Merritt Island, where they can watch shuttle launches from their backyards. One man, who helped double- and triple-check the thermal tiles on the doomed orbiter Challenger, feels rattled for a long time after the 1986 disaster.
2016-12-12.headline_main: 'The Dream Life of Astronauts,’ Hopes Too Fragile for the Cold

2016-12-12.abstract: The Cuomo administration and federal officials have clashed over the markets, as federal law prohibits the sale of over-the-counter goods at recreation areas.
2016-12-12.snippet: The Cuomo administration and federal officials have clashed over the markets, as federal law prohibits the sale of over-the-counter goods at recreation areas.
2016-12-12.lead_paragraph: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo’s “Taste NY” program seemed simple enough: Slap some new branding on the blue billboards that line New York State’s roadways, establish markets that sell local products at places frequented by travelers and hold events across the state featuring homegrown goods.
2016-12-12.headline_main: ‘Taste NY’ Markets Pit the State Against Federal Regulators

2016-12-12.abstract: Guardiola’s reign at Manchester City could validate the Premier League’s sense of self (if he struggles) or question tenets of England’s identity (if he thrives).
2016-12-12.snippet: Guardiola’s reign at Manchester City could validate the Premier League’s sense of self (if he struggles) or question tenets of England’s identity (if he thrives).
2016-12-12.lead_paragraph: The criticism itself will neither surprise nor sting Pep Guardiola. He made that perfectly clear months ago, on the day he was presented as Manchester City manager.
2016-12-12.headline_main: Pep Guardiola: A Continental Success and English Soccer’s Measuring Stick

2016-12-12.abstract: In an Instagram era, “instant” pictures of Madonna, Pharrell Williams and Emily Ratajkowski, made with film that is no longer available, acquire special status.
2016-12-12.snippet: In an Instagram era, “instant” pictures of Madonna, Pharrell Williams and Emily Ratajkowski, made with film that is no longer available, acquire special status.
2016-12-12.lead_paragraph: There was a time when the term “instant” brought to mind not an iPhone snap but the simple bliss of seeing a film pop through a Polaroid camera, fixing a giddy moment onto a memory that would last a lifetime (provided the photograph didn’t fade).
2016-12-12.headline_main: Celebrity Polaroids Give New Life to Dead Film

2016-12-12.abstract: The plan to merge Public School 241, which has had its enrollment decline, with P.S. 76 angered parents, who said they had not had enough time to respond.
2016-12-12.snippet: The plan to merge Public School 241, which has had its enrollment decline, with P.S. 76 angered parents, who said they had not had enough time to respond.
2016-12-12.lead_paragraph: New York City’s Education Department is withdrawing a plan to merge two elementary schools in southern Harlem after receiving criticism that it had not given parents enough time to respond, it said on Monday.

2016-12-12.abstract: Major veterans groups favor leaving Robert A. McDonald at the helm, saying other rumored candidates’ inexperience and ideological leanings could cripple the system.
2016-12-12.snippet: Major veterans groups favor leaving Robert A. McDonald at the helm, saying other rumored candidates’ inexperience and ideological leanings could cripple the system.
2016-12-12.lead_paragraph: The nation’s largest veterans groups are urging President-elect Donald J. Trump to keep President Obama’s secretary of veterans affairs, Robert A. McDonald, out of concern that his rumored candidates’ inexperience and ideological leanings could cripple the massive veterans health care system.
2016-12-12.headline_main: Veterans Groups Urge Trump to Keep Obama’s V.A. Secretary

2016-12-12.abstract: After his scoring slipped to the lowest level of his long career last season, the hard-charging Hossa, 37, revamped his training program and is now Chicago’s top goal producer.
2016-12-12.snippet: After his scoring slipped to the lowest level of his long career last season, the hard-charging Hossa, 37, revamped his training program and is now Chicago’s top goal producer.
2016-12-12.lead_paragraph: CHICAGO — Marian Hossa arrived in Trencin, his hometown in Slovakia, in May, returning to family and friends months earlier than he had in recent memory.
