2016-12-13.abstract: President Abdel Fattah el-Sisi moved to reassure Egypt’s Coptic Christians after a bombing at their cathedral in Cairo stirred fears of resurgent Islamist violence.
2016-12-13.snippet: President Abdel Fattah el-Sisi moved to reassure Egypt’s Coptic Christians after a bombing at their cathedral in Cairo stirred fears of resurgent Islamist violence.
2016-12-13.lead_paragraph: CAIRO — President Abdel Fattah el-Sisi on Monday made dramatic efforts to reassure Egypt’s Coptic Christians — a pillar of his government’s support — as they buried victims of a bombing on Sunday at their cathedral in Cairo, an act that has stirred fears of resurgent Islamist violence.
2016-12-13.headline_main: Cathedral Bombing in Cairo Leaves Egypt Alarmed, and Its President Scrambling

2016-12-13.abstract: The N.B.A. franchise will reclaim the city identity it left behind when it took up residence in the suburbs in 1978.
2016-12-13.snippet: The N.B.A. franchise will reclaim the city identity it left behind when it took up residence in the suburbs in 1978.
2016-12-13.lead_paragraph: Motown is not going back to Detroit but the Pistons are. This recent news, capping a standup year of N.B.A. social activism and outspokenness, was soul-cleansing music to Dave Bing’s ears.
2016-12-13.headline_main: Detroit and the Pistons Are One Again

2016-12-13.abstract: A toy distributor is accused of hoarding and price gouging, and the consumer protection agency steps in. But some accuse the government of grandstanding.
2016-12-13.snippet: A toy distributor is accused of hoarding and price gouging, and the consumer protection agency steps in. But some accuse the government of grandstanding.
2016-12-13.lead_paragraph: CARACAS, Venezuela — It was a haul that might have even given Santa Claus pause: 3.8 million toys, seized by Venezuela’s government on the grounds that their owners were hoarding castles and kiddie cars ahead of Christmas.
2016-12-13.headline_main: Venezuela’s Government Plays Santa, After Seizing Millions of Toys

2016-12-13.abstract: The first step to office will be a grilling on potential business conflicts of interest and, for some, tax returns, courtesy of Senate sleuths.
2016-12-13.snippet: The first step to office will be a grilling on potential business conflicts of interest and, for some, tax returns, courtesy of Senate sleuths.
2016-12-13.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — For the billionaires, the multimillionaires and the plain well-off people whom President-elect Donald J. Trump is choosing for his cabinet, the first step to office will be the sort of grilling he didn’t face — on potential business conflicts of interest and, for some, tax returns — courtesy of the Senate sleuths who have taken their toll in the past.
2016-12-13.headline_main: Donald Trump’s Wealthy Cabinet Picks to Undergo Financial Scrutiny He Didn’t Face

2016-12-13.abstract: The United States Supreme Court denied a request to review the settlement, meaning certain retired players with brain ailments can begin receiving as much as $5 million.
2016-12-13.snippet: The United States Supreme Court denied a request to review the settlement, meaning certain retired players with brain ailments can begin receiving as much as $5 million.
2016-12-13.lead_paragraph: The United States Supreme Court on Monday denied a request to review the N.F.L.’s settlement with retired players who had accused the league of hiding the dangers of head trauma, paving the way for some players with brain ailments to begin receiving payments of as much as $5 million.
2016-12-13.headline_main: N.F.L. Concussion Settlement Payments Can Begin After Supreme Court Defers

2016-12-13.abstract: Lawyers for Pedro Hernandez, who is on trial on charges of killing Etan Patz in 1979, continued to build on arguments that he has schizotypal personality disorder.
2016-12-13.snippet: Lawyers for Pedro Hernandez, who is on trial on charges of killing Etan Patz in 1979, continued to build on arguments that he has schizotypal personality disorder.
2016-12-13.lead_paragraph: He demanded that his daughter hold his hand as she crossed the street, even though she was a teenager. He could be stubborn and taciturn and strict with his rules. He warned his daughter about a dark world — one in which there “were no good people.”
2016-12-13.headline_main: In Patz Trial, Suspect’s Family Tells of His Odd Behavior

2016-12-13.abstract: Tejada, whose tenure with the Mets effectively ended with a broken leg sustained in a 2015 playoff game against the Dodgers, will have to compete with Ronald Torreyes for a utility position.
2016-12-13.snippet: Tejada, whose tenure with the Mets effectively ended with a broken leg sustained in a 2015 playoff game against the Dodgers, will have to compete with Ronald Torreyes for a utility position.
2016-12-13.lead_paragraph: Ruben Tejada, the infielder whose tenure with the Mets ended when he broke his leg during the 2015 playoffs, signed a minor league contract with the Yankees on Monday, according to his agent, Peter Greenberg. The deal includes an invitation to major league camp.
2016-12-13.headline_main: Yankees Sign Former Mets Infielder Ruben Tejada to Minor League Deal

2016-12-13.abstract: The move is unlikely to satisfy critics, who have said the only way for Mr. Trump to avoid conflicts of interest is to entirely divest his stake in his business.
2016-12-13.snippet: The move is unlikely to satisfy critics, who have said the only way for Mr. Trump to avoid conflicts of interest is to entirely divest his stake in his business.
2016-12-13.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President-elect Donald J. Trump said late Monday night that “no new deals will be done” by his real estate business while he is in the Oval Office, a promise that appeared meant to address ethical concerns about conflicts of interest between his elected position and his real estate empire.

2016-12-13.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Labor Secretary Thomas E. Perez has told three senior Democrats that he intends to run for chairman of the Democratic National Committee, challenging the front-running candidate, Representative Keith Ellison, and inserting an ally of President Obama into the contest to rebuild a bruised party.

2016-12-13.abstract: As an essayist and cultural critic for The Sunday Times, Mr. Gill laid stylishly malicious waste to superstar chefs, trendy restaurants and food fads.
2016-12-13.snippet: As an essayist and cultural critic for The Sunday Times, Mr. Gill laid stylishly malicious waste to superstar chefs, trendy restaurants and food fads.
2016-12-13.lead_paragraph: A. A. Gill, an essayist and cultural critic whose stylishly malicious restaurant reviews for The Sunday Times made him one of Britain’s most celebrated journalists, died on Saturday in London. He was 62.

2016-12-13.abstract: Donald Trump has chosen for the top post an apologist for Russia and for deputy a past diplomat with dangerous policies.
2016-12-13.snippet: Donald Trump has chosen for the top post an apologist for Russia and for deputy a past diplomat with dangerous policies.
2016-12-13.lead_paragraph: Set aside the fact that Rex Tillerson, the chief executive of Exxon Mobil and Donald Trump’s choice for secretary of state, knows scores of world leaders and is a skilled businessman. Why would Mr. Trump choose as his top diplomat a man whose every decision or action would be tainted by suspicion that he’s capitulating to Russian interests or those of the oil industry, having spent his entire career at Exxon Mobil?
2016-12-13.headline_main: Flawed Choices for the State Department

2016-12-13.abstract: Quotation of the day for Tuesday, December 13, 2016.
2016-12-13.snippet: Quotation of the day for Tuesday, December 13, 2016.
2016-12-13.lead_paragraph: “My aim is to turn my mustache yellow — I’ll smoke as long as my health allows it.”
2016-12-13.headline_main: Quotation of the Day

2016-12-13.abstract: Mr. Flynn’s view that the C.I.A. is a political arm of the Obama administration isn’t widely shared in Washington but seems to have been internalized by Donald J. Trump.
2016-12-13.snippet: Mr. Flynn’s view that the C.I.A. is a political arm of the Obama administration isn’t widely shared in Washington but seems to have been internalized by Donald J. Trump.
2016-12-13.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Long before Lt. Gen. Michael T. Flynn became Donald J. Trump’s choice for national security adviser, he believed that the Central Intelligence Agency had become a political tool of the Obama administration — a view now echoed by the president-elect in his mocking dismissals of C.I.A. assessments that Russia sought to tip the election in Mr. Trump’s favor.

2016-12-13.abstract: Ms. Redzepova, who sang in 10 languages, helped to bring wider recognition and respect to Romany music.

2016-12-13.lead_paragraph: Esma Redzepova, the Macedonian singer who was acclaimed for decades as the greatest female voice in Romany (Gypsy) music, died on Sunday in Skopje, the capital of Macedonia. She was 73.
2016-12-13.headline_main: Esma Redzepova Dies at 73; Sang of Her Roma Heritage to Generations

2016-12-13.abstract: We asked readers — without any context — to caption a photo that ran in The New York Times. Here’s how they responded.
2016-12-13.snippet: We asked readers — without any context — to caption a photo that ran in The New York Times. Here’s how they responded.
2016-12-13.lead_paragraph: Times Insider shares insights into how we work at The New York Times. Occasionally we have some fun.

2016-12-13.abstract: On Nov. 26, an “unauthorized third party” gained access to names, dates of birth and lab results, but not insurance or financial information, the company said.
2016-12-13.snippet: On Nov. 26, an “unauthorized third party” gained access to names, dates of birth and lab results, but not insurance or financial information, the company said.

2016-12-13.headline_main: Hack of Quest Diagnostics App Exposes Data of 34,000 Patients

2016-12-13.abstract: Russia’s energy industry could create a blurry line between Mr. Tillerson’s interests as an oilman and the role he will assume as America’s top diplomat.
2016-12-13.snippet: Russia’s energy industry could create a blurry line between Mr. Tillerson’s interests as an oilman and the role he will assume as America’s top diplomat.
2016-12-13.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW — Now that President-elect Donald J. Trump has chosen Rex W. Tillerson, the chief executive of Exxon Mobil, to be the next secretary of state, the giant oil company stands to make some major gains as well: It has billions of dollars in deals that can go forward only if the United States lifts sanctions against Russia.
2016-12-13.headline_main: Rex Tillerson’s Company, Exxon, Has Billions at Stake Over Sanctions on Russia

2016-12-13.abstract: Daniel Craig is the Iago to the Othello of David Oyelowo in this breathless interpretation of Shakespeare’s taut portrait of lives razed by jealousy.
2016-12-13.snippet: Daniel Craig is the Iago to the Othello of David Oyelowo in this breathless interpretation of Shakespeare’s taut portrait of lives razed by jealousy.
2016-12-13.lead_paragraph: “I am your own forever.” When these words are uttered in the electrifying new production of “Othello,” which opened on Monday night at the New York Theater Workshop, you feel you’ve heard the most frightening vow ever spoken. It is delivered at the end of the first half of a performance that is drawn in lightning.
2016-12-13.headline_main: Review: Jealousy and Lies in a No-Exit Theater of War in ‘Othello’

2016-12-13.abstract: A debut by David Alfred Bywaters.
2016-12-13.snippet: A debut by David Alfred Bywaters.
2016-12-13.lead_paragraph: I do love a punny debut, and today we solve The New York Times debut puzzle of David Alfred Bywaters, who has a name that is more reminiscent of a Victorian novelist than a crossword constructor in 2016.
2016-12-13.headline_main: Legal Precedents

2016-12-13.abstract: In choosing the leader of an energy giant, President-elect Donald J. Trump is dismissing bipartisan concerns that Mr. Tillerson is too cozy with Vladimir V. Putin.
2016-12-13.snippet: In choosing the leader of an energy giant, President-elect Donald J. Trump is dismissing bipartisan concerns that Mr. Tillerson is too cozy with Vladimir V. Putin.
2016-12-13.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President-elect Donald J. Trump on Tuesday officially selected Rex W. Tillerson, the chief executive of Exxon Mobil, to be his secretary of state. In saying he will nominate Mr. Tillerson, the president-elect is dismissing bipartisan concerns that the globe-trotting leader of an energy giant has a too-cozy relationship with Vladimir V. Putin, the president of Russia.
2016-12-13.headline_main: Rex Tillerson, Exxon C.E.O., Chosen as Secretary of State

2016-12-13.abstract: Donald J. Trump’s election will affect major issues facing António Guterres, including the Syrian war and how to preserve the United Nations’ funding and values.
2016-12-13.snippet: Donald J. Trump’s election will affect major issues facing António Guterres, including the Syrian war and how to preserve the United Nations’ funding and values.
2016-12-13.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS — António Guterres took the oath of office  on Monday to become the next secretary general of the United Nations amid a rise in nationalist movements around the world and what he called a loss of confidence in institutions, including the one he will take over in January.
2016-12-13.headline_main: António Guterres, Sworn In as U.N.’s Next Leader, Must Factor Trump Into His Plans

2016-12-13.snippet: Officials evacuated about 500 passengers from Lufthansa Flight 441, which was traveling from Houston to Frankfurt.

2016-12-13.abstract: Millions of Indians are moving toward a cashless economy, fulfilling what Prime Minister Narendra Modi now says was an objective of banning 500- and 1,000-rupee notes.
2016-12-13.snippet: Millions of Indians are moving toward a cashless economy, fulfilling what Prime Minister Narendra Modi now says was an objective of banning 500- and 1,000-rupee notes.
2016-12-13.lead_paragraph: NEW DELHI — For a year, Ashish Kumar Mandal scratched out a living selling dumplings on the streets of New Delhi for a bit less than 50 cents a plate, until the government banned most of the country’s currency bills last month, crushing his all-cash business. In desperation, the 32-year-old took a step he had never even contemplated before: He offered his customers the option of paying electronically.

2016-12-13.abstract: At least 259 journalists were imprisoned worldwide, a third of them in Turkey, the Committee to Protect Journalists said.
2016-12-13.snippet: At least 259 journalists were imprisoned worldwide, a third of them in Turkey, the Committee to Protect Journalists said.
2016-12-13.lead_paragraph: At least 259 journalists have been jailed around the world this year, a press advocacy group reported on Monday, the most since it began a detailed annual census of imprisonments in 1990.
2016-12-13.headline_main: Record Number of Journalists Jailed in 2016, Press Advocacy Group Says

They asked him to dine with them at Comet Ping Pong, the pizzeria at the center of debate over whether allies of President-elect Donald J. Trump are spreading so-called fake news.
2016-12-13.headline_main: Mike Pence Is Invited to Dine at Pizzeria at Center of Fake News Barrage

2016-12-13.abstract: In Africa, accommodations include hotels, camps and villas—and the prospect of seeing giraffes, mountain gorillas and hippos.
2016-12-13.snippet: In Africa, accommodations include hotels, camps and villas—and the prospect of seeing giraffes, mountain gorillas and hippos.
2016-12-13.lead_paragraph: To stay or to roam? That is the African question. The following new and improved accommodations, from Indian Ocean island resorts and highland volcano lodges to hotels in working vineyards and solar-powered desert camps, capture the continent’s diversity. Meanwhile, the latest tours take roads less traveled, from the desert of Sudan to migratory grounds in Zambia.
2016-12-13.headline_main: From Botswana to Zambia, New Lodges, Resorts and Tours

2016-12-13.abstract: Andrew Woodward said he was raped for years by his coach, Barry Bennell. A decision decades later to go public has inspired others to come forward.
2016-12-13.snippet: Andrew Woodward said he was raped for years by his coach, Barry Bennell. A decision decades later to go public has inspired others to come forward.
2016-12-13.lead_paragraph: MARTON, England — Andrew Woodward grew up with a soccer ball between his feet. His room, in a working-class housing estate, was filled with posters of famous players and his head with dreams of becoming a defender for England. When he was 9, he scored a goal from the halfway line in a school match and raced across the field into the arms of his father, who said he was “the proudest dad in the world.”
2016-12-13.headline_main: Child Sexual Abuse Scandal Rocks U.K. Soccer

2016-12-13.abstract: America needs to defend the liberal world order and not become complicit in dismantling it.
2016-12-13.snippet: America needs to defend the liberal world order and not become complicit in dismantling it.
2016-12-13.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — In February 1945, in the twilight of World War II, Franklin D. Roosevelt, Joseph Stalin and Winston Churchill convened in Yalta, a Russian resort town in the Crimea, to deliberate on the direction of the war and the peace to follow. They agreed to a postwar order managed by Roosevelt’s “Four Policemen” — the United States, Britain, Russia and China.
2016-12-13.headline_main: What Is America Without Influence? Trump Will Find Out.

2016-12-13.abstract: In 2016, on subjects from prison punishment and urban planning to selling vinyl records, reporters focused on fixing, not just describing, problems.
2016-12-13.snippet: In 2016, on subjects from prison punishment and urban planning to selling vinyl records, reporters focused on fixing, not just describing, problems.
2016-12-13.lead_paragraph: The goal of journalism, in the words of Carl Bernstein, is to provide the “best obtainable version of the truth.” This is hard to do. It’s not just a matter of sorting fact from fiction, dealing with “filter bubbles” and motivated denial of facts, or even contending with the public’s lack of trust for journalists.
2016-12-13.headline_main: From Many Corners, Journalism Seeking Solutions

2016-12-13.abstract: For the religious right, vouchers are a way to dismantle public education.
2016-12-13.snippet: For the religious right, vouchers are a way to dismantle public education.
2016-12-13.lead_paragraph: BOSTON — At the rightmost edge of the Christian conservative movement, there are those who dream of turning the United States into a Christian republic subject to “biblical laws.” In the unlikely figure of Donald J. Trump, they hope to have found their greatest champion yet. He wasn’t “our preferred candidate,” the Christian nationalist David Barton said in June, but he could be “God’s candidate.”
2016-12-13.headline_main: Betsy DeVos and God’s Plan for Schools

2016-12-13.snippet: Michael Bloomberg starts a promising new project that can address working-class alienation.
2016-12-13.lead_paragraph: Many college campuses have reacted to Donald Trump’s election with shock and angst. Professors and students are wondering how the rest of the country could be so different from them. The more introspective are asking: What can we do?
2016-12-13.headline_main: Make Colleges Diverse

2016-12-13.abstract: In the city of Dothan, one man’s grip on the criminal justice system has exacted a steep price for many.
2016-12-13.snippet: In the city of Dothan, one man’s grip on the criminal justice system has exacted a steep price for many.
2016-12-13.lead_paragraph: DOTHAN, Ala. — It was a run-of-the-mill keg party in an open field, until one guest, Harvey Drayton Burch III, objected to paying for his beer. Witnesses said Mr. Burch fired a gun over the crowd and began spraying Mace. With partyers fleeing, Mr. Burch jumped into the back seat of a car as it drove away.
2016-12-13.headline_main: Alabama Prosecutor Sets the Penalties and Fills the Coffers

2016-12-13.snippet: The latest reshaping of the Italian lender will be closely watched for what it says about the willingness of investors to help troubled banks saddled with problem loans.
2016-12-13.lead_paragraph: LONDON — UniCredit, Italy’s largest bank by assets, said on Tuesday that it planned to cut 14,000 jobs over the next three years and that it would seek to raise nearly $14 billion, part of a strategic overhaul that comes at a crucial time for the country’s troubled banking sector.
2016-12-13.headline_main: UniCredit to Cut 14,000 Jobs and Raise Nearly $14 Billion in Overhaul

2016-12-13.abstract: Ron Haviv’s own experience with finding long-lost rolls of unprocessed film led him to ask people to send him their own rolls of forgotten, undeveloped film.
2016-12-13.snippet: Ron Haviv’s own experience with finding long-lost rolls of unprocessed film led him to ask people to send him their own rolls of forgotten, undeveloped film.
2016-12-13.lead_paragraph: If you ever visit a photographer’s home and peek in the refrigerator, you’re likely to find a bag of undeveloped film stuck way in the back, near an ancient box of baking soda. (Yes, that includes this photographer’s refrigerator.) It’s a near universal phenomenon — little spools of celluloid, chilled and never explored.
2016-12-13.headline_main: A Mission to Rescue Forgotten Photos

2016-12-13.snippet: Why do officials suspect Russian hackers broke into American computer systems last spring, and what would their motives have been?

2016-12-13.abstract: After years of bloodletting, one almost welcomes an end to the siege of Aleppo. But what comes next may be worse.
2016-12-13.snippet: After years of bloodletting, one almost welcomes an end to the siege of Aleppo. But what comes next may be worse.
2016-12-13.lead_paragraph: The battle for eastern Aleppo will be over soon, but tens of thousands of Syrians  there will find little peace. The victory for the government of President Bashar al-Assad will open another violent, disorienting chapter in their lives, and a dangerous one for the opposition. Soon, civilians and rebel fighters alike will either be punished or have to flee the city and join the many thousands of others displaced by Mr. Assad and his Iranian and Russian allies — part of a plan to break the insurgency, and change Syria forever.
2016-12-13.headline_main: What Comes After Aleppo Falls?

2016-12-13.abstract: The purchase of Pilsner Urquell and other Central and East European brands would give the Japanese beverage company a greater global presence.
2016-12-13.snippet: The purchase of Pilsner Urquell and other Central and East European brands would give the Japanese beverage company a greater global presence.
2016-12-13.lead_paragraph: Asahi Group, the Japanese beer giant, said on Tuesday that it would pay $7.8 billion to buy a group of Central and Eastern European beer brands from Anheuser-Busch InBev, in the latest brand shuffle for the rapidly consolidating brewing business.
2016-12-13.headline_main: Asahi to Buy Beer Brands From Anheuser-Busch InBev for $7.8 Billion

2016-12-13.abstract: Following the deadly attacks in 2015, the French government is seeking to turn the national anthem, often associated with the political right, into a symbol of unity.
2016-12-13.snippet: Following the deadly attacks in 2015, the French government is seeking to turn the national anthem, often associated with the political right, into a symbol of unity.
2016-12-13.lead_paragraph: PARIS — Last November, immediately after the Bataclan terror attacks here, France’s national anthem took on a global significance that few would have predicted. “La Marseillaise” was sung at rallies across the country, in English soccer stadiums and American concert halls.
2016-12-13.headline_main: The Twists and Turns of ‘La Marseillaise’

2016-12-13.abstract: Social media companies aren’t just an open marketplace for ideas — they’re also amplifying the most dangerous ones.
2016-12-13.snippet: Social media companies aren’t just an open marketplace for ideas — they’re also amplifying the most dangerous ones.
2016-12-13.lead_paragraph: In the days immediately following the presidential election, one striking statement by Stephen K. Bannon, the president-elect’s chief strategist and former campaign chief executive, rose to particular prominence. Speaking in July in his capacity as the chairman of Breitbart News, Bannon told the journalist Sarah Posner, in an article for Mother Jones, that his site was “the platform for the alt-right.” The statement was interpreted as both a claim of credit and a sort of explanation. The man who helped guide Donald J. Trump to the White House, and who will guide him again as president, had revealed the connection between his candidate, his publication and America’s most noxious political faction — a recently emboldened white-nationalist movement. And not only that, he seemed proud of it.
2016-12-13.headline_main: Who’s Responsible When Extremists Get a Platform?

2016-12-13.abstract: Societies roiled by populist anger could take a lesson from Japan’s attitude toward labor — and the importance of investing it with meaning.
2016-12-13.snippet: Societies roiled by populist anger could take a lesson from Japan’s attitude toward labor — and the importance of investing it with meaning.
2016-12-13.lead_paragraph: A few weeks ago, in a Kyoto tempura bar, I watched a lone chef, a man in late middle age, cooking behind a counter for his 11 customers. The set menu had 15 items on it. That meant that at any given moment, he was keeping track of 165 pieces of food, each subject to slightly different timing and technique. He wrote nothing down and expended no apparent effort. It was a demonstration of total mastery. This didn’t look so much like a job as a life: His work was his whole being.
2016-12-13.headline_main: What the West Can Learn From Japan About the Cultural Value of Work

2016-12-13.abstract: The executives meeting with Mr. Trump in Manhattan on Wednesday include Elon Musk of Tesla, Timothy D. Cook of Apple and Jeff Bezos of Amazon.

2016-12-13.lead_paragraph: ‘Donald Trump never laughs,” Al Franken said.

2016-12-13.abstract: The Osun-Osogbo sanctuary, a Unesco World Heritage site, has temples, distinctive art, and a sense of peace.
2016-12-13.snippet: The Osun-Osogbo sanctuary, a Unesco World Heritage site, has temples, distinctive art, and a sense of peace.
2016-12-13.lead_paragraph: The ritual drummers preceded her as she strode down the broad steps toward the Osun shrine, carefully balancing on her head a calabash filled with kola nuts, palm oil and other offerings to the Yoruba gods. She was not used to walking barefoot, so the sticks and stones on the forest floor sometimes hurt her feet, yet she continued on her course with a trancelike resolve. It was all part of an initiation ceremony of the traditional Ifa religion of the Yoruba, the largest ethnic group in southwest Nigeria, and the main reason she had traveled to the Osun-Osogbo Sacred Grove in Nigeria. At home in Brooklyn people know her as AnnMarie Sealey. Here in Osogbo they call her Ifaseye Orisabunmi Adeegbe.
2016-12-13.headline_main: In Sacred Grove in Nigeria, Worship and Connection

2016-12-13.abstract: In the first 10 months of this year, there were 17,063 homicide cases in Mexico, the highest 10-month tally since 2012.
2016-12-13.snippet: In the first 10 months of this year, there were 17,063 homicide cases in Mexico, the highest 10-month tally since 2012.
2016-12-13.lead_paragraph: CIUDAD JUÁREZ, Mexico — Five men shot dead in a barbershop, their bodies slumped near the doorway. A decapitated body dumped next to a housing development. Three others killed behind a pool hall and several more in a bar called Tres Mentiras, or Three Lies.
2016-12-13.headline_main: Mexico Grapples With a Surge in Violence

2016-12-13.abstract: While the tragedy has prompted vows to be safer, there is a sense of agitation among artists, who often do not have the resources to ensure their industrial event spaces are up to code.
2016-12-13.snippet: While the tragedy has prompted vows to be safer, there is a sense of agitation among artists, who often do not have the resources to ensure their industrial event spaces are up to code.
2016-12-13.lead_paragraph: Just before midnight on Wednesday, two young women with shaved heads slipped into a hallway during a party at a commercial building in Brooklyn and removed their clothes. While a man wearing a neoprene jumpsuit and knee-high boots crooned in a nearby room, the women crawled under a plastic tarp and began to grapple, a 10-minute piece of performance art that ended with them covered in handprints of black ink as an appreciative audience applauded.
2016-12-13.headline_main: After Oakland Fire, Brooklyn Artists Vow to Keep Partying

2016-12-13.abstract: A 4,250-mile, 16-day trip through six countries with five children and four hardheaded adults. What could go wrong?
2016-12-13.snippet: A 4,250-mile, 16-day trip through six countries with five children and four hardheaded adults. What could go wrong?
2016-12-13.lead_paragraph: We had made it to Tete, Mozambique. The sun was sinking behind the Zambezi River like a scoop of orange sherbet as we sat on the motel’s deck taking in the quiet close of another long day on the road. But we avoided one another’s eyes. The table in front of us was cluttered with maps, notebooks, competing spreadsheets and empty beer bottles.
2016-12-13.headline_main: Seeing Africa by Road

2016-12-13.abstract: Though Ms. Cash had every opportunity to eat delicious and nutritious food while growing up in San Francisco, she never met a vegetable she liked.
2016-12-13.snippet: Though Ms. Cash had every opportunity to eat delicious and nutritious food while growing up in San Francisco, she never met a vegetable she liked.
2016-12-13.lead_paragraph: I grew up in San Francisco, land of organic vegetables and vegan delights, before such things were so popular. From an early age, my parents sent me to school with peanut-butter-and-honey sandwiches, hard-boiled eggs, and fresh fruit from the fields of the Central Valley. Although I had every opportunity to eat delicious and nutritious food, I never met a vegetable I liked.
2016-12-13.headline_main: Aya Cash: The First Time I Ate a Vegetable (I Was 22)

While pro-government forces were moving in, United Nations officials said they were receiving multiple reports of execution-style killings.
2016-12-13.headline_main: Battle Over Aleppo Is Over, Russia Says, as Evacuation Deal Reached

2016-12-13.headline_main: Rick Perry, Ex-Governor of Texas, Is Trump’s Pick as Energy Secretary

2016-12-13.abstract: Immerse yourself in the story.
2016-12-13.snippet: Immerse yourself in the story.
2016-12-13.lead_paragraph: This year The Times published over fifteen groundbreaking virtual reality films that allow you to experience  a range of stories, from standing on the surface of Pluto to the battle to retake Falluja from ISIS this past summer. Below are some of our favorites. Download the NYT VR app on iPhone or Android to watch these films on your smartphone.
2016-12-13.headline_main: Virtual Reality Stories That Transported Viewers in 2016

2016-12-13.abstract: A Pew Research Center survey of 151 countries found wide gaps in education among major religions, including among Christians and minority faiths in the United States.
2016-12-13.snippet: A Pew Research Center survey of 151 countries found wide gaps in education among major religions, including among Christians and minority faiths in the United States.
2016-12-13.lead_paragraph: Religious minorities in the United States are far more likely to have attended college or a vocational school than members of the Christian majority, according to a review of census and survey data from 151 countries released on Tuesday that found wide gaps in education among followers of the world’s major religions.
2016-12-13.headline_main: Christians in U.S. Are Less Educated Than Religious Minorities, Report Says

2016-12-13.abstract: The structures built by the Wright brothers in Dayton, Ohio, are being preserved with the help of the National Park Service, redevelopers and history enthusiasts.
2016-12-13.snippet: The structures built by the Wright brothers in Dayton, Ohio, are being preserved with the help of the National Park Service, redevelopers and history enthusiasts.
2016-12-13.lead_paragraph: DAYTON, Ohio — On a chilly fall afternoon, 4-year-old Antoine Alston and his 8-year-old sister, De’Asia Liggins, waited for the bus with their mother on the western side of this city. Behind them was an abandoned factory of historical significance, but that was news to the children.
2016-12-13.headline_main: Pitching In to Preserve Aviation History

2016-12-13.abstract: The Dayton area has more than a dozen sites for aviation enthusiasts to visit, including the bicycle shop occupied in 1892 by the Wright Brothers.
2016-12-13.snippet: The Dayton area has more than a dozen sites for aviation enthusiasts to visit, including the bicycle shop occupied in 1892 by the Wright Brothers.
2016-12-13.lead_paragraph: The Dayton area has more than a dozen sites for aviation enthusiasts to visit, including the bicycle shop occupied in 1892 by the Wright Brothers and the Baptist church where Orville Wright’s funeral was held in 1948. Among the options are five stops specific to the birth of flight that are part of the official Dayton Aviation Heritage National Historical Park.
2016-12-13.headline_main: Sites for Aviation Buffs

2016-12-13.abstract: Potential jobs mattered more than a potential wall in Yuma County.
2016-12-13.snippet: Potential jobs mattered more than a potential wall in Yuma County.
2016-12-13.lead_paragraph: YUMA, Ariz. — For all the talk on the campaign trail of a border wall and mass deportations, it was Donald J. Trump’s pledge to create more jobs, lift wages and increase opportunities that persuaded Latinos in this majority-minority city 30 miles north of Mexico to vote for him.
2016-12-13.headline_main: In Arizona County Where Latinos Have an Edge, So Did Trump

2016-12-13.abstract: Foreign media alone will not rapidly transform the country, but they offer hope for incremental shifts.
2016-12-13.snippet: Foreign media alone will not rapidly transform the country, but they offer hope for incremental shifts.
2016-12-13.lead_paragraph: Last summer, I had breakfast with a teenager who had just completed a crash course that seeks to help North Korean defectors adapt to their new lives in the South. As a poor orphan in North Korea, he survived harsh winters by smuggling foreign films across the frozen Tumen River. He would stuff cash into women’s stockings and hurl them across narrow parts of the river. On the other side, his Chinese counterparts would fill up the stockings with DVDs and thumb drives and slide them back.
2016-12-13.headline_main: Can Smuggled TV Shows Change North Korea?

2016-12-13.abstract: Yahya Jammeh, the dictator of Gambia, is trying to hold on to his throne after an electoral defeat.
2016-12-13.snippet: Yahya Jammeh, the dictator of Gambia, is trying to hold on to his throne after an electoral defeat.
2016-12-13.lead_paragraph: On Dec. 2, Yahya Jammeh, the dictator of the small West African country Gambia, did something remarkably undictatorial: He agreed to step down after losing an election. But a week later, he reverted to type, appearing live on state television to reject the results.
2016-12-13.headline_main: To Be or Not to Be a Dictator

2016-12-13.lead_paragraph: The great mystery of “Rogue One” — the big payoff, the thing people like me would be pilloried for divulging, the puzzle you will congratulate yourself for solving — is where it fits in with the rest of the “Star Wars” cycle. There are scattered hints early on, and later appearances by familiar characters that elicit chuckles of recognition from fans. The very last shot tells us exactly where we are, and why we should have cared about everything we just saw.
2016-12-13.headline_main: Review: ‘Rogue One’ Leaves ‘Star Wars’ Fans Wanting More and Less

2016-12-13.abstract: The Atelier YUL’s sleek carryalls were born out of one woman’s frustration at the lack of options for transporting large-format drawings and models.
2016-12-13.snippet: The Atelier YUL’s sleek carryalls were born out of one woman’s frustration at the lack of options for transporting large-format drawings and models.
2016-12-13.lead_paragraph: When she started making bags last summer, the architect and designer Cece de la Montagne didn’t imagine she was founding an accessories line. She was just trying to solve a problem. Her job at a boutique SoHo-based architecture firm required her to regularly present models and large-format drawings at meetings with clients — but she couldn’t find a nice bag that could hold them without folding or wrinkling. “Not to bash Staples, but literally, the options you have are either you go to Staples or you get something really high-end,” in the $1,000-plus range, she explains. “I’d end up going to these meetings feeling like a bag lady, truthfully.”
2016-12-13.headline_main: Minimal, Super-Functional Bags for Creatives — Designed by an Architect

2016-12-13.abstract: Mr. Trump should separate himself from his company, and the company should be transparent about dealings with the federal and foreign governments.
2016-12-13.snippet: Mr. Trump should separate himself from his company, and the company should be transparent about dealings with the federal and foreign governments.
2016-12-13.lead_paragraph: Over the years, Judicial Watch has called out many White House conflicts of interest. We fought in court against President Bill Clinton’s taking money to pay his legal bills through a legal-defense fund. During the George W. Bush administration, we questioned the propriety of his father, President George H.W. Bush, working for Carlyle Group, an investment company that was, in effect, a major defense contractor. We also investigated and sued over the connections between another defense contractor, Halliburton, and Vice President Dick Cheney, the company’s former C.E.O. We highlighted in 2014 how Bill Clinton was getting unusually large six-figure speaking fees from foreign governments while Hillary Clinton was secretary of state.
2016-12-13.headline_main: How Trump Can Avoid the Ethical Tar Pit

2016-12-13.abstract: Other restaurant news includes a move for Charlie Palmer Steak and roast goose dinners around the city.
2016-12-13.snippet: Other restaurant news includes a move for Charlie Palmer Steak and roast goose dinners around the city.
2016-12-13.lead_paragraph: TAVO Julieta Ballesteros, who has made her name at a number of Mexican spots, including Crema, La Loteria and China Latina, has teamed up with Francisco Decrescenzo, a native of Monterrey, Mexico, and a fledgling restaurateur who developed his business plan while at the Stern School of Business at New York University. The menu’s Mexican approach is richly seasoned with global notions, the result of both partners’ travels. You will find Peking duck carnitas, chow fun noodles with corn and shrimp, and lamb chops in a chocolate-habanero sauce. Chorizo shumai, calamari in a blue cornmeal crust, and Cuban lasagna with adobo pulled pork and plantains are also available. The dining room is finished in copper, oak and white brick, and the restaurant gets its name, short for Gustavo, from one of Mr. Decrescenzo’s grandfathers. (Opens Friday): 615 Hudson Street (West 12th Street), 917-675-6454, tavonyc.com.
2016-12-13.headline_main: At Tavo, Mexican With Stops Around the World

2016-12-14.lead_paragraph: A little over a year ago, Billy Bean, Major League Baseball’s ambassador for inclusion, began hearing from people outside the sport who were concerned about a growing phenomenon inside the game.
2016-12-14.headline_main: ‘We Are the Sport of Jackie Robinson, and We Need to Lead by Example’

2016-12-14.abstract: A 20-week ban in Ohio may be a sign of things to come.
2016-12-14.snippet: A 20-week ban in Ohio may be a sign of things to come.
2016-12-14.lead_paragraph: Last year, Teresa Fedor, an Ohio state representative, a veteran and a former public-school teacher, told the story of her abortion after a rape in a statement on the House floor. “I dare you to walk in my shoes,” she said to lawmakers who were supporting a bill to ban abortion as soon as a fetal heartbeat could be detected, as early as six weeks. “I understand your story, but you don’t understand mine.”
2016-12-14.headline_main: Rolling Back Abortion Rights After Donald Trump’s Election

2016-12-14.abstract: The Bergdorf Goodman store on Fifth Avenue and the Excelsior Power Company building in the Financial District were among those designated landmarks.
2016-12-14.snippet: The Bergdorf Goodman store on Fifth Avenue and the Excelsior Power Company building in the Financial District were among those designated landmarks.
2016-12-14.lead_paragraph: It has taken more than two years to resolve the bureaucratic quagmire of backlogged buildings at the New York City Landmarks Preservation Commission. Considering that some have been in limbo for four decades, it may have seemed like no time at all.
2016-12-14.headline_main: 10 New York Sites Get Landmark Status as Panel Clears Backlog

2016-12-14.abstract: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo of New York has had a surprising level of involvement in the long-delayed $4.4 billion project, which some critics say seems primarily aimed at promoting his image.
2016-12-14.snippet: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo of New York has had a surprising level of involvement in the long-delayed $4.4 billion project, which some critics say seems primarily aimed at promoting his image.

2016-12-14.abstract: After an attack in Cairo that killed 25 people on Sunday, the Islamic State vowed to escalate its “war on polytheism,” a reference to Christianity.
2016-12-14.snippet: After an attack in Cairo that killed 25 people on Sunday, the Islamic State vowed to escalate its “war on polytheism,” a reference to Christianity.

2016-12-14.headline_main: ISIS Claims Responsibility for Egypt Church Bombing and Warns of More to Come

Trump’s nominee for secretary of state, was probably the man least expected to show up at a town council meeting in North Texas to oppose a local construction project.

2016-12-14.abstract: Damage may be present even in the absence of obvious abnormalities like small heads, and the virus may go on replicating in babies’ brains well after birth, studies found.
2016-12-14.snippet: Damage may be present even in the absence of obvious abnormalities like small heads, and the virus may go on replicating in babies’ brains well after birth, studies found.
2016-12-14.lead_paragraph: Babies born to Zika-infected mothers are highly likely to have brain damage, even in the absence of obvious abnormalities like small heads, and the virus may go on replicating in their brains well after birth, according to three studies published Tuesday.
2016-12-14.headline_main: Extensive Brain Defects Seen in Babies of Mothers With Zika

2016-12-14.snippet: An HC-30 and two military helicopters seen over New York were conducting authorized flights in coordination with Federal Aviation Administration air-traffic control, the agency said.

2016-12-14.abstract: Deepening a rift with its Gulf allies, the White House blocked the sale by Raytheon of about 16,000 guided munitions kits over worries about civilian casualties.
2016-12-14.snippet: Deepening a rift with its Gulf allies, the White House blocked the sale by Raytheon of about 16,000 guided munitions kits over worries about civilian casualties.

2016-12-14.abstract: You can get there in a handbasket, but the route proposed by “The Strange Undoing of Prudencia Hart” is a lot more fun. And drinks are served.
2016-12-14.snippet: You can get there in a handbasket, but the route proposed by “The Strange Undoing of Prudencia Hart” is a lot more fun. And drinks are served.
2016-12-14.lead_paragraph: In search of merry and bright drinking companions in this dark and sullen winter? You could do a lot worse than raise a shot glass (or two or three) with the rousing band of Scots who’ve encamped in a pub at the McKittrick Hotel in Chelsea. They sing, dance on tables, discuss post-post-structuralist theory, talk in rhyme. And they tell one hell of a tale.

2016-12-14.lead_paragraph: WEDNESDAY PUZZLE — Are you a leader or a follower? Never mind, it doesn’t matter. We are all following things in today’s New York Times debut by Alan DeLoriea. No cutting in line, please.
2016-12-14.headline_main: Something to Follow

2016-12-14.abstract: A critic of the F.B.I.’s handling of the email case has requested materials related to an investigation into emails belonging to Huma Abedin, an aide to Hillary Clinton.
2016-12-14.snippet: A critic of the F.B.I.’s handling of the email case has requested materials related to an investigation into emails belonging to Huma Abedin, an aide to Hillary Clinton.

2016-12-14.abstract: Carmelia Goffe, who died last week, helped found East Brooklyn Congregations, which has built or rebuilt about 5,000 homes for working people of modest means since 1980.
2016-12-14.snippet: Carmelia Goffe, who died last week, helped found East Brooklyn Congregations, which has built or rebuilt about 5,000 homes for working people of modest means since 1980.
2016-12-14.lead_paragraph: The car coasted down her sister’s old block in Brownsville, Brooklyn, and in the front seat Janis Borden glanced out the window and, for an instant, saw not a Monday in December 2016, but an evening in the late 1970s or early 1980s. At the time, Ms. Borden’s sister, Carmelia Goffe, had three little sons.
2016-12-14.headline_main: Behind Brooklyn Neighborhood’s Rebirth, a Woman Who Joined in a Dream

Tillerson, would reverse “years of foreign policy blunders and disasters,” and that his close ties to antagonistic foreign leaders — a potential hurdle to his confirmation by the Senate — was one of the reasons he had picked him.

2016-12-14.abstract: Syaru Shirley Lin, a political economist, discusses Donald J. Trump’s break with protocol in talking to Taiwan, and Taiwan’s ambivalence toward economic integration with China.
2016-12-14.snippet: Syaru Shirley Lin, a political economist, discusses Donald J. Trump’s break with protocol in talking to Taiwan, and Taiwan’s ambivalence toward economic integration with China.
2016-12-14.lead_paragraph: Syaru Shirley Lin, a native of Taiwan, is a political economist who teaches at both the University of Virginia and the Chinese University of Hong Kong. Previously she was a partner at Goldman Sachs, where she was responsible for private equity and venture capital investments in Asia and spearheaded the firm’s investments in technology start-ups, including Alibaba. Her new book, “Taiwan’s China Dilemma,” published by Stanford University Press, focuses on the emergence of Taiwanese national identity and how it has influenced the island’s economic policy toward China over the past three decades.
2016-12-14.headline_main: For Taiwan, a Dilemma Over Identity, Economy and China

2016-12-14.abstract: The Democratic Party has avoided fighting the legitimacy of Donald Trump’s election. This is a mistake the Republicans would not have committed.
2016-12-14.snippet: The Democratic Party has avoided fighting the legitimacy of Donald Trump’s election. This is a mistake the Republicans would not have committed.
2016-12-14.lead_paragraph: On Monday, members of the Electoral College will vote in Donald J. Trump as president. Though he lost the election by nearly three million votes and almost daily generates headlines about new scandals, the Democratic Party is doing little to stop him. If you’ve been asking yourself “Where are the Democrats?” you’re not alone.
2016-12-14.headline_main: Buck Up, Democrats, and Fight Like Republicans

2016-12-14.abstract: The law bars his nominees from serving until they account for conflicts of interest. So far, they haven’t.
2016-12-14.snippet: The law bars his nominees from serving until they account for conflicts of interest. So far, they haven’t.
2016-12-14.lead_paragraph: Worried about the corporate gazillionaires whom Donald Trump is naming to his cabinet? Don’t fret — it could be months, if ever, before these people set foot inside the federal government. Mr. Trump’s transition team is seriously behind — some in Washington say they’ve gotten nowhere — on vetting his nominees for potential conflicts of interest. Whatever one thinks of his choices, this does not bode well for a smooth transfer of power.
2016-12-14.headline_main: Donald Trump’s Nominees Are In for a Rough Ride

2016-12-14.abstract: The era after the Civil War is a potent reminder that rights we take for granted can be taken away.
2016-12-14.snippet: The era after the Civil War is a potent reminder that rights we take for granted can be taken away.
2016-12-14.lead_paragraph: Although Americans are already looking ahead to the next presidential administration, President Obama retains the power to shape his legacy and our nation in his remaining weeks in office. He has already used his final months to create several  national monuments, and we urge him to create another, one that will speak as much to the nation’s present and future as it does to its past: the first national monument dedicated to Reconstruction — the turbulent, misunderstood era after the Civil War — in Beaufort, S.C., which has one of the country’s highest concentrations of Reconstruction-related sites.
2016-12-14.headline_main: Why We Need a National Monument to Reconstruction

2016-12-14.abstract: As a professor, I had a choice — reveal my condition and risk stigma, or remain isolated.

2016-12-14.lead_paragraph: The new class I was teaching — “Composing Disability: Crip Ecologies” — was one of several first-year writing seminars offered at George Washington University. Given the focus, it was likely to be a challenge for at least some of the students. And it was presenting a particular challenge to me.
2016-12-14.headline_main: Should I Tell My Students I Have Depression?

2016-12-14.abstract: Anup Shah spends his days patiently waiting to make up-close black-and-white portraits of the lions, leopards and wildebeests of Kenya’s Masai Mara, hoping to reveal something of their personalities.
2016-12-14.snippet: Anup Shah spends his days patiently waiting to make up-close black-and-white portraits of the lions, leopards and wildebeests of Kenya’s Masai Mara, hoping to reveal something of their personalities.
2016-12-14.lead_paragraph: “I just came back from seeing elephants,” Anup Shah said over the phone from Kenya on a recent Saturday. Now, for anyone else that might be the highlight of the year, if not a lifetime. But for Mr. Shah, a wildlife photographer, it was just another day. When he wakes up in a tent on Kenya’s Masai Mara National Reserve, his day begins with animals. “When the birds start calling,” he said, “I get up, and off I go just before dawn.”
2016-12-14.headline_main: Secrets of Wildlife on Kenya’s Masai Mara

2016-12-14.abstract: The radio host on talking about politics in public and whether we’ve elected a president who appears to be indifferent to religion.
2016-12-14.snippet: The radio host on talking about politics in public and whether we’ve elected a president who appears to be indifferent to religion.
2016-12-14.lead_paragraph: People say to never discuss religion or politics with others in public, but do you think that we should be talking about these topics more openly now? Coming out of this election year, I think what we absolutely have to find a way and a place and a vocabulary to talk about is moral imagination: the human effects of policies and the question of how we create common life and who we are to one another. We don’t necessarily need religious or political doctrine to answer those questions.
2016-12-14.headline_main: Krista Tippett Thinks We Can’t Change One Another’s Minds

2016-12-14.headline_main: What Should You Do When Customers Make Racist Remarks?

2016-12-14.abstract: The year 1980 brought us the greatest holiday song of all time: one that finds beauty in the shabbiness of real life.
2016-12-14.snippet: The year 1980 brought us the greatest holiday song of all time: one that finds beauty in the shabbiness of real life.
2016-12-14.lead_paragraph: Let us resist, as another year slides darkly toward its death, the creeping fascism of holiday music. It is not normal; it is not a public good. Holiday music is sonic propaganda, crackling down at us from ancient mall sound systems and pouring point-blank from the mouths of horrible neighbors. It erodes our humanity with its cheerful clichés. Resist the elves and the messiahs, the apple-cheeked grandmothers and the man-size golems of sentient snow; resist the melodies that jump and flip like windup toys. Resist the fa and the la and the la la la. We are grown-ups. Let’s look at life, for once, full in the face.
2016-12-14.headline_main: Letter of Recommendation: Dan Fogelberg, ‘Same Old Lang Syne’

2016-12-14.snippet: What are the benefits of classrooms that include people from many walks of life? What have you learned from students in your class who come from a different background than yours?

2016-12-14.abstract: The conventional belief is that only small tribes could have inhabited the Amazon jungle, but new discoveries call that into question.

They were longtime friends in their quiet suburban neighborhood, and they joked with teenagers and greeted children with a smile.
2016-12-14.headline_main: French Terrorism Suspects Appeared Anything But

2016-12-14.abstract: How Google used artificial intelligence to transform Google Translate, one of its more popular services — and how machine learning is poised to reinvent computing itself.
2016-12-14.snippet: How Google used artificial intelligence to transform Google Translate, one of its more popular services — and how machine learning is poised to reinvent computing itself.
2016-12-14.lead_paragraph: Late one Friday night in early November, Jun Rekimoto, a distinguished professor of human-computer interaction at the University of Tokyo, was online preparing for a lecture when he began to notice some peculiar posts rolling in on social media. Apparently Google Translate, the company’s popular machine-translation service, had suddenly and almost immeasurably improved. Rekimoto visited Translate himself and began to experiment with it. He was astonished. He had to go to sleep, but Translate refused to relax its grip on his imagination.
2016-12-14.headline_main: The Great A.I. Awakening

2016-12-14.lead_paragraph: Does Darth Vader have a cameo or a more substantial role? Is Jyn Erso a heroine for the ages? How are the new droids — and the music without John Williams? “Rogue One,” the first “Star Wars” stand-alone movie, will begin storming multiplexes on Thursday night, and those questions will finally be answered. The Times chief film critic A.O. Scott has weighed in with his review here. And below — without giving too much away — our senior editor for movies, Mekado Murphy, offers some key takeaways after finally laying eyes on the film.
2016-12-14.headline_main: ‘Rogue One’ Takeaways: Vader, Droids and a Stunning Planet

His decision is an extraordinary departure from the practices of his predecessors who received a briefing every day, with the exception of Richard M. Nixon, who had extensive foreign policy experience before his 1968 election victory.

2016-12-14.abstract: This two-hour special from the Wachowskis and J. Michael Straczynski arrives on Friday, Dec. 23.
2016-12-14.snippet: This two-hour special from the Wachowskis and J. Michael Straczynski arrives on Friday, Dec. 23.
2016-12-14.lead_paragraph: When last we saw the alluring, transcendentally attuned global citizens of Netflix’s “Sense8,” they were sailing into the North Atlantic on a fishing boat. But wherever they landed, trouble was sure to follow. And in “Sense8: A Christmas Special” (debuting Friday, Dec. 23) — a two-hour gift from the Wachowskis and J. Michael Straczynski, the masterminds of the series — it has. The stars are back in their own worlds, and in one another’s minds: Nomi (Jamie Clayton) hides in San Francisco; Riley (Tuppence Middleton) drugs Will (Brian J. Smith) in Amsterdam; life is upended for Lito (Miguel Ángel Silvestre) in Mexico; Sun (Doona Bae) languishes in a South Korean prison; Capheus (Toby Onwumere) tinkers with his bus in Nairobi; and Kala (Tina Desai) can’t keep Wolfgang (Max Riemelt), in Berlin, out of her marital bed in Mumbai. And the henchman Mr. Whispers (Terrence Mann) lurks. Meanwhile, there are birthdays and holidays to celebrate with raves, orgies and unconditional support — a joyful excuse to keep fans sated until Season 2 in May.
2016-12-14.headline_main: ‘Sense8: A Christmas Special’ Is Coming to Netflix

2016-12-14.abstract: This 100-minute English-language version is tailored to families around the holidays.
2016-12-14.snippet: This 100-minute English-language version is tailored to families around the holidays.
2016-12-14.lead_paragraph: We wouldn’t want to be the ones to trim an hour of Mozart’s sublime “The Magic Flute.” But several years ago, the Metropolitan Opera took up the scissors, creating a 100-minute English-language version tailored to families around the holidays.
2016-12-14.headline_main: ‘The Magic Flute,’ Trimmed Down, at the Metropolitan Opera

2016-12-14.abstract: His farewell concert in his hometown, New York City, will take place Dec. 21 at the Apollo Theater.
2016-12-14.snippet: His farewell concert in his hometown, New York City, will take place Dec. 21 at the Apollo Theater.
2016-12-14.lead_paragraph: Yasiin Bey, the rapper best known as Mos Def, announced earlier this year that he will retire from music and acting, and he’s following through. His farewell concerts in his hometown, New York City, will take place Wednesday, Dec. 21, and Thursday at the Apollo Theater before he moves on to the Kennedy Center in Washington. The Apollo is an appropriate spot, steeped in the African-American heritage and sense of community that Mos Def’s raps have constantly invoked, both with Talib Kweli in Black Star and in diverse projects on his own. Politics, history and a sense of cultural responsibility have always informed his work, usually with a touch light enough to avoid being didactic. With luck, he’ll continue getting his message across in other media. (212-531-5300, apollotheater.org)
2016-12-14.headline_main: Mos Def Bids Goodbye to Music and Acting, at the Apollo

2016-12-14.abstract: What was the best thing you ate this year?
2016-12-14.snippet: What was the best thing you ate this year?
2016-12-14.lead_paragraph: Good morning. For all the good cheer and pine-scented sidewalks, there is something ghostly and wistful about these December days, as we cast our eyes back toward the year that was. Pete Wells wrote about his top 10 restaurants of the year, and about the best dishes he ate for the Food section we blue-bagged and delivered to doors, porches and bushes this morning. (For those dining on the cheap in New York City, Ligaya Mishan offered her own list of bests.)
2016-12-14.headline_main: Your Best Eats of 2016

2016-12-14.lead_paragraph: Tuesday began as most days do when Donald Trump is announcing a cabinet pick. At precisely 6:43 a.m. the president elect sent out a tweet announcing that he would nominate Rex Tillerson, C.E.O. of Exxon Mobil, to be the next secretary of state.
2016-12-14.headline_main: A Trump Cabinet Pick and the Ties That Bind

2016-12-14.abstract: At an internship last year, a girl Naivon Lake Jr. was tutoring asked why he wasn’t in college. Good question, Naivon thought.

2016-12-14.abstract: A study, published in JAMA Psychiatry, undermines the claim that women seeking abortions might develop emotional and psychological trauma.
2016-12-14.snippet: A study, published in JAMA Psychiatry, undermines the claim that women seeking abortions might develop emotional and psychological trauma.
2016-12-14.lead_paragraph: It’s an idea that has long been used as an argument against abortion — that terminating a pregnancy causes women to experience emotional and psychological trauma.
2016-12-14.headline_main: Abortion Is Found to Have Little Effect on Women’s Mental Health

2016-12-14.abstract: “A Steady Pulse,” a digital archive published last year by the Pew Center, offers a close look at eight works created between 1963 and 1978.
2016-12-14.snippet: “A Steady Pulse,” a digital archive published last year by the Pew Center, offers a close look at eight works created between 1963 and 1978.
2016-12-14.lead_paragraph: The Lucinda Childs Dance Company recently wrapped up a two-week season at the Joyce Theater, surveying several decades of its founder’s mesmerizing minimalism. If you missed it — or even if you didn’t — the next best thing is “A Steady Pulse,” an absorbing digital archive published last year by the Pew Center for Arts and Heritage. Late December’s dance lull (various versions of “The Nutcracker” notwithstanding) is the perfect time to dive into this collection, which offers a close look at eight works created by Ms. Childs between 1963 and 1978.
2016-12-14.headline_main: The Works of Lucinda Childs, Online and Absorbing

2016-12-14.abstract: “Tomás Saraceno: Stillness in Motion — Cloud Cities” is a complex of cords and reflective panels built to evoke a 10,000-node airborne habitation.
2016-12-14.snippet: “Tomás Saraceno: Stillness in Motion — Cloud Cities” is a complex of cords and reflective panels built to evoke a 10,000-node airborne habitation.
2016-12-14.lead_paragraph: In “The Empire Strikes Back,” we learned that a city in the clouds was not such a great idea. “I’ve had supply problems of every kind — I’ve had labor difficulties,” grouses Lando Calrissian, the dashing administrator of the movie’s gravity-defying metropolis.
2016-12-14.headline_main: Tomás Saraceno at the San Francisco Museum of Modern Art

2016-12-14.abstract: The executive, Patricia Barbizet, will be vice chairwoman. Mr. Cerutti is taking over at a time when auction houses are struggling to fill sales with inventory.
2016-12-14.snippet: The executive, Patricia Barbizet, will be vice chairwoman. Mr. Cerutti is taking over at a time when auction houses are struggling to fill sales with inventory.

2016-12-14.headline_main: Christie’s Chief Executive to Step Down and Hand Reins to Guillaume Cerutti

2016-12-14.abstract: The concentration of military bases, along with business programs for former military personnel, has fueled a growth in entrepreneurship.

2016-12-14.lead_paragraph: SAN DIEGO — For decades, politicians lobbied to bring military bases to their districts for one reason: jobs. A base is akin to a corporate headquarters, bringing with it jobs in related businesses.

2016-12-14.abstract: Several contestants from “RuPaul’s Drag Race” have been featured already, and entertainers including Jackie Beat will perform in this monthlong series.
2016-12-14.snippet: Several contestants from “RuPaul’s Drag Race” have been featured already, and entertainers including Jackie Beat will perform in this monthlong series.
2016-12-14.lead_paragraph: How can you not feel holiday spirit when standing up at the Laurie Beechman Theater, swaying your arms and singing “Let There Be Peace on Earth” with the drag queen Ginger Minj? Such was my enviable lot recently, and while that show is over, the monthlong “Christmas Is a Drag” series at the Beechman continues this week with some of the most offbeat holiday entertainment you’ll find.

2016-12-14.abstract: “The Tree of the Wooden Clogs,” Ermanno Olmi’s Palme d’Or-winning film of Italian peasant families in the late 19th century, is showing.
2016-12-14.snippet: “The Tree of the Wooden Clogs,” Ermanno Olmi’s Palme d’Or-winning film of Italian peasant families in the late 19th century, is showing.
2016-12-14.lead_paragraph: “The Tree of Wooden Clogs,” Ermanno Olmi’s farsighted view of Italian farm life in the late 19th century, immerses you in what feels like an unchanging preindustrial world. The beautiful three-hour film, which won the Palme d’Or at Cannes in 1978, follows the lives of four peasant families laboring on the estate of an absentee landlord in the province of Bergamo. The actors, all residents of the area, speak in their native dialect.
2016-12-14.headline_main: The Farming Life in an Older Italy, at Film Forum

2016-12-14.snippet: The Library of Congress announced its latest additions on Wednesday, which also include “The Breakfast Club,” “The Birds,” “East of Eden” and “Lost Horizon.”
2016-12-14.lead_paragraph: Somewhere in the Library of Congress the Breakfast Club will always be meeting for a Saturday morning’s detention, a young lion named Simba will perpetually have no worries for the rest of his days and Thelma and Louise will be forever holding hands as they speed toward the Grand Canyon. The motion pictures that made these characters memorable are among the 25 that have been selected for preservation in the library’s National Film Registry.

In New York’s NoHo neighborhood, it’s the name of a new restaurant from Maiko Kyogoku, a Japanese-American restaurateur who worked with the contemporary artist Takashi Murakami before opening Bessou.

2016-12-14.lead_paragraph: The Italian writer Italo Calvino defined a classic as “a book that’s never finished saying what it has to say.” This year, The Times’s daily critics reviewed nearly 250 titles. What follows are their lists of the fiction and nonfiction books that most moved, excited and enlightened them in 2016 — books that, in their own ways, are perhaps not finished saying what they have to say.

2016-12-14.abstract: Yolande Batteau of Callidus Guild and Randi Mates of Aesa launch their first official collaboration: a line of precious metal and wood earrings and pendants.
2016-12-14.snippet: Yolande Batteau of Callidus Guild and Randi Mates of Aesa launch their first official collaboration: a line of precious metal and wood earrings and pendants.
2016-12-14.lead_paragraph: Coming from different, and multiple, milieus, the close friends Yolande Batteau and Randi Mates meet in the middle — that is, 82nd Street and Fifth Avenue. “We have a mutual devotion to the Metropolitan Museum of Art, particularly the study rooms,” says Batteau, a painter and co-founder of the noted interiors studio Callidus Guild, of Mates (herself a classical goldsmith and Aesa jewelry founder). “The level of our mutuality is such that we can go to a museum together, separate to wander for an hour and then come together only to find we have taken photos of the same exact pieces,” Mates adds. “It’s a rare and thrilling experience to find another person who is as wholly enamored by history, the minutiae of objects and the deep physicality of materials as I am.”
2016-12-14.headline_main: Jewelry That Draws From a Japanese Technique — and Constructivist Sculpture

2016-12-14.lead_paragraph: CHARLESTON, S.C. — Polly Sheppard, a 72-year-old retired nurse and longtime stalwart of Emanuel African Methodist Episcopal Church, dived under a table as the gunfire began and did the only thing she could think to do: She prayed aloud. She could see the bullet casings skittering across the floor of the fellowship hall and the young man’s boots approaching. Dylann S. Roof told her to “shut up,” then asked menacingly if he had shot her yet.
2016-12-14.headline_main: Spared by Gunman in Charleston, Churchgoer Describes Night of Terror

2016-12-14.abstract: Around a handful of beaches on the island of Cebu, divers can swim with sparkling aggregations of fish that collect in “bait balls.”
2016-12-14.snippet: Around a handful of beaches on the island of Cebu, divers can swim with sparkling aggregations of fish that collect in “bait balls.”
2016-12-14.lead_paragraph: Thousands to millions of sardines emerge from a coral wall in cobalt waters just a few yards from the shores of Cebu Island in the Philippines. They move in a single undulating cloud of silver that twists, turns, shrinks, expands and wraps itself around any object that gets in its way. At times, it becomes a thundercloud, blocking out the sun or clapping violently as it suddenly flips its formation to evade a predator.
2016-12-14.headline_main: Swimming With the Mysterious Sardine Disco Balls of the Philippines

2016-12-14.lead_paragraph: So the Fed has raised rates. It was, I’d argue, a mistake, although not as severe a mistake as it would have been a year ago. Anyway, it seems like a good time to review where I think the economy stands, and what it means for monetary and fiscal policy.
2016-12-14.headline_main: Notes on the Macroeconomic Situation

2016-12-14.abstract: The president-elect met with Jeff Bezos of Amazon and Timothy D. Cook of Apple, among other tech leaders, in a surprisingly genial gathering.
2016-12-14.snippet: The president-elect met with Jeff Bezos of Amazon and Timothy D. Cook of Apple, among other tech leaders, in a surprisingly genial gathering.
2016-12-14.lead_paragraph: The meeting between President-elect Donald J. Trump and the nation’s tech elite was hyped as something out of “The Apprentice”: The new boss tells his minions to shape up. It turned out to be a charm offensive, a kind of “Dancing With the Silicon Valley Stars.”
2016-12-14.headline_main: ‘I’m Here to Help,’ Trump Tells Tech Executives at Meeting

2016-12-14.abstract: Demand for drones has surged, in part because of their lower cost, but consumers should know that some companies may exclude related accidents from their policies.
2016-12-14.snippet: Demand for drones has surged, in part because of their lower cost, but consumers should know that some companies may exclude related accidents from their policies.

2016-12-14.headline_main: Getting a Drone as a Gift? Check Your Insurance

2016-12-14.abstract: To prepare for his role in “Natasha, Pierre & the Great Comet of 1812,” he tackled the accordion — and, reluctantly, learned to dance.
2016-12-14.snippet: To prepare for his role in “Natasha, Pierre & the Great Comet of 1812,” he tackled the accordion — and, reluctantly, learned to dance.
2016-12-14.lead_paragraph: Josh Groban has sold more than 30 million records, making him a household name all over the world. But when he began talking to the producers and creators behind the Broadway-bound musical “Natasha, Pierre & the Great Comet of 1812,” it was clear he’d need to learn a few things.
2016-12-14.headline_main: For Josh Groban, a Boot Camp for Broadway

2016-12-14.abstract: The festival’s 85th season includes a tap program organized by Michelle Dorrance and a site-specific work by the troupe Pilobolus.
2016-12-14.snippet: The festival’s 85th season includes a tap program organized by Michelle Dorrance and a site-specific work by the troupe Pilobolus.
2016-12-14.lead_paragraph: A tap program organized by Michelle Dorrance, a site-specific work by the troupe Pilobolus and rare visits from Cuban and Canadian companies are in store for the 85th season of Jacob’s Pillow Dance Festival.
2016-12-14.headline_main: Jacob’s Pillow Dance Festival Unveils 2017 Season

2016-12-14.abstract: Our writers, editors and critics single out indelible scenes from the past year onstage.
2016-12-14.snippet: Our writers, editors and critics single out indelible scenes from the past year onstage.
2016-12-14.lead_paragraph: “Hamilton” continued its remarkable reign. Even the vice president-elect checked it out — though maybe he wishes he hadn’t. We end the year still thinking about the searing performances, challenging stagecraft and oddball experiments that make theater anything but a safe space. Here New York Times writers, editors and critics single out moments to remember.
2016-12-14.headline_main: Memorable Theater of 2016: Twining Twins, Bathroom Sex and Cod Kisses

2016-12-14.abstract: Shelling resumed Wednesday in rebel-held neighborhoods of Aleppo, Syria, halting a planned the evacuation of thousands of civilians. A ceasefire reached the night before, involving Russia and Turkey, seemed to have fallen through.
2016-12-14.snippet: Shelling resumed Wednesday in rebel-held neighborhoods of Aleppo, Syria, halting a planned the evacuation of thousands of civilians. A ceasefire reached the night before, involving Russia and Turkey, seemed to have fallen through.

2016-12-14.abstract: The country’s government is coming under criticism after the death of a journalist imprisoned under a new law that criminalizes offending the president.

2016-12-14.lead_paragraph: TUNIS — The Algerian government is coming under criticism for its treatment of a freelance British-Algerian journalist, Mohamed Tamalt, who died in a hospital on Sunday after being imprisoned under a draconian new law that criminalizes offending the president and state institutions.
2016-12-14.headline_main: Harsh Facebook Posts, Jail and Now Death: A Man’s Fate Angers Algeria

2016-12-14.headline_main: Russian Hackers and the 2016 Election

2016-12-14.abstract: A tax provision allows incoming executive branch members to defer capital gains taxes on any divestments required under ethics rules.
2016-12-14.snippet: A tax provision allows incoming executive branch members to defer capital gains taxes on any divestments required under ethics rules.
2016-12-14.lead_paragraph: There are many dewy-eyed reasons a wealthy and powerful business executive would choose to give up a throne in the private sector and move to Washington for an important government job. There is the chance to give something back to your country through public service, the belief that you have some serious expertise to offer the incoming president and his administration, and a feeling that the country has been on the wrong course and that every American could benefit from some new thinking. Plus, when you get asked to serve the president of the United States, well, you do it.
2016-12-14.headline_main: For Trump’s Wealthy Cabinet, Prospect of a Sweet Tax Break

2016-12-14.abstract: American and Russian officers talk three times a week to “deconflict,” military jargon for an effort to call ahead to avoid disaster in the skies over Syria.

2016-12-14.headline_main: A Hotline for Americans and Russians to Avoid Catastrophe in Syrian Skies

2016-12-14.abstract: Some robot accounts protest; others expose racists; and at least one — aimed at people looking for a fight — keeps them busy talking to a brick wall.

2016-12-14.abstract: The Russian president fears failure the most. So the best idea is a concept from nuclear policy: deterrence.
2016-12-14.snippet: The Russian president fears failure the most. So the best idea is a concept from nuclear policy: deterrence.
2016-12-14.lead_paragraph: PRAGUE — Welcome to 21st-century conflict, more Machiavellian than military, where hacks, leaks and fake news are taking the place of planes, bombs and missiles. The Russian interference in the United States presidential election is just a taste of more to come.
2016-12-14.headline_main: Putin Is Waging Information Warfare. Here’s How to Fight Back.

2016-12-14.abstract: Jason Seaver doesn’t rank as the best television father of his era, yet he helped liberate TV dads from the prison of always being right and always being serious.
2016-12-14.snippet: Jason Seaver doesn’t rank as the best television father of his era, yet he helped liberate TV dads from the prison of always being right and always being serious.
2016-12-14.lead_paragraph: Chat boards and social media have been full of memories and tributes to Alan Thicke and his “Growing Pains” character, Dr. Jason Seaver, since Mr. Thicke’s death on Tuesday at 69. “Alan Thicke will forever be a better dad than me,” Blair Herter, the TV personality, wrote in a representative tweet.  “Thanks for the memories, Dr. Seaver.”
2016-12-14.headline_main: Alan Thicke’s Dr. Seaver Didn’t Know Best. That Was His Charm.

2016-12-14.abstract: Kathryn Marinello becomes chief facing missed third-quarter estimates and a cut in the company’s full-year guidance.
2016-12-14.snippet: Kathryn Marinello becomes chief facing missed third-quarter estimates and a cut in the company’s full-year guidance.
2016-12-14.lead_paragraph: The new Hertz Global chief executive, Kathryn Marinello, faces a tough drive out of the ditch. She has a great résumé. The problem is that she is the $2 billion rental car outfit’s third boss in two years — and the activist investor Carl C. Icahn is in the back seat, fidgeting with a 35 percent stake. Moreover, the company’s engine is sputtering, despite her predecessor’s attempts to get it firing more smoothly.
2016-12-14.headline_main: New Hertz Chief Faces a Tough Road

2016-12-14.abstract: The company says the attack was separate from the breach that led to an earlier disclosure that 500 million accounts were hacked.

2016-12-14.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Yahoo, already reeling from its September disclosure that 500 million user accounts had been hacked in 2014, disclosed Wednesday that a different attack in 2013 compromised more than 1 billion accounts.
2016-12-14.headline_main: Yahoo Says 1 Billion User Accounts Were Hacked

2016-12-14.abstract: On WNEW-AM and other stations, Mr. Lowe brought the American songbook to generations of listeners. He also had a No. 1 hit of his own in 1956.
2016-12-14.snippet: On WNEW-AM and other stations, Mr. Lowe brought the American songbook to generations of listeners. He also had a No. 1 hit of his own in 1956.
2016-12-14.lead_paragraph: Jim Lowe, who played standards for more than 50 years as a disc jockey, most notably at WNEW-AM in New York, and in 1956 had a No. 1 record of his own, “The Green Door,” died on Monday at his home in East Hampton, N.Y. He was 93.

2016-12-14.lead_paragraph: On the fifth day of Christmas, my true love sent to me: five golden Hoorsenbuhs rings. On Thursday, the jewelry house, based in Santa Monica, Calif., will open a SoHo gallery space where you’ll find the new Chassis series in 18-karat yellow, rose or white gold and diamonds (starting at $2,000), artwork by Damien Hirst, a custom gold vault and a bronze and leather lounge chair inspired by the company’s signature negative space designs. At 458 Broome Street.

2016-12-14.abstract: A loss to Phoenix, his old employer, may have been bittersweet. But the Knicks’ coach has other priorities, like bringing out the best in his new team.
2016-12-14.snippet: A loss to Phoenix, his old employer, may have been bittersweet. But the Knicks’ coach has other priorities, like bringing out the best in his new team.
