2016-12-14.headline_main: Suns Behind Him, Jeff Hornacek Coolly Contemplates What’s Next

2016-12-14.abstract: Nocking Point, a wine club started by the actor Stephen Amell and his friend Andrew Harding, banks on a comic-book fan base and a “dude” image.
2016-12-14.snippet: Nocking Point, a wine club started by the actor Stephen Amell and his friend Andrew Harding, banks on a comic-book fan base and a “dude” image.
2016-12-14.lead_paragraph: HOLLYWOOD — “We usually start with some sparkling just because it’s morning,” said Andrew Harding, a founder of the Nocking Point wine club. It was a recent Monday, and Mr. Harding, 39, was in the castlelike home of his friend and co-founder, Stephen Amell, 35, the star of the television drama “Arrow.”
2016-12-14.headline_main: ‘Arrow’ Star and a Former MTV Executive: Just 2 Guys, Selling Wine

2016-12-14.abstract: The Wall Street firm named two executives to share president and chief operating officer roles and promoted others as a new group of potential C.E.O.s emerges.

2016-12-14.lead_paragraph: Goldman Sachs promoted a new generation of leaders on Wednesday, as Gary D. Cohn, its longtime No. 2 executive, leaves the Wall Street bank to join President-elect Donald J. Trump’s incoming administration.
2016-12-14.headline_main: At Goldman, Top Departure Opens a Door for the Next Generation

2016-12-14.abstract: Mr. Cole’s new album, ‘4 Your Eyez Only,’ is about unvarnished anxiety and uncomplicated love, and he again features no guest stars.
2016-12-14.snippet: Mr. Cole’s new album, ‘4 Your Eyez Only,’ is about unvarnished anxiety and uncomplicated love, and he again features no guest stars.
2016-12-14.lead_paragraph: Each of J. Cole’s three major label albums to date has gone platinum, but as his online defenders will never fail to remind you, the most recent one, “2014 Forest Hills Drive,” went “platinum with no features” — that is, with no other big-name guests. The phrase became a rallying cry and eventually a meme. The subtext was that Mr. Cole’s vision is singular, his work not a by-committee agglomeration: He managed to take their honor while playing by his rules.
2016-12-14.headline_main: Review: The Only Big Name Here Is Still J. Cole’s

2016-12-14.abstract: Bernhard Laufer’s lawyer plans to appeal the conviction and sentence on charges including the 2012 stabbing in Kew Gardens Hills of a worshiper.
2016-12-14.snippet: Bernhard Laufer’s lawyer plans to appeal the conviction and sentence on charges including the 2012 stabbing in Kew Gardens Hills of a worshiper.
2016-12-14.lead_paragraph: He called the mosque in Queens and left threatening messages, and when a door was smashed in, the man was also the culprit, the authorities said. Then, early one morning in 2012, prosecutors said, the same man waited as a worshiper unlocked the mosque’s front door and then stabbed the worshiper repeatedly.
2016-12-14.headline_main: Man Gets 20-Year Sentence for Hate Crimes at a Queens Mosque

2016-12-14.abstract: Khaled Khalifa’s episodic novel focuses on one family in Aleppo, his native city, and stops several years short of the Syrian civil war.
2016-12-14.snippet: Khaled Khalifa’s episodic novel focuses on one family in Aleppo, his native city, and stops several years short of the Syrian civil war.
2016-12-14.lead_paragraph: Aleppo has essentially fallen. The images have been unignorable, calamitous: of residents wandering numbly through burning city streets; of parents sobbing over dead children; of the strong wheeling away the weak. On Tuesday, a United Nations official described the massacre of fleeing civilians as “a complete meltdown of humanity.” Residents have been tweeting out their goodbyes. Tens of thousands have already been displaced or perished.
2016-12-14.headline_main: Review: ‘No Knives in the Kitchens of This City’ Describes a Syrian Hell

2016-12-14.abstract: It remains a difficult landscape for female composers, but they have advocates.
2016-12-14.snippet: It remains a difficult landscape for female composers, but they have advocates.
2016-12-14.lead_paragraph: With the presentation of Kaija Saariaho’s “L’Amour de Loin” this month, the Metropolitan Opera finally broke a 113-year streak of not performing any operas written by women. It remains a difficult landscape for female composers, but there are institutions that advocate for them.
2016-12-14.headline_main: To Help Women in Opera, Several Institutions Arise

2016-12-14.abstract: The defendants in a murder case, almost all teenagers at the time, were prosecuted for sexually assaulting and killing Catherine Fuller, 48. No physical evidence was presented.
2016-12-14.snippet: The defendants in a murder case, almost all teenagers at the time, were prosecuted for sexually assaulting and killing Catherine Fuller, 48. No physical evidence was presented.
2016-12-14.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Supreme Court on Wednesday agreed to decide whether the convictions of seven defendants in a notorious 1984 murder must be set aside because prosecutors withheld evidence about another suspect. The court also said it would hear a case on the consequences of bad legal advice about whether a criminal conviction would lead to deportation.
2016-12-14.headline_main: Justices to Hear Cases on Withheld Evidence and Bad Advice

2016-12-14.abstract: People living illegally in warehouses in Oakland, Calif., are worried since the Ghost Ship fire, but lawmakers are working on legislation that might allow them to stay.
2016-12-14.snippet: People living illegally in warehouses in Oakland, Calif., are worried since the Ghost Ship fire, but lawmakers are working on legislation that might allow them to stay.
2016-12-14.lead_paragraph: New York Times reporters are investigating the devastating fire that killed 36 people this month at a warehouse called the Ghost Ship in Oakland, Calif. We’re also doing something new: providing regular updates on our findings. Do you have information, advice or feedback? Send an email to oaklandfire@nytimes.com.
2016-12-14.headline_main: The Oakland Fire: Tenants Living in Warehouses Face Eviction

2016-12-15.abstract: Kevin Lord will take on a new role several months after a sexual harassment scandal led to the ousting of the network’s chairman.
2016-12-15.snippet: Kevin Lord will take on a new role several months after a sexual harassment scandal led to the ousting of the network’s chairman.

2016-12-15.abstract: Adrian Maldonado was killed after a drug deal at a Bronx housing complex. Rumors focused on a spurned lover, but witnesses were reluctant to come forward over fears of reprisals.
2016-12-15.snippet: Adrian Maldonado was killed after a drug deal at a Bronx housing complex. Rumors focused on a spurned lover, but witnesses were reluctant to come forward over fears of reprisals.

Trump announced Wednesday that Ronna Romney McDaniel, the chairwoman of the Michigan Republican Party, would serve as the senior official of the Republican National Committee, rewarding a loyalist from a crucial state and retaining a firm grip on his adopted party.

2016-12-15.abstract: As Lucious struggles to thwart a romantic rival, a much more dangerous enemy is hatching his plans.
2016-12-15.snippet: As Lucious struggles to thwart a romantic rival, a much more dangerous enemy is hatching his plans.
2016-12-15.lead_paragraph: The phrase “midseason finale” is television’s most egregious neologism. Essentially marketing-speak for “the last episode of the year before we take a few weeks off around the holidays, because we’re not just airing the whole season in a row the way cable shows do,” it carries with it an oxymoronic promise of finality. But this week’s “Empire” is the rare (sigh) midseason finale that lives up to the moniker. An effective wrap-up of a half season’s worth of story lines, it sets up the show to start anew next year, bigger and better.
2016-12-15.headline_main: ‘Empire’ Season 3, Episode 9: The Enemy Within

2016-12-15.abstract: More than 400,000 Syrians have died since the civil war began. When will it stop?
2016-12-15.snippet: More than 400,000 Syrians have died since the civil war began. When will it stop?
2016-12-15.lead_paragraph: Watching the fall of the ancient Syrian city of Aleppo has been excruciating. Civilians who survived weeks of intense shelling have reportedly been slaughtered by the forces of the Assad government as they have fled the battle zone, some shot in house-to-house searches. Thousands more are trapped with no food, water or shelter. “This is a message from someone saying farewell and who could face death or arrest at any time,” a medic wrote on a messaging service. The United Nations called the catastrophe a “complete meltdown of humanity.”
2016-12-15.headline_main: Aleppo’s Destroyers: Assad, Putin, Iran

2016-12-15.abstract: Intense traffic, a strong multicultural vibe, big global businesses — and yet you can still feed giraffes and elephants within the city limits.
2016-12-15.snippet: Intense traffic, a strong multicultural vibe, big global businesses — and yet you can still feed giraffes and elephants within the city limits.
2016-12-15.lead_paragraph: Nairobi, the capital of Kenya, calls itself the City in the Sun, and a visit can be as pleasant as that sounds. Most outsiders drop in for two reasons: business and animals. A short flight from spectacular wildlife parks such as the Maasai Mara, Nairobi has also become a magnet for some of the world’s biggest corporations trying to gain a foothold in Africa. The city is surprisingly beautiful with flowering trees and the perfect climate: 70s and 80s, sunny, low humidity — almost every day. It’s a palpably multicultural place, encapsulating what is happening in Africa better than any other city on the continent. Picture new construction, a lot of people, intense traffic, and more and more Western businesses. Yet you can still feed giraffes and baby elephants from within the city limits and see Maasai warriors ordering lattes in red-checkered blankets.
2016-12-15.headline_main: 36 Hours in Nairobi, Kenya

2016-12-15.abstract: Pristina is the hub of Europe’s youngest national population, and the vortex of this energetic destination is Bulevardi Nene Tereza (Mother Theresa Boulevard).
2016-12-15.snippet: Pristina is the hub of Europe’s youngest national population, and the vortex of this energetic destination is Bulevardi Nene Tereza (Mother Theresa Boulevard).
2016-12-15.lead_paragraph: Pristina swims in superlatives. With a population of 200,000, Kosovo’s chief metropolis is also the hub of Europe’s youngest national population; the average age of a Kosovar is 28. The vortex of this energetic destination is the pedestrian-only Bulevardi Nene Tereza (Mother Teresa Boulevard). Radiating from the promenade, named for the recently canonized Albanian nun and bookended by the Yugoslavian-era Grand Hotel and National Theater, is a tangle of streets crowded with cafes, boutiques, fashionable locals, in-the-know internationals and the case for yet another superlative: coolest neighborhood in the Balkans.
2016-12-15.headline_main: Five Places to Go in Pristina

2016-12-15.snippet: There are 4.3 million Muslims in the country, yet their faith is legally nonexistent.
2016-12-15.lead_paragraph: Religion in Germany is not a private affair. Government at all levels recognizes religious communities as public institutions, and encourages participation in them — Germans who register with the state as Roman Catholics, Protestants or Jews pay a “religion tax,” which the government then sends to their respective institution. Religious groups are also allowed to give faith-based instruction in public schools: It’s not uncommon for a small-town pastor, priest or lay person to have a spot on the local high school faculty.

She started out as a designer working the big animated billboard in the 1970’s, participated in the groundbreaking Times Square art show in 1980 and finally moved there in 1981 with her husband, the filmmaker Charlie Ahearn. One New Year’s Eve soon afterwards, the artist was pregnant and cooped up in her loft. Against advice — and maybe common sense — she braved the growing crowds and went out to photographs the revelers.

2016-12-15.abstract: Why scientists and startups are tinkering with our most popular legume.
2016-12-15.snippet: Why scientists and startups are tinkering with our most popular legume.
2016-12-15.lead_paragraph: In the summer of 1987, Wesley Burks, a pediatric allergist in Little Rock, decided to enroll in a graduate-level biochemistry course at the University of Arkansas. Twice a week, instead of driving to his laboratory at the Arkansas Children’s Hospital, he headed to the medical-school campus about a mile away. There, he joined some 20 students learning to pipette liquid extracts into gels and stain them with pigments to figure out which protein molecules they contained. Burks had only recently completed his medical fellowship, where he studied why some children have allergic reactions to milk and eggs. Now he was throwing himself into biochemistry so he could be the first to figure out what it was about peanuts that made people so allergic. “It’s easy to say you want to do something that’ll change kids’ lives,” Burks says. “But you have to focus on an area to really get it done.”
2016-12-15.headline_main: Is It Possible to Make a Less Allergenic Peanut?

2016-12-15.snippet: Starring Denzel Washington, who also directed, and Viola Davis, this film adaptation of August Wilson’s play features performances of unmatched force.
2016-12-15.lead_paragraph: By the end of “Fences,” we will have learned a lot about Troy Maxson — about his hard Southern childhood, his time in prison and the Negro Leagues, his work ethic, his sexual appetites and his parenting philosophy — but the first and most important thing we know about the man is that he is one of the world’s great talkers. He enters the screen on a tide of verbiage, jawing with his friend Bono (Stephen McKinley Henderson) and bantering with his wife, Rose (Viola Davis). The audience quickly grasps what Rose and Bono have known for years. Troy is by turns funny, provocative, inspiring and hurtful, but one thing he will never be as long as he draws breath is silent.
2016-12-15.headline_main: Review: Beneath the Bombast, ‘Fences’ Has an Aching Poetry

2016-12-15.abstract: More than 740,000 young undocumented immigrants are allowed to work under an Obama administration directive, but Donald J. Trump could take that away.
2016-12-15.snippet: More than 740,000 young undocumented immigrants are allowed to work under an Obama administration directive, but Donald J. Trump could take that away.
2016-12-15.lead_paragraph: Vanessa Luna arrived in New York as a 10-year-old from Peru, and grew up as an undocumented immigrant. While her parents worked at cleaning jobs, she hid her status in high school until a guidance counselor helped her get into the State University of New York at Binghamton to study American history.
2016-12-15.headline_main: Once Accepted, Soon Rejected? New York’s Young Immigrants Uncertain Under Trump

2016-12-15.abstract: The party is at odds over whether it should tailor its message to the young and nonwhite constituencies that propelled President Obama, or make an effort to court moderate voters.
2016-12-15.snippet: The party is at odds over whether it should tailor its message to the young and nonwhite constituencies that propelled President Obama, or make an effort to court moderate voters.
2016-12-15.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Sounding like a frustrated Cassandra, Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. lamented last week that Hillary Clinton had not done enough to reach white working-class voters in the presidential campaign. Even more egregious to Mr. Biden, some fellow Democrats had concluded that blue-collar whites were not even worth pursuing.
2016-12-15.headline_main: Democrats at Crossroads: Win Back Working-Class Whites, or Let Them Go?

2016-12-15.abstract: Family members and friends of the nine victims of the massacre at Emanuel A.M.E. Church have endured the defendant’s trial with stoicism and grace.
2016-12-15.snippet: Family members and friends of the nine victims of the massacre at Emanuel A.M.E. Church have endured the defendant’s trial with stoicism and grace.
2016-12-15.lead_paragraph: CHARLESTON, S.C. — Each morning they flowed into Courtroom Six, escorted by federal officials from a holding room reserved for survivors and families of the victims. The accused, Dylann S. Roof, never turned from the end of the defense table to acknowledge the parents, widows and widowers, children, grandchildren and fellow congregants of the nine African-Americans he confessed to killing in June 2015 at Emanuel African Methodist Episcopal Church.
2016-12-15.headline_main: Congregants’ Quiet Agony at the Dylann Roof Trial

2016-12-15.abstract: A look at the developments that shaped the industry, and that will continue to have an impact in 2017.
2016-12-15.snippet: A look at the developments that shaped the industry, and that will continue to have an impact in 2017.
2016-12-15.lead_paragraph: Fashion may never quite recover from 2016. The most memorable thread of the last 12 months had less to do with clothes than existential self-doubt. When Jeremy Scott literally put a smoking — O.K., not a gun, but a dress — on his Moschino runway, it proved to be the metaphor for the whole darn year. In the end, much of what we thought we knew was in question, and all we actually knew was to expect the unexpected. It came in many different shapes, and styles.
2016-12-15.headline_main: The Year’s Top Stories From the Fashion World

2016-12-15.abstract: The men and boys on the migrant trail out of countries like Niger and Mali say fickle rains and hotter days leave them no option but to risk their lives to gain a livelihood.
2016-12-15.snippet: The men and boys on the migrant trail out of countries like Niger and Mali say fickle rains and hotter days leave them no option but to risk their lives to gain a livelihood.

2016-12-15.lead_paragraph: BEIRUT, Lebanon — After months of fierce bombardment and failed diplomacy, the Syrian government began removing residents from the last rebel-held districts in the city of Aleppo on Thursday, a process that solidifies President Bashar al-Assad’s control over the country’s largest city.

2016-12-15.abstract: Bill Simmons, Heben Nigatu, Tracy Clayton and Ezra Edelman discuss what stuck with them this year.
2016-12-15.snippet: Bill Simmons, Heben Nigatu, Tracy Clayton and Ezra Edelman discuss what stuck with them this year.
2016-12-15.lead_paragraph: It’s the end of the year, which means a lot of parties that can end in sloppiness and chagrin. For us, it means jotting down what culture mattered this year and talking about that. We invited four pals to join us on Still Processing to talk about what they jotted: Bill Simmons, the chief executive of The Ringer and host of the “Bill Simmons Podcast”; Ezra Edelman, director of the documentary “O.J.: Made in America,” the movie Wesley thinks is the best of 2016; and Tracy Clayton and Heben Nigatu, who host the podcast “Another Round.” Their lists are published below, but their energy and explanations you have to hear for yourself. Next week, we’ll share our own lists.
2016-12-15.headline_main: Unforgettable Cultural Moments From 2016

2016-12-15.abstract: The president-elect’s apparent willingness to rethink the principle that prioritizes China over Taiwan has energized many, but some fear being used as a bargaining chip.
2016-12-15.snippet: The president-elect’s apparent willingness to rethink the principle that prioritizes China over Taiwan has energized many, but some fear being used as a bargaining chip.
2016-12-15.lead_paragraph: TAIPEI, Taiwan — Lin Fei-fan led the charge nearly three years ago when hundreds of students occupied Taiwan’s legislature to protest a trade deal with China. With the island’s economy increasingly tied to the mainland’s, and Beijing’s global influence on the rise, he worried that Taiwan’s independence was at stake — and might be a lost cause.
2016-12-15.headline_main: Taiwan Is Both Exhilarated and Unnerved by Trump’s China Remarks

2016-12-15.abstract: The German owner of the 1,500 artworks was of sound mind when he bequeathed them to a museum in Switzerland, a court in Munich ruled.
2016-12-15.snippet: The German owner of the 1,500 artworks was of sound mind when he bequeathed them to a museum in Switzerland, a court in Munich ruled.
2016-12-15.lead_paragraph: BERLIN — A German man who had stashed a trove of art that included works stolen by the Nazis was of sound mind when he bequeathed his father’s collection to the Museum of Fine Arts in Bern, Switzerland, a Munich court ruled on Thursday. The decision paves the way for the 1,500 artworks to be transferred.
2016-12-15.headline_main: Ruling Paves Way for Transfer of Art Trove Including Nazi-Looted Works

Is there a safe way to preserve them — off my phone, maybe even to transfer them to hard copy? I would be devastated if they disappeared because of hacking, changes in the program, my account ending, etc.

Only occasionally do they pause, perhaps hearing a light rustle on the fallen leaves or glimpsing something scampering among the dark green foliage.
2016-12-15.headline_main: Rodents Run Wild in Paris. Blame the European Union.

2016-12-15.lead_paragraph: MILWAUKEE — After nearly 25 years, I’m stepping down from my daily conservative talk radio show at the end of this month. I’m not leaving because of the rise of Donald J. Trump (my reasons are personal), but I have to admit that the campaign has made my decision easier. The conservative media is broken and the conservative movement deeply compromised.

2016-12-15.abstract: “Hank: The Short Life and Long Country Road of Hank Williams” is a timely biography, though its subject died nearly 64 years ago.
2016-12-15.snippet: “Hank: The Short Life and Long Country Road of Hank Williams” is a timely biography, though its subject died nearly 64 years ago.
2016-12-15.lead_paragraph: In a year when a number of notable books (and editorials and electoral analyses) focused on the history and fate of the white working class in America, Mark Ribowsky’s “Hank: The Short Life and Long Country Road of Hank Williams” is a timely biography, though its subject died nearly 64 years ago. “Like his old man,” Ribowsky writes, Hank “was brought up believing he was white trash — and this sensibility was his means of finding success, not by pushing it away but by turning it into engaging commercial appeal.” (“I Saw the Light,” a biopic starring Tom Hiddleston as the crooner, was released earlier this year.)
2016-12-15.headline_main: Hank’s Long Suffering

It was billed as a potential slugfest between the president-elect and the tech industry because there had been little love lost between both sides during the presidential campaign.

2016-12-15.snippet: The region shows how populist leaders make their own rules and undermine the democratic system.
2016-12-15.lead_paragraph: LEXINGTON, Ky. — Will Donald J. Trump follow the populist script for concentrating power by cracking down on critics? Or are the foundations of American democracy and the institutions of civil society strong enough to resist such an action? For answers, Americans should take a look at Latin America, where, starting in the 1940s, elected populists undermined democracy.

2016-12-15.abstract: The Times critic Michael Kimmelman reflects on how architects have changed New York City this year, making it more livable, humane and energizing.
2016-12-15.snippet: The Times critic Michael Kimmelman reflects on how architects have changed New York City this year, making it more livable, humane and energizing.
2016-12-15.lead_paragraph: For the ribbon-cutting at the Washington Heights Library this month, the son of a former custodian returned to his old home. He grew up in what used to be the caretaker’s apartment on the third floor. While his father shoveled coal at night to heat the place, he would go downstairs to read about boat building and navigating by the stars. Ronald Clark went on to become the first in his family to graduate from high school and college, and decades later he built himself a boat and navigated by the stars that he had learned about in the library under him.
2016-12-15.headline_main: The Best Architecture in New York of 2016

2016-12-15.abstract: New research shows a drop in hearing loss, thanks to factors like fewer noisy factories, reduced use of medicines that can affect hearing, and better health in general.
2016-12-15.snippet: New research shows a drop in hearing loss, thanks to factors like fewer noisy factories, reduced use of medicines that can affect hearing, and better health in general.
2016-12-15.lead_paragraph: As concern rises over the effect of continuous use of headphones and earbuds on hearing, a new paper by federal researchers has found something unexpected. The prevalence of hearing loss in Americans of working age has declined.
2016-12-15.headline_main: Americans’ Hearing Loss Decreases Even With Ubiquitous Headphones

2016-12-15.abstract: The movies follow protagonists trying to write their own histories in the midst of events over which they have no control.
2016-12-15.snippet: The movies follow protagonists trying to write their own histories in the midst of events over which they have no control.
2016-12-15.lead_paragraph: How risky is it to make a movie about a real-life historical character audiences think they already know? Filmmakers do it all the time, of course, with varying degrees of skill and success. But it’s rare to attempt it twice at the same time, with two strikingly different movies filmed in different languages and set in different countries, as the 40-year-old Chilean director Pablo Larraín has just done.

2016-12-15.abstract: A lidocaine swab can be an easy and effective way to ease the pain of childhood injections.
2016-12-15.snippet: A lidocaine swab can be an easy and effective way to ease the pain of childhood injections.
2016-12-15.lead_paragraph: A bit of sugar on the tongue may help distract a baby from the pain of an injection, and cuddling and cooing probably helps, too. But according to a new study, the most effective way to reduce the infant’s pain is to apply lidocaine cream at the injection site as well.

2016-12-15.snippet: With trips to Africa, the Amazon and Alaska, the founder of Gondwana Ecotours wants to preserve wild places and support nonprofit groups.
2016-12-15.lead_paragraph: The New Orleans resident Jared Sternberg, 30, started Gondwana Ecotours in 2013, the same year he graduated from Tulane University Law School in that city. He studied environmental and human rights with the idea of helping indigenous and underserved populations preserve land and resources, but after completing service work in locations including Ghana, Ecuador, Alaska and Nicaragua, Mr. Sternberg became convinced that tourism could achieve the same goals. This year, Gondwana offered trips to six destinations on three continents. (The name Gondwana refers to an ancient landmass.)
2016-12-15.headline_main: To Protect the Land, Jared Sternberg Turned to Tourism

2016-12-15.lead_paragraph: At Pata Cafe in Elmhurst, Queens, a tree climbs from the floor through the ceiling. It’s as if you’d popped through a trap door into a secret clubhouse. A stuffed monkey lounges on a branch, a homage to Bua Noi (Little Lotus), a gorilla who has spent her life in the rooftop zoo of the Pata department store in Bangkok.
2016-12-15.headline_main: At Pata Cafe, Few Ingredients but a Mélange of Thai Flavors

2016-12-15.lead_paragraph: CHARLESTON, S.C. — Dylann S. Roof, a self-radicalized young white supremacist who killed nine black parishioners last year when he opened fire during a long-planned assault on Emanuel African Methodist Episcopal Church, was found guilty by a federal jury here on Thursday.
2016-12-15.headline_main: Dylann Roof Found Guilty in Charleston Church Massacre

2016-12-15.abstract: Officials tiptoed through a geopolitical minefield as they gathered in Brussels for their end-of-year summit meeting. Here’s a guide to the thorniest issues.
2016-12-15.snippet: Officials tiptoed through a geopolitical minefield as they gathered in Brussels for their end-of-year summit meeting. Here’s a guide to the thorniest issues.
2016-12-15.lead_paragraph: BRUSSELS — The European Union has had a rough year, buffeted by terrorism, “Brexit,” far-right populism and lethargic growth, and leaders of its member states were tiptoeing through a geopolitical minefield on Thursday during their end-of-year summit meeting in Brussels. The migration crisis has abated, but only slightly, and collective decision-making is harder than ever. Referendums, like Britain’s June 23 vote to leave the European Union and Italy’s Dec. 4 decision to reject constitutional changes, have made life harder for democratically elected leaders. The war in Syria, aggression and meddling by Russia and the election of Donald J. Trump as the United States president have added to the complexity.
2016-12-15.headline_main: What E.U. Leaders Are Wrestling With at the End of a Tough Year

In an interview, the director Denis Villeneuve discussed why he and his production designer decided against using green screen, and how puppeteers were used to mimic the movement of ailens. Here are excerpts from that conversation.

2016-12-15.abstract: The Anthology Film Archives is giving viewers a chance to discover this long-forgotten director with a beautiful restoration of her 1916 film “The Dumb Girl of Portici.”
2016-12-15.snippet: The Anthology Film Archives is giving viewers a chance to discover this long-forgotten director with a beautiful restoration of her 1916 film “The Dumb Girl of Portici.”
2016-12-15.lead_paragraph: Once upon a Hollywood time, one of filmdom’s biggest directors was Lois Weber. Woodrow Wilson was president, and women couldn’t have voted for him even if they had wanted to, but inside the movie industry, women thrived, and Weber thrived above all others. An auteur before that word entered the cinematic lexicon, she wrote, directed and edited films and was admired for her sensitive work with actors, her on-set meticulousness and her stories about women. Her name was invoked alongside the likes of D. W. Griffith, yet, like most female directors of that era, she faded into obscurity.
2016-12-15.headline_main: Lois Weber, Eloquent Filmmaker of the Silent Screen

2016-12-15.abstract: Girl at the White Horse, which opens this month, has a series of cozy and intimate nooks to hang out in.
2016-12-15.snippet: Girl at the White Horse, which opens this month, has a series of cozy and intimate nooks to hang out in.
2016-12-15.lead_paragraph: Reza Fahim designed Tenants of the Trees, a nightclub in the Silver Lake neighborhood of Los Angeles, for the new generation of Hollywood stars that relishes privacy: It’s surrounded by 14-foot high concrete walls. Within the cramped, labyrinthine corridors of Tenants, on the smallest dance floor in Los Angeles, Frank Ocean swayed incognito on the night his long-anticipated second album, “Blonde,” dropped last August. And on a recent Thursday night, the burgeoning London rockers the Big Moon claimed a cabaret stage to play a secret concert to close their first North American tour; unbeknown to them, the band served as an opening act for an impromptu two-hour set by Dave Chappelle.
2016-12-15.headline_main: Like Drinking Cocktails at Home, in L.A.

2016-12-15.abstract: Also: When you realize you didn’t get an invitation to a holiday party you’ve gone to for years; the complexities of gift giving, and more.
2016-12-15.snippet: Also: When you realize you didn’t get an invitation to a holiday party you’ve gone to for years; the complexities of gift giving, and more.
2016-12-15.lead_paragraph: I am 55 and the oldest of four siblings. We all congregate at our parents’ home (with spouses and kids) over the holidays. Their place has many bedrooms but only two baths. The commotion is fun during the day, but at night, the house is overcrowded and noisy. For a few years, I have gotten a hotel room three blocks away. I only use it for sleeping and showering. But sleeping there, instead of on the couch, causes resentment in the family, especially from my mother. How can I explain that I don’t mean offense?
2016-12-15.headline_main: Can I Stay at a Hotel When Visiting My Crowded Family Home?

2016-12-15.lead_paragraph: Over the last 15 years, the rising appeal of grower Champagne, wine produced by small farmers who grow their own grapes, has transformed our notion of what the region’s wines can be.

2016-12-15.abstract: The language has two words for truth. It’s time for Americans to learn them.
2016-12-15.snippet: The language has two words for truth. It’s time for Americans to learn them.
2016-12-15.lead_paragraph: The Russian language has two words for truth — a linguistic quirk that seems relevant to our current political climate, especially because of all the disturbing ties between the newly elected president and the Kremlin.
2016-12-15.headline_main: To Understand Trump, Learn Russian

2016-12-15.abstract: Ms. Pensato’s new Brooklyn studio is already filled with her collection of toys and figurines, but she says she wants the place to be “a lot dirtier.”
2016-12-15.snippet: Ms. Pensato’s new Brooklyn studio is already filled with her collection of toys and figurines, but she says she wants the place to be “a lot dirtier.”
2016-12-15.lead_paragraph: “It’s getting there,” the painter Joyce Pensato said. Hands on her hips, she was scrutinizing the cluttered, paint-splattered length of a studio in Bushwick, Brooklyn, that she moved into about a year ago, after the building that housed her previous studio, a spiritual sanctuary for more than 30 years, was sold. “I need to get this a lot dirtier, a lot more stuffed. But it takes time to trash something up just the way you want it.”
2016-12-15.headline_main: For Joyce Pensato, It’s Not the Same Without the Ambient Muck

2016-12-15.abstract: Not long after the deer was offered a last-minute reprieve by the governor, the city said it planned to put it to death on Friday morning, calling it “the only humane and safe recourse.”
2016-12-15.snippet: Not long after the deer was offered a last-minute reprieve by the governor, the city said it planned to put it to death on Friday morning, calling it “the only humane and safe recourse.”
2016-12-15.lead_paragraph: The white-tailed deer of Harlem will live — but most likely only for a few hours.
2016-12-15.headline_main: Captured Harlem Deer Gets a Reprieve, but Faces Death Hours Later

2016-12-15.abstract: The debit cards marketed on many campuses often are not designed with students’ best interests in mind, a new report found.
2016-12-15.snippet: The debit cards marketed on many campuses often are not designed with students’ best interests in mind, a new report found.
2016-12-15.lead_paragraph: Debit cards marketed on many college campuses often aren’t designed with students’ best interests in mind, a new report has found.
2016-12-15.headline_main: Students Advised to Be Wary of College-Sponsored Debit Cards

2016-12-15.abstract: Polly Sheppard, a church member, reported the shooting to a 911 operator.
2016-12-15.snippet: Polly Sheppard, a church member, reported the shooting to a 911 operator.
2016-12-15.lead_paragraph: Polly Sheppard, a church member, reported the shooting to a 911 operator.
2016-12-15.headline_main: The Call to 911

2016-12-15.abstract: A satellite of the celebrated restaurant is expected to fully open its doors next week in Midtown West.
2016-12-15.snippet: A satellite of the celebrated restaurant is expected to fully open its doors next week in Midtown West.
2016-12-15.lead_paragraph: When the opening of a Manhattan branch of the high-end supermarket Brooklyn Fare was announced in 2013, a satellite of its acclaimed restaurant was supposed to follow in the store soon after. Now, three years later, it is about to open.
2016-12-15.headline_main: Chef’s Table at Brooklyn Fare Set to Open a Manhattan Branch

2016-12-15.abstract: Mr. Sager was known as much for his outlandish outfits as for his brief interviews with basketball coaches and players on N.B.A. broadcasts.
2016-12-15.snippet: Mr. Sager was known as much for his outlandish outfits as for his brief interviews with basketball coaches and players on N.B.A. broadcasts.
2016-12-15.lead_paragraph: Craig Sager, an exuberant sideline reporter for National Basketball Association television broadcasts who was as well known for his outlandishly garish outfits as for the questions he asked coaches and players, died on Thursday in Atlanta. He was 65.
2016-12-15.headline_main: Craig Sager, Colorful N.B.A. Sideline Reporter, Dies at 65

2016-12-15.abstract: Doris Payne, 86, was arrested — again — on Tuesday in a suburb of Atlanta. Ms. Payne stands accused of stealing a $2,000 necklace.
2016-12-15.snippet: Doris Payne, 86, was arrested — again — on Tuesday in a suburb of Atlanta. Ms. Payne stands accused of stealing a $2,000 necklace.
2016-12-15.lead_paragraph: For Doris Payne, an international jewel thief whose criminal career spans seven decades, old habits are hard to kick, if police records are any indication.
2016-12-15.headline_main: No Retirement for a Jewel Thief With a Seven-Decade Career

2016-12-15.abstract: Cheng Er’s gangland drama unwinds nonchronologically, like episodes of a mini-series shown out of order.
2016-12-15.snippet: Cheng Er’s gangland drama unwinds nonchronologically, like episodes of a mini-series shown out of order.
2016-12-15.lead_paragraph: Set against the backdrop of the second Sino-Japanese War, “The Wasted Times” has the outward appearance of being a sweeping gangland epic. But by employing a nonlinear structure, Cheng Er — who wrote, directed and edited this film — severely diffuses the story’s dramatic impact. To think back through the narrative, which spans more than a decade, is to wonder what was gained by withholding details only to reveal them later in flashbacks.
2016-12-15.headline_main: Review: ‘The Wasted Times,’ a Hopscotching Shanghai Crime Tale

2016-12-15.abstract: New York Times critics pick their favorite movies of the year, with links telling you where to stream them.
2016-12-15.snippet: New York Times critics pick their favorite movies of the year, with links telling you where to stream them.
2016-12-15.lead_paragraph: ‘Tis the season for big family films and Oscar hopefuls. But as the film critics for The New York Times remind us, there were plenty of great movies that opened in the year’s other 11 months. If you happened to miss any, their lists of the best movies of the year should help.
2016-12-15.headline_main: Where to Stream the Best Movies of 2016

2016-12-15.abstract: The actress plays multiple roles in Julian Rosefeldt’s ‘Manifesto’ video installation at the Park Avenue Armory.
2016-12-15.snippet: The actress plays multiple roles in Julian Rosefeldt’s ‘Manifesto’ video installation at the Park Avenue Armory.
2016-12-15.lead_paragraph: If the art world gave out Oscars, Cate Blanchett should win for her tour de force of starring roles in “Manifesto,” at the Park Avenue Armory. This toweringly ambitious, if occasionally pretentious film installation is the creation of Julian Rosefeldt, its writer, director and producer, a German artist drawn to complex narratives and fusions of real and cinematic space. His latest effort consists of 13 short films whose scripts are stitched together from nearly 50 manifestoes mostly by 20th-century artists, composers, architects and filmmakers. From Futurism to Pop Art and beyond, the writings layer knowledge, language and style into head-spinning densities. Some of these treatises were important turning points in art history; others are nearly forgotten.
2016-12-15.headline_main: 12 Faces of Cate Blanchett: A Chameleon in the Armory

2016-12-15.abstract: Kim Nguyen’s film focuses on a pair of damaged young souls enveloped in beauty, absurdity and, despite the cold air, a lot of overheated romanticism.
2016-12-15.snippet: Kim Nguyen’s film focuses on a pair of damaged young souls enveloped in beauty, absurdity and, despite the cold air, a lot of overheated romanticism.
2016-12-15.lead_paragraph: “Two Lovers and a Bear” begins with two-thirds of the title characters — the lovers — sledding to a frozen body of water, where they then drill holes and do some ice fishing. Passing time while waiting for a bite, the male lover talks about the fact that there are only two musicians that he likes.
2016-12-15.headline_main: Review: ‘Two Lovers and a Bear’ Walk Onto Some Arctic Ice

2016-12-15.abstract: Thirteen days after a bus crash seriously injured several cheerleaders and killed the booster club president, Iraan’s team played in a state title game.
2016-12-15.snippet: Thirteen days after a bus crash seriously injured several cheerleaders and killed the booster club president, Iraan’s team played in a state title game.
2016-12-15.lead_paragraph: ARLINGTON, Tex. — Even in the discomfort of back and neck braces, Katie Kent, 15, wore her cheerleader uniform on Wednesday morning for a pep rally to send her brother and his teammates off to the state championship game.
2016-12-15.headline_main: Bereaved Texas Town Finds Comfort in a State High School Title Game

2016-12-15.abstract: Justin Vernon’s band played shows based on the album “22, a Million” in and around New York City. Three venues provided different experiences.
2016-12-15.snippet: Justin Vernon’s band played shows based on the album “22, a Million” in and around New York City. Three venues provided different experiences.
2016-12-15.lead_paragraph: Even in the digital era, physical space deeply affects music: a proposition that Bon Iver, Justin Vernon’s band, affirmed this month with 10 concerts in and around New York City. I saw three of them, all in Brooklyn.
2016-12-15.headline_main: Review: From Bon Iver, Concerts Tailored to the Spaces

2016-12-15.abstract: Mr. Hopkins joins Jeffrey Dean Morgan, who plays an F.B.I. agent in this disordered drama.
2016-12-15.snippet: Mr. Hopkins joins Jeffrey Dean Morgan, who plays an F.B.I. agent in this disordered drama.
2016-12-15.lead_paragraph: “Solace” was filmed before either of its primary leads, Anthony Hopkins and Jeffrey Dean Morgan, had become highly visible fixtures on two of this fall’s most hyped television shows. And after seeing Mr. Morgan strut and slaughter as the latest big bad on “The Walking Dead,” and Mr. Hopkins sneak and scheme as the spider at the center of “Westworld,” accepting them as this movie’s white-hat heroes is quite the challenge.
2016-12-15.headline_main: Review: ‘Solace’ Enlists Anthony Hopkins as a Psychic in a Serial-Killer Case

2016-12-15.abstract: A kidney transplanted from a deceased 79-year-old can be as effective as one from a person 30 years younger, a new study found.
2016-12-15.snippet: A kidney transplanted from a deceased 79-year-old can be as effective as one from a person 30 years younger, a new study found.
2016-12-15.lead_paragraph: Old age is not necessarily a barrier to kidney donation.
2016-12-15.headline_main: Never Too Old to Be an Organ Donor

2016-12-15.abstract: Death and damage arrive out of nowhere in Gonzalo López-Gallego’s violent drama.
2016-12-15.snippet: Death and damage arrive out of nowhere in Gonzalo López-Gallego’s violent drama.
2016-12-15.lead_paragraph: In “The Hollow Point,” a grimy, hyperviolent drug drama, death and damage arrive out of nowhere, zipping into the frame by car, bullet, machete and sword. So unexpected are these incidents, and so economically realized, that the movie becomes a lesson in how to build tension without the usual assists of a screaming soundtrack and a deranged camera. Here, mayhem is matter-of-fact.
2016-12-15.headline_main: Review: Matter-of-Fact Mayhem Strikes in ‘The Hollow Point’

2016-12-15.abstract: The government can’t do its job if it refuses to measure the damage caused by carbon.
2016-12-15.snippet: The government can’t do its job if it refuses to measure the damage caused by carbon.
2016-12-15.lead_paragraph: Last week, Donald J. Trump’s transition team sent a startling questionnaire to the Department of Energy. Among other things, the questionnaire asked for the names of all employees and contractors who attended meetings of the Interagency Working Group on the Social Cost of Carbon, as well as all emails associated with those meetings, and the department’s “opinion” on the underlying issues — a request it essentially refused.
2016-12-15.headline_main: Donald Trump Should Know: This Is What Climate Change Costs Us

2016-12-15.abstract: This salutary documentary follows four cyclists who bike across the country to call attention to Friedreich’s ataxia, a devastating neuromuscular disease.
2016-12-15.snippet: This salutary documentary follows four cyclists who bike across the country to call attention to Friedreich’s ataxia, a devastating neuromuscular disease.
2016-12-15.lead_paragraph: A couple of years back, the ice bucket challenge was a social-media sensation, raising an estimated $115 million for research into amyotrophic lateral sclerosis, or Lou Gehrig’s disease.
2016-12-15.headline_main: Review: A Race to Raise Awareness in ‘The Ataxian’

2016-12-15.abstract: The show employs video, puppets and action figures, as well as actors, to tell its familiar story, about a boy abandoned by his vacationing family.
2016-12-15.snippet: The show employs video, puppets and action figures, as well as actors, to tell its familiar story, about a boy abandoned by his vacationing family.
2016-12-15.lead_paragraph: It takes audacity and energy to satirically sabotage a holiday film as revered as the 1990 comedy “Home Alone.” But in “Kevin!!!!!,” a multimedia sendup at the People’s Improvisational Theater, the troupe Recent Cutbacks displays plenty.
2016-12-15.headline_main: Review: ‘Kevin!!!!!,’ a Multimedia Sendup of ‘Home Alone’

2016-12-15.abstract: “Adventures in Moominland,” in London, exhibits (and celebrates) the cult midcentury cartoonist Tove Jansson’s Moomin series.
2016-12-15.snippet: “Adventures in Moominland,” in London, exhibits (and celebrates) the cult midcentury cartoonist Tove Jansson’s Moomin series.
2016-12-15.lead_paragraph: During her lifetime, the artist, author and cartoonist Tove Jansson earned fame far beyond her native Finland for her children’s books featuring the Moomins, a race of hippo-like, bulbous-nosed creatures driven by abundant curiosity. Their intrepid exploits, as well as Jansson’s formidable inventiveness, inform the spirit of the exhibition “Adventures in Moominland,” which opens tomorrow at London’s Southbank Centre.
2016-12-15.headline_main: Beloved Children’s-Book Characters, in Their Own Immersive World

2016-12-15.abstract: Circus der Sinne, based in Tanzania, deploys performers who leap, juggle and perform myriad other feats at the New Victory Theater, backed by a live band.
2016-12-15.snippet: Circus der Sinne, based in Tanzania, deploys performers who leap, juggle and perform myriad other feats at the New Victory Theater, backed by a live band.
2016-12-15.lead_paragraph: Life may hold no guarantees, but unless the roof falls in at the New Victory Theater, you’re pretty much assured a swell time at “Mother Africa: My Home.”
2016-12-15.headline_main: Review: ‘Mother Africa: My Home’ Melds Acrobatics and Drumming

2016-12-15.abstract: An immersive new exhibition at London’s Southbank Centre features sketches and other artworks by Tove Jansson, the author and illustrator who created the Moomin series.
2016-12-15.snippet: An immersive new exhibition at London’s Southbank Centre features sketches and other artworks by Tove Jansson, the author and illustrator who created the Moomin series.
2016-12-15.lead_paragraph: An immersive new exhibition at London’s Southbank Centre features sketches and other artworks by Tove Jansson, the author and illustrator who created the Moomin series.
2016-12-15.headline_main: “Adventures in Moominland”

2016-12-15.abstract: This Ted Fendt film centers on a young man who gets a small jolt, but still can’t escape from his drab existence.
2016-12-15.snippet: This Ted Fendt film centers on a young man who gets a small jolt, but still can’t escape from his drab existence.
2016-12-15.lead_paragraph: Of the many words that might describe Mike (Mike Maccherone), the protagonist of Ted Fendt’s dour, poker-faced comedy, “Short Stay,” “deadbeat” and “slacker” are two that immediately come to mind.
2016-12-15.headline_main: Review: A ‘Short Stay,’ but Long Stuck in a Rut

2016-12-15.abstract: The movie, starring Will Smith, riffs on “A Christmas Carol” as it tells a story of a man who experiences the loss of a child.
2016-12-15.snippet: The movie, starring Will Smith, riffs on “A Christmas Carol” as it tells a story of a man who experiences the loss of a child.
2016-12-15.lead_paragraph: The five stages of grief sometimes seem applicable to movie reviewing, except that I usually skip denial, rarely get around to acceptance and generally just settle into anger, which is where I am with “Collateral Beauty.” Many of the words that I would like to use to describe this waste of talent and time, which riffs on Dickens’s eternal “A Christmas Carol” and tries to manufacture feeling by offing Tiny Tim, can’t be lobbed in a family publication. So, instead, I will just start by throwing out some permissible insults: artificial, clichéd, mawkish, preposterous, incompetent, sexist, laughable, insulting.
2016-12-15.headline_main: Review: Lots of Plastic in the Face of ‘Collateral Beauty’

2016-12-15.abstract: A team of about six people will draw on the resources of ABC News to get to the bottom of questionable articles, said James Goldston, the president of ABC News.
2016-12-15.snippet: A team of about six people will draw on the resources of ABC News to get to the bottom of questionable articles, said James Goldston, the president of ABC News.
2016-12-15.lead_paragraph: To fight the spread of fake news, Facebook on Thursday said it was trying a series of tests to limit the false articles, including working with several news organizations like The Associated Press, PolitiFact and Snopes. Those groups have formed a coalition to fact-check some of the items flagged as fake news across the social network.
2016-12-15.headline_main: How Facebook’s Fact-Checking Partnership Will Work

2016-12-15.abstract: Here’s what you need to know at the end of the day.
2016-12-15.snippet: Here’s what you need to know at the end of the day.
2016-12-15.lead_paragraph: (Want to get this briefing by email? Here’s the sign-up.)
2016-12-15.headline_main: Aleppo, Donald Trump, Dylann Roof: Your Thursday Evening Briefing

2016-12-15.abstract: As a junior, Barack Obama landed at Columbia University as a transfer student and sought his place in the worlds that collide in Harlem.
2016-12-15.snippet: As a junior, Barack Obama landed at Columbia University as a transfer student and sought his place in the worlds that collide in Harlem.
2016-12-15.lead_paragraph: Abraham Lincoln remains the most hallowed of our screen presidents, but it wouldn’t be surprising if Barack Obama — another historic, divisive, lanky colossus — eventually followed. In “Barry,” a satisfying slice of neo-Americana, the future 44th president of the United States is a seeker who enters his journey into the self at a critical juncture, much like the hero in John Ford’s “Young Mr. Lincoln.” Lincoln’s road to discovery puts him on the back of a mule to Springfield; Barry just takes a plane to New York.
2016-12-15.headline_main: Review: Before Barack, There Was ‘Barry’

2016-12-15.abstract: Jake Broder brings the decades-gone comedian back to slang-slinging life in “His Royal Hipness Lord Buckley,” but without the pith helmet.
2016-12-15.snippet: Jake Broder brings the decades-gone comedian back to slang-slinging life in “His Royal Hipness Lord Buckley,” but without the pith helmet.
2016-12-15.lead_paragraph: Few things age as fast as slang — just imagine a play entirely in Valley Girl-ese. At least it could bank on familiarity, which is not the case with “His Royal Hipness Lord Buckley,” a show built on the half-forgotten verbal quirks of an entirely forgotten personality from the 1940s and ’50s. Dig the swinging world of the hip? Solid!
2016-12-15.headline_main: Review: Lord Buckley, Remembrance of a Hipster Past

2016-12-15.abstract: A review that the government refuses to release found that suspects had been arrested and moved illegally, jeopardizing any criminal case in the 2014 disappearance.
2016-12-15.snippet: A review that the government refuses to release found that suspects had been arrested and moved illegally, jeopardizing any criminal case in the 2014 disappearance.
2016-12-15.lead_paragraph: MEXICO CITY — The Mexican government has refused to release an internal review that found investigators broke the law in their search for 43 missing students, a conclusion that threatens the legal foundations of a case that has roiled Mexico.
2016-12-15.headline_main: Mexican Report Says Investigators Botched Search for 43 Students

2016-12-15.abstract: Several centrist and liberal organizations refused to attend the event, co-hosted by an umbrella organization of major Jewish groups and the Embassy of Azerbaijan.
2016-12-15.snippet: Several centrist and liberal organizations refused to attend the event, co-hosted by an umbrella organization of major Jewish groups and the Embassy of Azerbaijan.
2016-12-15.lead_paragraph: As President Obama hosted his final Hanukkah celebration at the White House on Wednesday, an umbrella organization of major Jewish groups was co-hosting another Hanukkah party less than a mile away — at the Trump International Hotel.
2016-12-15.headline_main: Hanukkah Event at a Trump Hotel Highlights a Rift Among Jews

2016-12-15.abstract: DeVry, a for-profit university, agreed to settle allegations that it exaggerated the success of its graduates, though it did not admit wrongdoing.
2016-12-15.snippet: DeVry, a for-profit university, agreed to settle allegations that it exaggerated the success of its graduates, though it did not admit wrongdoing.
2016-12-15.lead_paragraph: DeVry University, a for-profit school that offers courses online and at dozens of locations nationwide, has agreed to a $100 million settlement of a federal lawsuit alleging that it falsely advertised the success of its graduates, the Federal Trade Commission announced on Thursday.
2016-12-15.headline_main: DeVry University Will Pay $100 Million for Students’ Loans and Tuition

2016-12-15.abstract: The Classical Theater of Harlem’s Christmas musical is a memory show; this year it moves to the main stage of the Apollo.
2016-12-15.snippet: The Classical Theater of Harlem’s Christmas musical is a memory show; this year it moves to the main stage of the Apollo.
2016-12-15.lead_paragraph: A soft snow was falling outside the Apollo Theater as the crowds arrived late Sunday afternoon, and the lobby inside was decked out for the holidays. When the lights dimmed in the gilded auditorium, and a small choir walked onstage to sing “The First Noel,” the a cappella sound was glorious.
2016-12-15.headline_main: Review: Remembering a Happier Holiday Among Many That Were Sad in ‘The First Noel’

2016-12-15.abstract: Pablo Larraín’s biopic about the Chilean poet pits the state versus the sensual.
2016-12-15.snippet: Pablo Larraín’s biopic about the Chilean poet pits the state versus the sensual.
2016-12-15.lead_paragraph: “Neruda,” Pablo Larraín’s semifantastical biopic, is a warmhearted film about a hot-blooded man that is nonetheless troubled by a subtle, perceptible chill. Blending fact with invention, it tells the story of a confrontation between an artist (the Chilean poet Pablo Neruda) and an emerging dictatorship, and more generally illuminates the endless struggle between political authority and the creative imagination. For anyone who believes that poetry and democracy spring from the same source and provoke the same enemies, this movie provides both encouragement and warning.
2016-12-15.headline_main: Review: ‘Neruda’ Pursues the Poet as Fugitive

2016-12-15.abstract: Our observations about the best student conversations and what made them work, as well as shout-outs to several individuals and one extraordinary school district.
2016-12-15.snippet: Our observations about the best student conversations and what made them work, as well as shout-outs to several individuals and one extraordinary school district.
2016-12-15.lead_paragraph: This fall, we invited teenagers to weigh in on some of the most divisive issues of this election and challenged them to have the kinds of respectful, productive discussions across ideological divides that, it seemed, many adults were unable to.
2016-12-15.headline_main: Ideas for Productive Discussion: Reflections on Our Civil Conversation Challenge

2016-12-15.abstract: The New York Times film critics review “Rogue One,” “Fences” and “Neruda.”
2016-12-15.snippet: The New York Times film critics review “Rogue One,” “Fences” and “Neruda.”
2016-12-15.lead_paragraph: The New York Times film critics review “Rogue One,” “Fences” and “Neruda.”
2016-12-15.headline_main: This Week’s Movies: Dec.16, 2016

2016-12-15.abstract: Suggested reading by book critics and editors at The New York Times.
2016-12-15.snippet: Suggested reading by book critics and editors at The New York Times.
2016-12-15.lead_paragraph: December has an unwarranted bad reputation in the book world. The so-called “big books” do tend to come out earlier in the fall (though this year many were pushed later to avoid competing for attention with the election). In December, the book world goes kind of quiet. But here’s the unsung part of the month: the little books. Not small in terms of quality — but the niche books, the hidden gems, the books that focus on perhaps a slightly narrower slice of life. Here are eight we think are deserving of (bigger) attention.
2016-12-15.headline_main: 8 New Books We Recommend This Week

2016-12-15.abstract: Previews, openings and some last-chance picks.
2016-12-15.snippet: Previews, openings and some last-chance picks.
2016-12-15.lead_paragraph: Our guide to plays and musicals coming to New York stages — and a few last-chance picks of shows that are about to close. Our reviews of open shows are at nytimes.com/reviews/theater.
2016-12-15.headline_main: What’s New in NYC Theater

2016-12-15.abstract: Several critics of The New York Times were up to the near-impossible task of citing only a few favorites among hundreds of classical albums this year.
2016-12-15.snippet: Several critics of The New York Times were up to the near-impossible task of citing only a few favorites among hundreds of classical albums this year.
2016-12-15.lead_paragraph: It is a preposterous notion: choosing a mere five albums for a list of the year’s most remarkable, out of the dozens, even hundreds, of memorable ones that land on a music critic’s desk over 12 months. So if this collection of 20 (technically, 21) favorites is by no means complete — indeed, it is by its nature almost arbitrary — it is at least a guide to four writers’ tastes and passions. (Though, coming from a group including devoted opera lovers, it is a strange guide that contains not a single complete opera recording.)
2016-12-15.headline_main: The Best Classical Music Recordings of 2016

2016-12-15.abstract: Our guide to stand-up, improv and variety shows.
2016-12-15.snippet: Our guide to stand-up, improv and variety shows.
2016-12-15.lead_paragraph: Our guide to stand-up, improv and variety shows.
2016-12-15.headline_main: Comedy in NYC This Week

2016-12-15.abstract: The ascendancy of Lopez and Gonzalez reflects both the surge of immigrants from Latin America and the fact that Hispanic surnames tend to be less diverse.
2016-12-15.snippet: The ascendancy of Lopez and Gonzalez reflects both the surge of immigrants from Latin America and the fact that Hispanic surnames tend to be less diverse.
2016-12-15.lead_paragraph: Taylor and Thomas are out. Lopez and Gonzalez are in. Six of the 15 most common surnames in the United States were of Hispanic origin in 2010, compared with four of 15 in 2000 and none as recently as 1990.
2016-12-15.headline_main: Hispanic Surnames on the Rise in U.S. as Immigration Surges

2016-12-15.abstract: A double-width townhouse on the city’s East Side was Franklin D. Roosevelt’s residence for years, and his early administration took shape within.
2016-12-15.snippet: A double-width townhouse on the city’s East Side was Franklin D. Roosevelt’s residence for years, and his early administration took shape within.
2016-12-15.lead_paragraph: At the stately age of 108, the handsome double-width townhouse at 47-49 East 65th Street bears no resemblance to a certain tower of gilt, glitz and high security just 12 blocks away.
2016-12-15.headline_main: Before That Gilded Tower, Another President-Elect Had a Manhattan Home Base

2016-12-16.abstract: Our guide to film series and special screenings.
2016-12-16.snippet: Our guide to film series and special screenings.
2016-12-16.lead_paragraph: Our guide to film series and special screenings. All our movie reviews are at nytimes.com/reviews/movies.
2016-12-16.headline_main: Film Series in NYC This Week

2016-12-16.abstract: Two men seeking approval for 396 new townhouses in Bloomingburg, N.Y., which has 420 residents, got ineligible voters registered by measures like putting toothbrushes in vacant apartments.
2016-12-16.snippet: Two men seeking approval for 396 new townhouses in Bloomingburg, N.Y., which has 420 residents, got ineligible voters registered by measures like putting toothbrushes in vacant apartments.
2016-12-16.lead_paragraph: As prosecutors painted it, the scheme seemed logical enough: If a rustic village in upstate New York would not approve a townhouse development that would more than quadruple its size, then bring in new residents, register them to vote and elect a new village board.
2016-12-16.headline_main: Builders Tried to Rig a Vote and Take Over a Village, U.S. Indictment Says

2016-12-16.abstract: Trouble with blades in the food processor has led to one of the largest appliance recalls on record and has cooks checking their machines.
2016-12-16.snippet: Trouble with blades in the food processor has led to one of the largest appliance recalls on record and has cooks checking their machines.
2016-12-16.lead_paragraph: A recall of blades in more than eight million Cuisinart food processors, the workhorse of many American kitchens, could not have come at a worse time for home cooks. With Hanukkah and Christmas less than two weeks away, there are potatoes to grate, nuts to chop and doughs to mix.
2016-12-16.headline_main: Cuisinart Recall ‘Just Screwed Up the Holidays for a Lot of People’

2016-12-16.abstract: Mr. Fox, in a sense, survived the Titanic twice, but was best-known for his role on “Bewitched”
2016-12-16.snippet: Mr. Fox, in a sense, survived the Titanic twice, but was best-known for his role on “Bewitched”
2016-12-16.lead_paragraph: Bernard Fox, a Welsh-born actor who spotted the iceberg that sank the Titanic in “A Night To Remember” and went on to play memorably daffy characters on the sitcoms “Bewitched” and “Hogan’s Heroes,” died on Wednesday in Van Nuys, Calif. He was 89.
2016-12-16.headline_main: Bernard Fox, Actor on Classic ’60s Sitcoms, Dies at 89

2016-12-16.abstract: Antiques, custom furnishings and what the owners say will be the longest bar in New York City fill a space honoring the Irish playwright.
2016-12-16.snippet: Antiques, custom furnishings and what the owners say will be the longest bar in New York City fill a space honoring the Irish playwright.
2016-12-16.lead_paragraph: Stepping into the cavernous space is a bit like walking into the great hall of the mansion in “Citizen Kane.” Classical marble sculptures, elaborately carved wooden animals and panels covered with painted rosebuds are everywhere. Though the place is still under construction, the haphazard collection of antiques already here raises the question: What exactly is going on?
2016-12-16.headline_main: Ambiance for a Victorian Spirit at a Bar Called Oscar Wilde

2016-12-16.abstract: Samamkaya Yoga in the Flatiron district caters to practitioners with aches and pains, focusing on therapeutic movements that strengthen alignment.
2016-12-16.snippet: Samamkaya Yoga in the Flatiron district caters to practitioners with aches and pains, focusing on therapeutic movements that strengthen alignment.
2016-12-16.lead_paragraph: In the era of hip-hop yoga and handstands on Instagram, it’s easy to associate yoga with impossibly lithe and limber young people. Those with chronic back pain, arthritis or a bum hip might not feel so welcome in a power vinyasa class.
2016-12-16.headline_main: A Manhattan Yoga Studio for Bad Backs

2016-12-16.abstract: The rules passed by the state’s energy agency represent another step in California’s efforts to drastically lower its greenhouse gas emissions.
2016-12-16.snippet: The rules passed by the state’s energy agency represent another step in California’s efforts to drastically lower its greenhouse gas emissions.
2016-12-16.lead_paragraph: Computers, long a symbol of the digital age, are now moving into a more earth-friendly future: California’s state energy agency voted unanimously Wednesday to approve new regulations for energy efficiency in desktop computers and monitors.
2016-12-16.headline_main: California to Regulate Energy Use of Desktop Computers and Monitors

2016-12-16.abstract: The Durst Organization purchased the historic building after the original developers said they “didn’t have the horsepower” to complete it.
2016-12-16.snippet: The Durst Organization purchased the historic building after the original developers said they “didn’t have the horsepower” to complete it.

2016-12-16.snippet: For some nursing home residents, companion animals don’t have to be real to offer real benefits.
2016-12-16.lead_paragraph: Lou Ann Wyckoff cradled the gray-and-white cat in her lap. She scratched the back of its head and the cat purred, eyes closed. When she stopped petting the cat, it opened its green eyes and meowed for more.
2016-12-16.headline_main: Therapy Cats for Dementia Patients, Batteries Included

2016-12-16.abstract: Photographs by Vincent Tullo of the final season of the Big Apple Circus, which announced in July that it had run out of money.
2016-12-16.snippet: Photographs by Vincent Tullo of the final season of the Big Apple Circus, which announced in July that it had run out of money.
2016-12-16.lead_paragraph: Photographs by Vincent Tullo of the final season of the Big Apple Circus, which announced in July that it had run out of money.
2016-12-16.headline_main: Before the Tents Folded

2016-12-16.abstract: Vincent Tullo captured part of the final season of the nonprofit circus, which announced this year that it had run out of money and would not return.
2016-12-16.snippet: Vincent Tullo captured part of the final season of the nonprofit circus, which announced this year that it had run out of money and would not return.
2016-12-16.lead_paragraph: Here’s another way that 2016 feels like a break in the space-time continuum: The Big Apple Circus tents are absent from Lincoln Center this holiday season. After almost four decades, the nonprofit announced in July that it had run out of money, and that a desperate $2 million fund-raising drive had fallen woefully short. Which means there are a lot of sad clowns out there. Children who dream of running away to join the circus will have to Google another roadshow.
2016-12-16.headline_main: The Last Days of the Big Apple Circus

2016-12-16.abstract: A book recounts the town’s 33-day battle against the British, “arguably America’s most historic tipping point.”
2016-12-16.snippet: A book recounts the town’s 33-day battle against the British, “arguably America’s most historic tipping point.”
2016-12-16.lead_paragraph: “Tipping Point at Saratoga” might sound like a good wager at the majestic upstate New York racetrack, but it’s an even better bet as the subtitle to “1777” (Oxford University Press, $34.95), a book about the decisive battle that year, which turned the tide of the American Revolution.
2016-12-16.headline_main: The Revolution Upstate: Saratoga’s Role in Forging the U.S.

2016-12-16.abstract: Each December, a Manhattan guide leads a tour making the case that the current image of Santa Claus originated and evolved in New York City.
2016-12-16.snippet: Each December, a Manhattan guide leads a tour making the case that the current image of Santa Claus originated and evolved in New York City.
2016-12-16.lead_paragraph: If a guy on Broadway in wraparound shades and a Santa hat insisted to you that Santa is really a New Yorker, you might slip him a buck and make a quick escape to your office party.
2016-12-16.headline_main: Santa’s a New Yorker. You Got a Problem With That?

2016-12-16.abstract: The news about an Afghan asylum seeker raised concerns about Europe’s ability to enforce laws within the 26 countries that allow for free cross-border travel.
2016-12-16.snippet: The news about an Afghan asylum seeker raised concerns about Europe’s ability to enforce laws within the 26 countries that allow for free cross-border travel.
2016-12-16.lead_paragraph: BERLIN — An Afghan migrant accused of raping and killing a medical student in Germany had been convicted of attempted murder in Greece and had violated parole there, but the German authorities were not aware of his criminal past when he entered the country, the government’s top security official said Thursday.
2016-12-16.headline_main: Germany Didn’t Know Migrant Held in Killing Had Violent Past in Greece

2016-12-16.abstract: The proposed contract would improve job security and schedules, but allows workers in New Jersey to earn less than those in New York.
2016-12-16.snippet: The proposed contract would improve job security and schedules, but allows workers in New Jersey to earn less than those in New York.
2016-12-16.lead_paragraph: After seven months of negotiations, thousands of airport workers in New York and New Jersey have come to terms on their first union contract. But it does not address an impending anomaly that will leave workers on opposite sides of the Hudson River earning different pay for doing the same work.
2016-12-16.headline_main: New Union Contract for New York City Area Airports Does Not Cover Wages

2016-12-16.abstract: Performing in multiple shows of intense, precise movement, the 31-year-old dancer takes every moment she can to relax.
2016-12-16.snippet: Performing in multiple shows of intense, precise movement, the 31-year-old dancer takes every moment she can to relax.
2016-12-16.lead_paragraph: In her 11th season as a Rockette, Danelle Morgan spends much of her weekends during the holiday season with 35 other high-kicking dancers onstage at Radio City Music Hall. The “Christmas Spectacular Starring the Radio City Rockettes,” which runs through Jan. 2, offers up to five shows on Sundays alone, several featuring Ms. Morgan, 31. She grew up in Highland Park, N.J., where she studied dance under Mary Frangione, a former Rockette, and later graduated with honors from the Ailey/Fordham B.F.A. dance program. She lives in Manhattan with her husband, Edouard Darres, and their dog, Lula.
2016-12-16.headline_main: How Danelle Morgan, Radio City Rockette, Spends Her Sundays

2016-12-16.abstract: Newly released documents from 1966 show that the Federal Bureau of Investigation had informants who let the agency know the details of the boxer’s involvement with the group led by Elijah Muhammad.
2016-12-16.snippet: Newly released documents from 1966 show that the Federal Bureau of Investigation had informants who let the agency know the details of the boxer’s involvement with the group led by Elijah Muhammad.

2016-12-16.lead_paragraph: Having lost the governorship of North Carolina, Republicans there are resorting to a novel strategy to subvert the will of the voters: They are trying to strip the new governor of some of his powers.

2016-12-16.abstract: Republicans said by repealing the Affordable Care Act, and then delaying the effective date, they hope to guarantee access to health care, not just to health insurance.
2016-12-16.snippet: Republicans said by repealing the Affordable Care Act, and then delaying the effective date, they hope to guarantee access to health care, not just to health insurance.
2016-12-16.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — House Republicans, responding to criticism that repealing the Affordable Care Act would leave millions without health insurance, said on Thursday that their goal in replacing President Obama’s health law was to guarantee “universal access” to health care and coverage, not necessarily to ensure that everyone actually has insurance.
2016-12-16.headline_main: G.O.P. Plans to Replace Health Care Law With ‘Universal Access’

2016-12-16.abstract: Brin-Jonathan Butler went to Cuba with boxing gloves, a wad of cash and an empty notebook. He returned with a critically acclaimed book. Now he makes ends meet by teaching boxing.
2016-12-16.snippet: Brin-Jonathan Butler went to Cuba with boxing gloves, a wad of cash and an empty notebook. He returned with a critically acclaimed book. Now he makes ends meet by teaching boxing.
2016-12-16.lead_paragraph: In a glowing underpass in Central Park one night last month, a man and woman danced through a boxing routine. They skipped rope and sparred. He swung and she ducked. Echoing through the space, playing on a cellphone, was a piano composition by the Cuban composer Ernesto Lecuona. It had the feel of a dirge, possibly because Fidel Castro had died three nights earlier.
2016-12-16.headline_main: The Trials of a Boxing Romantic

2016-12-16.snippet: Quotation of the day for Wednesday, December 16, 2016.
