2016-12-16.abstract: This all-male troupe, on point, merges the absurd and the adorable, as it has for decades on stages around the world.
2016-12-16.snippet: This all-male troupe, on point, merges the absurd and the adorable, as it has for decades on stages around the world.
2016-12-16.lead_paragraph: Ballet is a completely absurd art — and we love it to pieces: that’s what Les Ballets Trockadero de Monte Carlo proclaims with every move. The divas and cavaliers of this all-male troupe are — as they present themselves to us in performance — fabulously stupid, artificial, hammy, clichéd, superficial, dated, monstrous. But they simply adore dancing and their audiences, even more than they love makeup and costumes. So, while you laugh at their demented antics, you find yourself watching them with a special tenderness. You’re on their side.
2016-12-16.headline_main: Review: The Trocks Delight With Fabulous Charm

2016-12-16.abstract: A welder and union official who became a mediator under two presidents, Mr. Usery reached deals for railway and postal workers, coal miners and football players.
2016-12-16.snippet: A welder and union official who became a mediator under two presidents, Mr. Usery reached deals for railway and postal workers, coal miners and football players.
2016-12-16.lead_paragraph: Bill Usery, an indefatigable and gregarious negotiator who helped avert or settle strikes by railway and postal workers, coal miners and football players as a federal mediator and as the secretary of labor under President Gerald R. Ford, died on Saturday in Eatonton, Ga. He was 92.
2016-12-16.headline_main: Bill Usery, Who Settled Wide Range of Labor Disputes, Dies at 92

2016-12-16.abstract: Two grand juries in Manhattan are hearing testimony in federal and state investigations into Mayor Bill de Blasio’s fund-raising, people with knowledge of the matters said.
2016-12-16.snippet: Two grand juries in Manhattan are hearing testimony in federal and state investigations into Mayor Bill de Blasio’s fund-raising, people with knowledge of the matters said.
2016-12-16.lead_paragraph: Two separate grand juries in Manhattan have begun hearing testimony in connection with federal and state criminal investigations into Mayor Bill de Blasio’s campaign fund-raising, according to several people with knowledge of the matters.
2016-12-16.headline_main: Grand Juries Said to Hear Testimony on Inquiries Into de Blasio Fund-Raising

2016-12-16.abstract: The announcement brings the threat of a federal lawsuit into a controversy in a California county where some murder convictions have already been overturned.
2016-12-16.snippet: The announcement brings the threat of a federal lawsuit into a controversy in a California county where some murder convictions have already been overturned.
2016-12-16.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — The Department of Justice opened a civil rights investigation on Thursday into whether the Orange County district attorney’s office improperly used jailhouse informants and withheld evidence.
2016-12-16.headline_main: U.S. Examines Whether Orange County Violated Defendants’ Rights

2016-12-16.abstract: Many top editors say that stolen documents are fair game for coverage when they’re newsworthy, but others argue that such coverage only helps hackers.
2016-12-16.snippet: Many top editors say that stolen documents are fair game for coverage when they’re newsworthy, but others argue that such coverage only helps hackers.
2016-12-16.lead_paragraph: When WikiLeaks and other websites published troves of hacked emails from the Democratic National Committee and Hillary Clinton’s campaign during the final months of the presidential election, the American news media enthusiastically seized on the documents to illuminate the inner workings of a political party and its standard-bearer.
2016-12-16.headline_main: Editors Defend Coverage of Stolen Emails After News of Russian Hacks

2016-12-16.abstract: A security researcher says hackers are offering records of more than 1 billion users, but as with the company’s stock, the price is dropping.
2016-12-16.snippet: A security researcher says hackers are offering records of more than 1 billion users, but as with the company’s stock, the price is dropping.
2016-12-16.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Some time around August 2013, hackers penetrated the email system of Yahoo, one of the world’s largest and oldest providers of free email services. The attackers quietly scooped up the records of more than 1 billion users, including names, birth dates, phone numbers and passwords that were encrypted with an easily broken form of security.
2016-12-16.headline_main: Hacked Yahoo Data Is for Sale on Dark Web

2016-12-16.abstract: A collaboration between Martin Ashwood-Smith and George Barany.
2016-12-16.snippet: A collaboration between Martin Ashwood-Smith and George Barany.
2016-12-16.lead_paragraph: FRIDAY PUZZLE — Martin Ashwood-Smith, also known as He Who Builds Quad Stacks, is back with a collaboration with George Barany, and today they offer us a 16x15 grid that has been stretched a bit. They’ve done this to up the long-entry ante with an additional pair of 15-letter entries, the second of which made me laugh out loud. Last. Because it was at the bottom of the grid.
2016-12-16.headline_main: Calling the Shots

2016-12-16.abstract: The university’s decision to suspend the season of the men’s swimming and diving team was made after the discovery of material that was “vulgar and offensive as well as misogynistic and racist.”
2016-12-16.snippet: The university’s decision to suspend the season of the men’s swimming and diving team was made after the discovery of material that was “vulgar and offensive as well as misogynistic and racist.”
2016-12-16.lead_paragraph: Princeton University suspended the season of its men’s swimming and diving team after the discovery of material on its electronic mailing list that was “vulgar and offensive as well as misogynistic and racist,” the university said Thursday.
2016-12-16.headline_main: Princeton Is Latest Ivy League School to Suspend Team Over Vulgar Materials

2016-12-16.abstract: It was Mr. Trump’s first reference to such an American role in Syria’s civil war since the election, and it came amid a humanitarian catastrophe in Aleppo.
2016-12-16.snippet: It was Mr. Trump’s first reference to such an American role in Syria’s civil war since the election, and it came amid a humanitarian catastrophe in Aleppo.
2016-12-16.lead_paragraph: HERSHEY, Pa. — President-elect Donald J. Trump said on Thursday that the United States would create “safe zones” in Syria, his first reference to such an American role in the war there since he was elected, and one that comes as the Syrian government has all but recaptured the rebel stronghold of Aleppo.
2016-12-16.headline_main: ‘It’s So Sad,’ Donald Trump Says of Syria, Promising ‘Safe Zones’

2016-12-16.abstract: After the mayor was fined, the City Council passed a bill restricting outside nonprofit political groups that was aimed at a group he had created.
2016-12-16.snippet: After the mayor was fined, the City Council passed a bill restricting outside nonprofit political groups that was aimed at a group he had created.

2016-12-16.snippet: The university’s team is protesting the suspension of 10 players in connection with a sexual assault investigation.

2016-12-16.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President-elect Donald J. Trump on Thursday named David M. Friedman, a bankruptcy lawyer aligned with the Israeli far right, as his nominee for ambassador to Israel, elevating a campaign adviser who has questioned the need for a two-state solution and has likened left-leaning Jews in America to the Jews who aided the Nazis in the Holocaust.

2016-12-16.abstract: Francesco Totti, a native Roman, has spent his entire career with A.S. Roma: 23 years and counting. He hopes to end his playing days in a Roma jersey.
2016-12-16.snippet: Francesco Totti, a native Roman, has spent his entire career with A.S. Roma: 23 years and counting. He hopes to end his playing days in a Roma jersey.
2016-12-16.lead_paragraph: ROME — Armed with spray cans, the vandals last descended on Via della Madonna dei Monti, a dead-end alley not far from the Colosseum, about six months ago. They come to this corner of Rome quite often, according to the street’s weary residents. They are sick of seeing their walls daubed with slogans, but they are resigned to it now.
2016-12-16.headline_main: A Roman to the Core, and the Core of Roma

2016-12-16.abstract: Since 1932, the business has been a place for craftsmanship and camaraderie for its loyal customers.
2016-12-16.snippet: Since 1932, the business has been a place for craftsmanship and camaraderie for its loyal customers.
2016-12-16.lead_paragraph: On a recent Thursday afternoon, Jim’s Shoe Repair, at 50 East 59th Street between Park and Madison, was packed. Customers — surrounded by old-school shoeshine chairs with brass pedestals and other objects from bygone eras like an oversize gold register from the 1940s — waited to speak with Joe Rocco, 58, or his son Andrew Rocco, 27. Interactions were unhurried and convivial.
2016-12-16.headline_main: Old-School Charm at Jim’s Shoe Repair

2016-12-16.snippet: More than 300 House members expressed concern about the proposal, which would have used reimbursement formulas different from those in federal Medicare law.
2016-12-16.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Obama administration said on Thursday that it had scrapped one of its most significant efforts to rein in spending on prescription drugs: a plan for a nationwide experiment in which Medicare would have reduced payments for many drugs given to patients in doctors’ offices and hospital clinics.
2016-12-16.headline_main: Plan to Reduce Medicare Drug Costs Is Withdrawn After Bipartisan Criticism

2016-12-16.lead_paragraph: OAKLAND, Calif. — Carmelo Anthony is 32 years old. By conventional actuarial tables, he is in the prime of his adult life. In N.B.A. terms, however, Anthony is grizzled beyond his years — a fact that was thrown into sharper relief Thursday, when the Knicks announced hours before tipoff that he would sit out the team’s marquee matchup against the Golden State Warriors.
2016-12-16.headline_main: Golden State Warriors Take Advantage of Carmelo-Less Knicks

2016-12-16.headline_main: Enough Conflicts to Fill the White House

2016-12-16.abstract: The president-elect appears much less interested in preventing blockbuster mergers that limit competition than he was during the campaign.
2016-12-16.snippet: The president-elect appears much less interested in preventing blockbuster mergers that limit competition than he was during the campaign.
2016-12-16.lead_paragraph: During the campaign, Donald Trump railed against powerful corporations and promised to prevent  blockbuster mergers like the proposed $85.4 billion deal between AT&T and Time Warner. That was then. Since the election, Mr. Trump has been decidedly less interested in constraining the power of big companies, especially those in the telecommunications industry.
2016-12-16.headline_main: Expect a Cozy Trump-Telecom Alliance

2016-12-16.abstract: He needs a jolt several times a day, and he gives it back to you. It’s a dangerous codependency.
2016-12-16.snippet: He needs a jolt several times a day, and he gives it back to you. It’s a dangerous codependency.
2016-12-16.lead_paragraph: You would think forcing Mitt Romney to eat frog legs, while swallowing his dignity, would have been enough humiliation during the dinner segment of his failed tryout for secretary of state. You would think.
2016-12-16.headline_main: The Narcotic of Trump

2016-12-16.abstract: Russia got lots of help in the United States hacking the election.
2016-12-16.snippet: Russia got lots of help in the United States hacking the election.
2016-12-16.lead_paragraph: On Wednesday an editorial in The Times described Donald Trump as a “useful idiot” serving Russian interests. That may not be exactly right. After all, useful idiots are supposed to be unaware of how they’re being used, but Mr. Trump probably knows very well how much he owes to Vladimir Putin. Remember, he once openly appealed to the Russians to hack Hillary Clinton’s emails.
2016-12-16.headline_main: Useful Idiots Galore

2016-12-16.abstract: The sharing economy isn’t really about sharing. So what do we call it?
2016-12-16.snippet: The sharing economy isn’t really about sharing. So what do we call it?
2016-12-16.lead_paragraph: It’s a hip, fast-growing sector of the economy, filled with headline-grabbing companies: Uber, Lyft, Airbnb, Task Rabbit. But there’s a gnawing problem: People aren’t sure what to call it. Many critics dislike the term most commonly used, the “sharing economy,” because there often isn’t much actual sharing going on. Others prefer to call it the on-demand economy, peer-to-peer economy, crowd-based economy, gig economy or collaborative economy.
2016-12-16.headline_main: The Whatchamacallit Economy

2016-12-16.abstract: With norms weakening, past stability is no guarantee of our government’s future survival.
2016-12-16.snippet: With norms weakening, past stability is no guarantee of our government’s future survival.
2016-12-16.lead_paragraph: Donald J. Trump’s election has raised a question that few Americans ever imagined asking: Is our democracy in danger? With the possible exception of the Civil War, American democracy has never collapsed; indeed, no democracy as rich or as established as America’s ever has. Yet past stability is no guarantee of democracy’s future survival.
2016-12-16.headline_main: Is Donald Trump a Threat to Democracy?

2016-12-16.abstract: By advocating around a problem that Mayor Bill de Blasio has seemed so ineffective in mitigating, Ms. Quinn has put herself in a position to mount a new challenge.
2016-12-16.snippet: By advocating around a problem that Mayor Bill de Blasio has seemed so ineffective in mitigating, Ms. Quinn has put herself in a position to mount a new challenge.
2016-12-16.lead_paragraph: On Sept. 11, 2013, Christine C. Quinn, who had just suffered a rough and at one time entirely unimaginable defeat in New York City’s Democratic primary race for mayor, headed downtown to the National September 11 Memorial and turned off her phone. A few hours later, she realized she had missed several calls from Hillary Clinton’s office. Mrs. Clinton had phoned to extend her sympathies to a female candidate who had received only 16 percent of the vote among women, had been criticized for an abrasive demeanor, a grating voice, a poorly managed campaign and a failure to telegraph a resonant message that could speak to the fear and disgust surrounding the rise in economic inequality. Only in the rear view, of course, do we see this as preamble.
2016-12-16.headline_main: With Homeless Issue, Christine Quinn Gets Back in the Conversation

2016-12-16.abstract: Building a new home on the land where family members were killed.
2016-12-16.snippet: Building a new home on the land where family members were killed.
2016-12-16.lead_paragraph: Many assumed I died in the massacre of December 1981, when government soldiers killed hundreds of people in El Mozote, my village in El Salvador. The victims were accused of collaborating with left-wing guerrillas, but most of them were women, children and old people. Soldiers tortured my family, poured gasoline on them and set my childhood home on fire. But I survived, because I was in San Salvador, working and studying for my accounting degree. It was only years later that I had thoughts of moving back.
2016-12-16.headline_main: A Grim Discovery in El Mozote

2016-12-16.abstract: How can we trust him in our homes when he won’t even release his birth certificate?
2016-12-16.snippet: How can we trust him in our homes when he won’t even release his birth certificate?
2016-12-16.lead_paragraph: Spencer writes: I believe that Santa Claus is an elf. In “The Night Before Christmas,” Santa is described as “a right jolly old elf.” He is also said to travel by “miniature sleigh” led by “eight tiny reindeer,” suggesting he is elf-size. My co-worker Elena believes, as many others do, that Santa is a kind of superpowered human. Who is right?
2016-12-16.headline_main: Judge John Hodgman on Santa Claus Conspiracies

2016-12-16.abstract: Strengthen the back and shoulders. Be willing to battle for little to no glory.
2016-12-16.snippet: Strengthen the back and shoulders. Be willing to battle for little to no glory.
2016-12-16.lead_paragraph: “You need a thick wrist and a big hand and a long forearm,” says Kent Damore, a 27-year veteran of “pulling,” which is what the pros call arm-wrestling. Endurance also plays a big role. “Cardio helps a lot,” he adds. “Thirty seconds of arm-wrestling is equivalent to a round of boxing.” He recommends starting with hand- and wrist-strengthening exercises like fingertip pull ups and push ups, as well as wrist curls.
2016-12-16.headline_main: How to Arm Wrestle

2016-12-16.abstract: Selected by Matthew Zapruder.
2016-12-16.snippet: Selected by Matthew Zapruder.
2016-12-16.lead_paragraph: As the title indicates, this poem is an erasure of Florida’s Stand Your Ground law. The poet has eliminated most of the law’s existing text, leaving phrases, words and even parts of words in order to locate within the statute a kind of ghost poem. Such erasures can reveal a deeper poetic truth within texts never designed to be poetry. Selected by Matthew Zapruder.
2016-12-16.headline_main: Home Force, Presumption of Death ...

2016-12-16.abstract: Homes close to city centers and mass transit stations are selling faster than ones farther afield.
2016-12-16.snippet: Homes close to city centers and mass transit stations are selling faster than ones farther afield.
2016-12-16.lead_paragraph: Andrew and Jeanine Gillette wanted to bring a bit of city living with them when they decamped to the suburbs from a two-bedroom rental in Manhattan late last year. For more than $1.6 million, they bought a six-bedroom house close to the main shopping streets and in walking distance of a Long Island Rail Road station in Garden City, on Long Island.
2016-12-16.headline_main: Suburban Buyers Ask: Can I Walk to Town?

2016-12-16.lead_paragraph: In most countries, sleeping on the job isn’t just frowned upon, it may get you fired.

2016-12-16.abstract: A woman fleeing Aleppo, Syria, goes unmentioned in a caption, but not unnoticed by readers. And a student’s violent threat appears to be equated in severity with criticism of racism.
2016-12-16.snippet: A woman fleeing Aleppo, Syria, goes unmentioned in a caption, but not unnoticed by readers. And a student’s violent threat appears to be equated in severity with criticism of racism.
2016-12-16.lead_paragraph: This week, the mailbag has gone international. We’ll begin in Aleppo, where a pro-Syrian government offensive was forcing civilians to flee. The Times captured the ongoing escape with the lead photo of the Dec. 13 issue carrying the caption: “A man fleeing to rebel-held areas of Aleppo, Syria, on Monday, carrying a child with an IV drip.” Readers took issue with the fact that the caption did not note the woman in the photo.
2016-12-16.headline_main: Friday Mailbag: The Veil, Storm Troopers and False Equivalence

2016-12-16.abstract: In 2016, designers formerly on the fringe were invited into the establishment. And they brought the fringe with them.
2016-12-16.snippet: In 2016, designers formerly on the fringe were invited into the establishment. And they brought the fringe with them.
2016-12-16.lead_paragraph: Seating was limited at the most anticipated fashion show of 2016, as you would expect. The invitations, printed primly with each attendee’s name and affiliation, no larger than a pack of gum and eminently lose-able in the dark hole of a handbag, were in short supply. If there was a no-show or an empty seat in the padded television studio where Demna Gvasalia was showing his first collection for Balenciaga, I didn’t see it.
2016-12-16.headline_main: When It Became Cool to Be Cool

2016-12-16.snippet: New multifamily developments outside New York are changing the yard-and-picket-fence image of commuter towns and villages.
2016-12-16.lead_paragraph: Some suburbs around New York City are becoming decidedly less suburban, as new apartment buildings and condominium communities close to mass transit help expand the downtowns of these villages and towns. Multifamily housing is also popping up near highways and main thoroughfares.
2016-12-16.headline_main: The New Suburbia: More Urban

The red rectangles, one for each factory, overlapped one another like badly laid mosaic tiles.

An assistant attorney general for Tennessee, he applies the same level of meticulousness to leisurely excursions as he does to his casework. 2016-12-16.lead_paragraph: There’s wood-fired pizza, lots of fried snacks and house-made pasta. But there’s also seafood, a sexy absinthe bar and sleek décor. It is a place vibrant enough for a happy hour pop-in, yet intimate enough for after-dark canoodling over caviar and cocktails. Waypoint, whose name means a stopping point in a journey, is all of these things — and a destination unto itself.

2016-12-16.lead_paragraph: One night in 2001, when she was just 15, Jessie Della Femina threw what was meant to be a private party at her Hamptons home. The precocious Ms. Della Femina was a fashion upstart who that summer ran a trunk show with a friend, who had diabetes, to raise money for research. She ended up with a clothing line in more than 300 stores.
2016-12-16.headline_main: Of All the Taco Bells in All the Towns ...

2016-12-16.snippet: The United States will be agnostic on human rights, freedom and democracy.

2016-12-16.abstract: A Illinois rule taking effect on Jan. 1 will require salon workers to train to recognize the signs of abuse and assault.
2016-12-16.snippet: A Illinois rule taking effect on Jan. 1 will require salon workers to train to recognize the signs of abuse and assault.
2016-12-16.lead_paragraph: In the two decades that Angela Smith has been a hairstylist in Chicago, she has heard countless intimate stories from the women who have sat in her chair. Most times the banter is carefree. But sometimes, there are whispers of mistreatment by spouses or partners, of being choked, chased or emotionally abused.
2016-12-16.headline_main: A New Front Against Domestic Abuse: The Hairstylist’s Chair

2016-12-16.abstract: The actress, who plays a crack-addicted mother in the film, had concerns about a potentially clichéd role, but the director’s approach reassured her.
2016-12-16.snippet: The actress, who plays a crack-addicted mother in the film, had concerns about a potentially clichéd role, but the director’s approach reassured her.
2016-12-16.lead_paragraph: Barry Jenkins has drawn tremendous reviews (and the top spot on a number of year’s best lists) for his tender film “Moonlight,” about a young black boy, Chiron, who is gay, growing up in the impoverished Liberty City neighborhood of Miami. One of the performers singled out for extra praise is Naomie Harris, who plays Chiron’s crack-addicted mother, Paula.
2016-12-16.headline_main: Naomie Harris Explains How ‘Moonlight’ Avoided Crack-Addict Stereotypes

2016-12-16.abstract: To the rest of the world, the election of Donald Trump feels like a sudden plunge after a gradual decline.
2016-12-16.snippet: To the rest of the world, the election of Donald Trump feels like a sudden plunge after a gradual decline.
2016-12-16.lead_paragraph: SYDNEY, Australia — On the other side of the world from you, we are living in two time zones. One regulated by the rise and fall of the sun, the other regulated by the American news cycle. In our early afternoon you go to bed, in our late evening you wake again and news breaks afresh. We examine the entrails of the tweets of your president-elect for news of our common future.
2016-12-16.headline_main: Dear America, Why Did You Let Us Down?

2016-12-16.lead_paragraph: This is not a guilt trip. Pile the presents to the sky, by all means.

2016-12-16.abstract: Businesses find it useful to have experienced hands who can train younger staff. And those workers get to stay active as they ease into retirement.
2016-12-16.snippet: Businesses find it useful to have experienced hands who can train younger staff. And those workers get to stay active as they ease into retirement.
2016-12-16.lead_paragraph: CALL them boomerang retirees: people who exit gracefully after their career at a company, then return shortly afterward to work there part time.

2016-12-16.abstract: The talks between President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia and Prime Minister Shinzo Abe of Japan yielded little, other than details of business deals that had already been announced.
2016-12-16.snippet: The talks between President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia and Prime Minister Shinzo Abe of Japan yielded little, other than details of business deals that had already been announced.
2016-12-16.lead_paragraph: TOKYO — The Japanese news media gave breathless coverage to President Vladimir V. Putin’s two-day visit to Japan this week, training television cameras on the airport in Yamaguchi Prefecture where the Russian leader arrived more than two hours late. Schoolchildren in Nagato, Prime Minister Shinzo Abe’s hometown, ate borscht and piroshki in honor of Mr. Putin’s trip to hot spring baths there. In Tokyo on Friday, Kodokan, the premier judo school, received the Russian leader, a black belt, for a demonstration and a meeting with Olympic medalists.
2016-12-16.headline_main: Meeting Between Japan and Russia Ends With Stalemate on Disputed Islands

2016-12-16.abstract: Travelers are booking trips after the World Health Organization said that the virus was no longer a global health emergency.
2016-12-16.snippet: Travelers are booking trips after the World Health Organization said that the virus was no longer a global health emergency.
2016-12-16.lead_paragraph: For hotels in the Caribbean and Mexico, the news came in time for their peak season: On Nov. 18, the World Health Organization declared that Zika was no longer a global health emergency and should be considered a dangerous mosquito-borne virus.
2016-12-16.headline_main: Zika Fears Fading, Renewed Interest in Caribbean and Mexico

2016-12-16.abstract: Friday: A foul odor on the coast, a federal inquiry into the Orange County district attorney’s office, and another mountain lion becomes roadkill.

2016-12-16.abstract: In “The Book of Joy,” No. 14 in hardcover nonfiction, the Dalai Lama and Desmond Tutu conclude: “The human drama is often a comedy, and laughter is the saving grace.”
2016-12-16.snippet: In “The Book of Joy,” No. 14 in hardcover nonfiction, the Dalai Lama and Desmond Tutu conclude: “The human drama is often a comedy, and laughter is the saving grace.”
2016-12-16.lead_paragraph: Merry Happy: “A Buddhist, a Christian and a Jew walk into a bar,” Douglas Abrams writes in his introduction to “The Book of Joy,” a dialogue between the Dalai Lama and Archbishop Desmond Tutu that has spent eight weeks so far on the hardcover nonfiction list. (It’s currently No. 14.) Abrams, who conceived and helped write the book, is taking some liberties here in the name of comedy — he actually identifies as secular despite his Jewish roots, and the participants really met not in a bar but in the Dalai Lama’s residence in Dharamsala, India, over the course of a week last year. But when the subject is joy, a little humor is allowed. “See if you can chuckle at your problem, at your shortcomings, at your frailties,” the book advises toward the end. “Even if it is a very grave or serious situation, there is often some humor that can be found. The human drama is often a comedy, and laughter is the saving grace.” (O.K., so those sentences are themselves strikingly earnest and humorless. But do as they say, not as they do.)
2016-12-16.headline_main: The Story Behind This Week’s Best Sellers

2016-12-16.lead_paragraph: Good morning. On this day in 1985, the mafia boss Paul Castellano and his protégé Thomas Bilotti were shot dead in front of Sparks Steak House on East 46th Street, an execution that cleared the way to power for the lieutenant who ordered the hit, John Gotti. Some time later, the restaurateur Ben Benson put up this poster in the bar of his own steakhouse on West 52nd Street, now closed. “Eat at Ben Benson’s,” it reads, over a photograph of Bilotti lying dead in the street in front of Sparks. “It won’t kill you.”
2016-12-16.headline_main: What to Cook This Weekend

2016-12-16.lead_paragraph: The premise of “The OA,” which debuts today on Netflix, is irresistible: A blind woman, gone missing from her suburban town seven years ago, suddenly returns with her sight restored. She’s started calling herself “the OA,” and she won’t tell anyone what’s happened to her, except a motley group of four teenage boys and their middle-aged teacher. To reveal any more would be a disservice — the show hinges on very deliberate dissemination of information — but suffice it to say that its plot is labyrinthine, compulsively compelling and often absolutely bonkers.

When production work came with a union card, it was a relatively high-paying career. But it was not welcoming to women.

2016-12-16.lead_paragraph: Nine out of 85 foreign feature movies have landed on the shortlist for the 2017 Oscars, the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences announced Thursday. While the festival favorite, Germany’s “Toni Erdmann,” made the cut as expected, a few heavily promoted and celebrated films did not, including, most surprisingly, France’s entry, “Elle,” directed by Paul Verhoeven and starring Isabelle Huppert — who has collected several awards and nominations for her performance. Other unexpected omissions are the Chilean entry, Pablo Larraín’s “Neruda,” and Pedro Almodóvar’s “Julieta.”
2016-12-16.headline_main: Oscars 2017: ‘Toni Erdmann’ Makes the Foreign-Language Shortlist; ‘Elle’ Is Snubbed

2016-12-16.abstract: A select list of holiday classics and non-classics. But, please remember, “Zombie Lake” is not a Christmas movie.
2016-12-16.snippet: A select list of holiday classics and non-classics. But, please remember, “Zombie Lake” is not a Christmas movie.
2016-12-16.lead_paragraph: Before the recommendations, an anecdote: Beginning my research for this column, I searched Amazon Video using the term “Christmas Movies.” About 20 pages in, I saw “Zombie Lake” listed. Now, “Zombie Lake” is an unusually tatty 1981 film by the director Jean Rollin (whose best work, of which this is not an example, is grisly and poetic with a lot of erotic obsessiveness) about dead German soldiers who rise out of a lake where they’d been dumped by the French Resistance fighters who’d killed them. It is not good (even Rollin nuts rate it low), but I checked it out again to see if there was some Christmas or holiday theme I’d missed before. No dice. There’s a brief winter battle scene, atrociously cut into a narrative that takes place largely when trees are in bloom, but that’s it.
2016-12-16.headline_main: O.K., Who Put the Nazi Zombie Under the Tree?

2016-12-16.abstract: There’s a perverse symmetry to the way things work in Federico Axat’s mind-bending psychological thriller “Kill the Next One.”
2016-12-16.snippet: There’s a perverse symmetry to the way things work in Federico Axat’s mind-bending psychological thriller “Kill the Next One.”
2016-12-16.lead_paragraph: It sometimes seems as if there’s a support group for every lost soul on our planet. In KILL THE NEXT ONE (Mulholland/Little, Brown, $26), we’re even introduced to a source of reinforcement for would-be suicides. There’s a perverse symmetry to the way things work in this mind-bending psychological thriller by the Argentine author Federico Axat, translated here by David Frye. Let’s say that someone like Ted McKay, who has just learned he has an inoperable brain tumor, decides to kill himself. A shadowy organization (known as the Organization) will send someone like Justin Lynch to his door with the suggestion that he first take out two other people — one a vicious killer who has eluded justice and the other a sad sack like himself who wants only to die. (“He knows all about it; he’ll be waiting for you.”)
2016-12-16.headline_main: The Best and Latest in Crime Fiction

2016-12-16.abstract: Two decades after graduation, a college a cappella group harmonizes to celebrate the success of a member.
2016-12-16.snippet: Two decades after graduation, a college a cappella group harmonizes to celebrate the success of a member.
2016-12-16.lead_paragraph: I don’t exactly spread this around, for obvious reasons, but I sang in a coed a cappella group in college. We knew enough to mock it, but we also all loved it, and yes, God save me, on more than one occasion we spontaneously broke out in six-part harmony, unbidden, at a fast-food restaurant. Despite such acts of deep earnestness, we considered ourselves the irreverent a cappella group on campus, at Yale; we liked to stop in the middle of the first song of our set and send my friend Jen, a tiny, beautiful soprano, out to the front of the stage to tell the audience a joke: “My boyfriend says I should tell him whenever I have an orgasm. But he’s never there. So why bother?” She’s now a cantor outside Philadelphia.
2016-12-16.headline_main: Singing Together Again at a Broadway Reunion

2016-12-16.headline_main: Wedged and Softened to Fit in on the Upper West Side

2016-12-16.snippet: For Hasan Minhaj, braving the city’s real estate market was the biggest challenge in his move from Los Angeles.
2016-12-16.lead_paragraph: When the actor and comedian Hasan Minhaj was hired as a correspondent on “The Daily Show” in late 2014, the new job meant moving from Los Angeles to New York, where he and his wife, Beena, live in a sleek one-bedroom rental in Hell’s Kitchen. It also meant the purchase of wholly unfamiliar clothing.
2016-12-16.headline_main: A ‘Daily Show’ Correspondent Adjusts to Life in New York

2016-12-16.snippet: Sooner or later, we all return to the highest honor our nation bestows: being a good citizen.
2016-12-16.lead_paragraph: Washington — Once, I occupied a prized office in the Rayburn House Office Building, with a commanding view that stretched to the Lincoln Memorial. Now, I occupy Cubicle No. 45, with a decent view of Cubicles 44 and 46.
2016-12-16.headline_main: The Humiliations of Life After Congress

2016-12-16.abstract: The selection of David Friedman, a bankruptcy lawyer with extremist views, is a serious mistake.
2016-12-16.snippet: The selection of David Friedman, a bankruptcy lawyer with extremist views, is a serious mistake.
2016-12-16.lead_paragraph: PRINCETON, N.J. — President-elect Donald J. Trump’s selection of David Friedman as United States ambassador to Israel is a serious mistake that should be rectified. Spoken and published statements by Mr. Friedman, a 57-year-old bankruptcy lawyer in New York, about Israel and American policies in the Mideast suggest he is unsuitable to represent America in one of the most high-pressure diplomatic positions in the world. This call to withdraw Mr. Friedman’s name also reflects a sober assessment of the damage that could be caused to American interests and to Mr. Trump’s presidency by the reckless words for which Mr. Friedman is already known.
2016-12-16.headline_main: Donald Trump’s Israel Ambassador Pick Is Hazardous to Peace

2016-12-16.abstract: The president said he refrained from retaliating against Moscow for hacking the D.N.C. before the election because he did not want it to be seen as unfair meddling.
2016-12-16.snippet: The president said he refrained from retaliating against Moscow for hacking the D.N.C. before the election because he did not want it to be seen as unfair meddling.
2016-12-16.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Obama said for the first time on Friday that he had held back from retaliating against Russia’s meddling in the presidential race for fear of inciting further hacking “that could hamper vote counting.” But he said he was weighing a mix of public and covert actions against the Russians in his last 34 days in office, actions that would increase “the costs for them.”
2016-12-16.headline_main: Obama Says He Told Putin: ‘Cut It Out’ on Hacking

2016-12-16.abstract: Mr. Feinstein’s latest seasonal show, “A Holiday to Remember,” focusing on the Garland songbook, was a bit more somber than usual.
2016-12-16.snippet: Mr. Feinstein’s latest seasonal show, “A Holiday to Remember,” focusing on the Garland songbook, was a bit more somber than usual.
2016-12-16.lead_paragraph: There were no jingling bells, Santa hats or signs of giddy festivity at the opening-night performance of Michael Feinstein’s show, “A Holiday to Remember,” at Feinstein’s/54 Below. This was the most sober evening of seasonal cheer I can recall in the singer’s long-running tradition of annual Christmastime fetes, which in earlier days evoked the glossy bonhomie of TV variety specials.
2016-12-16.headline_main: Review: Michael Feinstein’s Holiday Ode to Judy Garland

2016-12-16.abstract: Why flood a valley, many ask, when there is not much demand for the power it will help generate?
2016-12-16.snippet: Why flood a valley, many ask, when there is not much demand for the power it will help generate?
2016-12-16.lead_paragraph: The expansion of the Trans Mountain pipeline is not the only energy mega-project attracting protests in British Columbia. Our Dan Levin went to the Peace River Valley, where the provincially owned electrical utility in British Columbia plans to spend $7 billion to build a dam and flood about 51 miles of the valley within the decade. The project has raised environmental concerns and has been challenged on constitutional grounds by indigenous groups. But Mr. Levin also found that many people also think the dam, known as Site C, makes no sense when electrical demand is flat and alternative power sources are increasingly feeding the grid.
2016-12-16.headline_main: Canada Today: Energy Project Clash, Christmas Tree Scorn and Rules on Marijuana

2016-12-16.lead_paragraph: RALEIGH, N.C. — Amid a tense and dramatic backdrop of outrage and frustration, North Carolina’s Republican-controlled legislature on Friday approved a sweeping package of restrictions on the power of the governor’s office in advance of the swearing in of the Democratic governor-elect, Roy Cooper.
2016-12-16.headline_main: North Carolina Governor Signs Law Limiting Successor’s Power

2016-12-16.abstract: The German baritone discusses a moment from Mahler’s “Wo die schönen Trompeten blasen” (“Where the fair trumpets sound,” 1898).
2016-12-16.snippet: The German baritone discusses a moment from Mahler’s “Wo die schönen Trompeten blasen” (“Where the fair trumpets sound,” 1898).
2016-12-16.lead_paragraph: The German baritone Christian Gerhaher is the foremost lieder, or art song, singer of our time, able to blend poetic intelligence with endless shadings of vocal color. On Saturday, he returns to Lincoln Center, accompanied by his longtime friend and pianist Gerold Huber. Asked to choose a favorite page from this all-Mahler recital, Mr. Gerhaher selected one that’s special not just for what it says about Mahler but about the art of song more generally.
2016-12-16.headline_main: Christian Gerhaher: Summiting Mount Mahler

2016-12-16.abstract: A look at the photographs that almost made Bill’s column this year, explained by his longtime collaborator.
2016-12-16.snippet: A look at the photographs that almost made Bill’s column this year, explained by his longtime collaborator.
2016-12-16.lead_paragraph: Every Sunday, after Bill had gone to church, I could be sure that my phone would ring. “Kurdewan … Bill Cunningham here,” he would say, as if I didn’t know, every time. Every week we would talk about his pages “On the Street” and “Evening Hours,” and he was always very concerned about whether the reader was getting bored with them. It always amazed me that he would even think that. And every Sunday we would start planning our course for the next week, like how many parties he had to go to (sometimes it was 15 or 16) and which charities he wanted to cover. I would tell him he had to start slowing down, but, of course, he never listened.
2016-12-16.headline_main: Bill Cunningham, Unpublished Photos

2016-12-16.abstract: A budding novelist learns the wisdom of taking a chance on wacky opportunities.
2016-12-16.snippet: A budding novelist learns the wisdom of taking a chance on wacky opportunities.
2016-12-16.lead_paragraph: After graduate school, I moved back to Boston, where I’d spent my undergraduate years. I’d just earned a master’s degree in creative writing from Stanford University and was pumped with literary ambition.
2016-12-16.headline_main: When a Writing Opportunity Knocks, Answer

2016-12-16.abstract: More than 30 teams of filmmakers have turned up to document the protests, the Sioux say, and some are neither Native American nor all that respectful.
2016-12-16.snippet: More than 30 teams of filmmakers have turned up to document the protests, the Sioux say, and some are neither Native American nor all that respectful.
2016-12-16.lead_paragraph: As the Standing Rock protest against the Dakota Access Pipeline has gone from bad to worse to hopeful to tentative, dozens of documentarians have descended on the Sioux reservation — 34 teams, according to the tribal database. And while it’s no longer uncommon for major news events to attract multiple filmmakers, some members of the horde in North Dakota seemed to need a lesson in where they were.
2016-12-16.headline_main: ‘Respect the Feathers’: Who Tells Standing Rock’s Story?

2016-12-16.abstract: Financial wrongdoing dropped — and stayed down — at companies that were subject to investigations, a new study shows.
2016-12-16.snippet: Financial wrongdoing dropped — and stayed down — at companies that were subject to investigations, a new study shows.
2016-12-16.lead_paragraph: For those who doubt that whistle-blowers are a force for good in corporate America — and yes, such skeptics exist — a new study out of the University of Iowa could not be more important. It demonstrates for the first time that financial shenanigans at companies decrease markedly in the years after truth tellers come forward with information about wrongdoing inside their operations.
2016-12-16.headline_main: Whistle-Blowers Spur Companies to Change Their Ways

2016-12-16.abstract: The New York City Education Department said it would close Junior High School 162 Lola Rodriguez de Tio, one of the lowest-performing schools in the state.
2016-12-16.snippet: The New York City Education Department said it would close Junior High School 162 Lola Rodriguez de Tio, one of the lowest-performing schools in the state.
2016-12-16.lead_paragraph: The New York City Education Department said on Friday that it planned to close Junior High School 162 Lola Rodriguez de Tio in the South Bronx, which has been among the lowest-performing schools in New York State for a decade.
2016-12-16.headline_main: New York City to Close ‘Persistently Struggling’ School in the South Bronx

2016-12-16.abstract: With a new C.E.O., a company that had remained steadfastly mum in the face of complaints now shows an openness to discussing them.
2016-12-16.snippet: With a new C.E.O., a company that had remained steadfastly mum in the face of complaints now shows an openness to discussing them.
2016-12-16.lead_paragraph: Remember Conn’s? It’s the appliance and furniture chain, based in Texas, that refused to speak to the Haggler when, in the summer of 2014, he tried to intervene on behalf of an unhappy customer.

2016-12-16.abstract: Jurors will be able to watch almost all of an 11-hour video of the police questioning Angelika Graswald, who is charged with the 2015 murder of her fiancé.
2016-12-16.snippet: Jurors will be able to watch almost all of an 11-hour video of the police questioning Angelika Graswald, who is charged with the 2015 murder of her fiancé.
2016-12-16.lead_paragraph: GOSHEN, N.Y. — The judge in the case of a woman accused of killing her fiancé during a kayak outing will allow jurors to watch virtually all of an 11-hour police interrogation video in which the defendant, Angelika Graswald, makes a series of incriminating statements.

2016-12-16.abstract: The subjugation of eastern Aleppo by Bashar al-Assad, the Syrian president, has proved the effectiveness of violence and highlighted the reluctance of many countries to step in.
2016-12-16.snippet: The subjugation of eastern Aleppo by Bashar al-Assad, the Syrian president, has proved the effectiveness of violence and highlighted the reluctance of many countries to step in.

2016-12-16.abstract: Representative Mick Mulvaney is a fierce advocate of deep spending cuts and helped found the House Freedom Caucus, the group of conservative lawmakers who pushed for Speaker John A. Boehner to resign.

2016-12-17.abstract: He intervened with two comrades to halt the massacre of unarmed Vietnamese civilians by United States soldiers in 1968.
2016-12-17.snippet: He intervened with two comrades to halt the massacre of unarmed Vietnamese civilians by United States soldiers in 1968.
2016-12-17.lead_paragraph: Larry Colburn, who became an 18-year-old American hero when he intervened with two comrades to halt the massacre of unarmed Vietnamese civilians by United States soldiers in 1968, elevating an innocuous hamlet named My Lai into a watchword for the horrors of war, died on Tuesday at his home in Canton, Ga. He was 67.
2016-12-17.headline_main: Larry Colburn, Who Helped Stop My Lai Massacre, Dies at 67

Putin, the Russian president. It also coincided with a growing belief, in Moscow, that Russia faced an imminent threat in Hillary Clinton’s candidacy.

2016-12-17.abstract: Their numbers have swelled past 50 percent, but it’s less clear whether that will lead to an advantage in the profession.
2016-12-17.snippet: Their numbers have swelled past 50 percent, but it’s less clear whether that will lead to an advantage in the profession.

2016-12-17.abstract: Mr. Tudyk’s character is a scene stealer with his British accent and devil-may-care attitude. He’s not bad on stilts, either.
2016-12-17.snippet: Mr. Tudyk’s character is a scene stealer with his British accent and devil-may-care attitude. He’s not bad on stilts, either.
2016-12-17.lead_paragraph: You may not have seen much of the actor Alan Tudyk’s face, but if you’ve been watching Disney movies lately, you’ve heard a lot of his voice. He has been behind characters in “Wreck-It Ralph,” “Frozen,” “Big Hero Six,” “Zootopia” and “Moana.”
2016-12-17.headline_main: The Man Who Gave an Android His Best Lines in the ‘Star Wars’ Film ‘Rogue One’

2016-12-17.abstract: Chapman, whom the Yankees have reacquired, was particularly bothered by having to start the ninth inning of Game 6 of the World Series, a game the Cubs were leading by 9-2.
2016-12-17.snippet: Chapman, whom the Yankees have reacquired, was particularly bothered by having to start the ninth inning of Game 6 of the World Series, a game the Cubs were leading by 9-2.

2016-12-17.abstract: Tulane apologized to 130 early-decision applicants but indicated that those students would not receive special consideration for admittance.
2016-12-17.snippet: Tulane apologized to 130 early-decision applicants but indicated that those students would not receive special consideration for admittance.
2016-12-17.lead_paragraph: Alyssa was in her high school health class around midday Wednesday when she got the email welcoming her to Tulane University and giving her a college email address. In a grueling college admissions season, it was her first-choice university, and she had applied early decision, meaning she was committed to the place.
2016-12-17.headline_main: Agony as Tulane Applicants Learn Acceptance Emails Are in Error

2016-12-17.abstract: The university president met with the team regarding the suspensions of 10 players over a sexual assault investigation.
2016-12-17.snippet: The university president met with the team regarding the suspensions of 10 players over a sexual assault investigation.
2016-12-17.lead_paragraph: The University of Minnesota’s president met with the football team late Friday, a day after the players had pledged to boycott a bowl game unless the university lifted the suspensions of 10 teammates related to a sexual assault investigation.

2016-12-17.abstract: Quotation of the day for Saturday, December 17, 2016.
2016-12-17.snippet: Quotation of the day for Saturday, December 17, 2016.
2016-12-17.lead_paragraph: “We are well beyond normal political concerns here. This is about the integrity of our democracy and the security of our nation.”

2016-12-17.abstract: Thousands of notes lining the wall of a Manhattan subway station will be kept by the New-York Historical Society.

2016-12-17.lead_paragraph: The thousands of sticky notes lining a subway station wall in Manhattan bearing messages about the 2016 presidential race came down on Friday, marking the end of one of the most significant public expressions of emotion in response to the election results.

2016-12-17.abstract: Uber said it had no intention of ending a new test of its self-driving vehicles in San Francisco, even though the state said it was illegal.

2016-12-17.lead_paragraph: The public has long been wary of used cars and the claims of roadworthiness by the dealers who sell them. On Friday, the nation’s main advertising regulator issued a ruling that consumer groups complained will give used-car dealers too much leeway in the disclosures they are required to make.
2016-12-17.headline_main: Buyer Beware: ‘Certified’ Used Cars May Still Be Under Recall

2016-12-17.snippet: From Vermont to Chicago, the first Arctic blast of the winter sent temperatures and wind chills, in some places, below zero. Staying warm depends on where one is.

2016-12-17.abstract: To Mitch McConnell, the Montana congressman was an ideal candidate to defeat Senator Jon Tester, a two-term Democrat, in 2018. Then the president-elect intervened.
2016-12-17.snippet: To Mitch McConnell, the Montana congressman was an ideal candidate to defeat Senator Jon Tester, a two-term Democrat, in 2018. Then the president-elect intervened.
2016-12-17.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The courtship of Ryan Zinke began months before the end of the presidential race. A Republican congressman from Montana and a former Navy SEAL commander, Mr. Zinke was approached over the summer by Senator Mitch McConnell, the majority leader, about running for the Senate in 2018.
2016-12-17.headline_main: McConnell Eyed Ryan Zinke for a Senate Seat. Donald Trump Had Other Ideas.

2016-12-17.abstract: Parents and teachers have announced a long list of grievances against the interim acting principal of Townsend Harris High School, Rosemarie Jahoda, whom they want removed.

2016-12-17.abstract: Riding the Iron Curtain Trail in winter probably makes one an epic fool, not an epic hero. But I had to believe otherwise.
2016-12-17.snippet: Riding the Iron Curtain Trail in winter probably makes one an epic fool, not an epic hero. But I had to believe otherwise.
2016-12-17.lead_paragraph: London — Every bike ride is a pocket drama. Reflect on the humblest cycling commute and you’ll find yourself reliving short-story excitements denied to co-workers who yawned their way in on the train: the reconstructive surgery so skilfully swerved when some idiot flung open his car door, the race you pretended not to have with that courier, those bracing exchanges with bike-blind jaywalkers and cabdrivers.
2016-12-17.headline_main: 6,000 Miles on a Shopping Bike

2016-12-17.snippet: Corrections appearing in print on Saturday, December 17, 2016.

2016-12-17.abstract: The nuns were right about Russia after all.
2016-12-17.snippet: The nuns were right about Russia after all.
2016-12-17.lead_paragraph: I was raised in an era when we spent a lot of time worrying about Russia. That was because of Communism, which was such an obsession in my Catholic school that the countries on the map were colored red (Communist controlled), pink (leaning Communist) or green (safe – for now). Only the United States and Ireland were green.
2016-12-17.headline_main: Trump and Putin, in the Barn

2016-12-17.abstract: Mrs. Evansky, a Jewish refugee from Nazi Germany, developed blow-dry styling in the 1960s at her London salon, and inadvertently created a revolution in hairdressing.
2016-12-17.snippet: Mrs. Evansky, a Jewish refugee from Nazi Germany, developed blow-dry styling in the 1960s at her London salon, and inadvertently created a revolution in hairdressing.
2016-12-17.lead_paragraph: Rose Evansky, a British hairdresser who liberated women from the prison of the head-encasing domed dryer when she invented blow-dry styling at her London salon in the early 1960s, died on Nov. 21. She was 94.
2016-12-17.headline_main: Rose Evansky, a Pioneer in Women’s Hairstyling, Dies at 94

2016-12-17.abstract: Mr. Trump’s chosen representative is more likely to provoke conflict than promote peace.
2016-12-17.snippet: Mr. Trump’s chosen representative is more likely to provoke conflict than promote peace.
2016-12-17.lead_paragraph: In appointing David Friedman as the next ambassador to Israel, Donald Trump voiced a desire to “strive for peace in the Middle East.” Unfortunately, his chosen representative would be far more likely to provoke conflict in Israel and the occupied territories, heighten regional tensions and undermine American leadership.
2016-12-17.headline_main: A Dangerous Choice for Ambassador to Israel

2016-12-17.abstract: Zhouqin Burnikel starts off our solving weekend.
2016-12-17.snippet: Zhouqin Burnikel starts off our solving weekend.
2016-12-17.lead_paragraph: SATURDAY PUZZLE — Fashions come and fashions go, and the same could be said for trends in crosswords. Almost every day, words and phrases appear in crosswords for the first time and others return after a long absence. I can only speak to The New York Times Crosswords, but I love to see how language and usage evolves over time based on those trends. Thanks to websites like XWord Info, we can track those trends.
2016-12-17.headline_main: Hotter Than Jalapeños

2016-12-17.abstract: The point of a child-welfare system in a city like New York is to make sure that no child falls through the cracks.

2016-12-17.lead_paragraph: During her final days as attorney general, Loretta Lynch is not uttering President-elect Donald Trump’s name at formal events. But the fear his election has sparked among marginalized communities was clearly on her mind this week as she delivered parting thoughts on civil rights.

2016-12-17.abstract: It can heal and restore memory when witnesses have been erased.
2016-12-17.snippet: It can heal and restore memory when witnesses have been erased.

Ettinger, a visual artist, philosopher and psychoanalyst.  Her most recent publication is “And My Heart Wound-Space,” published on the occasion of the 14th Istanbul Biennial.

2016-12-17.headline_main: Free Cash in Finland. Must Be Jobless.

2016-12-17.lead_paragraph: Krista Knudsen Thomas has lived in Temescal, a vibrant multicultural neighborhood in North Oakland, Calif., since 2007. She moved into a 1920s house on 44th Street, one of a pair that the family of her then-boyfriend (now husband) had bought for a total of about $625,000. Her sister-in-law lives in the other house. “A little compound,” Ms. Knudsen Thomas, 41, calls the arrangement.

2016-12-17.abstract: In 2016, the Fox News anchor challenged political and gender expectations with both substance and style.
2016-12-17.snippet: In 2016, the Fox News anchor challenged political and gender expectations with both substance and style.
2016-12-17.lead_paragraph: Megyn Kelly — breakout star of the 2016 presidential campaign, anchor of the “The Kelly File” on Fox News, current object of employment desire for multiple networks, best-selling author, mother, wife, daughter and friend (the last four being how she describes herself) — has something she wants everyone to know. Really. A lot. Listen up.
2016-12-17.headline_main: No One Tells Megyn Kelly What to Wear

2016-12-17.abstract: Times journalists reported from more than 150 countries over the last year.
2016-12-17.snippet: Times journalists reported from more than 150 countries over the last year.
2016-12-17.lead_paragraph: The New York Times put journalists on the ground in more than 150 countries over the last year, covering nearly every corner of the world. Here are some of the most gripping tales from our foreign correspondents, photographers and editors in 2016.
2016-12-17.headline_main: We Were There: Reports From Our Far-Flung Correspondents in 2016

2016-12-17.abstract: Discussing anxiety, Oprah, and the death of her beloved dog with the woman behind the #NotOkay social media movement.
2016-12-17.snippet: Discussing anxiety, Oprah, and the death of her beloved dog with the woman behind the #NotOkay social media movement.
2016-12-17.lead_paragraph: On a bleak-for-Los Angeles morning this month, Kelly Oxford — author, mother, social media activist and provocateur — sat in a coffee shop where she had never been before, tapping away texts to her mom and friends, and talking about her late dog Lou, a toy poodle who was made so popular by her Instagram feed that he has attracted his own press attention. Lou’s death has disrupted not only Ms. Oxford’s life, but also her daily routine.
2016-12-17.headline_main: Kelly Oxford Is Looking for Peace of Mind

2016-12-17.abstract: Where to go when the weather turns cold? There are discounts to be had in Montreal, New York City and Salt Lake City.
2016-12-17.snippet: Where to go when the weather turns cold? There are discounts to be had in Montreal, New York City and Salt Lake City.
2016-12-17.lead_paragraph: With the snowbird migration underway, warm-weather deals can be hard to find. But winter is a good time to seek a bargain in cities, especially cities where the cold weather may be bleak. But what’s a little rain to a museum-goer?
2016-12-17.headline_main: In Winter, Hotel Bargains in Northern Climes

2016-12-17.snippet: Fifty-five were injured in the attack, which targeted a bus carrying soldiers on weekend leave in the city of Kayseri.

2016-12-17.headline_main: A Little Variety

2016-12-17.abstract: With the explicit aim of getting Donald J. Trump elected, a website run by a far-right activist pumped out anti-Hillary Clinton hoaxes and drew tens of thousands of views.
2016-12-17.snippet: With the explicit aim of getting Donald J. Trump elected, a website run by a far-right activist pumped out anti-Hillary Clinton hoaxes and drew tens of thousands of views.
2016-12-17.lead_paragraph: The Patriot News Agency website popped up in July, soon after it became clear that Donald J. Trump would win the Republican presidential nomination, bearing a logo of a red, white and blue eagle and the motto “Built by patriots, for patriots.”
2016-12-17.headline_main: How a Putin Fan Overseas Pushed Pro-Trump Propaganda to Americans

2016-12-17.abstract: Canada welcomes Syrian refugees like no other country. But for one 10-year-old’s parents, is she leaving too much behind?
2016-12-17.snippet: Canada welcomes Syrian refugees like no other country. But for one 10-year-old’s parents, is she leaving too much behind?
2016-12-17.lead_paragraph: TORONTO — As soon as Bayan Mohammad, a 10-year-old Syrian refugee, arrived here last winter, she began her transformation. In her first hour of ice-skating, she managed to glide on her own. She made fast friends with girls different from any she had ever known. New to competitive sports, she propelled herself down the school track so fast that she was soon collecting ribbons.
2016-12-17.headline_main: Wonder and Worry, as a Syrian Child Transforms

2016-12-17.abstract: Facebook fights fake news, and Google picks a funny name for its car business.
2016-12-17.snippet: Facebook fights fake news, and Google picks a funny name for its car business.
2016-12-17.lead_paragraph: Each Saturday, Farhad Manjoo and Mike Isaac, technology reporters at The New York Times, review the week’s news, offering analysis and maybe a joke or two about the most important developments in the tech industry. Mike is away this week, so Daisuke Wakabayashi, a Times technology reporter, took pity on Farhad and chatted with him.
2016-12-17.headline_main: Farhad’s and Daisuke’s Week in Tech: Is Google’s Waymo Way Better?

2016-12-17.abstract: A co-op board is responsible for protecting its employees from shareholders behaving badly — even if they’re lawyers (or just litigious).
2016-12-17.snippet: A co-op board is responsible for protecting its employees from shareholders behaving badly — even if they’re lawyers (or just litigious).
2016-12-17.lead_paragraph: Q. I am on the board of a small co-op in Midtown Manhattan. For the past year, a shareholder has had frequent and noisy sexual encounters in his apartment, making it difficult for the superintendent, who lives in the apartment below, to sleep. After the super complained to the shareholder and to the board, the shareholder began harassing her. He would ring her bell as he entered the building, sometimes at 3 or 4 in the morning, awakening her before his noisy assignations began. Because the shareholder is a lawyer, the board members are afraid that if we confront him he will retaliate against the board and individual members. How can we stop his uncivil behavior?
2016-12-17.headline_main: Harassing the Super

2016-12-17.abstract: Economics can’t explain it.
2016-12-17.snippet: Economics can’t explain it.
2016-12-17.lead_paragraph: Brad DeLong has an interesting meditation on markets and political demands — inspired by a note from Noah Smith — that offers food for thought. I wonder, however, if Brad’s discussion is too abstract; and I also wonder whether it fully recognizes the disconnect between what Trump voters think they want and reality. So, an entry of my own.
2016-12-17.headline_main: What Do Trump Voters Want?

2016-12-17.abstract: China’s seizure of the American underwater drone off the Philippines raised tensions between the countries as a new president prepared to take power.
2016-12-17.snippet: China’s seizure of the American underwater drone off the Philippines raised tensions between the countries as a new president prepared to take power.
2016-12-17.lead_paragraph: BEIJING — The Pentagon on Saturday said that Beijing had agreed to return an underwater drone seized by China in international waters, an indication that the two countries were moving to resolve an unusual incident that risked sharpening tensions in the run-up to the inauguration of President-elect Donald J. Trump.
2016-12-17.headline_main: China Agrees to Return Seized Drone, Ending Standoff, Pentagon Says

2016-12-17.abstract: Beverly Emers, who dropped out of high school and served nine stints in jail, enrolled in college after her young son asked her, “When are you graduating?”
2016-12-17.snippet: Beverly Emers, who dropped out of high school and served nine stints in jail, enrolled in college after her young son asked her, “When are you graduating?”
2016-12-17.lead_paragraph: Beverly Emers strode through campus with assurance, her 13-year-old son, Jabari, a few paces behind, as she gave the history of each monument at Bronx Community College this fall. Although decades older than most students there, Ms. Emers, 43, cannot walk between the buildings without someone waving, calling her name or inviting her to a party.

Rabbi Lawrence Malinger, a friend of the bride’s family, officiated at the Cranwell Resort in Lenox, Mass.
