2016-12-17.headline_main: Outsiders Selected by Trump Aim to Unnerve Washington

2016-12-17.abstract: With the Taliban making gains in their insurgency and seizing control of territory from the government, opportunities for women in the Afghan work force have shrunk.
2016-12-17.snippet: With the Taliban making gains in their insurgency and seizing control of territory from the government, opportunities for women in the Afghan work force have shrunk.
2016-12-17.lead_paragraph: KANDAHAR, Afghanistan — Gunmen in the southern Afghan city of Kandahar opened fire on a van carrying female airport employees on Saturday morning, killing five women and their male driver, officials said.
2016-12-17.headline_main: Gunmen in Afghanistan Kill 5 Female Airport Employees

2016-12-17.abstract: They had maintained that 10 teammates who were suspended from the football team because of a sexual assault inquiry had not been afforded due process.
2016-12-17.snippet: They had maintained that 10 teammates who were suspended from the football team because of a sexual assault inquiry had not been afforded due process.
2016-12-17.lead_paragraph: The University of Minnesota football team on Saturday rescinded its threatened boycott of a bowl game, a protest that had been intended to persuade the administration to lift the suspensions of 10 players entangled in a sexual assault inquiry. Team leaders continued to say that the 10 players, whose suspensions remain in effect, were being punished without the benefit of due process.
2016-12-17.headline_main: Minnesota Players Rescind Boycott and Will Play in Holiday Bowl

2016-12-17.abstract: After years of complaints over massive crowds, loud music and crime, Miami Beach is seeking to change the “carnival-like” atmosphere of Ocean Drive.
2016-12-17.snippet: After years of complaints over massive crowds, loud music and crime, Miami Beach is seeking to change the “carnival-like” atmosphere of Ocean Drive.
2016-12-17.lead_paragraph: MIAMI BEACH, Fla. — From rooftop bars and rope lines to gridlocked streets and sidewalks, Ocean Drive, the once-idyllic neon heartbeat of South Beach, can trample the senses on most weekends.
2016-12-17.headline_main: Miami Beach Tries to Tame Its Most Raucous Street (but the Fishbowl Drinks Can Stay)

2016-12-17.abstract: Strong disagreement seems inevitable among the president-elect’s inexperienced advisers.
2016-12-17.snippet: Strong disagreement seems inevitable among the president-elect’s inexperienced advisers.
2016-12-17.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — With the announcement that he will nominate the Exxon Mobil chief executive Rex Tillerson as his secretary of state, President-elect Donald J. Trump has rounded out a foreign policy team that is, to put it mildly, profoundly different from that of any of his six Republican predecessors since World War II. It’s also unlikely to last particularly long.
2016-12-17.headline_main: Donald Trump’s Foreign Policy Team: Built to Fail

2016-12-17.abstract: ’Tis true, children: St. Nick lived in what is now Turkey. He was not fat, but legend has it he dropped gifts down people’s chimneys.
2016-12-17.snippet: ’Tis true, children: St. Nick lived in what is now Turkey. He was not fat, but legend has it he dropped gifts down people’s chimneys.
2016-12-17.lead_paragraph: DEMRE, Turkey — The jagged Taurus Mountains rise on one side of the church, while the Mediterranean Sea gleams in the distance on the other. The bougainvillea is in bloom, the orange trees bursting with ripe fruit. It is, in other words, a long way from here to the North Pole.
2016-12-17.headline_main: In Turkey’s Home of St. Nick, Far From North Pole, All Is Not Jolly

2016-12-17.abstract: Officials and others say Mr. Kabila, days away from his scheduled exit, has looted millions of dollars in public assets, with potential repercussions that could make him try to stay in power.
2016-12-17.snippet: Officials and others say Mr. Kabila, days away from his scheduled exit, has looted millions of dollars in public assets, with potential repercussions that could make him try to stay in power.
2016-12-17.lead_paragraph: KINSHASA, Democratic Republic of Congo — In a mansion along the Congo River, with a collection of expensive watches, expensive motorcycles and a chimpanzee in a cage, Joseph Kabila, the president of this vast and troubled country, should be packing up.
2016-12-17.headline_main: As President Joseph Kabila Digs In, Tensions Rise in Congo

2016-12-17.abstract: With a greater appreciation of his skill, Raines, who is in his 10th and final year on the writers’ ballot, has steadily gained more support.
2016-12-17.snippet: With a greater appreciation of his skill, Raines, who is in his 10th and final year on the writers’ ballot, has steadily gained more support.
2016-12-17.lead_paragraph: A defining measure of Tim Raines’s greatness probably never appeared on his baseball cards. Year after year, for the Montreal Expos and beyond, Raines would reach base around 40 percent of the time. Yet even Raines could not have told you his on-base percentage.
2016-12-17.headline_main: Tim Raines’s Hall of Fame Candidacy in Last of the 10th

2016-12-17.abstract: A young artist recreates the city he remembered.
2016-12-17.snippet: A young artist recreates the city he remembered.
2016-12-17.lead_paragraph: Mohammed Qutaish, who was born in Aleppo, was 10 when popular protests broke out against President, Bashar al-Assad of Syria. “I wasn’t sure exactly what was going on but I liked it. It felt positive,” Mohammed told me during one of our video-chats earlier this year. However, protesters were met with force, violence escalated and soon Mohammed and his family fled their beloved city. When they returned four months later, having been told that it was safely under the control of opposition forces, they were shocked to see the city in ruins.
2016-12-17.headline_main: Aleppo Rebuilt, With Cardboard and Colored Pencil

2016-12-17.abstract: The beleaguered European Union faces a series of critical tests in 2017, but none is more important than the French presidential election, with a fierce opponent of the bloc a leading contender.
2016-12-17.snippet: The beleaguered European Union faces a series of critical tests in 2017, but none is more important than the French presidential election, with a fierce opponent of the bloc a leading contender.
2016-12-17.lead_paragraph: LE LUC, France — When the French put a draft Constitution for a newly enlarged European Union to a referendum in 2005, Pascal Verrelle voted passionately against it — hoping it would stop the European Union in its tracks. He rejoiced when the effort failed, yet was dismayed when the bloc kept gathering more members and powers, anyway.
2016-12-17.headline_main: E.U. Faces Its Next Big Test as France’s Election Looms

2016-12-17.abstract: The vice president, Gen. Abdul Rashid Dostum, is accused of abducting and torturing his rival, Ahmad Ishchi, during a sports event.
2016-12-17.snippet: The vice president, Gen. Abdul Rashid Dostum, is accused of abducting and torturing his rival, Ahmad Ishchi, during a sports event.
2016-12-17.lead_paragraph: KABUL, Afghanistan — The office of Afghanistan’s attorney general said on Saturday that it had opened an investigation into allegations that the country’s vice president had tortured and sexually abused a political rival.
2016-12-17.headline_main: Afghanistan to Investigate Vice President on Charges of Assaulting a Rival

2016-12-17.abstract: Readers on and off campus discuss the postelection environment.
2016-12-17.snippet: Readers on and off campus discuss the postelection environment.
2016-12-17.lead_paragraph: After the election: What happens when conservative students want safe spaces, too.
2016-12-17.headline_main: Donald Trump on Campus

2016-12-17.abstract: The gun industry, and the lawmakers who do their bidding, will be facing a potent new adversary.
2016-12-17.snippet: The gun industry, and the lawmakers who do their bidding, will be facing a potent new adversary.
2016-12-17.lead_paragraph: A promising new force in the fight for gun control has arrived on the scene. A coalition that includes corporate litigators from seven of the nation’s leading law firms is taking aim at some of the most glaring flaws in gun safety. One is Congress’s restriction of the government’s ability to conduct basic public health research on gun deaths. The lawyers will also seek ways to challenge state lawmakers who have invited millions of citizens to pack guns in public buildings and businesses.
2016-12-17.headline_main: A Pro Bono Dream Team Takes On the N.R.A.

2016-12-17.abstract: A weekly comic strip featured in the Sunday Review.
2016-12-17.snippet: A weekly comic strip featured in the Sunday Review.
2016-12-17.lead_paragraph: A weekly comic strip featured in the Sunday Review.
2016-12-17.headline_main: The Strip

2016-12-17.abstract: Vladimir Putin is being rewarded for his attack on the United States.
2016-12-17.snippet: Vladimir Putin is being rewarded for his attack on the United States.
2016-12-17.lead_paragraph: In 1972, President Richard Nixon’s White House dispatched burglars to bug Democratic Party offices. That Watergate burglary and related “dirty tricks,” such as releasing mice at a Democratic press conference and paying a woman to strip naked and shout her love for a Democratic candidate, nauseated Americans — and impelled some of us kids at the time to pursue journalism.
2016-12-17.headline_main: Donald Trump: The Russian Poodle

2016-12-17.abstract: The Times needs to do a far better job hiring people of color as the country it covers grows more diverse and its ambitions become more global.
2016-12-17.snippet: The Times needs to do a far better job hiring people of color as the country it covers grows more diverse and its ambitions become more global.
2016-12-17.lead_paragraph: ONLY two of the 20-plus reporters who covered the presidential campaign for The New York Times were black. None were Latino or Asian. That’s less diversity than you’ll find in Donald Trump’s cabinet thus far. Of The Times’s newly named White House team, all six are white, as is most everyone in the Washington bureau.
2016-12-17.headline_main: Preaching the Gospel of Diversity, but Not Following It

2016-12-17.abstract: The president-elect’s own advisers, as well as congressional Republicans, will gladly help him break his promise to protect Social Security.
2016-12-17.snippet: The president-elect’s own advisers, as well as congressional Republicans, will gladly help him break his promise to protect Social Security.
2016-12-17.lead_paragraph: Donald Trump campaigned on a promise not to cut Social Security, which puts him at odds with the Republican Party’s historical antipathy to the program and the aims of today’s Republican leadership. So it should come as no surprise that congressional Republicans are already testing Mr. Trump’s hands-off pledge.
2016-12-17.headline_main: Will Donald Trump Cave on Social Security?

2016-12-17.abstract: How big a problem is bullying on the school bus? Bigger than we think.
2016-12-17.snippet: How big a problem is bullying on the school bus? Bigger than we think.
2016-12-17.lead_paragraph: One evening after school, about three weeks ago, my husband and daughter were on the curb in the too-early dark with the usual group of kids and parents, when my 5-year-old informed another mom that an older boy had come up to her son on the bus and said, “I wish I had a pair of scissors, so I could cut out your tongue.”
2016-12-17.headline_main: ‘I Wish I Had a Pair of Scissors, So I Could Cut Out Your Tongue’

2016-12-17.abstract: A rap musical based on Shakespeare provides an unexpected look into the ideals of Donald Trump’s chief strategist.
2016-12-17.snippet: A rap musical based on Shakespeare provides an unexpected look into the ideals of Donald Trump’s chief strategist.
2016-12-17.lead_paragraph: PORTLAND, Ore. — Soon after Stephen K. Bannon was appointed chief strategist for President-elect Donald J. Trump, profiles noted that he was a co-author of a rap musical based on Shakespeare’s Roman tragedy “Coriolanus.” The revelation played as a punch line, another loopy swerve in a career that took Mr. Bannon from a working-class Democratic family to the Trump White House. Coming just after Mr. Trump denounced the hip-hop hit “Hamilton” as “overrated,” the news that his right-hand man had scripted a hip-hop statesman himself felt almost comical.
2016-12-17.headline_main: Behold, Steve Bannon’s Hip-Hop Shakespeare Rewrite: ‘Coriolanus’

2016-12-17.abstract: My co-workers had uncertain futures, and no easy explanation for why the American dream didn’t work out for them.
2016-12-17.snippet: My co-workers had uncertain futures, and no easy explanation for why the American dream didn’t work out for them.
2016-12-17.lead_paragraph: Seven years ago, I joined the night shift at a Walmart in rural Michigan. For $8.10 an hour, I spent four or five nights a week filling shelves with the flour and sugar and marshmallow fluff that residents of the local county, which in 2008 voted for Barack Obama, needed to get through the holidays. Four years ago, the county went with President Obama a second time, though by a thinner margin. But this past November, the county, like the state, turned red.
2016-12-17.headline_main: White Resentment on the Night Shift at Walmart

2016-12-17.abstract: The case for political moderation in our immoderate age.
2016-12-17.snippet: The case for political moderation in our immoderate age.
2016-12-17.lead_paragraph: THE Trump era will be unpredictable in many ways. But there’s one thing that we can reasonably count on. Moderation, an ancient virtue, will be viewed with contempt. After all, the most temperamentally immoderate major party nominee in American history ran for president and won because of it. Victory spawns imitation, and the Trump template is likely to influence our politics for some time to come.
2016-12-17.headline_main: One Way Not to Be Like Trump

2016-12-17.abstract: The unifying force in the United States is whiteness.
2016-12-17.snippet: The unifying force in the United States is whiteness.
2016-12-17.lead_paragraph: In 2005, after Hurricane Katrina, Kanye West appeared on live TV during a celebrity fund-raiser for victims of the disaster and said, “George Bush doesn’t care about black people.” This wasn’t based on intimate knowledge of Mr. Bush’s racial views, but rather on his treatment of black people in a time of crisis.
2016-12-17.headline_main: What Donald Trump Doesn’t Know About Black People

2016-12-17.abstract: They responded to years in confinement by rapidly assimilating into American culture — and supporting the president-elect.
2016-12-17.snippet: They responded to years in confinement by rapidly assimilating into American culture — and supporting the president-elect.
2016-12-17.lead_paragraph: When I was growing up my family simply called it “camp,” like the summer retreat I would escape to as a kid. Both places tended to have wood cabins, tight rows of beds and a large mess hall. My grandmother, or Baachan as I called her, used to say the baseball diamonds at her camp would draw huge crowds for every game.
2016-12-17.headline_main: My Family Was Interned. Now They’re With Trump.

2016-12-17.abstract: A Florida newspaper exposes a judicial system where skin color determines time behind bars.
2016-12-17.snippet: A Florida newspaper exposes a judicial system where skin color determines time behind bars.
2016-12-17.lead_paragraph: Decades of research have shown that the criminal courts sentence black defendants more harshly than whites. But a striking new investigation of sentencing disparities in Florida by The Sarasota Herald-Tribune expands our understanding of this problem in two important ways.
2016-12-17.headline_main: Unequal Sentences for Blacks and Whites

2016-12-17.abstract: Imagine the conversation we’d be having if we weren’t debating facts.
2016-12-17.snippet: Imagine the conversation we’d be having if we weren’t debating facts.
2016-12-17.lead_paragraph: We are once again engaged in an argument about facts. Such arguments can feel deceptively substantive. This one certainly does.
2016-12-17.headline_main: Arguing the Truth with Trump and Putin

2016-12-17.abstract: “I shouldn’t have to see the pain, struggle and despair of homeless people to and from my way to work every day.”
2016-12-17.snippet: “I shouldn’t have to see the pain, struggle and despair of homeless people to and from my way to work every day.”
2016-12-17.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — California may be the new capital of American liberalism, but everybody who likes the sound of that ought to consider the fate of three recent San Francisco ballot initiatives.
2016-12-17.headline_main: The Tent Cities of San Francisco

2016-12-17.abstract: Players and coaches are still growing accustomed to the latest change to the league’s concussion protocol, adding New York-based spotters to in-arena ones.
2016-12-17.snippet: Players and coaches are still growing accustomed to the latest change to the league’s concussion protocol, adding New York-based spotters to in-arena ones.
2016-12-17.lead_paragraph: With his team tied with the Minnesota Wild at 1-1 in the second period on Dec. 4, Edmonton Oilers Coach Todd McLellan received an unexpected visit from the referee T. J. Luxmore that left him shaking his head.
2016-12-17.headline_main: From Afar, an Extra Set of Eyes to Spot Concussions in the N.H.L.

2016-12-17.abstract: Dr. Heimlich entered the pantheon of medical history with his maneuver but in later years often found himself at odds with a medical establishment skeptical of his claims.
2016-12-17.snippet: Dr. Heimlich entered the pantheon of medical history with his maneuver but in later years often found himself at odds with a medical establishment skeptical of his claims.
2016-12-17.lead_paragraph: It is called the Heimlich maneuver — saving a choking victim with a bear hug and abdominal thrusts to eject a throat obstruction — and since its inception in 1974 it has become a national safety icon, taught in schools, portrayed in movies, displayed on restaurant posters and endorsed by medical authorities.
2016-12-17.headline_main: Dr. Henry J. Heimlich, Famous for Antichoking Technique, Dies at 96

2016-12-17.abstract: The president has vowed to “send a clear message” to Russia over its hacking of the U.S. election but has few ideal options.
2016-12-17.snippet: The president has vowed to “send a clear message” to Russia over its hacking of the U.S. election but has few ideal options.
2016-12-17.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Over the past four months, American intelligence agencies and aides to President Obama assembled a menu of options to respond to Russia’s hacking during the election, ranging from the obvious — exposing President Vladimir V. Putin’s financial ties to oligarchs — to the innovative, including manipulating the computer code that Russia uses in designing its cyberweapons.
2016-12-17.headline_main: Obama Confronts Complexity of Using a Mighty Cyberarsenal Against Russia

2016-12-17.abstract: The government has made prescriptions more accessible as business has rapidly grown, and it may even support exports as a source of revenue.
2016-12-17.snippet: The government has made prescriptions more accessible as business has rapidly grown, and it may even support exports as a source of revenue.
2016-12-17.lead_paragraph: JERUSALEM — Israeli scientists began their pioneering research to isolate the psychoactive ingredient in marijuana with a 10-pound stash seized by the Tel Aviv police. That effort, in the 1960s, helped propel Israel to the vanguard of research into the plant’s medicinal properties and lay the foundations for a medical marijuana industry.
2016-12-17.headline_main: Israel, a Medical Marijuana Pioneer, Is Eager to Capitalize

2016-12-17.abstract: With nothing to show from the area’s 13 pro teams since the Giants’ Super Bowl win in 2012, this has become a drought of epic proportions, by our spoiled-rotten standards.
2016-12-17.snippet: With nothing to show from the area’s 13 pro teams since the Giants’ Super Bowl win in 2012, this has become a drought of epic proportions, by our spoiled-rotten standards.
2016-12-17.lead_paragraph: The Knicks are finally respectable again, the Giants seem headed toward a playoff berth, and the Rangers own one of the better records in their conference. The Mets recently re-signed Yoenis Cespedes, and the Yanks threw a Boss’s ransom, old style, at Aroldis Chapman.
2016-12-17.headline_main: Five Years Without a Pro Title? Oh, Woe Is the New York Sports Fan

2016-12-17.abstract: Grambling won after an excessive celebration penalty pushed back the point-after attempt by 15 yards.
2016-12-17.snippet: Grambling won after an excessive celebration penalty pushed back the point-after attempt by 15 yards.
2016-12-17.lead_paragraph: Grambling State won the Celebration Bowl when it blocked a late extra-point kick, which had been set back 15 yards by an excessive-celebration penalty, to hold off North Carolina Central, 10-9, in Atlanta on Saturday.
2016-12-17.headline_main: Grambling Holds Off North Carolina Central on Blocked Kick

2016-12-17.abstract: The South Carolina representative, who was elected in the Tea Party wave of 2010, has opposed infrastructure spending and voted to allow a government shutdown in 2011.
2016-12-17.snippet: The South Carolina representative, who was elected in the Tea Party wave of 2010, has opposed infrastructure spending and voted to allow a government shutdown in 2011.
2016-12-17.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — When the government was hours away from shutting down in 2011, Representative Mick Mulvaney gathered with his three fellow South Carolina Republican freshmen in a Capitol Hill chapel to seek spiritual guidance on how to vote on a measure to keep the lights on. The verdict: Vote “no.”
2016-12-17.headline_main: In Mick Mulvaney, Trump Finds Anti-Establishment Leader for Budget Office

2016-12-17.lead_paragraph: CROWLEY, La. — In mid-December last year, Capt. Clay Higgins of the St. Landry Parish Sheriff’s Office was standing before a camera for a Crime Stoppers video, lecturing three at-large suspects in the thefts of several four-wheelers.
2016-12-17.headline_main: Trump’s Win Helps Carve a Path to Washington for the ‘Cajun John Wayne’

2016-12-18.abstract: On Saturday, Donald J. Trump returned to Alabama, to the site of a campaign rally 16 months ago that lifted his campaign’s confidence during a time he was still being dismissed in the primary race.
2016-12-18.snippet: On Saturday, Donald J. Trump returned to Alabama, to the site of a campaign rally 16 months ago that lifted his campaign’s confidence during a time he was still being dismissed in the primary race.
2016-12-18.lead_paragraph: MOBILE, Ala. — It was here, some 16 months ago, that Donald J. Trump displayed the sheer power behind his candidacy, packing this aging gridiron with tens of thousands of fans braving traffic and the August sun to get a glimpse of a candidate who, despite his swelling crowds and soaring poll numbers, was still being dismissed as a long shot.

2016-12-18.abstract: The bears that come here are climate refugees, on land because the sea ice they rely on for hunting seals is receding.
2016-12-18.snippet: The bears that come here are climate refugees, on land because the sea ice they rely on for hunting seals is receding.
2016-12-18.lead_paragraph: KAKTOVIK, Alaska — Come fall, polar bears are everywhere around this Arctic village, dozing on sand spits, roughhousing in the shallows, padding down the beach with cubs in tow and attracting hundreds of tourists who travel long distances to see them.
2016-12-18.headline_main: Polar Bears’ Path to Decline Runs Through Alaskan Village

2016-12-18.abstract: With contemporary art continuing to drive the market, dealers, auction houses and museums are trying to broaden the appeal of historical works.
2016-12-18.snippet: With contemporary art continuing to drive the market, dealers, auction houses and museums are trying to broaden the appeal of historical works.
2016-12-18.lead_paragraph: LENS, France — Trying to make the old look young is one of the abiding fixations of our times. Not only have human beings become disinclined to age gracefully — 60 has become the new 50 (or is it 40?) — but our material culture is continually being given a face-lift to remain relevant.
2016-12-18.headline_main: Seeking a Fountain of Youth for Old Masters

2016-12-18.abstract: The episode is seen as one more reason to fear Beijing, and to doubt whether the American Navy will rise to the defense of allies in the region.
2016-12-18.snippet: The episode is seen as one more reason to fear Beijing, and to doubt whether the American Navy will rise to the defense of allies in the region.
2016-12-18.lead_paragraph: BEIJING — Only a day before a small Chinese boat sidled up to a United States Navy research vessel in waters off the Philippines and audaciously seized an underwater drone from American sailors, the commander of United States military operations in the region told an audience in Australia that America had a winning military formula.
2016-12-18.headline_main: Muted U.S. Response to China’s Seizure of Drone Worries Asian Allies

2016-12-18.abstract: Senators from both parties urged the creation of a new committee on cyberattacks to investigate possible Russian interference in the American election.

2016-12-18.headline_main: Bipartisan Letter Seeks Single Inquiry Into Russian Hacking Claims

2016-12-18.abstract: In its 19th-century beginnings, New York Life Insurance sold 508 policies covering slaves. Their descendants are grappling with it.
2016-12-18.snippet: In its 19th-century beginnings, New York Life Insurance sold 508 policies covering slaves. Their descendants are grappling with it.
2016-12-18.lead_paragraph: New York Life, the nation’s third-largest life insurance company, opened in Manhattan’s financial district in the spring of 1845. The firm possessed a prime address — 58 Wall Street — and a board of trustees populated by some of the city’s wealthiest merchants, bankers and railroad magnates.
2016-12-18.headline_main: Insurance Policies on Slaves: New York Life’s Complicated Past

2016-12-18.abstract: An Egyptian court suspended the prison sentence of the writer, Ahmed Naji, in a decision that paves the way for his release.
2016-12-18.snippet: An Egyptian court suspended the prison sentence of the writer, Ahmed Naji, in a decision that paves the way for his release.
2016-12-18.lead_paragraph: CAIRO — Egypt’s highest appeals court on Sunday suspended the prison sentence of Ahmed Naji, a prominent writer who had been convicted on charges of obscenity, in a decision that paved the way for his release, his lawyer said.
2016-12-18.headline_main: Egyptian Novelist Jailed on Obscenity Charges to Be Released

2016-12-18.abstract: Not every outing to report from a crime scene results in a juicy column. A few came with high hopes that didn’t last.

2016-12-18.lead_paragraph: “I just called the police,” the angry man on the other side of the apartment door said after I knocked and introduced myself. “They’re on the way.”
2016-12-18.headline_main: In a Year of Crime News, Some Dark Deeds Yield Dead Ends

2016-12-18.abstract: Diane Fields’s life was turned upside down after she learned she had pancreatic cancer, battling not only the disease but also associated financial problems.
2016-12-18.snippet: Diane Fields’s life was turned upside down after she learned she had pancreatic cancer, battling not only the disease but also associated financial problems.

2016-12-18.headline_main: Cancer Patient Awaits Day She Can Return to the Kitchen

2016-12-18.abstract: The violence began when a patrol was sent to check on reports of a house on fire. Gunmen then attacked a police station in the city.

2016-12-18.abstract: It’s going to be a weird, holiday-focused week. You might as well eat well.
2016-12-18.snippet: It’s going to be a weird, holiday-focused week. You might as well eat well.
2016-12-18.lead_paragraph: Good morning. This is going to be a weird week whatever you do for a living, however you worship or don’t, wherever you stand on the political spectrum, all across the United States. There are coming holiday feasts. But before those, everything is errands and secrecy, everyone is squirreling away gifts for loved ones, and many are packing their suitcases for long travel and forced cheer.
2016-12-18.headline_main: What to Cook This Week

2016-12-18.abstract: The attack was the second this month to kill scores of security forces near a military base in the southern port of Aden.
2016-12-18.snippet: The attack was the second this month to kill scores of security forces near a military base in the southern port of Aden.
2016-12-18.lead_paragraph: AL MUKALLA, Yemen — A suicide bomber disguised as a disabled man blew himself up at a gathering of Yemeni security officers in the southern port of Aden on Sunday, killing 48 people and wounding dozens of others, Yemeni officials said.
2016-12-18.headline_main: ISIS Suicide Attack Kills 48 in Southern Yemen

2016-12-18.abstract: The restaurant, a Manhattan standby since 1979, will close on Dec. 28 for store renovations, inspiring the curator of a New-York Historical Society display to share what trains have meant to him.
2016-12-18.snippet: The restaurant, a Manhattan standby since 1979, will close on Dec. 28 for store renovations, inspiring the curator of a New-York Historical Society display to share what trains have meant to him.
2016-12-18.lead_paragraph: The train expert from the New-York Historical Society took a seat in a restaurant that looks like a dining car on a train. It only looks like a dining car. There is no engine at one end and no caboose with an observation platform at the other, but like so many trains — the Twentieth Century Limited, the Rip Van Winkle, the Phoebe Snow or the Southerner, to name only four — this one is approaching the end of the line.
2016-12-18.headline_main: Le Train Bleu Is Departing Bloomingdale’s. A Rail Buff Sees It Off.

2016-12-18.abstract: A vote is set to take place on Monday morning. Russia had vowed to block a previous resolution, but diplomats said they had reached an agreement.

2016-12-18.lead_paragraph: BEIRUT, Lebanon — The removal of residents from besieged communities in Syria bogged down again on Sunday after rebels opposed to the agreement set fire to buses that were supposed to carry evacuees, while Security Council diplomats signaled that they had reached a compromise deal to send United Nations monitors to oversee the evacuations.
2016-12-18.headline_main: Aleppo Evacuations Will Be Monitored After U.N. Reaches Deal

2016-12-18.abstract: The Packers shook up the N.F.C. playoff picture, while the Houston Texans somehow still have a hold in the A.F.C. Week 15 highlights and analysis.

Elsewhere, the Packers threw a wrench in the Lions’ plans in the N.F.C. North, and the A.F.C. South is still a mess. Here’s what we learned in N.F.L. Week 15:
2016-12-18.headline_main: N.F.L. Playoffs: Cowboys, Patriots and Raiders Hold Tight to Top Spots

2016-12-18.headline_main: Russia Set to Block U.N. From Monitoring Aleppo Evacuation

2016-12-18.abstract: Despite off-putting weather, the latest film in the “Star Wars” franchise collected an estimated $155 million at theaters in North America, the second-biggest December opening on record.

2016-12-18.abstract: Punishment for the poor may outweigh favors to the rich.
2016-12-18.snippet: Punishment for the poor may outweigh favors to the rich.
2016-12-18.lead_paragraph: It’s now generally accepted that Trumpism will finally involve the kind of fiscal stimulus progressive economists have been pleading for ever since the financial crisis. After all, Republicans are deeply worried about budget deficits when a Democrat is in the White House, but suddenly become fiscal doves when in control. And there really is no question that the deficit will go up.
2016-12-18.headline_main: Will Fiscal Policy Really Be Expansionary?

2016-12-18.lead_paragraph: AMONA OUTPOST, West Bank — With just days to go before a looming deadline for a court-ordered dismantling of this illegal Israeli settler outpost, Amona’s residents agreed on Sunday to a government proposal to relocate many of their homes to an adjacent plot of land on the same West Bank hilltop — a solution critics have denounced as just as illegal.
2016-12-18.headline_main: Israel Reaches Agreement to Relocate Amona Settlers

2016-12-18.abstract: Two of the Middle East’s powers are setting themselves up for a fight. It’s not too late to avert one.
2016-12-18.snippet: Two of the Middle East’s powers are setting themselves up for a fight. It’s not too late to avert one.
2016-12-18.lead_paragraph: Today’s competition between Turkey and Iran is the latest iteration of an old power game: a struggle their progenitors, the Byzantine and Persian empires, started over the control of Mesopotamia — today’s Iraq and Syria. While the rivalry outlived their transformation from empires to nation-states, they have managed to keep the peace between themselves for nearly 200 years.
2016-12-18.headline_main: Turkey and Iran’s Dangerous Collision Course

2016-12-18.abstract: Arsenal, accustomed to falling apart in November, dropped from first to fourth in the Premier League in a week in mid-December, amid contract demands from two stars.

2016-12-18.snippet: Leung Chun-ying fell out of favor with Beijing because he tried too hard to please it.
2016-12-18.lead_paragraph: Hong Kong — In the quiet of a recent Friday afternoon, Hong Kong’s hard-line leader, Leung Chun-ying, announced in a subdued, sometimes hesitant, voice that he would not seek a second term as chief executive. He cited the need for more time with his family: One of Mr. Leung’s daughters has long been afflicted with mental-health issues.
2016-12-18.headline_main: Hong Kong’s Leader, Loyal to a Fault

2016-12-18.abstract: Australia has lowered global standards on how to deal with refugees, shifting the boundaries of what nations now find acceptable.

2016-12-18.lead_paragraph: JAKARTA, Indonesia — Like many college students, Abdul Hamid is not thinking too much about life after graduation.

2016-12-18.abstract: The joyful, fiery performance drew a classic Gotham crowd: a mix of those in the know, those with friends in the know and those lucky enough to be in the right place at the right time.
2016-12-18.snippet: The joyful, fiery performance drew a classic Gotham crowd: a mix of those in the know, those with friends in the know and those lucky enough to be in the right place at the right time.
2016-12-18.lead_paragraph: A week before Christmas, in the midst of a Midtown Manhattan decked in its holiday finery, Patti Smith, New York City’s punk poet laureate, gave an unannounced performance before a fast-gathering crowd of several hundred in the lobby of the Museum of Modern Art.
2016-12-18.headline_main: Patti Smith, in Surprise Appearance at MoMA, Says What’s on Her Mind

2016-12-18.abstract: Across the country, more and more towns have used local zoning laws as barriers to new mosques and Islamic schools, underscoring what civil rights advocates say is a growing wave of intolerance.
2016-12-18.snippet: Across the country, more and more towns have used local zoning laws as barriers to new mosques and Islamic schools, underscoring what civil rights advocates say is a growing wave of intolerance.
2016-12-18.lead_paragraph: BERNARDS TOWNSHIP, N.J. — Mohammad Ali Chaudry, a retired financial officer, has lived in this prosperous town for 40 years. It is where he raised his three children and where he served as mayor, and before that, as a member of the school board. It was also where Mr. Chaudry, an observant Muslim, always wanted to pray.
2016-12-18.headline_main: The Mosque Next Door: City Law vs. Houses of Faith

2016-12-18.abstract: A Beethoven work for string quartet, with 23 bars of music, went unsold at Sotheby’s last month after a scholar called it a fake.
2016-12-18.snippet: A Beethoven work for string quartet, with 23 bars of music, went unsold at Sotheby’s last month after a scholar called it a fake.
2016-12-18.lead_paragraph: When a 232-page handwritten score of Mahler’s epic Second Symphony (“Resurrection”) sold for $5.6 million at Sotheby’s in London last month, it shattered a nearly 30-year record for the highest price paid at auction for a musical manuscript.
2016-12-18.headline_main: As Prices for Classical Scores Soar, One Beethoven Is in Question

2016-12-18.abstract: This book by John Nixon, an analyst who interrogated Saddam Hussein, heavily criticizes the White House and the workings of the C.I.A.
2016-12-18.snippet: This book by John Nixon, an analyst who interrogated Saddam Hussein, heavily criticizes the White House and the workings of the C.I.A.
2016-12-18.lead_paragraph: Most C.I.A. memoirs are terrible — defensive, jingoistic and worst of all, tedious. Others are doomed by the C.I.A.’s heavy-handed and mandatory censorship.
2016-12-18.headline_main: Review: ‘Debriefing the President’ Tears Into the C.I.A.

2016-12-18.abstract: This work, performed by the Taylor 2 company, was part of a bill at the 92nd Street Y and brought to mind Mr. Taylor’s association with the artist Robert Rauschenberg.
2016-12-18.snippet: This work, performed by the Taylor 2 company, was part of a bill at the 92nd Street Y and brought to mind Mr. Taylor’s association with the artist Robert Rauschenberg.
2016-12-18.lead_paragraph: The choreographer Paul Taylor, who is preparing his next premiere for March, has been making dances since 1954. But there’s one curious divide within his output, too little discussed. Between 1954 and 1962, he made a series of 17 works with designs by the artist Robert Rauschenberg; the last of these was “Tracer.”
2016-12-18.headline_main: Review: Paul Taylor’s ‘Tracer’ Recalls a Dance and an Artist

2016-12-18.abstract: The filmmakers incorporated anti-hate activists as they tried to persuade members to leave the Klan — or at least to leave their children out of it.
2016-12-18.snippet: The filmmakers incorporated anti-hate activists as they tried to persuade members to leave the Klan — or at least to leave their children out of it.
2016-12-18.lead_paragraph: The setup is warm and fuzzy. “Girls, I got y’all some gifts,” says Steven Howard, presenting his two young daughters with prettily wrapped packages, which they eagerly rip into. The cameras then reveal what’s inside: the distinctive pointed hoods of the Ku Klux Klan.
2016-12-18.headline_main: Inside the Ku Klux Klan, With an A&E Documentary Series

2016-12-18.abstract: The work, a trip through Anna Kohler’s memories of being a young nude model in Paris, is directed by Caleb Hammond and is partly a sensory experiment.
2016-12-18.snippet: The work, a trip through Anna Kohler’s memories of being a young nude model in Paris, is directed by Caleb Hammond and is partly a sensory experiment.
2016-12-18.lead_paragraph: Pale flesh is the first thing we see, examined at very near range by the eye of a video camera. In the opening moments of Anna Kohler’s “Mytho? Lure of Wildness,” it roves over breasts and belly as a fingertip touches this body, which is neither firm nor svelte.
2016-12-18.headline_main: Review: ‘Mytho? Lure of Wildness’ Teases the Senses

2016-12-19.abstract: Up to a million people are trapped inside Iraq’s second-largest city, where the brutal urban war of attrition is proving to be tougher than expected.
2016-12-19.snippet: Up to a million people are trapped inside Iraq’s second-largest city, where the brutal urban war of attrition is proving to be tougher than expected.
2016-12-19.lead_paragraph: ISTANBUL — After two months, the battle to retake the Iraqi city of Mosul from the Islamic State has settled into a grinding war of attrition. The front lines have barely budged in weeks. Casualties of Iraqi security forces are so high that American commanders heading the United States-led air campaign worry that they are unsustainable. Civilians are being killed or injured by Islamic State snipers and growing numbers of suicide bombers.
2016-12-19.headline_main: Hungry, Thirsty and Bloodied in Battle to Retake Mosul From ISIS

2016-12-19.lead_paragraph: The New York Times Op-Docs is presenting a virtual reality film, “Indefinite,” about the indefinite detention of immigrants in Britain. To view it, either watch in the video player or for the full experience use the NYT VR app on your mobile device. (To download the app, go here for Android, and here for iPhone.)
2016-12-19.headline_main: For Immigrants, the Threat of Indefinite Detention

2016-12-19.abstract: Teen Vogue plans to cover Mr. Trump’s policies aggressively. And it may have help from its readers.
2016-12-19.snippet: Teen Vogue plans to cover Mr. Trump’s policies aggressively. And it may have help from its readers.
2016-12-19.lead_paragraph: Lots of adults started paying attention to Teen Vogue recently. It started with an opinion article by Lauren Duca, the magazine’s weekend editor, called “Donald Trump Is Gaslighting America.” Gaslighting is a form of psychological abuse that causes the victim to question his or her own sanity, Ms. Duca writes, “and that’s precisely what Trump is doing to this country.”
2016-12-19.headline_main: The Teen’s Guide to the Trump Presidency

2016-12-19.abstract: Presidents who sideline the intelligence community do so at their — and the country’s — risk.
2016-12-19.snippet: Presidents who sideline the intelligence community do so at their — and the country’s — risk.
2016-12-19.lead_paragraph: In recent days, President-elect Donald J. Trump has rejected the C.I.A.’s conclusions that Russian hackers attempted to sway the American elections, and has accused unnamed officials within the agency of trying to undermine him. And he has rejected the tradition of receiving the intelligence community’s daily briefing, implying that he would rather rely on information and analysis from his inner circle of advisers.
2016-12-19.headline_main: Will Trump Play Spy vs. Spy?

2016-12-19.abstract: With a push from the tech industry and others, automated vehicles are getting the green light without yielding to public interest.
2016-12-19.snippet: With a push from the tech industry and others, automated vehicles are getting the green light without yielding to public interest.
2016-12-19.lead_paragraph: Love was in the air at President-elect Donald J. Trump’s summit meeting last week with tech executives. Alphabet, Google’s parent company, was really feeling it, coming as it did a day after the company announced that its self-driving technology was ready for commercialization. The meeting was a giant green light for an industry and the multitrillion-dollar investment it will represent, the cost largely to be borne by consumers and government.
2016-12-19.headline_main: Google Wants Driverless Cars, but Do We?

2016-12-19.abstract: Donald Trump’s choice to run HUD does not appear to support the agency’s mission.
2016-12-19.snippet: Donald Trump’s choice to run HUD does not appear to support the agency’s mission.
2016-12-19.lead_paragraph: Antigovernment ideologues resent the Department of Housing and Urban Development even when they know nothing about it. Ben Carson, Donald Trump’s choice to run HUD, is a fine case in point.
2016-12-19.headline_main: Ben Carson’s Warped View of Housing

2016-12-19.abstract: Instead of dismissing college students as coddled, celebrate us as more in tune with our mental health.
2016-12-19.snippet: Instead of dismissing college students as coddled, celebrate us as more in tune with our mental health.
2016-12-19.lead_paragraph: MONTREAL — Red Bull? Check. Late-night delivery on speed dial? Check. Pringles? Check.
2016-12-19.headline_main: The Season to Be Stressful

2016-12-19.abstract: Forwarding a jeering meme to people who agree with you is not political action.
2016-12-19.snippet: Forwarding a jeering meme to people who agree with you is not political action.
2016-12-19.lead_paragraph: Four years ago, shortly after the re-election of Barack Obama, I published an essay in The Stone called “How to Live Without Irony.” In it, I argued that the surplus of apolitical irony in a certain segment of American culture — most clearly expressed in the rise of hipsterism but visible in many other forms — had a dangerous potential. It represented a surrender to commercial and political forces that could lead to an emptiness of both the individual and collective psyche. “Historically, vacuums eventually have been filled by something,” I wrote, “more often than not, a hazardous something.”
2016-12-19.headline_main: How to Live Without Irony (for Real, This Time)

2016-12-19.snippet: What are your traditions this time of year, whether you celebrate Christmas, Hanukkah, Kwanza, the winter solstice or anything else?

2016-12-19.snippet: Is skepticism of an agency that's made mistakes wise or dangerous?

2016-12-19.abstract: Though banned by the end of the 20th century, people exposed to asbestos in the 1970’s and 1980’s continue to be cut down by cancer and other illnesses related to the once-common material.
2016-12-19.snippet: Though banned by the end of the 20th century, people exposed to asbestos in the 1970’s and 1980’s continue to be cut down by cancer and other illnesses related to the once-common material.
2016-12-19.lead_paragraph: Although Italy joined asbestos-producing nations in banning the carcinogenic material at the end of the 20th century, thousands of people working in factories and living in public housing had already been exposed. In other words, as the Italian photographer Cinzia Canneri explained, the damage had been done by the 1980s.
2016-12-19.headline_main: Deadly Remnants of Asbestos in Italy

2016-12-19.abstract: In Williamsburg, a slowly growing new coffee shop now offers restorative tonics and elixirs.
2016-12-19.snippet: In Williamsburg, a slowly growing new coffee shop now offers restorative tonics and elixirs.
2016-12-19.lead_paragraph: The plant-powered potions on offer as of this week at the End, a cheerful new Williamsburg coffee bar with roots in Montauk, are “as psychedelic as you can get without using drugs,” laughs Madeleine Murphy, a partner there. Some of the drinks are stained sea blue, others dusted with a shimmery yolk-colored powder. And all promote wellness – from soothing anxiety to offering energy via sources beyond caffeine.
2016-12-19.headline_main: A Healing Unicorn Latte, From Brooklyn of Course

2016-12-19.abstract: From a swimwear brand that actually celebrates swimming to a company that finds vintage fabrics and dyes them black, 15 standout creators worth knowing.
2016-12-19.snippet: From a swimwear brand that actually celebrates swimming to a company that finds vintage fabrics and dyes them black, 15 standout creators worth knowing.
2016-12-19.lead_paragraph: From a swimwear brand that actually celebrates swimming to a Munich-based company that finds vintage fabrics and dyes them black, it’s been a great year for emerging talent on T. Here, 15 standout creators (featured in our weekly On the Verge series) worth knowing.
2016-12-19.headline_main: Fifteen Interesting New Brands We Discovered in 2016

2016-12-19.abstract: With more than 950,000 visitors from China this year, a sevenfold increase since 2007, the city says it still has work to do to expand its appeal beyond group tours.

2016-12-19.lead_paragraph: “Love, and a cough, cannot be hid,” the English metaphysical poet George Herbert wrote 400 years ago. It can be hard on parents to live with a child who keeps coughing — sometimes maybe harder on the parents than on the child.

2016-12-19.snippet: Electors across the country met on Monday and officially gave Mr. Trump a majority of votes, ending a long-shot bid to block his victory.
2016-12-19.lead_paragraph: Right Now: The Electoral College has affirmed Donald J. Trump as the nation’s 45th president, pushing him past the 270-vote threshold for election, with scant evidence of the anti-Trump revolt among electors that some of his critics had hoped would occur.
2016-12-19.headline_main: Donald Trump Completes Final Lap, Electoral College, to White House

2016-12-19.abstract: Donald J. Trump and Xi Jinping, the president of China, have contrasting political styles, and their pairing has injected new unpredictability into relations.
2016-12-19.snippet: Donald J. Trump and Xi Jinping, the president of China, have contrasting political styles, and their pairing has injected new unpredictability into relations.
2016-12-19.lead_paragraph: BEIJING — Both came to power vowing to restore their nations to greatness. But America’s loud, ad-libbing president-elect, Donald J. Trump, and China’s guarded, calculating president, Xi Jinping, are glaring contrasts as politicians, and their pairing has injected new unpredictability into relations between their governments.
2016-12-19.headline_main: Trump’s and Xi’s Differences Magnify Uncertainties Between U.S. and China

2016-12-19.abstract: An international study found that cold weather is responsible, directly or indirectly, for 20 times more deaths than hot weather.
2016-12-19.snippet: An international study found that cold weather is responsible, directly or indirectly, for 20 times more deaths than hot weather.
2016-12-19.lead_paragraph: Most of the Northern Hemisphere is now in the throes of the deadliest time of the year. Cold kills, and I don’t mean just extreme cold and crippling blizzards. I mean ordinary winter cold, like that typically experienced, chronically or episodically, by people in every state but Hawaii from late fall through early spring.
2016-12-19.headline_main: Beware: Winter Is Coming

2016-12-19.abstract: Video from a Wyoming ranch is being displayed on billboards in Times Square through Dec. 30 as part of an art exhibition lasting just three minutes a night.
2016-12-19.snippet: Video from a Wyoming ranch is being displayed on billboards in Times Square through Dec. 30 as part of an art exhibition lasting just three minutes a night.
2016-12-19.lead_paragraph: In the city that never sleeps, most people could not be bothered to count the sheep that for three minutes every night this month have been filling more than 20 electronic billboards in Times Square.
2016-12-19.headline_main: Flocks of Sheep, Seven Stories Tall, at the Crossroads of the World

2016-12-19.abstract: After Russia agreed to back a compromise deal, observers will oversee operations to bring civilians out of the besieged Syrian city.
2016-12-19.snippet: After Russia agreed to back a compromise deal, observers will oversee operations to bring civilians out of the besieged Syrian city.
2016-12-19.lead_paragraph: BEIRUT, Lebanon — With Russia’s backing, the United Nations Security Council voted on Monday to send United Nations observers  to monitor evacuations from the besieged Syrian city of Aleppo and to report back regularly.
2016-12-19.headline_main: U.N. Will Send Monitors to Aleppo, as Evacuations Resume

2016-12-19.abstract: Research shows pricing apps and websites don’t always help patients spend less.
2016-12-19.snippet: Research shows pricing apps and websites don’t always help patients spend less.
2016-12-19.lead_paragraph: You probably know where to pump the cheapest gas and how to get price comparisons online in seconds for headphones and cars. But how would you find the best deal on an M.R.I. or a knee replacement? No idea, right?
2016-12-19.headline_main: Price Transparency Is Nice. Just Don’t Expect It to Cut Health Costs.

2016-12-19.abstract: Thais are beginning to accept the king’s disappearance from their lives and the succession of his son to the throne.

2016-12-19.lead_paragraph: BANGKOK — More than two months after the death of Thailand’s long-serving king, Bhumibol Adulyadej, the country is still in mourning for him, with most people wearing black, and black billboards carrying tributes in the place of advertising.
2016-12-19.headline_main: Thailand Takes Small Steps Forward After Longtime King’s Death

2016-12-19.abstract: Here’s a selection of Times reporters’ most memorable stories of the year, with a focus on climate change and related environmental issues.
2016-12-19.snippet: Here’s a selection of Times reporters’ most memorable stories of the year, with a focus on climate change and related environmental issues.
2016-12-19.lead_paragraph: As the year ends, The New York Times asked reporters who have focused on climate change, global warming and the environment to choose the news they reported on that was the most memorable. These are their selections, ranging from sea level rise to the phenomenon of “rolling coal” to local actions to confront a warming planet.

2016-12-19.headline_main: Raiders Move Up, Chargers Move Down and Both May Be Moving Out

2016-12-19.abstract: Relations deteriorated when the imprisoned pro-democracy dissident Liu Xiaobo was awarded the Peace Prize in 2010.
2016-12-19.snippet: Relations deteriorated when the imprisoned pro-democracy dissident Liu Xiaobo was awarded the Peace Prize in 2010.
2016-12-19.lead_paragraph: LONDON — China and Norway announced on Monday that they would normalize relations, six years after the decision to award the Nobel Peace Prize to the imprisoned democracy advocate Liu Xiaobo opened a rift between the countries.
2016-12-19.headline_main: Norway and China Restore Ties, 6 Years After Nobel Prize Dispute

2016-12-19.abstract: At four new restaurants named Robin Hood, poor people are served by waiters, helping them regain a sense of dignity that is hard to achieve when eating in a soup kitchen.
2016-12-19.snippet: At four new restaurants named Robin Hood, poor people are served by waiters, helping them regain a sense of dignity that is hard to achieve when eating in a soup kitchen.
2016-12-19.lead_paragraph: MADRID — Ángel Castillo once worked as a restaurant cook. But after losing his job and struggling with alcoholism, he has been sleeping on the streets for most of the last 16 years. It has been a while since he has worked in a restaurant, let alone eaten at one.
2016-12-19.headline_main: In Spain, New Restaurants Nourish the Needy, and the Soul

2016-12-19.abstract: When The Times allowed its writer to accept and write about a $6,189 package from the Brooklyn Nets, it appeared to violate its own ethics standards.
2016-12-19.snippet: When The Times allowed its writer to accept and write about a $6,189 package from the Brooklyn Nets, it appeared to violate its own ethics standards.
2016-12-19.lead_paragraph: The Brooklyn Nets haven’t exactly been filling the seats at Barclays Center this year. Their 7-19 record puts them near the bottom of the NBA’s Eastern Conference. Box seats remain unsold. And rare is the day when a Nets game makes the front of The New York Times’s sports section, much less a splashy presence on the website’s home page.
2016-12-19.headline_main: A V.I.P. Nets Package Offered Free to The Times

2016-12-19.abstract: There is no precedent for such a breach between an incoming president and the nation’s national-security professionals.

2016-12-19.headline_main: Give the Windows 10 Start Menu a Classic Look

2016-12-19.abstract: Social media companies have always courted celebrities and their big followings. But on Snapchat, being famous isn’t so remarkable.

2016-12-19.abstract: With four new stations as blank canvases, Chuck Close, Vik Muniz, Jean Shin and Sarah Sze celebrate the culture and community of New York City.
2016-12-19.snippet: With four new stations as blank canvases, Chuck Close, Vik Muniz, Jean Shin and Sarah Sze celebrate the culture and community of New York City.

2016-12-19.abstract: The American exceptionalism of Trumpism.
2016-12-19.snippet: The American exceptionalism of Trumpism.
2016-12-19.lead_paragraph: This Washington Post article on Poland — where a right-wing, anti-intellectual, nativist party now rules, and has garnered a lot of public support — is chilling for those of us who worry that Trumpism may really be the end of the road for US democracy. The supporters of Law and Justice clearly looked a lot like Trump’s white working class enthusiasts; so are we headed down the same path?
2016-12-19.headline_main: Reality TV Populism

2016-12-19.abstract: Why the conflict over Pope Francis’s innovations has only just begun.
2016-12-19.snippet: Why the conflict over Pope Francis’s innovations has only just begun.
2016-12-19.lead_paragraph: Time for another intervention on matters Catholic, I’m afraid. Last week Austen Ivereigh, author of a very fine Pope Francis biography and frequent defender of the pontiff against conservative critics, wrote a piece for Crux announcing that the debate over “Amoris Laetitia” and communion for the remarried is essentially over, that intransigent conservatives are now as much “dissenters” from the papal magisterium as any liberal agitating for the ordination of women under John Paul II — and that long after the cardinals questioning Francis are no more “than a footnote in the history of this papacy, long after Ross Douthat’s predicted schism from the columns of the New York Times has failed to materialize, the next generation of priests will be applying the magnificent teaching of ‘Amoris Laetitia,’ and the noisy, angry strains of dissent will have faded into a distant memory.”
2016-12-19.headline_main: Amoris Laetitia and Everything After

2016-12-19.abstract: In this season of giving, we asked some notably avid readers — who also happen to be poets, musicians, diplomats, filmmakers, novelists, actors and artists — to share the books that accompanied them through 2016.

2016-12-19.lead_paragraph: “Marley was dead: to begin with. There is no doubt whatever about that,” said John Galazin, quoting not only the opening lines of Charles Dickens’s “A Christmas Carol” — which, of course, these are — but also a bookstore clerk who blurted out those lines when Mr. Galazin asked recently for a copy of the book.

2016-12-19.snippet: A founder of the hedge fund, Platinum Partners, and six others were charged on Monday in what federal prosecutors said was a scheme that overvalued the assets and misrepresented their performance.

2016-12-19.lead_paragraph: Try as she might, Carolyn Davidson knows she can no longer deny that at 67, she is starting to feel her age, especially the past few months. Her body aches, colds linger, her steps more deliberate, her energy easily sapped.

2016-12-19.abstract: “Le Manoir aux Quat’Saisons” offers history and a seasonal approach to Raymond Blanc’s cooking.
2016-12-19.snippet: “Le Manoir aux Quat’Saisons” offers history and a seasonal approach to Raymond Blanc’s cooking.
2016-12-19.lead_paragraph: There are nicely wrought seasonal recipes in this lavish book about Le Manoir aux Quat’Saisons near Oxford, England, written by its chef and owner, Raymond Blanc. Born in France and self taught, he opened the Manoir in Great Milton in 1984, and has used its 27 acres to grow fresh vegetables, berries and herbs for his kitchen. Over time, Mr. Blanc’s cooking, which has earned two Michelin stars, has evolved, with a broader, global palette of seasonings. But what makes this beautifully illustrated volume more than just a gift-worthy showpiece is that many of the recipes should inspire a home cook. Try chicken with morels, asparagus with chervil, salmon with spinach and watercress, poached egg on tomato fondue, Jerusalem artichoke soup, hake Grenobloise, and more: “Le Manoir aux Quat’Saisons: The Story of a Modern Classic” by Raymond Blanc (Bloomsbury, $75).
2016-12-19.headline_main: A French Cookbook From the English Countryside

2016-12-19.snippet: The Kitano hotel plans an Osechi meal of foods thought to bring good fortune for the new year.
2016-12-19.lead_paragraph: To call on the new for the new year, try a restaurant feast that is traditional in Japan but uncommon in the United States. Osechi is a six-course menu of foods thought to bring good luck, good health and all of that. At Hakubai in the Kitano Hotel New York, the meal includes symbolic foods like white and red fish cakes for purity and to protect against evil, and herring roe for fertility, along with sashimi and Wagyu beef. The brunch is served on Jan. 1 and 2, with seatings throughout the day starting at 10:30 a.m., $200 per person. Reservations are required. Free sake will be served in the lobby on Jan. 1: Hakubai, 66 Park Avenue (38th Street), 212-885-7111, kitano.com.
2016-12-19.headline_main: Good Luck, Served in 6 Courses, on New Year’s Day

2016-12-19.snippet: This yule log from Benoit’s new pastry chef fits right in with the architecture of Midtown.
2016-12-19.lead_paragraph: Who left the bûche de Noël out in the snow? Thomas Padovani, the new pastry chef at Benoit, has abandoned the traditional-looking log of cake garnished with meringue mushrooms for a sleeker, sparkly, slightly angular winter-white version. Inside, the cake is chocolate and scented with almond and citrus, flavors he relates to a Provençal candy, the calissons d’Aix. It will serve six to eight: Bûche de Noël, $38, with 24 hours’ notice, Benoit, 60 West 55th Street, 646-943-7373, bistrot@benoitny.com.
2016-12-19.headline_main: A Modernist Bûche de Noël

2016-12-19.snippet: These Brazilian cheese puffs, pão de queijo, ship frozen and are party ready in 20 minutes.
2016-12-19.lead_paragraph: Breadbaskets all over Brazil often tempt with warm, crusty rolls oozing cheese. Now you can serve bite-size pão de queijo, the Portuguese answer to gougères, fresh from the oven. That they are gluten-free enhances their appeal. Kika’s Treats ships them frozen, and all they take to achieve a party-ready burnish is about 20 minutes in the oven without defrosting. Let them rest a few minutes before serving: Brazilian Cheese Bread (Pão de Queijo), $12 for a dozen, kikastreats.com.

2016-12-19.lead_paragraph: On Dec. 20, 1981, “Dreamgirls’’ opened at the Imperial Theater, bringing a “seismic emotional jolt” to Broadway, as the critic Frank Rich wrote in The New York Times. Written by Henry Krieger and Tom Eyen and directed by Michael Bennett, the musical followed the path of a Supremes-style girl group and its driven, unscrupulous manager.

2016-12-19.snippet: Mr. Singer ruminates on sports doping, poverty, incest, religion and dozens of other topics in this collection of writings.
2016-12-19.lead_paragraph: In his influential memoir, “Hillbilly Elegy” (2016), J. D. Vance explains why some middle-class Americans turned against Michelle Obama. The first lady, he writes, “tells us that we shouldn’t be feeding our children certain foods, and we hate her for it — not because we think she’s wrong, but because we know she’s right.”
2016-12-19.headline_main: ‘Ethics in the Real World,’ Peter Singer’s Provocative Essays

2016-12-19.abstract: Bana and her mother, Fatemah, reported on Twitter that they had arrived Monday in an opposition-held area in the countryside of western Aleppo Province.
2016-12-19.snippet: Bana and her mother, Fatemah, reported on Twitter that they had arrived Monday in an opposition-held area in the countryside of western Aleppo Province.
2016-12-19.lead_paragraph: Bana al-Abed, a 7-year-old Syrian girl who became the face of the civilian plight in eastern Aleppo through social media, has finally been evacuated. Bana and her mother, Fatemah, arrived in Al Rashideen, an opposition-held area in the countryside of western Aleppo Province, on Monday, along with thousands of others displaced from the city they called home.
2016-12-19.headline_main: Bana al-Abed, Child Who Became Aleppo’s Civilian Face, Is Evacuated

2016-12-19.abstract: The illustrator Edward Gorey proves a complex subject in this imagined memoir for the stage that focuses more on the man than his art.
2016-12-19.snippet: The illustrator Edward Gorey proves a complex subject in this imagined memoir for the stage that focuses more on the man than his art.
2016-12-19.lead_paragraph: It’s usually wise to avoid assumptions based on an artist’s work. Actors so convincing as violent psychos go home to minivans and soccer lessons. Gilbert & George’s paintings can be provocatively outré, but they live routine lives in their conservative suits.
2016-12-19.headline_main: Review: Peering Behind the Whimsically Ghoulish ‘Gorey’

2016-12-19.abstract: The Times’s standards editor, Phil Corbett, discusses the publication of an image of a gunman standing beside the dead body of Russia’s ambassador to Turkey.
2016-12-19.snippet: The Times’s standards editor, Phil Corbett, discusses the publication of an image of a gunman standing beside the dead body of Russia’s ambassador to Turkey.
2016-12-19.lead_paragraph: Several readers have already written in to protest The Times’s use of a particularly graphic photograph on the home page on Monday. It showed a gunman, in suit and tie, standing beside the body of Russia’s ambassador to Turkey, whom the shooter had killed moments earlier. I asked Phil Corbett, associate masthead editor for standards and ethics, who was involved in the decision to use the photo, to explain the editors’ thinking.
2016-12-19.headline_main: Why’d You Do That? Running a Photo of a Killer on the Home Page

2016-12-19.snippet: Restorers painstakingly removed varnish and overpainting from a 15th-century work, after new scanning technology revealed that what lay below was stunning.

2016-12-19.lead_paragraph: The Bible says that “no one can serve two masters.” In federal law, this admonition is embodied in statutes that prohibit government officials from receiving any outside compensation for their work and bar them from acting in ways that favor their own financial interests.
2016-12-19.headline_main: With Cabinet Nominees, a Challenge to See Which Master Is Served

But he ended up stuck on the railroad tracks at a poorly marked California crossing.

2016-12-20.abstract: Columbus, which has made the playoffs only twice in 15 seasons, has won nine games in a row and is in third place in the Eastern Conference, led by Coach John Tortorella and goaltender Sergei Bobrovsky.
2016-12-20.snippet: Columbus, which has made the playoffs only twice in 15 seasons, has won nine games in a row and is in third place in the Eastern Conference, led by Coach John Tortorella and goaltender Sergei Bobrovsky.

2016-12-20.abstract: A $1.2 billion investment by Masayoshi Son’s conglomerate, SoftBank, is the first step in his promise made in a meeting with Mr. Trump to create thousands of jobs in the United States.
2016-12-20.snippet: A $1.2 billion investment by Masayoshi Son’s conglomerate, SoftBank, is the first step in his promise made in a meeting with Mr. Trump to create thousands of jobs in the United States.
2016-12-20.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — The Japanese business mogul Masayoshi Son pledged to President-elect Donald J. Trump nearly two weeks ago that he would invest in the United States and create about 50,000 jobs.

2016-12-20.abstract: Ms. Quattrochi served for 25 years as the AIDS Resource Center’s chief executive and was instrumental in building what became the nation’s largest housing resource for people living with AIDS.
2016-12-20.snippet: Ms. Quattrochi served for 25 years as the AIDS Resource Center’s chief executive and was instrumental in building what became the nation’s largest housing resource for people living with AIDS.
2016-12-20.lead_paragraph: Gina Quattrochi, who turned Bailey House into the nation’s largest provider of housing to people with AIDS and a model for similar organizations around the United States, died on Dec. 13 in Manhattan. She was 63.

2016-12-20.abstract: On Monday, the president extended his acts of clemency to 1,324 individuals, by far the largest use of the presidential power to show mercy in the nation’s history.
2016-12-20.snippet: On Monday, the president extended his acts of clemency to 1,324 individuals, by far the largest use of the presidential power to show mercy in the nation’s history.
2016-12-20.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Just weeks before leaving office, President Obama on Monday issued 78 pardons and commuted the sentences of 153 prisoners, extending his acts of clemency to a total of 1,324 individuals, one of the larger uses of the presidential power to show mercy in modern presidential history.
2016-12-20.headline_main: Obama’s 78 Pardons and 153 Commutations Extend Record of Mercy

2016-12-20.abstract: The people President-elect Donald J. Trump has chosen for his administration and the influence they could have over climate change.

2016-12-20.abstract: Designed to protect Southern slave states, this outdated institution undermines participatory democracy no matter who wins the White House.
2016-12-20.snippet: Designed to protect Southern slave states, this outdated institution undermines participatory democracy no matter who wins the White House.
2016-12-20.lead_paragraph: By overwhelming majorities, Americans would prefer to elect the president by direct popular vote, not filtered through the antiquated mechanism of the Electoral College. They understand, on a gut level, the basic fairness of awarding the nation’s highest office on the same basis as every other elected office — to the person who gets the most votes.
2016-12-20.headline_main: Time to End the Electoral College

2016-12-20.abstract: The assassination of a Russian ambassador by a Turkish gunman on Monday caused global alarm, but an armed conflict between Turkey and Russia is unlikely.
2016-12-20.snippet: The assassination of a Russian ambassador by a Turkish gunman on Monday caused global alarm, but an armed conflict between Turkey and Russia is unlikely.
2016-12-20.lead_paragraph: Turkey and Russia, whose up-and-down relationship has helped shape the Syrian war and its related crises, shared a new trauma on Monday after an off-duty Turkish police officer assassinated Russia’s ambassador.
2016-12-20.headline_main: Turkey, Russia and an Assassination: The Swirling Crises, Explained

2016-12-20.abstract: Ben Utecht, who retired in 2010 after too many hits to the head, has made it his mission to speak out about the dangers of head trauma and how it affected him.
2016-12-20.snippet: Ben Utecht, who retired in 2010 after too many hits to the head, has made it his mission to speak out about the dangers of head trauma and how it affected him.
2016-12-20.lead_paragraph: MINNEAPOLIS — Getting readers to spend $25 on a book about athletes and concussions can be a hard sell. The topic isn’t uplifting, and the biggest audience for sports books — people who are fans — typically prefers to read about famous coaches and players.
2016-12-20.headline_main: In a Book, an Ex-N.F.L. Player Details Consequences of Concussions

2016-12-20.abstract: Quotation of the day for Tuesday, December 20, 2016.
2016-12-20.snippet: Quotation of the day for Tuesday, December 20, 2016.
2016-12-20.lead_paragraph: “China is a dragon. America is an eagle. Britain is a lion. When the dragon wakes up, the others are all snacks.”
2016-12-20.headline_main: Quotation of the Day

2016-12-20.abstract: The settlements ended a saga that began with acts of grim and pointless violence and continued through an 11-year legal journey plagued by setbacks.
2016-12-20.snippet: The settlements ended a saga that began with acts of grim and pointless violence and continued through an 11-year legal journey plagued by setbacks.
2016-12-20.lead_paragraph: NEW ORLEANS — Surrounded by victims’ families, City Council members and senior police leaders, Mayor Mitch Landrieu of New Orleans announced Monday that the city had reached $13.3 million in civil settlements pertaining to three major police brutality cases from the weeks before and after Hurricane Katrina. The settlements ended what the mother of one victim called an “awful, long and rough road,” beginning with acts of grim and pointless violence and continuing through an 11-year legal journey.
2016-12-20.headline_main: New Orleans Settles Katrina-Era Police Brutality Cases for $13.3 Million

2016-12-20.abstract: The comptroller’s office accused the city’s largest charter school network of billing for special education services that Success Academy may not have provided. The network denied the audit’s findings.
2016-12-20.snippet: The comptroller’s office accused the city’s largest charter school network of billing for special education services that Success Academy may not have provided. The network denied the audit’s findings.
2016-12-20.lead_paragraph: A financial audit released on Monday by Comptroller Scott M. Stringer said that Success Academy, New York City’s largest charter school operator, was lax in its oversight and record keeping and understated its administrative costs while billing the Education Department for special education services it could not document were delivered.
2016-12-20.headline_main: Success Academy May Have Overcharged City for Special Education Services, Audit Says

2016-12-20.abstract: The effort was part of a burst of urgent, high-level diplomatic talks aimed at moving as many as possible of Guantánamo’s 22 prisoners who are recommended for transfer.
2016-12-20.snippet: The effort was part of a burst of urgent, high-level diplomatic talks aimed at moving as many as possible of Guantánamo’s 22 prisoners who are recommended for transfer.
2016-12-20.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — When Prime Minister Matteo Renzi of Italy visited the White House in October for a state dinner, he made a commitment to President Obama: Italy, which resettled a Yemeni detainee from Guantánamo Bay last summer, would take one more person on the transfer list. But before the deal was completed, Mr. Renzi resigned.
2016-12-20.headline_main: Obama Administration Intends to Transfer 17 or 18 Guantánamo Detainees

2016-12-20.abstract: Electors across the country faced protests, reflecting a vast divide that carried over from a tumultuous race and that the new president will be facing.
2016-12-20.snippet: Electors across the country faced protests, reflecting a vast divide that carried over from a tumultuous race and that the new president will be facing.
2016-12-20.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — In Florida, protesters swarmed the Capitol rotunda, one hoisting a “Trump Is Too Rusky” sign featuring a hammer and sickle. In Wisconsin’s statehouse, a heckler shouted, “We’re all going to go to war and die thanks to you,” during the formal meeting of the Electoral College.

2016-12-20.abstract: Should Zionist goals be pursued to the point of tolerating anti-Semitism?
2016-12-20.snippet: Should Zionist goals be pursued to the point of tolerating anti-Semitism?
2016-12-20.lead_paragraph: For weeks now, Jewish communities across America have been troubled by an awkward phenomenon. Donald J. Trump, a ruthless politician trafficking in anti-Semitic tropes, has been elected to become the next president, and he has appointed as his chief strategist Stephen K. Bannon, a prominent figure of the “alt-right,” a movement that promotes white nationalism, anti-Semitism, racism and misogyny. Though Bannon himself has expressed “zero tolerance” for such views, his past actions suggest otherwise; as the executive chairman of Breitbart News for the past four years, he provided the country’s most powerful media platform for the movement and its ideologies.
2016-12-20.headline_main: Liberal Zionism in the Age of Trump

2016-12-20.abstract: Polar bears have been left stranded on land desperately seeking other things to eat.
2016-12-20.snippet: Polar bears have been left stranded on land desperately seeking other things to eat.
2016-12-20.lead_paragraph: The polar bear, the largest bear of them all and a fearsome predator, is the poster animal of climate change, and for good reason: While most threatened animals, such as the rhinoceros, are victims of localized threats like poaching or human encroachment, the polar bear is threatened most gravely by global emissions of greenhouse gases.
2016-12-20.headline_main: The Climate Refugees of the Arctic

2016-12-20.abstract: Whether depicting the spectacle of people barreling forward in a snowstorm or the faces of his subjects, mostly black but also white, Adger Cowans’ lyrical images portray life as resonant with feeling.
2016-12-20.snippet: Whether depicting the spectacle of people barreling forward in a snowstorm or the faces of his subjects, mostly black but also white, Adger Cowans’ lyrical images portray life as resonant with feeling.
2016-12-20.lead_paragraph: The pictures accompanying Adger Cowans’ essay in a new monograph on his work are not his professional photos, but snapshots from his personal life: his childhood home, a group portrait of his mother’s relatives in their Sunday best, and Mr. Cowans cradling his godchild.
2016-12-20.headline_main: The Heartbeat of Our Being, in Black and White

2016-12-20.abstract: The two Texans picked for Trump’s cabinet, Rick Perry and Rex Tillerson, share an instinct for using power and keeping it.
2016-12-20.snippet: The two Texans picked for Trump’s cabinet, Rick Perry and Rex Tillerson, share an instinct for using power and keeping it.
2016-12-20.lead_paragraph: HOUSTON — Oops! Just when I thought it was safe to come out as a Texan again — you can’t pin Donald J. Trump on us — the president-elect goes and nominates two of my countrymen to his cabinet. And not just any Texans, but two of the most quintessential Texans on the planet: Rick Perry, our former governor, as secretary of energy, and Rex W. Tillerson, the Exxon Mobil chief executive, to head the State Department.
2016-12-20.headline_main: Scout’s Honor, Texas Style

2016-12-20.abstract: Compare President Obama’s treatment of Donald Trump to Pat McCrory’s behavior in North Carolina.
2016-12-20.snippet: Compare President Obama’s treatment of Donald Trump to Pat McCrory’s behavior in North Carolina.
2016-12-20.lead_paragraph: President Obama and Gov. Pat McCrory of North Carolina don’t agree on many policy questions. But they have found themselves facing a similar political situation this year. And their very different reactions capture the deep — and alarming — differences between our two political parties right now.
2016-12-20.headline_main: Democrats Had a Knife, and the G.O.P. Had a Gun

2016-12-20.snippet: The government of President Nicolás Maduro is conducting business in an increasingly bizarre, self-defeating manner.
2016-12-20.lead_paragraph: President Nicolás Maduro of Venezuela made a baffling announcement on Dec. 11, saying that his government intended to yank the 100 bolívar note from circulation in three days to thwart a supposed plot to hoard Venezuelan currency abroad. Any 100 bolívar bills that were not exchanged at the central bank within 10 days would become worthless. The result of this reckless decision was predictable.
2016-12-20.headline_main: Venezuela’s Currency Madness

They now say that it was very likely an act of terrorism. Like similar episodes, it involved a public space, an emblem of common ground and open society. But in this case, the symbolism of the site ran even deeper.
