2016-12-24.abstract: In Diyarbakir city, the informal Kurdish capital, a legacy of intense fighting between Kurdish rebels and the Turkish military.
2016-12-24.snippet: In Diyarbakir city, the informal Kurdish capital, a legacy of intense fighting between Kurdish rebels and the Turkish military.
2016-12-24.lead_paragraph: DIYARBAKIR, Turkey — It was the end of the day in an underground tavern with no name. Beneath a domed Ottoman ceiling, with the lights down low and the music muted, patrons could just hear a distant rumbling through the basalt block walls, five centuries old.
2016-12-24.headline_main: An Aleppo-like Landscape in a Kurdish Redoubt of Turkey

2016-12-24.abstract: Actually, basic macro has worked very well.
2016-12-24.snippet: Actually, basic macro has worked very well.
2016-12-24.lead_paragraph: Arguing about the state of economics seems like a distinctly secondary concern right now, especially arguing with people I agree with on most things. But Robert Skidelsky’s latest gets one big thing very wrong, and I think it matters for how we approach the general mess we’re in.
2016-12-24.headline_main: Don’t Blame Macroeconomics (Wonkish And Petty)

2016-12-24.abstract: My song of the year is 72 years old, its original lyrics mostly forgotten — and never more relevant.
2016-12-24.snippet: My song of the year is 72 years old, its original lyrics mostly forgotten — and never more relevant.
2016-12-24.lead_paragraph: True, it’s not by Beyoncé or Adele or Rihanna. It’s not even by anyone still alive. But I would like to nominate “Have Yourself a Merry Little Christmas” as song of the year, because if any single tune reflects the miseries of 2016, and the anxious uncertainty with which we greet 2017, it is this 72-year-old holiday chestnut.
2016-12-24.headline_main: Have Yourself a Merry Little 2017

2016-12-24.abstract: When unbelievers encounter the supernatural.
2016-12-24.snippet: When unbelievers encounter the supernatural.
2016-12-24.lead_paragraph: It’s Christmas; indulge me.
2016-12-24.headline_main: Varieties of Religious Experience

2016-12-24.abstract: Senate Republicans’ nine-month blockade of President Obama’s nominee was an outrageous, infuriating stunt. And then it worked.
2016-12-24.snippet: Senate Republicans’ nine-month blockade of President Obama’s nominee was an outrageous, infuriating stunt. And then it worked.
2016-12-24.lead_paragraph: Soon after his inauguration next month, President-elect Donald Trump will nominate someone to the Supreme Court, which has been hamstrung by a vacancy since the death of Justice Antonin Scalia in February. There will be public debates about the nominee’s credentials, past record, judicial philosophy and temperament. There will be Senate hearings and a vote.
2016-12-24.headline_main: The Stolen Supreme Court Seat

2016-12-24.abstract: To reverse four decades of bad policy, state lawmakers will need to approach reform more aggressively.
2016-12-24.snippet: To reverse four decades of bad policy, state lawmakers will need to approach reform more aggressively.
2016-12-24.lead_paragraph: States across the country have rushed to trim prison costs by backing away from the draconian sentencing policies that drove up the national prison population from 200,000 at the start of the 1970s to a peak of about 1.6 million in 2009.
2016-12-24.headline_main: Cutting Prison Sentences, and Costs

2016-12-24.abstract: The challenge for the Trump administration will be helping miners who are stricken, not trying to bring back more coal jobs.
2016-12-24.snippet: The challenge for the Trump administration will be helping miners who are stricken, not trying to bring back more coal jobs.
2016-12-24.lead_paragraph: Appalachian health officials report a shocking rise in cases of black lung — the deadly coal-mining disease thought to have been reined in by a landmark federal law passed in 1969. Young miners are proving particularly vulnerable because the thinner coal seams now being worked in Appalachia leave them vulnerable to a more volatile black lung strain rooted in silica dust, according to an investigative report by National Public Radio.
2016-12-24.headline_main: Black Lung, Incurable and Fatal, Stalks Coal Miners Anew

2016-12-24.abstract: Readers discuss an essay about the dangers of Donald Trump’s breaking of political norms and his “authoritarian tendencies.”
2016-12-24.snippet: Readers discuss an essay about the dangers of Donald Trump’s breaking of political norms and his “authoritarian tendencies.”
2016-12-24.lead_paragraph: Readers discuss an essay about the dangers of Donald Trump’s “authoritarian tendencies.”
2016-12-24.headline_main: A Threat to Democracy?

2016-12-24.abstract: A regional carrier in Russia, IrAero, reported finding metal fatigue in a tail section of a new Sukhoi Superjet, the latest setback for the plane.
2016-12-24.snippet: A regional carrier in Russia, IrAero, reported finding metal fatigue in a tail section of a new Sukhoi Superjet, the latest setback for the plane.
2016-12-24.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW — Russian aviation authorities have grounded the country’s fleet of its newest model of civilian airliner, the Sukhoi Superjet 100. Metal fatigue, a problem usually associated with older airplanes, was discovered in the tail section of a new Sukhoi plane, the Russian regulator Rosaviatsia said Friday.
2016-12-24.headline_main: Russia Grounds Its Newest Airliner Over Safety Concerns

2016-12-24.abstract: New England improved to 13-2 as the Jets fell to 4-11. Bryce Petty, the Jets’ young quarterback, left the game after injuring his left shoulder.
2016-12-24.snippet: New England improved to 13-2 as the Jets fell to 4-11. Bryce Petty, the Jets’ young quarterback, left the game after injuring his left shoulder.
2016-12-24.lead_paragraph: FOXBOROUGH, Mass. — Like Cody Kessler, Jared Goff and Trevor Siemian before him this season, Jets quarterback Bryce Petty faced the New England Patriots’ defense on Saturday for the first time. His afternoon, much like the experiences of his peers, did not go well.
2016-12-24.headline_main: Patriots Feast as Jets Join Those Who Fail to Test New England’s Defense

2016-12-24.abstract: Legislative leaders had considered convening before year’s end to act on a potential salary increase for their members as well as allowing companies like Uber to expand upstate.
2016-12-24.snippet: Legislative leaders had considered convening before year’s end to act on a potential salary increase for their members as well as allowing companies like Uber to expand upstate.
2016-12-24.lead_paragraph: A much-discussed plan for a special legislative session in Albany to deliberate whether state lawmakers’ pay should be raised and consider a host of other issues is off the table, after an announcement late Friday that negotiations had come up short.
2016-12-24.headline_main: New York Lawmakers Won’t Hold Special Session on Raises and Ride-Hailing Apps

2016-12-24.abstract: The prime minister ordered an evaluation of Israel’s ties to the United Nations, and assailed the Obama administration for its abstention during a Security Council vote.
2016-12-24.snippet: The prime minister ordered an evaluation of Israel’s ties to the United Nations, and assailed the Obama administration for its abstention during a Security Council vote.

2016-12-24.abstract: Kevin Der makes some great connections.

2016-12-24.abstract: The country’s defense minister, apparently believing that Israel had threatened Pakistan, wrote on Twitter that “Pakistan is a nuclear state too.”
2016-12-24.snippet: The country’s defense minister, apparently believing that Israel had threatened Pakistan, wrote on Twitter that “Pakistan is a nuclear state too.”

2016-12-24.abstract: An eight-part series that promised an up-close look at the Ku Klux Klan was derailed after it was discovered that some of the show’s producers had paid participants in exchange for access.
2016-12-24.snippet: An eight-part series that promised an up-close look at the Ku Klux Klan was derailed after it was discovered that some of the show’s producers had paid participants in exchange for access.

2016-12-24.abstract: Mr. Miller, who was named as White House communications director by Donald J. Trump two days ago, has told the president-elect that he will not take the job.

2016-12-25.abstract: The Giants, who are 10-5, backed into their first postseason berth in five years when the Saints beat the Buccaneers on Saturday.

2016-12-25.abstract: Prime Minister Shinzo Abe will make a trip that, because of domestic political opposition, has been all but impossible for Japanese leaders until now.
2016-12-25.snippet: Prime Minister Shinzo Abe will make a trip that, because of domestic political opposition, has been all but impossible for Japanese leaders until now.

2016-12-25.abstract: “When Harry Met Sally” is a New York City holiday classic dressed up as a romance. Here’s where to recapture the magic.
2016-12-25.snippet: “When Harry Met Sally” is a New York City holiday classic dressed up as a romance. Here’s where to recapture the magic.
2016-12-25.lead_paragraph: You’re reading a travel article that revisits locations used to shoot a well-known holiday movie set in New York City, so of course you assume you’ll see the phrase “Miracle on 34th Street.” Well, there it was, but don’t expect to encounter it again, because that film is too obvious a choice for our theme. Macy’s is still there, Gimbels isn’t; end of story.
2016-12-25.headline_main: In the Footsteps of Harry and Sally

2016-12-25.abstract: The couple met at a pool party in Dubai and were married in Rome.
2016-12-25.snippet: The couple met at a pool party in Dubai and were married in Rome.
2016-12-25.lead_paragraph: Lauren Elissa Dickinson and Henry Charles Monckton Miskin were married Dec. 22 in a civil ceremony at the Vignola Mattei, a former church in Rome that is now an event space. Concetta Nuscaan, a civil registrar designated by the mayor of Rome, officiated.

2016-12-25.abstract: When temperatures drop around North Pole, Alaska, wood smoke that goes up comes down again, causing dangerous pollution to hover at lung level.
2016-12-25.snippet: When temperatures drop around North Pole, Alaska, wood smoke that goes up comes down again, causing dangerous pollution to hover at lung level.
2016-12-25.lead_paragraph: NORTH POLE, Alaska — Miners huddled around them to stay warm through the long, cold nights in the Klondike gold rush of the 1800s. Artists have enshrined them in paintings and tourist curios. For many people in America’s far north, the old-fashioned wood stove — crackling and radiant, and usually cast-iron black — is as Alaskan as it gets. But many Alaskans also see their home state as a natural wonderland, where the expectation of bracingly pristine air is just as deeply ingrained.
2016-12-25.headline_main: Alaskans’ Cost of Staying Warm: A Thick Coat of Dirty Air

2016-12-25.headline_main: Singers in Russian Military Choir Among 92 Feared Dead After Plane Crashes Into Black Sea

2016-12-25.abstract: An examination of the company reveals a distinctly family business fortified with longtime loyalists that operates less on standardized procedures and more on a culture of Trump.
2016-12-25.snippet: An examination of the company reveals a distinctly family business fortified with longtime loyalists that operates less on standardized procedures and more on a culture of Trump.
2016-12-25.lead_paragraph: When Tiah Joo Kim arrived at the Manhattan headquarters of the Trump Organization to pitch a hotel and condominium project in Vancouver, British Columbia, he expected the famous company with ventures across the globe to come with capacious offices and a staff of hundreds. Instead, he was led through a mere two floors with what appeared to be no more than a few dozen employees. “Lean,” Mr. Tiah, a young Malaysian developer, remembers thinking as he walked the halls.
2016-12-25.headline_main: Inside the Trump Organization, the Company That Has Run Trump’s Big World

2016-12-25.abstract: Idi Diallo practiced every day in Ivory Coast, even as gunfire surrounded him. He made his way to the United States, and is still striving to become a professional soccer player.
2016-12-25.snippet: Idi Diallo practiced every day in Ivory Coast, even as gunfire surrounded him. He made his way to the United States, and is still striving to become a professional soccer player.
2016-12-25.lead_paragraph: Idi Diallo started playing soccer when he was 5, living in a small Ivory Coast village, kicking a ball on his family farm through two rocks that served as the goal. Even as he played, he could see troops fighting in the distance and hear gunfire ringing out in the civil wars that raged through his childhood.
2016-12-25.headline_main: A Dream That Survived Life in a War Zone and Life on the Streets

2016-12-25.abstract: Under nearly constant bombardment, the Islamic State is on the run, but the Berlin truck rampage shows it can still inspire terrorist attacks.
2016-12-25.snippet: Under nearly constant bombardment, the Islamic State is on the run, but the Berlin truck rampage shows it can still inspire terrorist attacks.
2016-12-25.lead_paragraph: In the past few weeks, the Islamic State has sustained a string of military defeats: ousted from its refuge on the Libyan coast, struggling to maintain its hold on the Iraqi city of Mosul, and losing ground in Syria. Yet as the deadly truck attack on a Christmas market in Berlin made clear, those losses do not diminish the group’s extraordinary power to inspire terrorist mayhem around the world, and may even help fuel it.
2016-12-25.headline_main: Weakened Militarily, ISIS Still Has Power to Sow Deadly Mayhem

2016-12-25.abstract: Memories of a South Bronx Christmas in 1963: wondrous toys and a lesson in self-control.
2016-12-25.snippet: Memories of a South Bronx Christmas in 1963: wondrous toys and a lesson in self-control.
2016-12-25.lead_paragraph: Through the dim memories of a South Bronx childhood — as blurry as the steamed-up living room windows protected by chicken wire from the local knuckleheads and their barrage of rocks — thoughts of Christmastime in 1963 come slowly into focus. The smell of roast pork, the hard-as-nails spiced red and green candies, and the Christmas tree topped by an angel whose very presence spooked me — all of these seasonal recollections fade before one that to this day makes my heart race.
2016-12-25.headline_main: Kept in Line by an Angel When Fort Apache Wasn’t Enough

2016-12-25.lead_paragraph: KABUL, Afghanistan — Contending that her “life isn’t at risk at all,” military officials in Afghanistan have asked that the United States reject the asylum case of Capt. Niloofar Rahmani, the first female fixed-wing pilot in the Afghan Air Force.
2016-12-25.headline_main: Afghan Response to Female Pilot’s U.S. Asylum Case: ‘I Am Sure She Lied’

2016-12-25.abstract: Years of the sculptor’s notebooks and manuscripts have culminated in “Donald Judd Writings,” published by the Judd Foundation and David Zwirner Books.
2016-12-25.snippet: Years of the sculptor’s notebooks and manuscripts have culminated in “Donald Judd Writings,” published by the Judd Foundation and David Zwirner Books.
2016-12-25.lead_paragraph: The sculptor Donald Judd, one of the most important artists of the mid20th century, declared that he took up writing in the early 1960s purely as a “mercenary,” to earn money as a critic in his spare time. The statement was about as sincere as the oft-cited one of the novelist John Cheever — that literature is not a competitive sport. Both men might have wanted, or needed, to believe their pronouncements, but they knew they weren’t exactly true.
2016-12-25.headline_main: Donald Judd, Artist, Revealed as a Philosopher-Critic by His Children

2016-12-25.abstract: Locked in a duel with surging Boston, the Knicks displayed a lack of cohesiveness as the clock wound down, and the Celtics escaped with a win at the Garden.
2016-12-25.snippet: Locked in a duel with surging Boston, the Knicks displayed a lack of cohesiveness as the clock wound down, and the Celtics escaped with a win at the Garden.
2016-12-25.lead_paragraph: With 1 minute 6 seconds remaining in the fourth quarter of their Christmas Day matinee, the Knicks and the Celtics were back where they had started, tied again after nearly 47 minutes of a game that tipped off shortly after noon and, perhaps because of the early start, at times seemed a little drowsy.
2016-12-25.headline_main: Facing Another Measuring Stick, Knicks Come Out on the Short End Against the Celtics

2016-12-25.headline_main: Visiting the African-American Museum: Waiting, Reading, Thinking, Connecting, Feeling

2016-12-25.abstract: For starters, Judd, who died in 1994, established extensive permanent installations of his work and that of artists he admired in Marfa, Tex.
2016-12-25.snippet: For starters, Judd, who died in 1994, established extensive permanent installations of his work and that of artists he admired in Marfa, Tex.
2016-12-25.lead_paragraph: 1. The Box. Beginning in the 1960s the artist Donald Judd created a new vocabulary for sculpture by taking it off the plinth and placing it directly on the floor, making the space around the work part of the experience of seeing it. His signature was the box, often deployed serially with subtle variations to emphasize the geometric volumes. Unpainted plywood was a staple of his work, along with Plexiglas and metals like anodized aluminum.
2016-12-25.headline_main: Four Things to Know About Donald Judd

2016-12-25.abstract: Donald Trump may not have the stomach to attack Medicare, but trouble is certainly brewing for millions of poor and working-class families.
2016-12-25.snippet: Donald Trump may not have the stomach to attack Medicare, but trouble is certainly brewing for millions of poor and working-class families.
2016-12-25.lead_paragraph: Progressives have already homed in on Republican efforts to privatize Medicare as one of the major domestic political battles of 2017. If Donald J. Trump decides to gut the basic guarantee of Medicare and revamp its structure so that it hurts older and sicker people, Democrats must and will push back hard. But if Democrats focus too much of their attention on Medicare, they may inadvertently assist the quieter war on Medicaid — one that could deny health benefits to millions of children, seniors, working families and people with disabilities.
2016-12-25.headline_main: The Quiet War on Medicaid

2016-12-25.snippet: The story of a teenager who had gone searching for wild roots to eat but poisoned himself instead seemed to embody everything that had gone wrong amid a national economic crisis.

2016-12-25.headline_main: No Food, No Medicine, No Respite: A Starving Boy’s Death in Venezuela

2016-12-25.abstract: The Positivist Church of Brazil, established by freethinkers from the Religion of Humanity, is another example of Rio’s letting its history and grandeur fall into disrepair.
2016-12-25.snippet: The Positivist Church of Brazil, established by freethinkers from the Religion of Humanity, is another example of Rio’s letting its history and grandeur fall into disrepair.
2016-12-25.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO — Neighbors from surrounding apartment buildings toss empty beer bottles through a gaping hole in the roof of the once-majestic church. Pigeons roam the cavernous nave, their excrement piling up on the floor. A watchman guards treasures from the thieves who prey on the city’s derelict buildings.
2016-12-25.headline_main: Nearly in Ruins: The Church Where Sages Dreamed of a Modern Brazil

2016-12-25.headline_main: Aboard a U.S. Eye in the Sky, Staring Down ISIS in Iraq and Syria

2016-12-25.abstract: A president’s popularity used to depend on growth. Now it depends on geopolitics.
2016-12-25.snippet: A president’s popularity used to depend on growth. Now it depends on geopolitics.
2016-12-25.lead_paragraph: LONDON — The Russian economy is in trouble — “in tatters,” President Obama has said — so why aren’t Russians more upset with their leaders? The country underwent a major recession recently. The ruble lost half of its value. And yet, according to a leading independent pollster in Russia, President Vladimir V. Putin’s approval ratings have consistently exceeded 80 percent during the past couple of years.
2016-12-25.headline_main: In Russia, It’s Not the Economy, Stupid

2016-12-25.abstract: It was reported in The Nashville Scene and Billboard that the United Record Pressing plant will expand to a new facility.
2016-12-25.snippet: It was reported in The Nashville Scene and Billboard that the United Record Pressing plant will expand to a new facility.
2016-12-25.lead_paragraph: The alt-weekly The Nashville Scene first reported last week that the United Record Pressing plant, a mainstay of vinyl production since 1949, would be expanding its operations to a new 142,000-square-foot facility in South Nashville. In a later article by Billboard, United said that the new facility, estimated to be the size of “two football fields,” would double the plant’s production capacity, and that the expansion would help the country’s largest vinyl manufacturer keep pace with strong market demand. According to a 2015 report from Nashville Public Radio, United produces up to 40,000 records a day, and United’s head of marketing is quoted in the piece as saying the plant accounts for 30 to 40 percent of all vinyl records available in stores.
2016-12-25.headline_main: Vinyl Record Manufacturer in Nashville Is Said to Be Expanding

2016-12-25.abstract: Donald J. Trump has shown few reservations about ignoring the norms of presidential media coverage. Journalists are wary of what that might mean.
2016-12-25.snippet: Donald J. Trump has shown few reservations about ignoring the norms of presidential media coverage. Journalists are wary of what that might mean.
2016-12-25.lead_paragraph: With the naming of Sean Spicer as White House press secretary, Donald J. Trump has selected a Republican Party insider and communications veteran.
2016-12-25.headline_main: Changes Coming to White House Press Room: Who, Where, When and How

2016-12-25.abstract: A night of storytelling and performances by original and revival cast members is planned for Jan. 21.
2016-12-25.snippet: A night of storytelling and performances by original and revival cast members is planned for Jan. 21.
2016-12-25.lead_paragraph: “Hair,” the musical that voiced a generation’s antiwar passions, will celebrate its 50th anniversary at La MaMa on Jan. 21 with a night of storytelling and performances by original and revival cast members. Those confirmed from the 1968 cast include Natalie Mosco; Allan Nicholls; the Rev. Marjorie Lipari; and Dale Soules, who now plays Frieda Berlin on “Orange Is the New Black.” They will be joined by, among others, André De Shields, who counts his appearance in a 1971 Chicago production as the official start of his career.
2016-12-25.headline_main: ‘Hair’ to Have 50th Anniversary Party at La MaMa

2016-12-25.abstract: After losing three superstars last season, the championship Huskies are undefeated again — the latest evidence that Coach Geno Auriemma’s success is based on more than recruiting.
2016-12-25.snippet: After losing three superstars last season, the championship Huskies are undefeated again — the latest evidence that Coach Geno Auriemma’s success is based on more than recruiting.
2016-12-25.lead_paragraph: Brian Stewart told people so. For four historically triumphant years, he contended that the Connecticut women’s basketball team was greater than the sum of Coach Geno Auriemma’s prize recruits, a conga line of achievers that included Stewart’s daughter, a once-in-a-generation talent by the name of Breanna.

2016-12-26.snippet: From a duet in 1985 with Elton John at Live Aid to “Careless Whisper” in 2008, a look back at the singer’s skills as a live performer.
2016-12-26.lead_paragraph: George Michael, the English songwriter and pop star who died at 53 on Sunday, was a reliably outstanding live performer, though after a world tour promoting his album “Faith” in 1988 and 1989, he turned away from the road. He never gave his 1990 album “Listen Without Prejudice Vol. 1” a proper tour, instead performing a set of cover songs in 1991 before he took a lengthy break from the road. He returned to the stage in 2006, and reached the United States two years later with a show that demonstrated he had no intention of becoming an oldies act, as The New York Times’s chief pop, critic Jon Pareles, wrote at the time. Here are five performances from 1985 to 2008 that showcase Mr. Michael’s range as a live artist:
2016-12-26.headline_main: Watch George Michael Perform Live: 5 Memorable Videos

2016-12-26.abstract: We avoid it, but we can’t separate it from the act of living.
2016-12-26.snippet: We avoid it, but we can’t separate it from the act of living.
2016-12-26.lead_paragraph: Ramses II, also known as Ramses the Great, was born about 3,000 years ago and is widely regarded as the most powerful pharaoh of the Egyptian Empire. The Greeks called him Ozymandias. When he died in 1213 B.C.E., he left a series of temples and palaces that stretched from Syria to Libya, and countless statues and monuments commemorating his impressive reign. By the 19th century, when European colonization reached Egypt, most of these statues were gone, and the ones that remained were in ruin. In 1816, the Italian archaeologist Giovanni Belzoni discovered a bust of Ramses and acquired it for the British Museum. This is when Ozymandias’s life, in one respect, truly began.
2016-12-26.headline_main: Looking Death in the Face

Maybe it’s for benign purposes — or better, a signal that the administration wants to make women’s empowerment a cornerstone of its foreign policy. But this seems unlikely, to put it mildly, given that such a commitment was absent from Donald J. Trump’s campaign, and alongside Mr. Trump’s vow to defund Planned Parenthood.

2016-12-26.abstract: The West’s democracies must stop giving Russia a pass, as its cyberweapons undermine them far more cheaply than traditional war could.
2016-12-26.snippet: The West’s democracies must stop giving Russia a pass, as its cyberweapons undermine them far more cheaply than traditional war could.
2016-12-26.lead_paragraph: CHICAGO — These days President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia cannot hide his glee. This is unusual for a man trained to deceive and mislead, a man who is practiced in his profession. In an interview with the Russian television program “Weekly News” on Dec. 4, Mr. Putin said it was obvious that the West had failed to create a unipolar world and that balance was being restored. He had reasons to feel triumphant: His years of supporting anti-establishment movements in the West, mostly on the right, by hacking and leaking private information, spreading fake news and financing parties and individuals ready to do the Kremlin’s bidding all seem to be paying off.
2016-12-26.headline_main: Putin Sees a Happy New Year

2016-12-26.lead_paragraph: ACCRA, Ghana — Last December, my family gathered at my grandmother’s house for the one-year anniversary of her death. Her house in Akim Oda, a small town in southern Ghana, was filled with well-wishers. I walked into the kitchen to fetch drinks for the guests, and as I opened the fridge, the lights flickered out.
2016-12-26.headline_main: The End for Ghana’s ‘Power-Cut’ President

2016-12-26.abstract: Incomprehensible diagram included.
2016-12-26.snippet: Incomprehensible diagram included.
2016-12-26.lead_paragraph: Serious critiques of one’s work can be thought-provoking, even when they mostly miss the point. So it is with this recent critique of my trade-and-jobs analysis by Tim Worstall. Worstall seems strangely unable to grasp that what EPI, Dean Baker, and yours truly are doing isn’t an analysis of the effects of trade deficits on overall employment, and even suggests that we are engaged in some kind of fallacy when asserting that trade deficits reduce manufacturing jobs. Hello — we’re talking about the sectoral mix of employment, about having fewer manufacturing and more service jobs.
2016-12-26.headline_main: Analytics of Trade Deficits and Manufacturing Employment (Very Wonkish)

2016-12-26.abstract: The contention that Americans chose Trump for his racist or sexist views is wrong; many voted for him despite that.
2016-12-26.snippet: The contention that Americans chose Trump for his racist or sexist views is wrong; many voted for him despite that.
2016-12-26.lead_paragraph: Donald J. Trump won the white working-class vote over Hillary Clinton by a larger margin than any major-party nominee since World War II. Instead of this considerable achievement inspiring introspection, figures from the heights of journalism, entertainment, literature and the Clinton campaign continue to suggest that Mr. Trump won the presidency by appealing to the bigotry of his supporters. As Bill Clinton recently said, the one thing Mr. Trump knows “is how to get angry white men to vote for him.”
2016-12-26.headline_main: Sorry, Liberals. Bigotry Didn’t Elect Donald Trump.

2016-12-26.abstract: Jason Stanley analyzes how modern propaganda can pose a grave danger to democracies by undermining reasoned deliberation.
2016-12-26.snippet: Jason Stanley analyzes how modern propaganda can pose a grave danger to democracies by undermining reasoned deliberation.
2016-12-26.lead_paragraph: In “Mein Kampf,” Hitler argued that effective propaganda appeals “to the feelings of the public rather than to their reasoning ability”; relies on “stereotyped formulas,” repeated over and over again, to drum ideas into the minds of the masses; and uses simple “love or hate, right or wrong” formulations to assail the enemy while making “intentionally biased and one-sided” arguments.
2016-12-26.headline_main: ‘How Propaganda Works’ Is a Timely Reminder for a Post-Truth Age

2016-12-26.abstract: Mr. Michael made turning out hits look easy. But there was an uneasiness just below the surface as he grappled with weightier things, like sexuality.
2016-12-26.snippet: Mr. Michael made turning out hits look easy. But there was an uneasiness just below the surface as he grappled with weightier things, like sexuality.
2016-12-26.lead_paragraph: If you were around in October of 1987 and had MTV then, you remember. You remember the camera climbing, in black and white, up a rotating pair of torn, bleach-splotched Levis. You remember it seeming to take in the seat of the pants — or seeming to let you take that in. You remember the annoying cut to a jukebox, against which leaned two pairs of legs: some lady’s in blue heels, and another in blue denim and steel-toed cowboy boots — a dude’s. You remember the fade from the jukebox back to the rotating body, and the camera’s revealing a man in a leather jacket and a white T-shirt, with perfectly trimmed stubble, aviator sunglasses and a cross dangling from his left ear.
2016-12-26.headline_main: George Michael Mattered Beyond the Music

2016-12-27.lead_paragraph: HOLMDEL, N.J. — As with a lot of homeowners, Nicholas Teetelli’s garage was a disaster, an overstuffed hodgepodge of tools, seasonal supplies and things in that weird suburban purgatory — not yet ready to be tossed out, but no longer essential. “It looked like I could have been on an episode of ‘Hoarders,’” he said. “I kept saying, ‘I need to take care of this.’”
2016-12-27.headline_main: Final Frontier in Home Renovation: Giving Garages a Makeover

2016-12-27.abstract: Stern words and recommendations were removed since a draft report was circulated in the spring, prompting critics to question the city’s seriousness on the issue.
2016-12-27.snippet: Stern words and recommendations were removed since a draft report was circulated in the spring, prompting critics to question the city’s seriousness on the issue.
2016-12-27.lead_paragraph: In the spring, an oversight agency for the New York Police Department circulated a draft report on the use of Taser stun guns. The report highlighted “troubling” findings and issued stern recommendations: The police should create an annual report on the use of Tasers and prohibit their use on handcuffed suspects.
2016-12-27.headline_main: Complaint Board Softened Report on Police Use of Tasers

2016-12-27.abstract: Florida’s Supreme Court just wiped out over 150 death sentences, the latest sign that capital punishment is on the way out.
2016-12-27.snippet: Florida’s Supreme Court just wiped out over 150 death sentences, the latest sign that capital punishment is on the way out.
2016-12-27.lead_paragraph: Piece by piece, the death penalty continues to fall apart. Last week, the Florida Supreme Court invalidated between 150 and 200 death sentences — nearly half of all those in the state — because they were imposed under a law the United States Supreme Court struck down as unconstitutional in January.
2016-12-27.headline_main: The Continuing Collapse of the Death Penalty

2016-12-27.lead_paragraph: Maria Bruno’s strength and her desire to give back to her community were inspired by her mother, Laura Andrews. “She was a wonderful person,” Ms. Bruno said. “When you were down and you spoke to her, she had the power to lift you up.” Her home was a safe haven for other children in their Brooklyn neighborhood. When Ms. Andrews suddenly died two years ago at the age of 50, Ms. Bruno fell into a deep depression. At the time, she was attending college and working as a counselor for people living with H.I.V., but all of that became overwhelming. She lost her job and dropped out of school. Her three young children were struggling to cope as well.
2016-12-27.headline_main: Receiving Help After a Devastating Loss

2016-12-27.lead_paragraph: Mick Mulvaney, the Republican congressman and fiscal hawk nominated by Donald Trump to head the White House Office of Management and Budget, will, if confirmed, be in charge of creating and promoting Mr. Trump’s federal budgets, a position that would put him at the center of debates within the administration and with Congress over the president’s priorities. As the O.M.B. director, Mr. Mulvaney would also have power to advance or impede federal regulation, because many proposed rules have to pass muster at O.M.B. before they are issued.

Yet it is the only option that almost always works to help very heavy people lose a lot of weight and that also can mysteriously make some chronic conditions vanish. Here are some answers about bariatric surgery and what it does.

2016-12-27.abstract: All the company needed were content-hungry millennials and an algorithm.
2016-12-27.snippet: All the company needed were content-hungry millennials and an algorithm.
2016-12-27.lead_paragraph: The Jukin Media headquarters, in Culver City, Calif., checks off all the clichés of the modern millennial workplace. The floor plan is cubicle-free and open, with skateboards — well, longboards — leaned insouciantly against more than a few desks. There is a Ping-Pong table, and the kitchen, of course, offers up a bottomless supply of Monster Energy drinks; a selfie stick hangs near a peanut-allergy warning near a fridge stocked with all manner of alternative milks and Greek yogurts. And yes, as you would expect, there is a keg of craft beer, which employees may drink from whenever they please, even at 10 in the morning — though I’ve been assured this has never happened, not even once in roughly seven years of operation. Jukin Media is, after all, a place of business, and as at any other business, there is work to be done.
2016-12-27.headline_main: How Jukin Media Built a Viral-Video Empire

2016-12-27.abstract: In their probing, sardonic commentary on Silicon Valley’s broken promises, artists have begun to sound an alarm that we might not be ready to hear.
2016-12-27.snippet: In their probing, sardonic commentary on Silicon Valley’s broken promises, artists have begun to sound an alarm that we might not be ready to hear.
2016-12-27.lead_paragraph: Last month, a Berlin nonprofit group called the Tactical Technology Collective took over a gallery in Lower Manhattan. They installed wall-size screens and display cases and arranged glossy tablets on large tables. The walls were white, and the décor was minimalist. If you squinted, you could mistake it for an Apple Store. That was the point. The exhibit, which Mozilla helped produce, lured people in with the visual language of high-tech consumption. But instead of housing cool new devices, each display contained an artifact or a piece of art intended to school and shock visitors on how much (or little) we know about privacy and data security.
2016-12-27.headline_main: Finding Inspiration for Art in the Betrayal of Privacy

2016-12-27.snippet: The internet was supposed to democratize information, but instead it has democratized disinformation.
2016-12-27.lead_paragraph: No one would argue that Edgar Welch, the 28-year-old North Carolina man who loaded his car with weapons in early December and drove 350 miles to liberate the children he believed were being held in the basement of a Washington pizzeria, was a model citizen or even necessarily sane. But after a tragedy had been averted and he was in police custody, Welch transformed himself into something of an unlikely sage, stumbling on a surprisingly resonant explanation for the misguided quest that sent him ricocheting from internet conspiracy theories to armed vigilantism: He had decided, he said, to “self-investigate.”
2016-12-27.headline_main: The Problem With ‘Self-Investigation’ in a Post-Truth Era

2016-12-27.abstract: Hundreds have perished without any accountability from the police.
2016-12-27.snippet: Hundreds have perished without any accountability from the police.
2016-12-27.lead_paragraph: Nearly 600 people died in police custody in India between 2010 and 2015, yet not one police official was convicted during this period. A report released by Human Rights Watch last week examines 17 cases in which families have sought accountability. Their stories reveal, in searing detail, why there have been so many deaths, starting with police contempt for proper procedures, a cavalier attitude toward the torture of detainees and near total impunity for wrongful deaths.

2016-12-27.abstract: Arlaux, a family-run winery known for its use of the pinot meunier grape, is now selling its Champagnes in the United States.
2016-12-27.snippet: Arlaux, a family-run winery known for its use of the pinot meunier grape, is now selling its Champagnes in the United States.
2016-12-27.lead_paragraph: In making Champagne, the dominant grapes are chardonnay and pinot noir, but the unsung hero is pinot meunier, often contributing fruit and freshness to the wine. Arlaux is one of the few wineries that depend on the grape, which accounts for about a third of the plantings in the Champagne region. A family-run estate on property farmed since the 12th century, Arlaux has made Champagne since 1826 but only now is exporting to the United States. The house makes eight Champagnes, all premier cru, notably the Brut Grande Cuvée, which is lovely, straightforward and yeasty, with lively acidity: Arlaux Brut Grande Cuvée nonvintage, $43 for 750 milliliters, Vintry Fine Wines, 230 Murray Street (West Street), 888-686-8767, vintryfinewines.com.
2016-12-27.headline_main: A New Champagne for the New Year

2016-12-27.abstract: With its low-slung buildings and vacant parcels, the River North Art District is seen as one of the last development frontiers in the city.
2016-12-27.snippet: With its low-slung buildings and vacant parcels, the River North Art District is seen as one of the last development frontiers in the city.
2016-12-27.lead_paragraph: DENVER — A checkerboard of low-slung buildings and vacant parcels, the River North Art District in this fast-growing city has developed a funky vibe over the last few years.
2016-12-27.headline_main: Denver’s Gritty Back Door Could Become Its New Gateway

2016-12-27.abstract: Jacobs & Brichford’s Briana with truffles has an alluring edge, while the Connersville, Ind., farm’s Ameribella has a satin creaminess.
2016-12-27.snippet: Jacobs & Brichford’s Briana with truffles has an alluring edge, while the Connersville, Ind., farm’s Ameribella has a satin creaminess.
2016-12-27.lead_paragraph: Among the cheeses made by Jacobs & Brichford is a stunner, Briana with truffles. It’s semisoft, almost lacy, and has an alluringly funky edge. The farm in Connersville, Ind., specializes in French cattle breeds whose milk results in cheeses like the prizewinning Everton Premium Reserve, spicy and fairly sharp, with a craggy texture. Other varieties ripen to satin creaminess, like the fruity Ameribella and the mushroomy JQ: Jacobs & Brichford Farmstead Cheeses, $5.75 to $6.75 per quarter pound, jandbcheese.com.
2016-12-27.headline_main: Midwest Cheeses With a French Pedigree

2016-12-27.abstract: A pasta sauce and a garlic dip from Delicious & Sons are ready for entertaining.
2016-12-27.snippet: A pasta sauce and a garlic dip from Delicious & Sons are ready for entertaining.
2016-12-27.lead_paragraph: Store shelves are lined with sauces and spreads galore, and newcomers show up all the time. This unusual aioli and a dusky blend of mushrooms and black truffles from a new company, Delicious & Sons, get a thumbs up. Use the orange-scented aioli straight from the jar with seafood or a paella. Toss pappardelle in the mushroom-truffle mix, thinned with a little pasta water: Delicious & Sons, 6.35-ounce jars, deliciousandsons.com, garlic aioli with saffron and orange, $8.95; black truffle and mushroom sauce, $12.35, amazon.com.
2016-12-27.headline_main: Entertaining Shortcut From a Jar

2016-12-27.snippet: Year-End Special: The opinion columnist Andrew Rosenthal on the good, bad and most maddening news of 2016.
2016-12-27.lead_paragraph: Times Insider delivers behind-the-scenes insights into how news, features and opinion come together at The New York Times. In this podcast, Andrew Rosenthal, a Times Op-Ed columnist, talks about the news of 2016 — the good, the bad and that which makes him mad.
2016-12-27.headline_main: Good, Bad and Mad: Andrew Rosenthal on the News of the Year

2016-12-27.abstract: The panzerotto, a Southern Italian turnover, is the star of a new shop on Macdougal Street.
2016-12-27.snippet: The panzerotto, a Southern Italian turnover, is the star of a new shop on Macdougal Street.
2016-12-27.lead_paragraph: “New York has every kind of food, but no place that sells panzerotti,” said Christian Francone, who has filled the gap with a sliver of a shop selling the Southern Italian turnovers. “They’re very popular in Italy.” His family is originally from Barletta, in Apulia, home of the fried half-moon snack his shop offers. Twelve fillings are available, including three sweet choices; the savory options, especially those with tomato and mozzarella with or without sausage or pepperoni, taste something like fried pizza. Smoked chicken with pesto and mozzarella, and spinach with ricotta offer a nice change of pace. For now he makes only 100 per day and closes the shop once they are sold. But soon he expects to stay open as late as 3 a.m. on weekends: Mr. Panzerotto, 124 Macdougal Street (Minetta Lane), 646-964-5035, mrpanzerotto.com.
2016-12-27.headline_main: The Calzone’s Cousin Comes to Greenwich Village

2016-12-27.abstract: Place mats from the Museum of Modern Art are ready for drips from messy eaters.
2016-12-27.snippet: Place mats from the Museum of Modern Art are ready for drips from messy eaters.
2016-12-27.lead_paragraph: Messy eaters? Not a problem when the table is set with these vinyl place mats in a dense Jackson Pollock pattern from the Museum of Modern Art. No drip will show. The only question is, what took the museum so long to come up with the idea? There is also a handsome table runner, 14 by 60 inches, with swaths of white, gray and black on a taupe ground. They’re based on Pollock’s “Number 1A, 1948” and “Number 7, 1950”: Jackson Pollock place mats, $24, table runner $65, momastore.org.
2016-12-27.headline_main: Splatter Away With These Pollock Place Mats

2016-12-27.abstract: Not as simple as you might think.
2016-12-27.snippet: Not as simple as you might think.
2016-12-27.lead_paragraph: Before the election, I wrote that I intended to spend the time after in an orgy of serious policy analysis – because I thought we were going to have a president serious about policy. Sad! And in some ways it’s hard to stay motivated about economic analysis when we’re in fact going to have a government that is completely uninterested in analysis, evidence, or truth of any kind.

2016-12-27.abstract: K & M chocolates are a partnership between the chef Thomas Keller and the olive oil producer Armando Manni.
2016-12-27.snippet: K & M chocolates are a partnership between the chef Thomas Keller and the olive oil producer Armando Manni.
2016-12-27.lead_paragraph: The chef and restaurateur Thomas Keller is now in the chocolate business: a bean-to-bar partnership with Armando Manni, a Tuscan olive oil producer. The idea was born five years ago, when the men were discussing the antioxidant properties of dark chocolate and olive oil. The results, called K & M Extravirgin Chocolate (they say it “K plus M”), are made in a former warehouse in Napa, Calif., where the cacao undergoes a special, gentler process to preserve the bean’s antioxidant properties. Mr. Manni’s olive oil is used in place of cocoa butter. The 75 percent cacao bars come in three varieties, according to the source of the chocolate. The Peruvian bar has coffeelike depth, the bar from Ecuador is smooth with woodsy hints of chestnut, and the Madagascar bar is spicy with notes of pineapple and passion fruit. You do not taste the olive oil: K & M Extravirgin Chocolate, $14.95 for 2.5 ounces at Williams-Sonoma stores, williams-sonoma.com, $120 for eight bars from kellermannichocolate.com.
2016-12-27.headline_main: Chocolate Made With Olive Oil

News this month of a coming Tina Turner bio-musical is making it clear that producers “Believe” demand for such shows is “Strong Enough.” (Couldn’t help it, Cher.)

2016-12-27.headline_main: Russians No Longer Dispute Olympic Doping Operation

2016-12-27.abstract: A prime-rib restaurant from the team behind Au Cheval in Chicago opens in the West Village, and more restaurant news.
2016-12-27.snippet: A prime-rib restaurant from the team behind Au Cheval in Chicago opens in the West Village, and more restaurant news.
2016-12-27.lead_paragraph: Here’s a stunning bar and trattoria with Old World bronze-trimmed elegance that outclasses its East Village location. It’s the work of the Church Group, which creates themed bars, several in the same neighborhood. Nearby, the group’s Kingston Hall is Jamaican, Shoolbred’s is as Scottish as its hot toddies, and Ninth Ward, which is closed temporarily, showcases the food and drink of New Orleans. (The group has opened another Ninth Ward in London.) Nic Ratner and Robert Morgan, a former Hollywood agent, are the partners. At the new Italian venture, a menu of small plates like crostini, panini, burrata, a chicken parm sandwich and meatballs is expanded for weekend brunch with the addition of egg dishes, a burger and French toast. The drinks — wine based, not spirits — are Italian-accented, with cocktails including a Bellini and a creditable Bloody Mary made with sake: 131 Avenue A (St. Marks Place), 646-275-0461, bacievendetta.com.
2016-12-27.headline_main: Baci e Vendetta Brings Old-World Elegance to the East Village

2016-12-27.abstract: Noche Flamenca, the dance troupe led by Soledad Barrio, opened its latest season with blends of flamenco, dance theater and hip-hop.
2016-12-27.snippet: Noche Flamenca, the dance troupe led by Soledad Barrio, opened its latest season with blends of flamenco, dance theater and hip-hop.
2016-12-27.lead_paragraph: Noche Flamenca, the beloved flamenco troupe, can eschew spectacle and concepts for a simple presentation, because it can rely on its dependably thrilling star, Soledad Barrio. In recent years, though, the group has grown a little more theatrically ambitious, and a new pattern has emerged: longer works that take a season or two to find their footing.
2016-12-27.headline_main: Review: A Guitarist Rejects Her. But She Knows How to Be Cruel.

2016-12-27.abstract: Annette Bening stars as a complicated and divorced Santa Barbara mother in Mike Mills’s funny, emotionally piercing new film.
2016-12-27.snippet: Annette Bening stars as a complicated and divorced Santa Barbara mother in Mike Mills’s funny, emotionally piercing new film.
2016-12-27.lead_paragraph: Love and loss go hand in hand in “20th Century Women,” a funny, emotionally piercing story about a teenager and the women who raise him. It opens in 1979, when cool kids danced to Talking Heads (“This ain’t no party, this ain’t no disco”) and President Carter bummed everyone out talking about our “crisis of confidence.” There’s something in the air — or so it seems, although the California light here tends to blot out the shadows. When a car bursts into flames soon after the movie opens, it looks about as threatening as an art installation. Apocalypse later, man.
2016-12-27.headline_main: Review: 1 Teenage Boy and 3 Mothers in ‘20th Century Women’

2016-12-27.abstract: Our dance critic reflects on the current Alvin American Dance Theater season. Performances of Mr. Brown’s dances proved that he was the real star.
2016-12-27.snippet: Our dance critic reflects on the current Alvin American Dance Theater season. Performances of Mr. Brown’s dances proved that he was the real star.
2016-12-27.lead_paragraph: There was one night (at least) this season — Dec. 14, to be exact — when everything came together for Alvin Ailey American Dance Theater. Movement melted off shoulders and fingertips without effort. Power emanated from the inside and then flowed out with searing swiftness, the rare sort that isn’t ostentatious. The men found strength in suppleness; the women were softer still, plush yet never weak.
2016-12-27.headline_main: An Evening of Ronald K. Brown Lifts Alvin Ailey’s Season

2016-12-27.abstract: This story of a soulful bus driver and basement poet is deceptively simple and nearly perfect, with a likely nod to William Carlos Williams.
2016-12-27.snippet: This story of a soulful bus driver and basement poet is deceptively simple and nearly perfect, with a likely nod to William Carlos Williams.
2016-12-27.lead_paragraph: Poems slip across the screen like water in “Paterson,” Jim Jarmusch’s wonderful new dispatch from Jarmusch-land. Sometimes they appear over water, too, surfacing word by word on images of the Great Falls along the Passaic River in Paterson, N.J. No pen or pencil directly spells out these words, no clattering keyboard or banging typewriter. Instead, the words — in a neat, cramped hand — appear onscreen as they are read aloud by their author, Paterson (Adam Driver), a soulful bus driver and basement poet. It’s as if he were beaming his heart-song straight from his head into yours.
2016-12-27.headline_main: Review: In Jim Jarmusch’s ‘Paterson,’ a Meditative Flow of Words Into Poetry

Trump’s Twitter post last week that the United States must “greatly strengthen and expand its nuclear capability” provoked confusion and anxiety that intensified the next day when he added, in a television interview, “Let it be an arms race. We will outmatch them at every pass and outlast them all.”

2016-12-28.abstract: The game — a predecessor to Saturday’s College Football Playoff semifinal between No. 1 Alabama and No. 4 Washington — put teams from the South on the map.
2016-12-28.snippet: The game — a predecessor to Saturday’s College Football Playoff semifinal between No. 1 Alabama and No. 4 Washington — put teams from the South on the map.
2016-12-28.lead_paragraph: The first time Alabama played Washington, in the 1926 Rose Bowl, the Crimson Tide arrived in Pasadena, Calif., more than a week early. The Huskies, by contrast, did not come down from Seattle until the day before the game, because their officials had determined, according to a New York Times article from Dec. 26, 1925, that “experience has proved that the Huskies play better when they have not been exposed to the enervating Southern breezes for any length of time.”
2016-12-28.headline_main: Alabama Win in 1926 Rose Bowl Put Southern Stamp on College Football

2016-12-28.lead_paragraph: Gordie Tapp, a regular for more than 20 years on the long-running television variety series “Hee Haw,” died on Dec. 18 in Burlington, Ontario. He was 94.

2016-12-28.abstract: In her second indictment since she left office last year, Mrs. Kirchner, the former president of Argentina, was indicted Tuesday on charges involving huge public works projects.
2016-12-28.snippet: In her second indictment since she left office last year, Mrs. Kirchner, the former president of Argentina, was indicted Tuesday on charges involving huge public works projects.
2016-12-28.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES — Cristina Fernández de Kirchner, the Argentine former president who with her late husband dominated the country’s politics for most of this century, was indicted Tuesday on fraud and corruption charges involving huge public works projects. It was her second indictment since she left office last year.
2016-12-28.headline_main: Cristina Fernández de Kirchner Indicted Again on Corruption Charges

2016-12-28.headline_main: John Kerry, in a Final, Pointed Plea, Will Outline a Vision of Mideast Peace

He did so again in the second period Tuesday, driving the rookie Rangers defenseman Brady Skjei into the boards and to the ice.

2016-12-28.lead_paragraph: ST. PETERSBURG, Russia — Quietly, the number of Russians who have received a positive H.I.V. diagnosis passed the one million mark this year. There is, however, little indication that the government will commit adequate resources to stem the acceleration of the virus from high-risk groups into the general population.
2016-12-28.headline_main: H.I.V. Cases Surpass a Million in Russia, but Little Is Done

2016-12-28.abstract: The Vesterbro neighborhood in the Danish capital, once a seedy area, has become home to local entrepreneurs opening quirky boutiques.
2016-12-28.snippet: The Vesterbro neighborhood in the Danish capital, once a seedy area, has become home to local entrepreneurs opening quirky boutiques.
2016-12-28.lead_paragraph: The Vesterbro neighborhood of Copenhagen was once a seedy part of town that was full of brothels and was not to be ventured into at night. But in the last several years, it has become home to both fledgling and established entrepreneurs who are opening quirky boutiques with interesting back stories. Many of the locally owned shops are on or near a busy thoroughfare called Istedgade, and what they sell varies from children’s clothes to home goods.
2016-12-28.headline_main: Five Places to Shop in Copenhagen

2016-12-28.lead_paragraph: At Saks Off Fifth recently, an Ivanka Trump white polyester and spandex blouse made in Indonesia was marked down to $34.99, from $69. A few racks over, her black and white jacket came from Vietnam, while several blocks away, at Macy’s, her leather bootee manufactured in China sold for more than $100.

A bacterial infection had entered his bloodstream, requiring him to spend nine days at Temple, where patients are overwhelmingly poor.
2016-12-28.headline_main: Hospitals in Safety Net Brace for Health Care Law’s Repeal

2016-12-28.abstract: The European Union is acting on gun safety while the U.S. Congress continues to evade the problem.
2016-12-28.snippet: The European Union is acting on gun safety while the U.S. Congress continues to evade the problem.
2016-12-28.lead_paragraph: The European Union, to its credit, has agreed on a series of proposals for tighter gun controls as a timely response to the growing threat of terrorism and mass shootings. The proposals, which are headed toward a final vote by members next year, would extend bans on semiautomatic assault weapons to more models, institute medical checks for gun buyers, tighten sales on the internet and track the resale of guns to foil black-market dealers.
2016-12-28.headline_main: Europe Takes a Braver Stance on Gun Control

2016-12-28.abstract: We have an immigration policy today that few Americans support or voted for.
2016-12-28.snippet: We have an immigration policy today that few Americans support or voted for.
2016-12-28.lead_paragraph: Donald J. Trump smashed many orthodoxies on his way to victory, but immigration was the defining issue separating him from his primary opponents and Hillary Clinton. President-elect Trump now has a clear mandate not only to stop illegal immigration, but also to finally cut the generation-long influx of low-skilled immigrants that undermines American workers.
2016-12-28.headline_main: Fix Immigration. It’s What Voters Want.

2016-12-28.abstract: How can we tell where the new administration is heading?
2016-12-28.snippet: How can we tell where the new administration is heading?
2016-12-28.lead_paragraph: Anyone who tells you, with perfect confidence, what a Trump administration will do is either bluffing or a fool. We have a prospective cabinet and a White House staff, but we haven’t got the first idea how the two will fit together or relate to Congress, or how the man at the top will preside over it all.
2016-12-28.headline_main: The Trump Matrix

2016-12-28.abstract: Louisiana detectives admitted deciding whether to hold people for days based on a mere “hunch” or “feeling.”
2016-12-28.snippet: Louisiana detectives admitted deciding whether to hold people for days based on a mere “hunch” or “feeling.”
2016-12-28.lead_paragraph: For a shocking glimpse of what’s been happening in the name of criminal justice in America, look no further than a Justice Department report last week on police behavior in Louisiana. Officers there have routinely arrested hundreds of citizens annually without probable cause, strip-searching them and denying them contact with their family and lawyers for days — all in an unconstitutional attempt to force cooperation with detectives who finally admitted they were operating on a mere “hunch” or “feeling.”
2016-12-28.headline_main: Where Secret Arrests Were Standard Procedure

2016-12-28.abstract: Tom Price is likely to go after Obamacare’s contraception-coverage requirement.

2016-12-28.abstract: The case of Tashi Wangchuk, an advocate for Tibetan language education who denies being a separatist, has attracted intense international attention.
2016-12-28.snippet: The case of Tashi Wangchuk, an advocate for Tibetan language education who denies being a separatist, has attracted intense international attention.
2016-12-28.lead_paragraph: The case of a Tibetan entrepreneur who was detained after being featured in an article and video by The New York Times has taken an unusual turn, with Chinese prosecutors asking a court for more time to investigate as the judges were weighing a trial.
2016-12-28.headline_main: Chinese Prosecutors Ask Court for More Time in Detained Tibetan’s Case

2016-12-28.abstract: Josh Haner, a staff photographer and senior editor for photo technology at The New York Times, discusses new ways to visualize climate change.
2016-12-28.snippet: Josh Haner, a staff photographer and senior editor for photo technology at The New York Times, discusses new ways to visualize climate change.
2016-12-28.lead_paragraph: Josh Haner has photographed eight stories across five countries this year about the effects of climate change, often employing drones to get unique vantage points. Mr. Haner is a staff photographer and a senior editor for photo technology at The New York Times. He talked with James Estrin about finding new ways to visualize climate change. The conversation has been edited for clarity and brevity.
2016-12-28.headline_main: Photographing Climate Change Refugees, by Drone and on Foot

2016-12-28.abstract: Time to avoid cheese, avoid sugar, trick your brain into making you feel less hungry, and learn to love yourself instead of dieting.
2016-12-28.snippet: Time to avoid cheese, avoid sugar, trick your brain into making you feel less hungry, and learn to love yourself instead of dieting.
2016-12-28.lead_paragraph: I’ve never understood why January is diet season. Don’t people realize they still have many months during which they can layer their layers? Every diet book should come out on May 1. That’s when you realize you have less than two months before someone, somewhere, is going to force you to go to the beach. But O.K., fine, “new year, new you” and all that. Let’s get a jump-start on the panic, shall we?
2016-12-28.headline_main: And a Thinner New Year: Five New Books About Food and Diets

2016-12-28.abstract: The surgeon general on the Affordable Care Act, the historic campaign to curb tobacco use and whether or not the president takes his advice.
2016-12-28.snippet: The surgeon general on the Affordable Care Act, the historic campaign to curb tobacco use and whether or not the president takes his advice.
2016-12-28.lead_paragraph: Why does the surgeon general wear a uniform? I wear the uniform of the U.S. Public Health Service Commissioned Corps, which evolved from a Marine hospital system headed by a supervising surgeon, later given the title of surgeon general. I like the uniform: There was a time when my friends wouldn’t let me leave the apartment without somebody first checking to make sure I wasn’t going to embarrass the group with what I was wearing, so having the uniform is helpful.
2016-12-28.headline_main: Vivek Murthy Thinks We Need to Learn How to Deal With Stress

2016-12-28.abstract: The magazine’s Ethicist columnist on how to navigate a nephew’s health concerns and what to disclose of an illness when applying for college teaching jobs that are few and far between.
2016-12-28.snippet: The magazine’s Ethicist columnist on how to navigate a nephew’s health concerns and what to disclose of an illness when applying for college teaching jobs that are few and far between.
2016-12-28.lead_paragraph: My sister and her ex are against vaccinating their kids, and I completely disagree with them. Vaccines have helped usher in the modern age; our life spans have been lengthened by the eradication or suppression of smallpox, polio, measles, flu, and so on. Recently, my 12-year-old nephew told me out of the blue that he wasn’t vaccinated and wanted to be. He got swine flu a year or two ago. He was very sick and has no desire to repeat anything like that again.
2016-12-28.headline_main: Your Sister Won’t Vaccinate Her Son. Can You Help Him?

2016-12-28.abstract: The Marine Corps taught Sam Siatta how to shoot. The war in Afghanistan taught him how to kill. Nobody taught him how to come home.
2016-12-28.snippet: The Marine Corps taught Sam Siatta how to shoot. The war in Afghanistan taught him how to kill. Nobody taught him how to come home.
2016-12-28.lead_paragraph: Sam Siatta was deep in a tequila haze, so staggeringly drunk that he would later say he retained no memory of the crime he was beginning to commit.

2016-12-28.abstract: The larvae of Doederlein’s Cardinalfish appear to use the Earth’s magnetic forces to guide their return to the reef where they were born.
2016-12-28.snippet: The larvae of Doederlein’s Cardinalfish appear to use the Earth’s magnetic forces to guide their return to the reef where they were born.
2016-12-28.lead_paragraph: The larvae of fish that live in coral reefs are tiny, and they are not very good swimmers. They are pushed by currents away from the reefs on which they were hatched for days or weeks until they learn to swim. Then, somehow, around 60 percent of them make their way back to their birthplaces, where they spend the rest of their lives.
2016-12-28.headline_main: How a Fish That Hatches in Coral Reefs Finds Its Way Home

2016-12-28.abstract: Productivity through automation and economic dynamism through immigration could hurt blue-collar workers.

We shouldn’t be content with the roughly 2 percent annual growth that has been the norm this century, he has said. And he thinks he can bring about the kind of robust growth of 4 percent or more that was commonplace in decades past.

2016-12-28.lead_paragraph: How do we deal with the job losses caused by automation? Offer a universal basic income? Halt the march of technology? Shorten the workweek? Get more education — or a different kind of it? Raise the minimum wage — or lower it?

2016-12-28.lead_paragraph: LONDON — It hasn’t always been an inevitable truth here that “The Nutcracker” plays during the holiday season. But things seem to be changing, perhaps influenced by the belt-tightening in British arts funding and the moneymaking powers of this ballet: For the past few years, the English National Ballet and the Royal Ballet have both had long December-into-January runs of “The Nutcracker.”

2016-12-28.lead_paragraph: FRUITA, Colo. — There was no screaming or insults when Anne Keller and Jason Brown sat down at a coffee shop to talk politics from opposite sides of a table. They didn’t shout over each other like cable talking heads. They didn’t fire off nasty tweets. One liberal, one conservative, talking and listening to each other while a fresh glaze of snow melted outside.

2016-12-28.lead_paragraph: An exhibition in Berlin of artworks from the Tehran Museum of Contemporary Art was canceled after the museum authority in Berlin said Iran had not granted export permits for any of the works to be shipped to Germany. The Tehran Museum’s collection of Western modern art is widely considered to be the most important outside of North America and Europe, and this was the first time that a show of these works was to be staged outside of Iran.

2016-12-28.abstract: Twenty-five years ago this month, a culture of paranoia destroyed the Soviet Union. I now see similar neuroses in America.
2016-12-28.snippet: Twenty-five years ago this month, a culture of paranoia destroyed the Soviet Union. I now see similar neuroses in America.
2016-12-28.lead_paragraph: EAST WINDSOR, N.J. — The gas masks given to me and other Soviet first graders in 1987 were hand-me-downs from World War II, made of stiff rubber and too big for our faces. They trapped moisture and reduced the world to two blurry circles bouncing in front of my face. Our teacher didn’t tell us about the gas mask drill ahead of time — she simply handed out the masks, and we blindly paraded around the school before going back to our lessons. None of us bothered to ask why we were training. There was no need.
2016-12-28.headline_main: A Flashback to My Soviet Childhood

2016-12-28.abstract: The musician appeared on albums by Kanye West and Chance the Rapper this year, as barriers between genres continued to soften.
2016-12-28.snippet: The musician appeared on albums by Kanye West and Chance the Rapper this year, as barriers between genres continued to soften.
2016-12-28.lead_paragraph: Kirk Franklin first came to crossover prominence in the mid-to-late 1990s as part of the first wave of gospel artists to take the sound and attitude of hip-hop seriously and incorporate them into their work. During that era, those worlds seemed to be miles apart. But time has a way of softening all barriers, and of late, the gospel impulse has firmly entrenched itself into hip-hop’s mainstream.
2016-12-28.headline_main: In Hip-Hop, Inspiration Arrived by Way of Kirk Franklin

2016-12-28.abstract: Ms. Matsoukas had a banner 2016, directing Beyoncé’s Grammy-nominated video, “Formation,” and also directing episodes of Issa Rae’s HBO comedy, “Insecure.”
2016-12-28.snippet: Ms. Matsoukas had a banner 2016, directing Beyoncé’s Grammy-nominated video, “Formation,” and also directing episodes of Issa Rae’s HBO comedy, “Insecure.”
2016-12-28.lead_paragraph: We take music videos for granted. In about 35 years, they’ve gone from an alleged scourge on the musical imagination to a form of oxygen. Every so often, one comes along that touches a nerve or causes a scandal. Back in February, on the eve of the Super Bowl, “Formation” stopped the nation. It was another Beyoncé sneak attack, but also a statement piece and a work of art. And for a month, the intent of its imagery — Beyoncé atop a sinking New Orleans Police Department cruiser; the witchiness of her wide-brimmed hat and her seemingly spiritually possessed head bob on the porch of a manse; a young black boy dancing before a phalanx of militarized cops — was deconstructed, debated and defended.
2016-12-28.headline_main: Melina Matsoukas Touched Nerves From Behind the Camera

2016-12-28.abstract: With the suite “America’s National Parks” and “A Cosmic Rhythm With Each Stroke,” with the pianist Vijay Iyer, the jazz trumpeter enlightened minds.
2016-12-28.snippet: With the suite “America’s National Parks” and “A Cosmic Rhythm With Each Stroke,” with the pianist Vijay Iyer, the jazz trumpeter enlightened minds.
2016-12-28.lead_paragraph: The trumpeter and composer Wadada Leo Smith made not one but two of this year’s standout jazz releases. “America’s National Parks,” a suite on two discs, features his Golden Quintet, made up of longtime associates like the pianist Anthony Davis and the drummer Pheeroan akLaff. “A Cosmic Rhythm With Each Stroke” is a duo session with another colleague, the pianist Vijay Iyer, inspired by the art of the Indian modernist Nasreen Mohamedi.
2016-12-28.headline_main: Wadada Leo Smith, Raising Issues With a Horn

2016-12-28.abstract: This German film, directed by Maren Ade, has been loved by critics since its debut at Cannes; it uses a kooky humor, not the country’s usual slapstick variety.
2016-12-28.snippet: This German film, directed by Maren Ade, has been loved by critics since its debut at Cannes; it uses a kooky humor, not the country’s usual slapstick variety.
2016-12-28.lead_paragraph: PARIS — The German director Maren Ade’s breakout film, “Toni Erdmann,” has won over audiences and racked up awards across Europe. An uncharacterizable father-daughter story that’s also about neoliberal economic reforms in Romania and the clash between the generation of 1968 and its capitalist children, the film is exceptional for another reason: It’s hilarious.
2016-12-28.headline_main: How ‘Toni Erdmann’ Became an Unexpected Comedy

2016-12-29.snippet: A proposed sluice gate faces a chorus of opposition from scientists and environmental groups who say it could have disastrous effects on the lake’s fragile ecosystem.
2016-12-29.lead_paragraph: HONG KONG — Long celebrated as China’s largest freshwater lake, Poyang reaches more than three times the expanse of Los Angeles in the summer wet season. It is home to the rare Yangtze finless porpoise, and its mud flats are the primary winter feeding grounds for thousands of birds that fly south each autumn to escape Siberia’s chill, including the critically endangered Siberian crane.
2016-12-29.headline_main: As China’s Largest Freshwater Lake Shrinks, Solution Faces Criticism

Republicans denounced what they said was the Obama administration’s harsh treatment of a steadfast ally and Democrats signaled that they were uneasy with Mr. Kerry’s pressure on Israel, even as they praised the effort to promote Middle East peace.

2016-12-29.abstract: The real reason Israel is at odds with the Obama administration.
2016-12-29.snippet: The real reason Israel is at odds with the Obama administration.
2016-12-29.lead_paragraph: Over the past week, differences between Israel and the United States have boiled over into a scalding diplomatic confrontation between these closest of allies. The dispute reflects not any change in American policy, but a dangerous evolution in Israeli policy, under the government of Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, away from an acceptance of a negotiated two-state resolution to Israel’s conflict with the Palestinians. The dispute also arises from Mr. Netanyahu’s lamentable practice of making his government a more nakedly partisan player in American politics than any foreign government in memory, save Russia.
2016-12-29.headline_main: Is Israel Abandoning a Two-State Solution?

2016-12-29.abstract: A suggestion to grieving admirers: Honor her not by watching her movies again but by reading her books.
2016-12-29.snippet: A suggestion to grieving admirers: Honor her not by watching her movies again but by reading her books.
2016-12-29.lead_paragraph: Oh, Carrie Fisher, gone way too soon. And now your mother, Debbie Reynolds. The startling loss this week of one of Hollywood’s great mother-daughter pairs was another blow in an unnerving year. You could call it a Hollywood ending, if by that you mean one that is larger and weirder than real life, and that tugs mightily at strong emotions.
2016-12-29.headline_main: The Honesty of Carrie Fisher

2016-12-29.lead_paragraph: As a little girl, Ioana Moldovan eagerly awaited her vacations at her grandfather’s house in southwestern Transylvania. He lived in a steel mill town, where he raised rows of tomatoes, cucumbers, strawberries, cranberries and cherries, which Ms. Moldovan would eat directly from the trees. While her grandfather, Ion Ciugudean, did not talk much about his work as a radiologist, he did seem to know everyone in the village. Whenever he would go to the market, shopkeepers and customers would say hello and treat him with the same respect he treated his patients.
2016-12-29.headline_main: The Devotion of an Old-Fashioned Doctor in Romania

2016-12-29.abstract: It’s a place somewhere past pain, but also time and fear.
2016-12-29.snippet: It’s a place somewhere past pain, but also time and fear.
2016-12-29.lead_paragraph: A few years ago I went snorkeling with my sister, and she startled a sea lion. Rather, I was snorkeling, and my sister was free diving — that is, diving much deeper, and holding her breath much longer. She had swum down to the ocean floor to inspect something, and as she glided up from the depths, the sea lion approached from out in the hazy blue. It was moving casually, but casual for a waterborne marine creature is still pretty fast. When it finally noticed my sister cruising through a space where humans normally are not, it pulled up, coming to a sudden halt, vertical in the water. The sea lion looked amazed and delighted — at least, that’s how it looked to me, looking at my sister — and at that moment, the thing I wanted most in the world was to learn how to hold my breath and dive deep long enough so that I might also startle and amaze someone, or something, like a sea lion.
2016-12-29.headline_main: Letter of Recommendation: Not Breathing

2016-12-29.abstract: Best friends have your back no matter what — especially when they’re court ordered.
2016-12-29.snippet: Best friends have your back no matter what — especially when they’re court ordered.
2016-12-29.lead_paragraph: Taylor writes: I believe that my roommate Zoe and I could be friends. But even though she lives in my house, I don’t know how to approach her. It’s a big house, and we live at opposite ends. Still, she seems cool and I’d like to get to know her better. I think she would be more convinced if you told her to give it a try. Please order Zoe to be my friend.
2016-12-29.headline_main: Judge John Hodgman on Forced Friendships

2016-12-29.abstract: The son of a famous pastor, Bart Campolo is now a rising star of atheism — using the skills he learned in the world he left behind.
2016-12-29.snippet: The son of a famous pastor, Bart Campolo is now a rising star of atheism — using the skills he learned in the world he left behind.
2016-12-29.lead_paragraph: One morning in the summer of 2011 Bart Campolo left his house in Cincinnati for a long bicycle ride. Goateed and bald, but still trim and fit at 48, Campolo was the envy of his generation of evangelical pastors. That morning, Campolo was, as usual, a little self-conscious about his attire. “I feel ridiculous in my spandex,” he says. Years of pickup basketball had wrecked his ankles, leaving regular bicycle treks as his only form of exercise. But he was excited to do 30 or 40 miles through the rolling southern Ohio hills.
2016-12-29.headline_main: The Evangelical Scion Who Stopped Believing

2016-12-29.snippet: Steak tartare and pommes Anna are an elegant twist on cheeseburger and fries.
2016-12-29.lead_paragraph: Maybe you have some ideas about the new year, as I do, and you’ve dedicated substantial minutes considering what version of yourself you’d like to cultivate in the coming months. You think you’d like to eat better. To have more adventures. Take more risks. Maybe you are moving to Canada and want to learn to speak French. In any case, you resolve that you are going to wake up on New Year’s Day, invigorated by the fresh start laid out in front of you like new snow on a school morning, and make some serious tracks.
2016-12-29.headline_main: On Your Way to Your New Year’s Self

2016-12-29.lead_paragraph: On the summit of Haleakala, a dormant volcano on the island of Maui in Hawaii, a telescope began clicking pictures of the night sky in 2010. 2016-12-29.lead_paragraph: It’s no secret that flying these days can be a headache, with long security lines, delays and a growing list of pared-down amenities. While passengers don’t have a say over most factors that can make flying unpleasant, there are ways for them to have a better experience, according to a flight attendant who has worked for a major United States airline for more than three decades who requested anonymity to protect her job. Here, she shares her insights:

2016-12-29.abstract: What is happening with Kanye West? We spend this week’s episode of Still Processing discussing that question.
2016-12-29.snippet: What is happening with Kanye West? We spend this week’s episode of Still Processing discussing that question.
2016-12-29.lead_paragraph: This year has been especially heavy with untimely popular culture deaths. In the past week, George Michael and Carrie Fisher joined that tally. Neither was entirely comfortable with fame, even though Ms. Fisher, as the daughter of Debbie Reynolds and Eddie Fisher, was born with fame virtually in her bloodstream. Her ambivalence always seemed healthy even when she herself was not. Their deaths are an occasion to think about the toll fame takes on a person, not only on the dead but also on the living. What if that person is Kanye West?
2016-12-29.headline_main: We Need to Talk About Kanye

2016-12-29.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW — Russian investigators said on Thursday that they had found no evidence that an explosion occurred aboard a Russian military plane that crashed into the Black Sea, killing all 92 passengers and crew, but that they had not ruled out the possibility of a terrorist attack.

Finally, I would have my chance to see what it would be like to be a brain in a jar.

2016-12-29.lead_paragraph: Just how music-obsessed is Hillary Kerr, the 37-year-old founder of a lifestyle-focused digital media company in Los Angeles? She can tell you what song was playing five years ago on the jukebox at the bar where she somewhat randomly met the man who became her husband. It was “These Days,” the version sung by Nico, the German singer-songwriter made famous by Andy Warhol and the Velvet Underground.
